dialogue: That ought to keep me going for a bit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That Darkness there felt different than before.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gemstones, and a little extra for Charon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never enough of these back at the House.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Should fetch me something good back home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles might know what to do with this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This holds some sort of power, but for what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stygius shuddered as I picked it up...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Coronacht shuddered when I picked this up...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My weapon shuddered at the touch of it...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My weapons can grow even stronger now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This can unlock a hidden aspect of my weapons.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I look forward to making use of this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Looks like I'm back in the club.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Head Chef always wants fish.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fish delivery for the Head Chef.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Head Chef is going to want this fish.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who's that new shade there next to Father?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Someone's at the desk next to the throne...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Something's different about that shade next to Father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll go no further, boy; at least, not yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everything is as it always was.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you see, boy? You are trapped.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I didn't think you had it in you, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph! I was looking all over for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I just got back shortly before you did!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Resolved the trouble with the Satyrs yet?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're bound to my domain, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: <Tsk, tsk, tsk, tsk> Too bad, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To suffer such indignity, from my own kin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Elysium is up in arms again because of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fought all the way out of Elysium, only to end up here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Hydra shall grow back, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get where I can see you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you have someplace else to be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you no better way to pass the time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew that you were more than capable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I had envisioned that you would succeed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus? Come here a moment, please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I spent many days tending this garden... or nights? Quite difficult to tell the time here. But, it's held on longer than I would have expected...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cerberus! I missed you so. And dutiful as ever, aren't you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I'm sorry. Know that I am sorry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hades... you look tired. Though, I am not the only one you ought to be apologizing to.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know. I know, I.... Why have you returned? If Olympus... if your mother discovers what happened, not even Zeus, not even he could stop what would transpire, here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I've a thought or two about how we can settle that. Though I shall need for you and Zagreus to cooperate with me on a solution. Or, if you'd rather, I could just return the way I came?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A solution? What, do you intend to have them over for Ambrosia? Not even you can fix a broken family, Persephone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're right, Hades! I can't. Certainly not by myself. So, are you going to help me, or what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I would do anything that you would ask of me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then, first, talk to your son.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Mm. Zagreus? You have already met Persephone, our Queen. I expect for you to show deference to her, at all times!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wow, Father, you called me by my name! What is this strange sensation that I feel? Perhaps it's this deference of which you speak?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, stop it, both of you. Don't make me regret this, Hades. Speak honestly with him. About yourself, not me. Go on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. I... Zagreus. I know there have been times... when I've let my mood reflect on you. I showed very little patience. Questioned your judgment, often, when my own was flawed. Thus, I apologize to you, my son. I have no excuses. And I ask no forgiveness.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What about the part where you lied to me about Mother, do you apologize for that? Your foul moods, and venting them on me... I've long since come to expect that from you. And I resented you for it. But I always thought... you're honest.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your mother did not come here willingly when we originally met. When she left... believing you were stillborn... her decision was final. I believed that she was better off without the lot of us, Olympus included. Deceiving both of you... it tore against my being. But it needed to be done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, you didn't need to vent all that inner turmoil onto me throughout my life. Though, I think I understand. I only wish I could have understood sooner. So, uh... what now? I've grown so used to ransacking your domain, I think I'm really going to miss it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: About that... your ransacking revealed many flaws in our security. The types that never get into reports. Our reputation rides on there being no escape from here. Would you... keep trying to break free? Not for my sake. But for this realm. For the Queen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus... If you keep fighting out of here... it shall help keep appearances that everything is as it always was.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Question, Father. Let's say I accept. When next I reach the surface... is it still going to be you waiting up there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, boy. If you think for an instant that I shall go easier on you because of this, you'll soon learn otherwise.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So I just battle to the surface and repeatedly kill my own father, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps you'll also tend to my little cottage while you're in the area? The garden doesn't take much care at all. I'd like to keep the place in decent shape. In case I cannot suffer this for long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahaha, well! I guess I'll see what I can do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just do the best you can. And, clearly, I've work to do as well. We have a lot of it ahead of us, I'd say. So, shall we get started, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know I can hear you, old man.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The House of Hades: That dark and lavishly appointed lair of the Underworld's King is home not just to him, but to his willful progeny.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What once was a small lounging area within the House of Hades now is sealed off, in utter shambles since the multi-headed Cerberus tore the space apart, mourning the missing Prince.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shades of the dead mill constantly within the House, complaining of their woes, and seeking audience from any who would listen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The lounging area within the House of Hades is a dismal place to be, in spite of its intended purpose to enliven the House's grim inhabitants.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's supposed to be updated every so often but it's always Thanatos.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never made it up there myself!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Won't ever see my face up on that wall I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A commemorative board adorns one of the stoic walls within the lounging area, celebrating and proclaiming the accomplishments of those who serve Lord Hades best of all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Still waiting for the festive occasion when we'll open one of these.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The ancient casks of wine hidden within the recesses of the House of Lord Hades... few have tasted the intoxicating vintage they contain, and fewer still are permitted anywhere near their vicinity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They fought bravely, but Lord Dionysus was too strong.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The stalwart casks of wine within the House of Hades now are almost entirely devoid of content, having bravely stood against the combined thirst of the Olympians during a certain feast.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The handiwork of Lord Hephaestus, himself! Sounds like he's been rather busy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A majestic gilded edifice of Mount Olympus, crafted with the utmost care from the true mountain's stone, now shines forever brightly even in the dim light of the House of Hades, as a parting gift from the Lord Master's kin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A vast and intricately crafted mosaic depicts the Underworld King presiding over the enormity of his domain, whilst its chthonic residents look on in awe of him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Seldom does the overbearing throne of grim Lord Hades sit unoccupied; thus the House's denizens all go about their business, daring not so much as to ask why.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not like Mother's cottage, but not bad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The garden of Persephone the Queen, off-limits to the Prince throughout his life, now is laid bare to him at last in all its splendor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He ventures toward the stately throne of his Lord Father, half-expecting to be caught, but ill-expecting what he is about to find.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He does not know exactly what he seeks. He only knows that something always has felt off to him, that he does not belong. Who is he, really? Lord Hades never would indulge such questions. So, Prince Zagreus would find out for himself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He rifles through his Lord Father's possessions. There is not much of any import there. Ledgers and administrative parchmentwork. Correspondence from Olympus which he had ignored. No trace of any reference to his son.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But then, there is the note... written finely in a hand and voice the likes of which the Prince had never seen or heard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thus did Prince of the Underworld Zagreus absorb the contents of this hidden letter, written in his mother's hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: His mother's hand, my mother's hand, wait, what?! You're saying this Persephone, that she's my... mother...? But, but Father always said that Nyx was my.... That liar. He lied to me, they both did. All my life!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Uhhh erm thus did the Prince discover, inadvertently, the well-kept truth about his lineage. Entirely by chance, this did occur....
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Persephone... the one-time Queen of all the Underworld... where had she gone, and why? Engulfed by newfound questions and his rage, the Prince decided to confront his Lord and Master.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Responsibility-rejecting Zagreus strides down his Father's hall, quite unconcerned about the urgency with which he is expected to behave under a set of circumstances such as this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The door to the administrative chamber beckons just beyond the hall. The prince perchance believes that he may enter quietly, without drawing the notice of those laboring within.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Among the countless splendid gemstones hidden underneath the earth, a great many are used to decorate the House of Hades, god of the dead, god of riches.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Water is the source of life, yet still it flows within the darkest Underworld recesses, whilst restless shades of mortals look upon it and recall the short days they could drink it and draw breath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The gemstone-bearing Prince commissioned such a finely crafted fountain for the House, that all the shades who witnessed it still think of him quite fondly, ever since.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The dead have utterly no use for sustenance, although they try to feast upon it anyway, as though imagining the customs of the mortal life brings them some sense of peace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Having invested heavily into the cooking-area within the House of Hades, the empty-stomached Zagreus can nonetheless find nothing fit to eat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Within the House's gallery now sits the bust of a distinguished poet, ruggedly handsome in his age, who, although yet to earn his fated fame, shall probably be better known someday.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The frightful countenance of a bleached Bloodless warrior decorates the hall forever more, eternally in tribute to the savage servants of the House's lord.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The perfect-chiseled physicality of one of Greece's greatest-ever heroes now adorns the House's gallery, reminding most onlookers of many ways in which they fail to compare.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The light provided by the flames of deepest hell enhances the lounging area with a soft glow; and their warmth soothes the few living denizens there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time seems to stand quite still within the eternal realm of the dead, evidenced even by the means of measuring its passage.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How's that knife set working out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Those spices working out all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cooking's one way to pass the time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Can't go this way just yet...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can't believe Father kept this place locked up...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pom trees are coming in nicely.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother's taken good care of this place since she got back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Still can't get over our gift from the Olympians. It's glorious!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I was just leaving, Zagreus. Happened to be in the area, no thanks to you, and thought I'd go retrieve the last of my possessions. I have to say, you've really let this place go to hell.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...She left. Great. Wonderful! I guess we'll just go back to killing each other repeatedly, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. We need to talk, again. My sisters are involved now, in all this. You've really stirred up quite a mess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry. My mother's out there, somewhere. I won't rest until I can find her. You wouldn't understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wouldn't know. What I'm trying to say is... with my sisters involved, it changes things. Takes some of the pressure off of me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm saying... I know you need to find your mother, Zagreus. I have my part to play in all of this, but let me see what I can do, if anything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. We need to talk, again. My sisters are involved now, in all this. You've really stirred up quite a mess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know. I'm sorry. But this is something that I have to do. You wouldn't understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wouldn't know. What I'm trying to say is... with my sisters involved, it changes things. Takes some of the pressure off of me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Some of the pressure... wait, what are you going to do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm saying... I know you're doing what you have to do, here, Zagreus. And, my sisters and I will always try to stop you. But I am only doing it because I have to. Understand?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus, would you shut up already with your idiotic questions, and get over here? Right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I thought you'd never ask. But I'm glad you did.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stop being insecure around me, Zag. You should know better than that by now. Though, yes, if you must know... I think we're good. But if you tell another living soul, or even a dead one, I will kill you, understand?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... loud and clear, Meg, yes, I understand. So then... what happens now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What happens now? I'll see you at the edge of Tartarus, I guess. Or maybe here. However long we keep this up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: However long we keep this up?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ask too many questions, Zag. I don't have the answers, and besides: You know more about living in the moment than I do. See you around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I... Meg, I'm deeply flattered, and you're very dear to me, it's just... this isn't what I want from our relationship. I fear I must have led you on. Forgive me. Please say you'll still be my friend?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...That's all you really want...? To be my friend? Heh. You're hard to figure out sometimes, Zag. But, you know what, we've tried a lot of things. Why don't we try it like you said? I'll see you out there, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to trouble you for something, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shut up already, Zagreus. And come here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I thought you'd never ask. But I'm glad you did.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ask too many questions, Zag. But yes, I'd say we are again, for now. But if you tell another soul, I'll kill you, understand?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But... no, wait... not even Than...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Than's not an idiot. He wants what's best for you. And he isn't the jealous type. Besides, I have a good working relationship with him, as you well know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, but... what about you, you're the punisher of jealousy. What if I...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're not mere mortals, Zag. Mortals cling to one another viciously because their lives are short. What do we care? If Nyx has taught me one thing, it's that the heart has no bounds. Now quit your worrying, and get prepared for when we meet again out there. See you around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I... Meg, I'm deeply flattered, and you're very dear to me, it's just... this isn't what I want from our relationship. I fear I must have led you on. Forgive me. Please say you'll still be my friend?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...You're sure? Look, I... it's totally all right. I'll see you out there, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to ask something of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just tell me one thing, Zagreus. Did you really mean what you told me before, that... maybe we ought to... take our time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I just... don't mean to push you, Than. I know all this is kind of a lot. And I wanted you to know... this isn't some impulsive thing for me. I'll wait for you however long it takes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Khh! You have no concept of which impulses to act upon, and which to keep in check. You say you'll wait, well, let me ask you this: What are you waiting for? What are you waiting for, I'm here, already. Right...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A lot of things. And you will have to grow to like it, Zag. Or, what I mean is... don't take my silence the wrong way, all right? I'd better get going, though, I'm way behind on work, but... see you again. If that's all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I did. Sometimes I need to slow things down. I'm thankful that we've been on better terms, lately. But, I've been coming on too strong. Forgive me. You're my dear friend. I don't want to do anything to hurt you. Or anybody else.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... oh. I see. I understand. You're my dear friend, as well. Though we have done an awful lot to jeopardize that lately, haven't we? Look, take care, Zag. Be seeing you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to ask something of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just tell me one thing, Zagreus. Did you really mean what you told me before, that... maybe we ought to... take our time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I just... don't mean to push you, Than. I know all this is kind of a lot. And I wanted you to know... this isn't some impulsive thing for me. I'll wait for you however long it takes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Khh! You have no concept of which impulses to act upon, and which to keep in check. You say you'll wait, well, let me ask you this: What are you waiting for? What are you waiting for, I'm here, already. Right...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Than... hahaha, I'm so glad! It's just... you know that Megaera has been here, too...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsch. I've known Megaera much longer than you. Who do you think talked me into this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah! She did, did she? That's good! That's good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A lot of things. And you will have to grow to like it, Zag. Or, what I mean is... don't take my silence the wrong way, all right? I'd better get going, though, I'm way behind on work, but... see you again. If that's all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I did. Sometimes I need to slow things down. I'm thankful that we've been on better terms, lately. But, I've been coming on too strong. Forgive me. You're my dear friend. I don't want to do anything to hurt you. Or anybody else.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're certain? Well... I understand. I'd best get back to my responsibilities for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, Meg, Than, what... what are you two... what's going on? Whatever it is, I can explain, or... wait, you're both smiling. Oh... let me just... take this in a moment here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You give Thanatos and me too little credit, Zag. We've known each other longer than you've been alive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd say we know quite a bit by now, all things considered. Isn't that right, Megaera?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can't you see we're off duty right now, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah! Well then... if this turns out to be some sort of dream, I will be very, very mad. Though... I guess there's one good way to find out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well! I think we've reached an understanding here. I should be off. Until the next one, Zag. And Thanatos.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whew, well, that was... that was... ahem.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Hey... look. I care about you. Both of you. A lot. I'm happy we're this close... you're this close, rather than being at each other's throats like before. But, I think it's all a little much for me, right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...You're sure? Look... it's totally all right. You've got enough pressure on you as it is. We'll see you out there, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Catch up with you some other time, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is the dead of night, or the approximation of it in the realm of Hades. Prince of the Underworld Zagreus rises from a fitful slumber, with much mischief on his mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The heavy-sleeping Underworld Prince arises, with the feeling that the brief nap he intended as a respite from the rigors of the day or night apparently was none-too-brief, at all...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey that must be the Fated List...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh come on, it's not that bad, is it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The bedchambers of Prince Zagreus lie in a perpetual state of utter disarray, despite his Lord and master of the House repeatedly insisting that he pick everything up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The shattered weapons of the siege of Ilion are now reduced to window-dressings in the Prince's ever-cluttered lair.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The valor of the great-hearted Achilles is immortalized upon the Prince's wall, as though it might stir up more courage from within.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The visage of the goddess Aphrodite now adorns the Prince's bedchambers, perhaps to provide consolation after when next he dies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's like we share a bond, man!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The ever-smiling, wine-washed countenance of the great Lord Dionysus now adorns the Prince's chamber-wall, thus radiating questionable influence.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A beautifully decorated, subtly enchanted bowl containing traces of the hapless Prince's past attempts to flee the Underworld now accents a particularly cluttered corner of his room.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A delicately crafted instrument of music-making now resides within the clamor-causing Prince's chambers, doubtless fearing, if it could, his heavy-handed touch.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An object intricately carven solely for the purposes of recreation now resides within the pleasure-seeking Prince's chambers, although his lack for an opponent limits its appeal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Much of the softness of the richly woven rug the Prince procured cannot be fully felt beneath his flame-licked feet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Already bought it, no need to sell me on it, old man.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With its just-right softness and death-themed embroidery, the new bedding of Prince Zagreus is the envy of all those who wish to rest in peace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The ever-energetic Prince alas remains incapable of sitting still, even with such a supple, comfortable seating arrangement nestled in his chambers now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A massive set of weights positioned carefully in line of sight of any visitors shall doubtless make them think the Prince is stronger and in better shape than in reality.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The fate-abetting Prince perhaps believes it was through his own choice that he procured the Fated List of Minor Prophecies, but it was preordained.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All is quiet at this time; ever-dreaming Hypnos put a spell upon the House, as willful Zagreus had asked of him. All are fast asleep, save for the Prince. It is exactly as he planned.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Should turn around. My escape route's in the courtyard I just left.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My escape route's back the other way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm back, Room, did you miss me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I want to go lie down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey what happened to the Pact of Punishment?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm back, Room, did you miss me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can still rank up within my heart, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm at the highest rank achievable!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Suppose I'm overdue to take a break...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's been a while, Resources Director. I'll be sure to pay you a visit whenever I'm swimming in Underworld valuables and want to feel better about myself in my new role.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Must be something worth a damn in here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father keeps things orderly I guess...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother didn't change the decor much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's never stopped thinking of her. Ugh, what a fool.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In his Lord Father's very private chambers, Zagreus, the lock-removing prince, discovers a most delicately painted likeness of none other than Persephone, herself. A coat of dust suggests it has remained here for some time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew it. It's just capes!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The stoic Lord and Master of the House possesses wealth beyond imagining, a portion of which he has used for a crisp set of attire for every passing day.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Eldest Sigil. Nyx needs it upgraded, huh.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Eldest Sigil should be fully powered up for Nyx.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Within the recesses of the administrative chamber lies the Eldest Sigil of the Master's House: a symbol of the Fate-given authority to rule beneath the earth, and means by which to travel the entirety of all that dark domain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The cool, purified waters of the Styx are available in limitless supply to all servants of the god of the dead authorized to work endlessly within the House administrative chamber.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The administrative chamber's ever-working shades remain utterly dedicated to their thankless toil all because of an inspiring rendition of how dedicated they ideally should be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Amongst the parchment-records of the dead and punished are the sealed documents known as the Knave-King's Sentence, forcing said king to endlessly toil with a boulder till the end of time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nestled among the towering administrative parchmentwork of the long-since-deceased lies an old document concerning a special pact signed by a once-living court musician, who attempted vainly to rescue his wife from death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Buried deep within the archives, holding many binding pacts between Lord Hades and the dead, resides an old agreement; an exchange for services from an extraordinary warrior, for eternity within Elysium for his dear partner.

dialogue: The day or night's duties are sheer simplicity itself; at least at first, as when the prince simply signs in to signal the commencement of his shift.

dialogue: The hard-laboring shades responsible for the administration of the prince's father's realm merely look on at the prince's ill-fated attempts.

dialogue: The relaxation-loving prince never paid suitably enough attention to learn properly how to arrange the record-bookings of the regions of his father's realm.

dialogue: This set of delicate responsibilities is easily achieved, at least by someone capable and trained to do the work, unlike the oft-distracted Underworld Prince.

dialogue: A careful record must be kept of all expenses paid within the House; a delicately-handled tabulation process which the prince is ill-equipped to fully undertake.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A steadily-updated ledger of the House's income in the form of brilliant gemstones, diamonds, Darkness, and the like, is merely one among the prince's least-liked aspects of his work.

dialogue: Records of expired House Contractor renovations line a desk in the administrative chamber, though the prince has absolutely no desire now to organize them alphabetically, by date.

dialogue: I haven't forgotten, no one told me!

dialogue: Disorderly Prince Zagreus gazes upon the endless stacks of parchment-paper, each containing work-details to be registered and neatly organized, and starts to feel his optimism fade.

dialogue: Prince Zagreus must have some favored tasks in the administrative chamber of the House; but surely none of them include the tasks demanding his attention, here.

dialogue: Reviewing lists of claims from shades with grievances is a very important service of the House, or so Lord Hades once attempted to impress upon his willful son.

dialogue: A litany of complaints submitted by restless shades across the Underworld must be evaluated, organized, and processed, but Prince Zagreus does not even know where to begin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Supplies on all the desks in the administrative chamber must be carefully maintained and neatly placed in a specific way, which the forgetful prince has not yet memorized in full.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Security reports concerning failed escape attempts from Tartarus require timely verification and official response, neither of which Prince Zagreus is fit to give.

dialogue: What would you know of the struggles of gods? Now you have eternity to think on what you've done. Maybe I'll check again with you after another aeon or two, see if you've learned anything more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The strum of music brought him to an unexpected sight...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do tell the Furies I said hi!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May you get out of here this time, Highness!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think he'll go all the way this time, Bouldy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That who I think it is...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Caught me on a break again!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How nice to see you, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The strum of music brought him to an unexpected sight...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fight like I'd fight out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, what do you want? Oh!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Could dash clear through that wall I think...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, lads, let's see who makes the bigger waves.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hello, Wave-Makers! I, too, can make waves.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I really hate this part of the job, Miss Meg!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Miss Meg, I am so sorry!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now break it up, you two!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hate to see you fight!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You give gorgons a bad name!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get ready for the real deal, gorgon heads!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come get a taste of your own medicine!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gorgons causing problems for you, Prince?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May I remind you, no relation, Prince?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, sister, let's see what you've got!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look at this big old snake!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh wow that thing is huge!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That big snake making trouble, Prince?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not afraid of snakes!! That would be weird.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh wow this guy is huge!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look at the size of this guy!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would you look at this crowd?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wow this place is amazing, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You stay away from him, please, Charon sir!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll please forgive us, won't you, Charon sir?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Um, no hard feelings, OK, Charon sir?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Am I supposed to be here, Prince?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Um, I could get in lots of trouble here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's Thanatos, what do you need me for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time to take out the trash!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got here as fast as I could!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll get right on it, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good thing we have this bond!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh wow, look at you go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wow, would you look at that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nice place you got here, boyo! Name's Skelly, how's it going, but enough with the small talk already, I'm here to do a job. So let me have it! Give me everything you got!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't remember having you on payroll, mate. Who's your supervisor?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh-hoh, I'm not about to rat my sources, pal! Just try and beat it out of me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't suppose I can talk you into fighting back this time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not a chance, boyo, I'm paid to take it not to dish it out! Now give it to me!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, you're getting pretty strong, there, pal! Though, I am being paid to tell you that! But not being paid to not tell you that last part...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to ask you something, mate. What do you even need the pay for, anyway?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That, pal, is nobody's business but my own! Besides, it's impolite discussing money all the time! Now back to beating me to powder!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me give you a piece of advice, boyo. You run across a guy like me out there, you just give him a good stab right in the back without a second thought before he sends you crying back to Papa.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You getting pretty strong, I'll give you that, boyo. Strong enough to smack a guy like me right up against the wall and I'd go straight to pieces, boom! You just remember, when you're duking it out, the walls are your friend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Smack guys against walls. Sound advice as ever, mate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey pal watch where you throw those bloodstone things of yours, you drop them, you go pick them up, you understand? But if somebody gives you grief, you got my permission to chuck one right in his eye!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll just aim generally for the midsection since the eyes are a lot harder to hit in my experience.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're pretty quick, you know, boyo! Just be sure to use that fancy dash of yours and keep 'em guessing! Don't let 'em catch you standing still!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dash like mad instead of standing still. That's not the worst advice, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Little tip, boyo? You find any coinage while you're out there, you be sure to pawn it off to that old Charon, boatman guy? Use it or lose it, pal, use it or lose it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanks, mate, note to self: Always spend everything I earn instead of ever saving.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once in a while, pal, you're going to see a real fancy bozo try to ruin your good time. You'll know him 'cause he's glowing like a light, but that's his special armor, see? You got to punch right through it, he's going to shrug you off until you do!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For a good time, beware the fancy glowing bozos on my quest. Check.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know something, boyo, I think you could do a real number on one of these columns holding up this place, and bring the whole thing down in just a few swipes, boom, boom, BOOM! I'd hate to be standing near one of them if you did!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wreck my father's finely crafted architecture every chance I get. That I can do for sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Boyo, next time you make it to the big VIP area upstairs, you watch out for those weapon-wielding gents out there! The eyeball soul thing that pops out when you beat 'em? You got to squash those, too, or else they'll grab their gear and come right back!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Crush the souls of Elysium's Exalted shades to stop them from regenerating over and over. I'll definitely do that next time I'm there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you're having a rough time out there, boyo, you just remember something: You're a god, all right?! Way tougher than you think. They give you trouble, you just turn on God Mode, and you let 'em have it for me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You act as though this God Mode is some sort of lever I can simply switch at will if ever I wish to unlock my latent strength, there, mate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skelly, how do you know all this stuff, by the way? I mean no offense, but you're a skeleton who just stands around. Yet you have this wealth of knowledge of the Underworld?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, I know people, pal! We'll just have to leave it at that. Now let's see you break some of these bones, huh?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, pal? You have come a pretty long way, let me tell you. I think most of the smarts I've picked up, you know by now. And so... if I'm fresh out of tips for you... I guess there's only one thing left to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stand there eternally to be whaled upon at my whim, using whichever weapon suits me at the time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, no, that definitely wouldn't fly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, mate? I picked up a painting for our lounge that looked a little like yourself. Reminds me... have you ever even been inside? Should come join us sometime.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, you know, while I appreciate that, there, boyo... those kind of social spaces, they're not really for me. I kind of like it out here, just me, these bats whizzing around from time to time.... Besides! The old contract makes it pretty clear I got to stay right here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if I picked you up bodily and brought you in? Contract have anything to say about that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got to say, you're really getting somewhere, boyo, I'm pretty impressed here! And they don't even pay me to do that, I'm just supposed to stand around!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Appreciate the vote of confidence, mate. Maybe you're right and someday I'll get out of here. Hey, if I never come back, you won't just be stuck here forever, will you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heh, hehehe, that's a good one! No! Probably not. Wasn't anything in the old contract about that... huh.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hitting a wall out there, boyo? Hey I know the feeling. You just keep at it, though! You're getting tougher, getting smarter... between the two of those, I'm thinking you'll pull through soon enough here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, mate, won't you say who hired you? Was it Achilles? Couldn't have been Nyx...? Is it that big a deal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am an individual of some integrity, boyo, and protect my sources with my life! You'll have to kill me if you want to make me squeal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, uh, Skelly? How'd you get here, anyway?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you know, just kind of zapped right in, like Papa lets us do! Some of us sometimes. Why do you ask?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I meant... how did you get to the realm of the dead, in the first place. Lord Hermes whisk you to the entryway? Thanatos scoop you up, Charon give you a lift, what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, haha! Well, that's a little personal, don't you think, boyo? I... I don't like to talk about it much. So, if I could have a little privacy...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skelly, is it really true you don't want to talk about how you got here? Just curious who you used to be. What you were like. Your real name.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, what makes you think this isn't my real name, pal? I'm offended!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, what I meant was... I was just interested to get to know you better, after all you've done to help. Anything you can share? Trade you for a detail about me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Well all right... I was once a commander of men. Name of Schelemeus. Captain of the Cretan second fleet, sailing on Athens under King Minos. We were unstoppable... but then one day... one wrong turn... and we sailed straight into the waters of Charybdis.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skelly, that's... that's incredible! So then... you and your crew, you perished at sea?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I, uh, pfff, hahaha, boyo, you are something else, you know? All that Schelemeus stuff, I could have had you eating out of my hand for days!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I get it. You got me. Fine, then, Schelemeus, but I don't appreciate the trick.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skelly... I'm serious. You really won't tell me anything about you? You're just going to leave me to speculate, forever?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, Skelly... or should I say Schelemeus? I happened to have a chat with somebody familiar with that name. Large bull-headed fellow originally from Crete. You said you made it all up! What's going on?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never said I made it up, pal! I just knew you weren't going to believe me, I mean, look at me! I look like a captain of the Cretan second fleet to you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know. I've never met one. Do they all just stand around doing nothing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, sounds like somebody's never had to lead like fifty-or-something sailors in a voyage across the sea in a Minoan galley with nothing but the stars to guide 'em! What do you think the captains do, pull the oars?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, what about Hermes? He gave me the impression you might have been somebody else. Nobody in particular. Not some great sea-captain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it with you gods talking behind the backs of all your friends, boyo?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That Lucky Tooth you gave me, Skelly. First off, thanks again, and secondly... is this even yours? Had a run-in with Hermes, who got me thinking.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, haha, you going to believe everything that gabby guy tells you, now, boyo? He doesn't know a thing about me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never said he did. Though since you let on... what's your relationship to him? Working for him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No! Nope. Definitely not working for him, closer to a peer relationship. Well, other than the fact that he's a god and I'm just... well, what you see is what you get with me, pal. Hey, you won't tell anyone, will you? I'm just here to help, I swear!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, fess up, Skelly, who are you working for? I know it's not Achilles. It's not Nyx. Dusa has no idea who you are. My father... no way. Hypnos? Give me a break. So the House is ruled out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, pal, my lips are sealed. How about we change the subject?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about you tell me who your sources are?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if I never hit you again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So help me, Skelly, if you don't tell me who you're working for, there will be no more violence between us, ever.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No mercy, Skelly. Tell me. Or else... it will be only pleasantries between us from here on out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nrrrghh, all right! But you got to promise me something, promise not to let on or tell anybody in your fancy House, all right? Or else I'm done for. I'm serious!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah. He's rich. He's got connections to guys like me, and I think he's got a horse in this chariot race you've got going on around here with Papa.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No idea. Maybe he likes you, maybe he's bored.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And Hermes... he's working for Charon, too?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yep! Now, let's pretend like none of this ever happened, so I can stick around, all right? Remember, pal, you promised!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you did, pal, I would not be here right now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skelly, did you tell Charon and Hermes about our little conversation from before, about your sources? Because, I didn't tell them, but... they seemed to know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Boyo, thought we agreed we weren't going to be having conversations on the subject from here on. Spares me having to spill my guts with my sources later.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I didn't get you into too much trouble, did I?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Skelly, what with everything out in the open now, with the Queen and Charon, and all that... mind if I mention some of this to Thanatos? Charon's his brother, after all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! Yeah, now that you mention it, I guess that part of the old contract no longer applies. So, go right ahead! Appreciate you asking, pal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pal, thanks again for that Nectar bottle from before, stuff just goes right through me like you won't believe! Though, I hope you're not going around giving that stuff away to every bozo you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, Skelly, you worried something bad is going to happen if I express a bit of generosity from time to time through our somewhat-illicit gift-giving custom around here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, I'm worried you'll be wasting your time! If you give that stuff away, don't expect to get anything back. Well, not after the first time, anyway. Usually! I'm just saying... don't get your hopes up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe I just want to show thanks to my friends for its own sake!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Skelly? You look like you know your way around Tartarus. Found some of this ancient Titan blood out there, and I was looking to score some more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, you've come to the right place regarding that, there, pal! It's your mean weapons back there that can find the stuff. Once you get all the way through Tartarus with one, that's all the blood you're going to get! For the time being anyhow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How am I supposed to keep track of which weapons I've earned these with, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know, there's always the invention of writing stuff down? You'll figure something out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skelly, you mentioned the ancient bit of blood I found in Tartarus. Know what I'm supposed to do with this stuff?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wouldn't know a thing about it! Definitely doesn't have anything to do with those Infernal Arms of yours, some of which appear to still be unavailable to you, as I understand?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I should go check it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So the strangest thing happened while you were out, boyo! One of your weapon holder things back there, it picked up this eerie glow! Could see it from the corner of my eye!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Calm down, Skelly. I'm sure whatever it is is perfectly normal for a legendary semi-sentient Titan-slaying weapon from the dawn of time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's just it! Those weapons of yours, they have seen some real business, pal. You're giving them a real workout, so maybe they're starting to like you or something? Loosening up a bit, you know? Like you and me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, pal, when you're not around and it's just me and all your weapons, I mean your Infernal Arms right over there, between us they are making me a bit uncomfortable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can't blame you, mate. I wouldn't want to be stuck in a chamber with a bunch of legendary, quite possibly malevolent killing artifacts. Anything I can do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh I didn't mean it like a bad thing, boyo! The weirder you make those things, the more it gives me the shakes, and keeps me hopping like this nice and steady till the next time you get back! So, thanks!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, Skelly? Don't suppose you'd care to tell me how the infamous Twin Fists of Malphon came to be right here in this very courtyard, would you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nope! Not any of my business, pal, which is to say, I didn't see a thing! And even if I did, it isn't what I'm paid to do! Don't you have someone in your fancy House there paid to keep watch over stuff like that? Ask them!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I miss my fancy sorcery already.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, just want to say, pal, that spooky crimson phoenix stuff that you were going on about before? I mean, whoa, you just say some nonsense and you get a brand-new spear? I was so impressed, I decided to try that trick for myself!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, gods... Skelly, what did you do...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Relax, boyo, just had a little chat with your old serving platter over there after you left, is all. That thing hits pretty hard! So, then, I say to it, I see you through the eyes of the crimson phoenix... and you want to know what happened after that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you carelessly spoke secret words imparted by the Fates themselves to an infernal weapon forged at the dawn of creation, then what? Say, did you walk up to Aegis, or just shout over your shoulder?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Over my shoulder! Anyway, what happened next was nothing! Your Aegis kept on bobbing like a dummy. So then I went and said that mumbo jumbo to every other weapon, but nope! Doesn't work at all. So much for your fancy sorcery, huh?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As likely an explanation as any I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, what exactly happened with the formerly pink window over there? Now it's got these sinister orange flames and an enormous Pact of Punishment hanging ominously over the exit. Father stop by?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pal, I don't know a thing about it, honest! I was just minding my own business, when all the sudden, wham! I get hit right in the back. I fall to pieces, no idea what's going on! When I finally come to, the window job was done...!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Listen, boyo: I don't know exactly how to put this, so I'm just going to come right out. I need your help with something, and, I'll be honest, I don't think you're going to like it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If it doesn't involve hacking away at you with reckless abandon, Skelly, I don't want to hear it. But... oh. You're being serious.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am. And funny you should put it like that. Boyo, I am asking you to get me out of here. Permanently, if you catch my drift. This standing around stuff... just kind of wears on you, after a while, you know?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I know. I can only imagine. Tell me what I can do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That blade of yours back there. It's got a special power. You got to spruce it all the way up. Your Aspect, not somebody's else's. Then let me have it with that thing... and I'm out of here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then you'd be dead, forever? You're asking me to kill you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know it's a lot to dump on you, but I got my reasons. I don't exactly have a lot of options, here, so... give it some thought. Till then, we'll act like nothing's changed, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Listen, boyo: I don't know exactly how to put this, so I'm just going to come right out. I need your help with something, and, I'll be honest, I don't think you're going to like it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If it doesn't involve hacking away at you with reckless abandon, Skelly, I don't want to hear it. But... oh. You're being serious.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am. And funny you should put it like that. Boyo, I am asking you to get me out of here. Permanently, if you catch my drift. This standing around stuff... just kind of wears on you, after a while, you know?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I know. I can only imagine. Tell me what I can do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That blade of yours back there. It's got a special power. Your Aspect, now that it's maxed out. You got to let me have it with that thing... and then I'm out of here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then you'd be dead... forever? You're asking me to kill you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know it's a lot to dump on you, but I got my reasons. I don't exactly have a lot of options, here, so... give it some thought. Till then, we'll act like nothing's changed, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, uh, pal? My sources tell me that you made it pretty far. Which means... my usefulness is coming to an end.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your usefulness, what, you just mean the standing around, letting me lay into you with whatever vicious attack sequence I fancy at the time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah! Once you achieve your goal... my contract's up. You won't need me anymore.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But only if I leave for good, isn't that right? So if I stuck around... you'd stay here, too?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Probably, but... wait, you're really going to stay?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So Mama's back in town from what I hear, boyo! It's awful nice knowing I trained you well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, you must mean the Queen, and evidently you're aware of our relationship. You keep that quiet, understand, Skelly?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahh, and thus the pupil trains the master, for a change! I hear you, pal. Your secret's safe with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must have had yourself a real bash, with all those fancy gods and stuff! Could hear all the festivity from all the way out here. How was it, pal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It... went better than expected, all in all. I hope you didn't feel left out! It was a pretty limited guest list. Kind of a diplomatic mission, I would say. Not quite as good a time as it might have sounded from the outside.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ohh, don't you even worry about me, there, pal! I much prefer the solitary life, and besides! When things are good for you, they're good for me. Glad everything worked out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Less yakking, more smacking, boyo, now come on!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Less chatter, more batter, boyo, hit me already!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Less talking, more socking, here, pal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, boyo, less gabbing, more stabbing over here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Less prattle, more battle, boyo, give me all you got!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can't break these bones, pal, what you just try it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want another a piece of this, or what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough with the small talk, boyo, hit me, go on!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Trying to bore me to death with all this chit-chat, pal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This look like a shoulder to cry on to you, boyo?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me have it already, boyo, no holding back!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's see what you can do in terms of hitting me, pal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You could be hitting me right now, boyo!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure could go for somebody just whaling away on me right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the matter, you gone soft or something, pal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You going to hit me over here, or what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go on, boyo, give me your best shot, it's my job!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure could use a good smack in the jaw from you right about now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want to fight me, boyo, well hop to it, stat!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do I look like, pal, some kind of conversationalist?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our relationship, boyo, requires no exchange of words!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For you, mate! Thought you might get a kick out of this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For me, pal? Awful nice of you, just awful nice, but guess what, I got this for you! Tit for tat, you understand, a deal's a deal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa-hoh, you being serious here, pal? You brought that all this way, for little old me?! That's real nice of you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're not so bad yourself, mate. Thanks for always being here for me to savagely attack without a second thought.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoaaaa, now get a load of what you got there, boyo! Wait, really, that's for me? Or you just pulling my leg?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm really giving this to you, mate. Now go enjoy it, will you? Once I've finished pummeling you some more just for the sake of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heeey now that's what I'm talking about, thanks, boyo! Won't forget you doing me a solid like this, cross my heart!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No need to thank me, mate. But don't you dare forget it or I'll attack you repeatedly and without mercy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh look here, pal, I can't just keep accepting these from you! Not when they're paying me already, I got standards to uphold, you know?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will look the other way if you do, mate. Now, here! Or else!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Haaah, you're kidding, what? Sometimes, boyo, you make me feel alive again, you know that? Being honest with you here, I'm grateful, really.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If not for you, my friend, I'd have no one to viciously attack with no fear of reprisal whatsoever.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skelly, while I know your services have already been paid in full, your sources ought to know you've been doing an excellent job. So much so, I wanted to give you this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whaaa, is that a vintage bottle of Ambrosia, pal?! I never even thought I'd get to try a thing like that, I mean, what am I, here? Know what, I want you to have this. To symbolize our friendship, and in case you ever need a hand out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hope you enjoyed that vintage bottle of Ambrosia last time, Skelly, because I got you another. Here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aww, no way, boyo, you kidding me right now? Why are you even, I... look, I, I just stand around and let you beat me up, you don't have to do this. You don't even know who I am. Who I was.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're my friend, mate. That's all that matters. Although... I don't suppose you're willing to divulge those types of details? Just out of curiosity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, Skelly, I still cannot entirely get over that whole permanently-kill-you stunt you pulled on me. You had me deeply worried for a while, all for just a laugh?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, that's right! Not exactly much to do here, case you hadn't noticed recently! Good thing I'm able to stay occupied with intellectual pursuits.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's what you call it, then? In any case, I did want to make sure: You sure that you're all right, having to stand around like this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You kidding, pal? This is the life! Imagine getting paid to stand around! And being pals with you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahaha, got you pretty good, again, didn't I, boyo?! I am asking you to get me out of here. Hahahaha! All that stuff about your blade, and your Aspect, I mean, you ate all of it right up! Woo, hoo-hoo!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It appears I've been the victim of an elaborate prank. Not sure that I appreciate it, Skelly. What if I were to never hit you again, how would you like that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa, whoa whoa whoa whoa, whoa! Now come on, boyo, it was just a joke, I figured things could lighten up a little here. Don't need to do anything rash!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skelly, mate... this what I think it is?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skelly, mate! You really shouldn't have. Do you have any idea how hard-to-find this is?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What'd you get, what'd you get?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look at this guy over here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time for a break there, pal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you want to give it a rest, or what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, pal, you can stop!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Anytime you want to stop, there, boyo.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How am I supposed to get back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't think I'm supposed to be here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Uh kind of stuck here, pal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never felt a cut like that before!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Love what you've done to your sword!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That bow's got a different sting to it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: New arrows or something there pal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your shield's looking pretty handsome pal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I get the feeling I am being watched...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never been stabbed quite like that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Felt all three points on that spear, pal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey that shot felt different somehow!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You been messing with that shooty thing pal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: More of a slicing feel there rather than a stabbing!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeoow that's got a nice little kick of heat to it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hooh now that's what I call getting shot by arrows!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ooh, nice burning sensation from that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oof, I felt that deep down in my jaw!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if I beg for mercy, huh?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pssh I coud hit harder than that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What'd you get, what'd you get?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Want a piece of me boyo?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think you can take me boyo?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah, haha, bet I got you pretty good!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All that damage, that was nothing, pal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, have I got something for you, boyo!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finally did it, what do I get?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another Skelly statue. Why am I not surprised.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Because, pal, you are a discerning individual!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a feeling I know what this is...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's another statue of you, Skelly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go fill out that form you got.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't make the rules, pal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got to sign up for this contest.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, pal, live a little!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think you got what it takes?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, pal, live a little!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nuh-uh, you gotta work for it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't make the rules, pal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa don't you touch that thing!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That is a priceless work of art there pal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, don't you scratch that thing, boyo!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You keep that whip away from my pal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, what's going on between you two?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look at the size of that thing!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey you big lug, over here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Big-Bones, want some of this?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why'd you drag me into this one, pal?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nice bone structure on that thing over there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, bull boy, what's the matter?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ooh, help, he's got a double bladed axe!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The king of Athens, I'm so scared, boyo!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This one's for you guys out in the cheap seats!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Looks like I made it for the big event!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Thanatos, big fan right here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Thanatos, big fan right here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Uh, must have taken a wrong turn somewhere!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, what you doing all the way up here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa it's Papa, you're in trouble, pal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think this one's between you and Papa, pal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoever kills me gets a big promotion!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah boyo this place is a mess!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa nice place to stand around!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got here just as soon as I was able, pal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah what a bunch of bozos!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa it is hot in here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey look at all that magma!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa, look at all of this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa this place is a dump!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The air feels weird up here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You haven't seen the last of me!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've got a lot of nerve.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think you can keep this up?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wretches of the Underworld, to me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wretches of Tartarus, I summon you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hear me, Wretches, and come fight with me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Back me up, Wretches of Tartarus, right now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, you wretched shades, appear!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hope you don't mind if I invited a few friends?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're going to pay for this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will not let you win.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not through with you yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not through with you yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not finished with you yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You used to be a total pushover.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did you get this tough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get the hell out of here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll hurt you worse than that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know Nyx is helping you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're running out of chances, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll need more help than that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is the meaning of this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're going to be sorry, Sisyphus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get back to your post, Shade!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I told you to get out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I said stay out of this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are not authorized to be here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you have someplace else to be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He had no chance against us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're mine and always will be, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're mine, Zag. Don't forget it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll have to finish this back home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's all part of the job.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You could do better than that, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't get so careless with me next time, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanks for the little workout there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess I'll see you back here before long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: About damn time I finally got you, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did you go easy on me, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did you just let me win...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must have let me win.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your heart just wasn't in it... why?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll take what vengeance I can get.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Fates were on my side for once.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You better not have given me this one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Still got it in me after all this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you know when to quit?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll kill you next time, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You just can't take a hint.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll kill you again, and again, and again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your shining relatives can't help you here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Next time will pan out just like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll send you back as often as it takes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got you again like in the old days, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beginning to see a pattern, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll never hold back, for you or anyone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There! Now get out of my hall.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get the hell out of here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do say hello to Nyx for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What did you do to me....
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Am I supposed to be impressed?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can do better than that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My sisters and I. We've had a chance to talk, and we have come to an agreement, Zagreus. As you can see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Three against one. Doesn't seem all that sporting, now, does it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're each well past the need for any sport. We'll kill you, whatever it takes. Erinyes! Now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the matter, Zagreus? You look a bit uncomfortable. Something you want to say to me? Or any one of us?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, it's just... there's something that I wanted to discuss with you, at some point, Meg, but after more consideration, I am thinking maybe now is not the time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand entirely. Though you should know my sisters and I keep no secrets from each other, anymore. Isn't that right, Sisters?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eugh, I almost want to thank you, Zagreus. I thought you'd never change that blasted Pact, and leave me here, in peace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, you mean you aren't lonelier without Alecto's or Tisiphone's companionship? They seem so wonderful to have around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They're tolerable each to some extent. About as much as I can say for you. Now let's the two of us begin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: See, Alecto? He is right on time, just as I said.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heads up, Tisiphone. I think I found a murderer for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to level with you, Zagreus. For all we've been through... never once have I wanted you to meet my sisters.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't imagine why not! We had a lovely time getting to know each other. We laughed, we cried! My only regret was that you couldn't be there, yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't know what you're saying. There's a reason that they're not permitted in the House. Though, come on. One of us is going back there, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've really done it, Zagreus. My sisters have returned. All three of us now share the same assignment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is it wrong of me that I am somewhat honored to have garnered the attention of the Erinyes?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh I would say it's very wrong of you, indeed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sense something different about you, Zagreus. Your old weakness. Ah... the Mirror. I thought you said you weren't trying to compete with me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wasn't. But then you gave me a good idea to try. I'm not as weak as I once was. With or without the Mirror's help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that so? Well then let's see if you're correct. Come on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard that you escaped. Then, what are you still doing here? Forget something along the way?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know... I think I'd rather fight you to the death again than try to answer either of those questions, right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know what you're up to, Zagreus. But I guess it doesn't matter, either way. All that matters is you're not getting past me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your mother has returned to us, already, Zagreus. And still you're going to keep battling your way out, past me and everything up there? Why?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father says there's no escape from here, and I like to repeatedly show him he's wrong. Besides, I think getting out there a bit from time to time does me some good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds like you've found yourself a steady line of work. Most jobs just need doing. If this one gives you some fulfillment, stick to it. Now, come on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it that you're up to now, Zagreus? The Queen is back. But still you're making me show up like this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got some unfinished business with the Olympians to take care of, was in the area, figured I'd say hi. Hi, Meg!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't start with me. You show up here, we fight, somebody dies. That's it. Now, who's it going to be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Been seeing an awful lot of each other lately, haven't we. You had enough of me, yet, Zag?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never enough, Meg. You ready for another go at it, too, I take it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Always. Although I do like to keep things fresh, so... surprise me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Listen to me, Zagreus. Your mother is long gone. You're never getting out of here, and even if you did, what hope could you possibly have in finding her up in the world out there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've hope enough. Not that it's any of your business anymore.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your family is here. And so is your responsibility. You're running from yourself. Though, I can slow you down a bit I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What... where did you get the Rail? Do you know what you have? Where are your customary weapons?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I left them at home. And, I sort of know what I have, inasmuch as it's largely responsible for getting me this far. Would you like to see a demonstration?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I would. I always have, as a matter of fact.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's that you're holding, Zagreus? Please tell me that you didn't steal the most dangerous, unstable artifacts sealed shut within your father's vault.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, it wasn't I who stole them, if that's any reassurance to you, Meg!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are a hopeless fool. You cannot possibly know what you're doing with those things. You put them back exactly where you found them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She did... so you heard. I don't know what happened. You didn't even get a chance to say goodbye?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Damn it. If you had anything to do with this...! Even if you didn't, come on and die!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What have you done with the Pact, Zagreus? This isn't even Asphodel, and I can barely tolerate the heat. Do you really want to die this terribly?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Appreciate all the concern, but I just thought I'd live a little, Meg. You ought to try it for yourself, sometime!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ought to try watching your mouth. You want a swift and painful death, you'll have one momentarily.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Halt, Zagreus. Not one step further.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Meg. Haven't we had more than enough of each other by now? Besides, don't you have someplace else to be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know exactly why I'm here. Now shut your mouth, and come die like a man.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Halt, Zagreus. Not one step further.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Meg. Haven't we had more than enough of each other by now? Besides, don't you have someplace else to be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father sent me. All in all, I'd rather be on your bad side than his. Now you can turn back like a good little man, or I can send you home the painful way. What'll it be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I'll have to go with the painful way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A man after my own heart.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me something, Zag, because I'm curious. Do your Olympian relatives know the real reason you've been trying to escape?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll get around to that in due time. They're family. They'll understand no doubt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're in over your head, you idiot. You'll fray what bonds are left between Lord Hades and those ingrates on Olympus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Things can't entirely be different between you and me. You know that, don't you, Zag? Not when it comes to this, at least.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do. We wouldn't both be consummate professionals if it were any other way. You won't be going easy on me, will you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going to pretend you didn't ask me that. Now give me everything you've got!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it, Zagreus? You've got that pleased-with-yourself look, which can only mean you have something obnoxious to tell me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never! Look, I'm simply pleased to see you, Meg. Hence the insuppressible smile. Could have been one of your lovely sisters here instead...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're not going to throw me off my guard that easily. My sisters wouldn't let me hear the end of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And where, exactly, do you think you're going, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think I'm going all the way to the top again, Meg. To find my mother. You won't stop me. Get out of my way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We both know that's not going to happen. Getting out of your way, I mean.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your mother, Zagreus. You really think you'll find her once again, out there? Even if you make it out... maybe she's found another hiding place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It isn't us she's hiding from up there. Father let her go. He never wanted to go after her. So I appreciate your concern, but I'll find her again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That sounds like information neither one of them would want for me to know. You know the punishment for spilling secrets, don't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you doing, Zagreus? The Underworld is sealed off. What you're attempting is impossible. You've seen what happens when you go too far.
