label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This place can't stay sealed shut forever, Meg. In the meantime, I thought I'd get some practice in, you know?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not your practice partner, fool.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May I help you with something, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that you mention it, you can, Meg. I was wondering what was Father carrying on with you about back home?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eavesdropping again? If you must know, my job performance is under review. Though, I'm sure this job's about to go just fine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sincerely hope that you enjoy these meetings with me while you can. I know I will.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that's a rather ominous thing to say to someone, Meg. Care to explain in terms an idiot like me could understand?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Hades is exploring other options. He has no confidence in my ability to stop you anymore. Though, maybe it isn't too late for me to change his mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's been a while, Zagreus. You must have made it pretty far last time. Let's see. Outer reaches of Asphodel?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Outer reaches of Asphodel. And I have to say, Meg, you are positively a sight compared with that blasted Bone Hydra stewing away up there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How very flattering, to have compared me to the remains of some mindless outsized lizard. Come, maybe I'll kill you just as easily as your new Hydra friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How many times have we been going at it like this, Zagreus? You tired of me, yet?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're both immortals, Meg. We'll be seeing plenty of each other for a while yet. I've come to welcome these occasions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then, good. Lashing you across the face beats waiting for the opportunity to do so. Come.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard what happened. You crossed the River of Flame. You really did it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That Hydra was a total bastard, though. Bastards. But, you sound practically impressed with me, there, Meg! I feel so flattered!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll soon feel something else. I don't know how you did it. But it changes nothing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How utterly disgusting... I was just counting, Zagreus, and as it happens, I have lost to you fifty times, already! If not more. Can you believe this? Ugh, how I've fallen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, don't take it so hard, Meg! Once you die several dozen times, you start to get accustomed to the emotional pain, as well as the physical! Up for some more of either?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course! Who do you think I am? Although I guess there's no use keeping score with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know how many times you've beaten me, here, Zagreus? Can you even guess?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm... feels like a lot, admittedly, I mean, we've been going at this for a while, now. Four hundred and twelve times...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Five hundred times, exactly. Though I figure, you haven't been keeping track of how many times I've killed you. Ugh, maybe that's my problem. Well, plenty of time to work it out after this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You beat Alecto, Zag. Could hear her screaming her head off about it all the way through Tartarus... I almost want to thank you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I almost want to say you're very welcome. Have you and she always been on bad terms like this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We have long-standing differences. It's worse with family. You know what it's like.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Huh. Not even Tisiphone could stop you. Your father must be sorely disappointed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's difficult to please, that much is true. What happened to Tisiphone, anyway? She isn't much for conversation.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It runs in the family. Tis only knows her work. And, professional distance is important.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If there's anyone in all the Underworld who owes you, Zagreus, it's your friend, Sisyphus. He would be much worse off if not for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, because I've been distracting you from administering lashings like before? I hate to think you prefer to whip with no fear of reprisal whatsoever, Meg.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dereliction of duty and fear of reprisal are not one and the same. Though you don't seem to be concerned with either one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your weapon's looking rather dull, there, Zagreus. Great Daedalus decided not to grace you with his gifts this time around?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that you mention it, he hasn't, no. Though I'm prepared to say I don't need special augmentations to get past you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, we can put that to the test right now. Just remember, you need all the help you can get.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That Mirror's made you stronger, Zagreus. You're fortunate to have Nyx helping you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No hard feelings. I think she feels partly responsible for all of this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She shouldn't. The only one responsible for all of this is you. And I thought even you would have understood that by now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsch. I can't believe it. You signed the Pact of Punishment. Have you completely lost your mind? Or just trying to insult me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well if you're going to be so rude about it, maybe a little of each? Though, what do you even care which pacts I sign or don't?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not an idiot. I see what you're doing. You want to be punished? Then, come on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsch. You really volunteered into a Pact of Punishment? You can't back out of it, now. You're even more of a fool than I already thought.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe I just like a challenge, ever thought of that? Besides, what do you even care which pacts I sign or don't?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're right. I don't care. You want to be punished? Then, come on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have been longing for a fairer fight with you. Maybe that's why you signed the Pact? To pity me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have my reasons. Pitying you isn't one of them. Although I guess you don't believe me, do you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If it's punishment you want, how am I to say no?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know I can hit even harder than usual with the Pact of Punishment working against you. Maybe that's why you signed it? To pity me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have my reasons. Pitying you isn't one of them. Although I guess you don't believe me, do you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, I don't think I do. Come on, then, and let's see where all your pity gets you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This should be over pretty quickly, I think, Zag. Never took you for the Forced Overtime type. That's not a Pact condition for the faint of heart.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wound me, Meg! You know I like to barge into situations thoughtlessly and recklessly, and sort everything out later. Forced Overtime's the perfect fit!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahh, well, when you put it that way. Look, don't go saying I didn't warn you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold it, Zagreus. I sense something, is that... ah. You've been in contact with Chaos. So even they are now involved with this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just because Chaos is giving me the power to crush you doesn't mean they're getting involved with this, does it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't know who or what you're dealing with. Ask Nyx about them for me sometime. Here, I'll give you a chance to ask her very soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know that Thanatos assisted you in getting to this point. I don't appreciate his interference.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure you'll have a chance to tell him back at home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He has domain over the wretched shades, but his power has no sway with me. And neither does your own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I still cannot believe that Thanatos is helping you. I mistook him for someone with integrity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mistook him for someone who blindly follows orders without considering the implications.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How dare you...! If you like death so much, then here, let me indulge you. Thanatos will welcome you with open arms.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prince Zagreus, you are trespassing beyond the limits of your authority. I am under orders to stop you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Meg, why so formal all of a sudden? We've been through this countless times. Wait, is it because...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, come on, Zag. Will you just learn to play along, for once? Come on and fight me like you mean it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it, Zagreus? You look a little hesitant to go another round with me. Or is it my imagination?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, it's just... can we really keep the personal and the professional completely separate like this, Meg? It's with mixed emotions that I fight you to the death, only to be happy to see you back at the House.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then learn to keep your emotions in check. You keep them bottled up a while, they'll be that much stronger when it's time to let them out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nice gloves, there, Zagreus. Think you can take me up close with those things? Well within striking distance of my whip.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not wearing them for fashion's sake, here, Meg. You won't mind if I give you my best shot with Malphon here, will you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd mind if you didn't. Want to get your hands dirty, fine. Let's see it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What happened to your weapon, Zagreus? I sensed its power long before you turned up. That isn't just some Daedalus enchantment on it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Stygius and I have been getting much more closely acquainted lately, Meg. Would you care to see the fruits of our healthy symbiotic relationship?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You, in a healthy relationship? Why yes, then this I have to see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nice earring, Zagreus. Maybe I should have thought twice before giving you a thing like that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, because the gift you generously gave me may end up being instrumental in your own demise? Sounds straight out of one of those tales the mortals like to go spreading around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They like it when best-laid plans fall completely to pieces, don't they? You better grow to like it, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sense something of death upon you, Zagreus. What's that you have, something from Thanatos is it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, this old thing? It's just a listless butterfly Than gave me, which happens to fill me with even more supernatural strength than usual. Don't pay it any mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not even Thanatos can help you here. But if I ever start a bug collection, I'll know who to call.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know Battie's not going to work here, don't you? I'm definitely not going to help you out of this one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Meg, you can do anything if you set your mind to it! Though, don't worry, Battie's just here for the show.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then, let's make it a good one. Come on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your little bat companion not too much to handle, is she, Zagreus? I trust you're taking excellent care of her. Not that she needs your help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh she's been positively perfect, thank you, Meg. Especially in how she puts us into contact when I need a hand. I hope it's not too much hassle, helping out from time to time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you were hoping to avoid a hassle, you've definitely come to the wrong place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look at yourself, Zagreus, you are a total mess. Halfway to death or worse. You're making this too easy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hit a few snags on my way to meet you, Meg. So, if you wouldn't mind going easy on me this one?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not on your life or death. But I will kill you quickly, how's that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're wounded, Zagreus. How unbecoming of a god. Not to mention that I have the upper hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I figured I'd give you a head start this time, so I let the wretched shades bludgeon me repeatedly along the way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fool. If you're half-dead already by the time you get to me, what hope can you possibly have for what lies ahead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You look like you had trouble getting to me, Zagreus. Did you try asking for directions on the way?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You sound like Hypnos. He's getting to you, isn't he. Isn't he!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You shut your mouth right now, with that. Come die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're not escaping death this time, here, Zagreus. You ready to go home?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, not just yet, though thanks for asking, Meg. If you intend to force me, know that I am going to resist, with all my might.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well I appreciate the warning. Now prepare to die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ever stubborn, aren't you. Maybe my whip might make you reconsider whatever it is that you're attempting here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your whip's not been all that persuasive in the past.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe persistence will pay off for both of us. Come, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And there you are again. Lord Hades ought to lock you up rather than let you run amok in his domain like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure he'd welcome all this feedback from you, Meg. Or maybe you're just pining for my father's job?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have no envy for your father's position. Besides, I happen to enjoy my own responsibilities.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, there you are. Just as I was beginning to think it's been too long since last I killed you, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Admit it, Meg. You can't stop thinking about me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't flatter yourself. I think of you in pain. And now there's no more need for the imagination.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Zag? Any last requests this time before I send you home?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's see, how about a swift and painful death, would that be possible?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be cheeky all you like. You'll get exactly what you asked, and nothing more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pff. And here you are again. You're slow to learn the way of things I see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I may be slow to learn, but... least I'm rather patient!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This talk about your patience is beginning to test mine. Enough! Come on and die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Give up already, Zag. Or I'll keep killing you each time you come this far.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have some bad news for you, Meg. Little by little, I'm getting stronger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That may be so. But you will never be my equal. Ever. You'd do well to remember that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're never getting past me, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: While that's probably the case... maybe I will this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Keep telling yourself that. Maybe it'll help take your mind off the pain that is to come.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even if you manage to get past me, there's no getting out of Asphodel. You saw what it was like. You really want to go back there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not a matter of want. The way out is there in that direction, past the river of flame.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're more stubborn than your father. I never thought that such a thing was possible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finally, you're back. You won't get past me like you did last time. Though, I would like to see you try.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Zag? May I have this dance for old time's sake?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ready for me this time, Zagreus? Come on and fight. No holding back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess we know the drill by now, don't we. Not that I don't enjoy our little arguments, in my own way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's here, Alecto. Tis. Let's get him, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prepare yourselves, Sisters. And you, too, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alecto. Tisiphone. Our guest is here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's here. Let's get to work, Sisters.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Sisters? We have a reputation to uphold.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ready, Sisters? There he is. Now, on my mark.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, Sisters, let's show him what we've got.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alecto, Tis, he's mine. Just back me up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No time for further talk, now, Sisters. Take him, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No quarter now or ever, Erinyes. Attack!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you ready, Sister? Let's take care of him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come, Sister, it's time to get to work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alecto and I were just wondering when you'd arrive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: See, Alecto? He is right on time, just as I said.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You see, Tisiphone? He's here, just as I said.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heads up, Tisiphone. I think I found a murderer for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's go, Sister. Together, we can take him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Well, Sister, we'll have to finish catching up some other time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wish it didn't have to be this way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why must we always have to fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's time we had one of our little fights.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I so was hoping you'd show up just now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that you're here, how about a little dance?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about we go once more for old time's sake?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And here I was just wondering when you'd show up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And there he is at last, the Prince himself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've come to die to me again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I killed you last time, I'll kill you again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess you want to die again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems you haven't learned your lesson yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope you'll pose more of a threat this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't seem to learn. Then, come and die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You aren't getting past me, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll never stand aside for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm back again, and I'll keep coming back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll get past me over my dead body.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm never going to back down from you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess we know how this is going to go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm pledged to stand against you, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will keep coming back, the same as you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will not stand aside for you, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't know if I can stop you anymore, but I can slow you down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll get you back for what you did last time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One of these encounters, you'll let your guard down, and I'll kill you again for old time's sake.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even if I can't stop you... I can get a few good hits in, I'm sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've got a lot of payback to administer here, let me tell you, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ungh, I've practically lost count how many times you beat me in a row here, Zag...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought you might show up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No need for small talk, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Up for another fight I see?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What say we get things started.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on and show me what you've got.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't just let you off without a fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come all this way again, just to see me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're prompt sometimes, I have to give you that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Halt, Zagreus. Not one step further.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come for another round with me, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's see if you can make it past me, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No hard feelings, Zagreus. And don't you dare hold back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One thing I like about you, Zag? You're always right on time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope you're ready for me this time, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't think I'm going to go easy on you, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know it's strictly business here between us, don't you, Zag?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I expect you to give me the best you've got, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you so much as think of going easy on me, Zagreus, I'll kill you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No holding back against me, Zagreus. Certainly not here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll find I don't grow weary of these run-ins with you, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know I can't just let you walk away without a fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You won't be getting out of here without a dance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's nothing you can do to hurt me, Zag. Though I would like to see you try.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm starting to enjoy these little outings with you, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Zag. Come at me with everything you've got.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you want me, Zagreus? Then come and get me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll give you one thing, Zag. You never keep me waiting very long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're looking pretty good, there, Zag. Though let me see what I can do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No pleasure without pain, right, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get out of here, death god!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do I know you, dead man?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What in the hell was that?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The hell did that come from?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stay out of this, I said!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh don't you mess with me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, I can get used to this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't have what it takes, redblood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Try not to waste my time again, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Was just a matter of time I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We fury sisters do like our revenge.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: About damn time I got my way with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You better not be going easy on me, redblood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was a sloppy fight even for you, redblood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: See you next time, you trash.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I told you what was going to happen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go on now back to daddy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bye now, see you next time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aw, we were just getting started.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Right down the drain with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another piece of trash goes down the drain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, all right, that's enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll hurt you worse than that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ready, Megaera? Tisiphone? Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Check it out, Sis! The god of trash is here. Let's get to work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ugh, would you just look at him! That smug look, that posture, everything! Please tell me you're not going soft for this trash-god, Sister.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Alecto. When was the last time that we looked to one another for approval? Besides, as long as we kill him, what do you even care?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, fair point, there, Sister! Very nicely said. Let's kill him, now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look at this awful piece of trash, come here again to bleed all over our nice shiny floor. Ready to fight my lovely sister, there, redblood?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's not so awful once you get to know him, Sis. Not that it matters for what we're about to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The both of you disgust me, Meg, you know that? Get it together and kill him this time, damn you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must have gone and signed a Pact! Isn't that right, redblood? Tell me right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, as a matter of fact, I have. Though I don't see how that's any business of yours, Alecto.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I like working alone! And you don't see me doing that, right now, do you? So I would say it's my business, all right. Along with killing you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whew, I thought I'd never get some quiet time again, you know, redblood? That damned Pact you stupidly agreed to, making me work with my sisters again. I'll get you for that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sensing a pattern that it really doesn't take much for you to have something to get me for, does it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, that's rich! How smart of you, you're smart! Know what? I'll get you for that, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, hah hah, hohohohohhh. Finally. I've been waiting for this! Really.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must be one of Megaera's lovely sisters, I don't believe we've had the pleasure. Waiting for what, exactly?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...So sick of, you know, doing my regular job, uninterrupted. Not having to clean up Meg's messes!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I get the feeling we're starting off on the wrong foot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Anyway. I always wanted to kill a god. You'll have to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heard rumblings about some news back at your daddy's House, redblood. So his illustrious abducted Queen, she's come back home?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, how do you even know all that? And should you really be talking about the Queen that way?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't answer to her! She can come and go as she wants for all I care. But you want to know who can't?! Yeah, you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I got to ask, how come you keep on showing up, redblood? I thought you would have had enough beatings by now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, you know, I've come to enjoy these visits with you so much, Alecto, that I've made it something of a regular routine. Form good habits, and then stick to them, I say!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You call this a good habit, huh? Maybe for me, it is. Well, come here all you like, and I will be here waiting, every single time! About once every three times, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heard you had a real bash down in your daddy's House, redblood. So sorry I couldn't make it. Next time, though, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Next time, definitely, Alecto. We missed you for sure and wish you could have made it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hohoho, I'm sure you did. But, you know, work comes first! So let's get busy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, redblood. I have done a lot of thinking, and I've come to the conclusion that I want you never to speak to me again. Ever. Got that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Erm, I don't know how to respond to what you said without directly disobeying your request, Alecto. But for future reference, fine, I'll bite.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll die! There's no use standing here flapping our gums when we could cut to killing one another right away. Come on!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahh, look at you, redblood. You're practically already dead! Now that's no fun at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry to disappoint you, Alecto. I know you enjoy being responsible for a hundred percent of my bloodshed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, that's all right, no hard feelings at all! You just be sure to get in better health before next I get to kill you, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know I smelled your blood from three chambers away? Hope you saved some of it for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've saved some of my blood, yes! Though I was thinking I'd hang onto it for now, if you don't mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do I look like someone who doesn't mind, trash god? I'll take your blood, however much you've got.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the matter, redblood? You look a little paler than usual. Been bleeding much, having to get this far?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I ran into some setbacks, if you have to know. But don't worry, I'm sure I've plenty left to bleed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh whew, that's a relief all right! I was so worried that I wasn't going to be the one to kill you this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're looking pretty beat already, there, redblood. So let's finish you off.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Next time, don't you go losing so much blood before you get here, trash! I like to take it out of you myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're no god! You're nothing but a piece of trash. Born into all of this. And you don't even want it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You seem to have me all figured out. And here I thought we were still getting to know each other.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsch. Well. You want to know what I want? Here, I'll show you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know what I like about you? The way you bleed. Mmm.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That... is not the type of flattery I'm used to. You're making me a bit uncomfortable, I'll have you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never met a god that bleeds like you. Red. Like a worthless mortal. Come on! Let's bleed you dry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's get to work, redblood, what do you say? Me, I say you've kept this girl waiting long enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I say I don't appreciate you calling me redblood. You're making me rather self-conscious about it, you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, hoho, you're funny. But you'll break. They always do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have got to admit, you are really frustrating, you know, redblood? What is it going to take to make you scream, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, you mean to say Meg never told you? And here I thought you two were close.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ehh, we'll find out. I've got plenty of ideas left I've been meaning to try.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know something, redblood? In retrospect, I should have known this wasn't going to be a quick job.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They say both gods and mortals are notoriously poor at estimating how long it takes to get anything done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Normally when I'm on the job, they grovel, then they scream. They shut up eventually, but not you. At least, not yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Huh! You really must like pain an awful lot, redblood. Or maybe it's just me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You see, Alecto? Turns out we do have a common interest after all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did you just? Don't you ever compare yourself to me again, you trash. You want more pain, I'm happy to oblige.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've got a lot to be thankful for, you know, redblood? Your daddy could have shut you in the lowest pits, and then we never would have met!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perish the thought, Alecto. What would you have done with yourself if not for all our fated encounters?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know! I mean, before we met, I flayed all sorts of other trash down here! But lately I've been keeping them waiting, because of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good job, redblood! You made it all this way! But, I have got to send you back to daddy, now. Nothing personal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wish you could join me, Alecto. Want me to put in a good word with Father next time, so you can come visit us at the House yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you know, I'd rather have my eyes put out, but thanks for offering! Now, time to head on home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, redblood, my appointments usually don't come to me, much less again and again! Think I'm here to show you a good time, huh?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alecto, I just like to see you menacingly smile. And, hey, having to deal with you now and again beats having to fight Meg all the time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whaa?! You think dealing with me beats dealing with that weakling? Graaaah!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How many times is it going to take, redblood? How many?! Tell me! How can you stand running into me like this, over and over?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, habits can be hard to break. As for how many times, I've really no idea. Though I guess there's one way to find out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll give you one thing... I like it when my prey bites back. Come on, let's see some blood again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tisiphone's started to say the strangest things, lately, redblood. You wouldn't happen to know anything about that, would you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, don't fret. I was just trying to help her expand her somewhat limited vocabulary.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stay out of her head!! You really think she's got something to learn from you? Learn to shut up from her!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eugh, still can't believe Megaera got mixed up with you, redblood. For all her weakness, I always thought at least she took her job here seriously. Eh, live and learn!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not interested in your nasty remarks about her, Alecto. Though if you keep them up, I'm warning you, I might get mad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ohh, you might get mad? Defend Megaera's honor, since she's far too weak to do it her damn self? You think she's so pure! Hahaha! You're disgusting! Both of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh hey, redblood! You're back for more. I like that stubborn stupidness about you, honestly. If only I could keep you alive even longer this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, you planning to kill me with insults this time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Haven't decided how just yet. This girl likes a little spontaneity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Huh! Normally my marks don't make a habit of seeking me out again after I'm through with them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can imagine that, it's just, I've really come to appreciate these little back-and-forth exchanges that we have.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ugh, I do so hate to let you down like this, redblood. But you're just not my type. Maybe I'll finally get it through your head this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Know something, redblood? Try as I might, I still have not forgiven you for beating me last time. Call it a crippling character flaw, I don't know...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forgiveness can take time. Though self-reflection is a healthy step. We're making progress!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think we're making progress? Here? Ah, hah, ha-hah, ha-hah, ha-hah, why you piece of trash! I'll show you progress.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Redblood, I'm getting awful sick of seeing your smug face, time, after time, after time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you given any thought to just... leaving me alone, and going back to wherever it is you came from?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You see? That is exactly what I mean. To think that Megaera had to put up with you for, I don't know how long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damn you for this, redblood. You're making me look bad, you know? Making me feel bad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alecto, I didn't ask you to repeatedly attempt to kill me. How did you expect me to respond?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah-hahah-hahaha, hahah, you do know what happens when you make me feel bad, don't you...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Huh, it's the god of trash, come once again to filthy up this place! You're getting real predictable, you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Considering I beat you last we met, I'd be much more concerned with your predictability than mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't want to hear it from you, trash! Just want to see you bleed. Now you come here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ohh, there he is, sisters. It's time to get to work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ready, Megaera? Tisiphone? Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's tear him into shreds, sisters, come on!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, check it out, sisters, he's back. You ready?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's come crawling back again, sisters. Let's get him, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, sisters! Don't screw this up for me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm taking point against this trash, sisters. You back me up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All three of us against this trash, sisters? All right!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The three Furies up against the trash god! What a fight!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, hohohohoho, look at him, sisters! Don't you just want to whip him all to shreds?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Much as I love chatting with you, Meg, Tisiphone... our prey is here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ready, Sis? This redblood's nothing to the both of us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Check it out, Sis! The god of trash is here. Let's get to work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Sis, what do you say we get started on him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There he is, Sis! I'm ready if you're ready.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, Sister! Let's rip him all to shreds!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ready for him, Sister? I most definitely am!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're never getting through the both of us without losing a lot of blood, trash god.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My sis and I, we're going to tear you limb from limb, redblood!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think you can scoot right past the both of us, trash god?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, Sis! You just back me up against this trash!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll just keep killing you, redblood. Not that I mind!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are we going to do with you this time, now, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm impressed, redblood. You really never learn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Turns out, killing the god of trash never gets old.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How would you like to die this time, redblood? Here, let me guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You just don't get it, do you? Though I bet I can make you learn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm getting real sick of you, trash god. Come on!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bad news for you, redblood. I like dying.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, redblood, let's see you kill me again!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're stuck with me forever, trash. Remember that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm really starting to hate you. You know that, redblood?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why if it isn't the god of trash himself. I'm so honored.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good news for you, I'm in a real bad mood right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Been looking forward to this chance to get you back, redblood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heard you were in the area, and thought I'd take another stab at killing you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Redblood, I really don't appreciate what happened here last time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You might get through me, trash god, but I'm going to spill your blood before you do!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Long as I slow you down, redblood, I've done my job.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think just 'cause you got through Megaera, you'll get through me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your daddy never should have given Megaera this job.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Megaera couldn't make it, redblood, so it's me and you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah! It's Megaera's hot mess. Let's clean you up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You got Tisiphone, so what. Now I'll get you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mess with Tis, redblood, you mess with me, get it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tisiphone's been having problems with you, huh. Let's see if I can help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nobody messes with Tisiphone but me, redblood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going to enjoy this, redblood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just when I was beginning to feel bored.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going to tear you limb from limb, redblood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Fates must want to spill your blood as much as I do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time to die, again, redblood. Let's get to killing you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This job never gets old, redblood, I can assure you that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well if it isn't the god of trash himself. Come die.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good, I was getting real tired waiting around to kill you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aww, you came back all this way! I'm flattered, redblood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got some kind of deathwish, don't you. Fine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, thank the Fates I get to deal with you this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's see what you can do, redblood. Come on!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well! Look who's back. The god of trash, himself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get ready for a bunch of pain and suffering, trash god.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa, whoa, whoa, hold it right there, redblood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Been waiting here to beat you to a bloody pulp, redblood!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't even open that damn mouth of yours, redblood. Except to scream.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must like pain, or something, don't you, there, redblood?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Somebody's dying soon, redblood! Ohh, I can't wait.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come give me everything you've got, trash god!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's see what you're made of, trash god! Come on!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Looks like my prayers to the god of trash have finally been answered, huh?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the matter, there, redblood? Gone awful quiet! Did I hurt your feelings, huh?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ohh, I'm going to bleed you till you're dry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want to mess with me again, redblood?! Well then, come on!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How is it possible I am so sick of you, but never sick of killing you, redblood?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Step on it, redblood! I've got lots of other trash to whip, you know!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want through that door back there, it's going to cost you blood!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Megaera's not just weak, she's got bad taste to match.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh good, I was just itching for a live one, here, trash god.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Live or die, your daddy doesn't care, redblood!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good thing your daddy hates you, or I wouldn't have the pleasure here, redblood!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm real sick of waiting here, so how about we make this real quick, redblood!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nothing like nice, fresh blood to warm things up in here, I always say!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When I heard you were coming through, redblood, I told my sisters I would see you here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ohh, we are going to enjoy this, here, redblood!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heard you were in the area and volunteered for this, trash god.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time to spill it for me once again, redblood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll send you screaming home to daddy, now come on!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey who turned out the lights?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mess with Tis, redblood, you mess with me, get it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heads up, Tisiphone. I think I found a murderer for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, you must be one of Meg's sisters! Nice to finally meet you. My name's Zagreus. Not Murderer. Definitely not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm... look, I've done some things that maybe aren't great, but I am very, very sure I haven't murdered anyone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well then, let's get to work!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm here on official business this time, Tisiphone, so, uh... stand aside! Although, I guess the whole point of this job is that you're meant to try and stop me anyway, isn't that right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, sorry that you couldn't make the feast back at the House, Tisiphone. Though, I don't really think it was your kind of scene. Although, Ares was there, he's probably done some murders, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm... how about, no? No murder. No murder!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was really hoping we could change the subject. Please?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me guess. Murder? Murderer, perhaps? One of those two.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please, I'm not a murderer, you don't have to do this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're not getting through to one another, are we. I'm sorry that it has to be this way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't understand. But I'm not who you think I am. My father sent you to stop me, that's all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, murder. Zagreus. My name is Zagreus! Can you say that, Tisiphone? No murder. Zagreus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You really did say murderzer, didn't you! That's progress! Zagreus! I'm Zagreus, I'm not a murderer! Can you say Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you remember me, Tisiphone? My name is Zagreus. Prince of the Underworld? Pretty close with Megaera, I guess. Try saying Zagreus again for me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you're so close, Tisiphone! Remember, Zagreus? That's me. I'm not your enemy, you know, don't you know that? I'm only Zagreus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Wait. Just the first part. No murderer. Just Zagreus. Or... let's see, how about... happy? Can you say happy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, well... let's try again with happy, how about that? Happy? No murder, only happy. Come on, now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eugh, I guess the happy thing just isn't doing it for you. Though, maybe trying to kill me like this is as close as you can get. You learned my name at least, that's something, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Then we're back to square one. Look, I was just trying to get through to you with all the Zagreus and happy stuff. But, if you can understand any of this, Tisiphone, I think you're all right, just the way you are. Friends?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, uhh, any second thoughts, by any chance, about the whole happy thing? Just making sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You and me, Severed Hydra Head!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall scour you from this place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Zeus, what have I done?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Poseidon, was I not your favored?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Poseidon, is this all because...?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dionysus, is this all because of Ariadne?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But Goddess Demeter, what did I do?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why is Death on his side?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You took me once already, Thanatos!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get out of here, you skeleton!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My noble warriors, you would side with him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is the meaning of this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Out of the way, my friend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He'd make a mockery of us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Out of the way, my friend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He'd make a mockery of us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Such a spectacle is it not?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nothing like battling before an audience!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They know our victory is certain here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That cheering's not for you, monster!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We shall prevail for you in the stands!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you enjoying yourselves in the stands?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Such fervor coming from this crowd!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To all who came to see us fight, thank you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We owe everything to our audience!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Keep cheering, as we battle to the last!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The roaring of the crowd fills me with strength!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just listen to that, friend Asterius!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You shall have what you came to see!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To all our fans, we dedicate this fight to you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was for last time, fiend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thus I reassert my status as the Champion!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your foolish attempts shall get you nowhere!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall send you to hell however many times it takes!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are forever doomed to fail.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We make a formidable duo, don't we, Asterius?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You were a fool to stand against our might.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Back to the hell that spawned you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I send you to the depths of hell.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Begone from here and don't return, you fiend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You had no chance against the Champion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When next we meet, it shall go even worse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Elysium is for the great, not for the likes of you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You should have stayed down in the depths of hell.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You failed, as was surely fated.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Asterius, my friend, you are avenged.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You destroy my chariot, I destroy you, end of tale.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Chariots can be repaired, rebuilt! Honor cannot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was for my beautiful chariot, foul daemon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your foul deeds shall go unsung, mark you my words.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There. I shall await when next you clamber to these heights.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If only you could hear the roaring crowd.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That ought to shut him up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They say to never meet your heroes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That ought to make Theseus shut it for a bit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It shall take more than that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We can take more than that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Guh, I shall not lose to you again!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Khh, I am not finished yet!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, hahaha, it's finally time, Asterius. He's here! Aren't you, now, you vile, insignificant hellspawn? Prepare now to be overrun!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, this is unfair... that's a bronze-plated Macedonian Tau-Lambda! What's an obnoxious bellyacher like you doing with the most durable chariot created, to date?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pah! You don't deserve to know. Suffice it that Asterius and I were handsomely rewarded once again. And we shall not hesitate to exploit our hard-fought spoils against you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He would pit you against me, Asterius. I can see it in his mis-matched eyes! I cannot shake the terrible vision that, someday or night, it shall be me, standing alone here, whilst you...? Whilst you take sides against me! With that fiend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Asterius, about that, please consider it a standing offer, if you like. I'd rather have you as a friend than as a foe. Not sure that I can say the same for Theseus, of course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You poisonous worm! I knew you had a more sinister trick at play, because your fighting style certainly is of no concern just on its own! Are there truly no depths to which you would not stoop?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I'm telling you, you're wrong, Asterius! He is no royalty, most certainly not any I would recognize! He's but a nameless, long-forgotten minor god born of the depths, and bound to stay in them!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I, too, once was berated by such words, king. We've faced this enemy how many times? And in my estimation, he's fought bravely, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bravely?! Hiding behind those pillars is what you call bravely, Asterius? We shall have to discuss this strange lapse of judgment after we achieve our victory!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I, too, once was berated by such words, king. We've faced this enemy how many times? And in my estimation, he's fought bravely, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bravely?! Hiding behind those pillars is what you call bravely, Asterius? We shall have to discuss this strange lapse of judgment after we achieve our victory!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope you're perfectly pleased with yourself, hellspawn. Because Asterius has been quite cross with me! Such as he is. He says I have misjudged the likes of you! Outrageousness.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't hear me, king. We still have a lot to learn about this foe. Each time, he's differently equipped. Weapons, god-given abilities, and such. Despite our efforts... it's been difficult to read his strategies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And now, you're saying I can't fight, Asterius? Even though I had no difficulty besting you within that maze of yours?! Come on, let's do this fight!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't hear me, king. We still have a lot to learn about this foe. Each time, he's differently equipped. Weapons, god-given abilities, and such. Despite our efforts... it's been difficult to read his strategies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And now, you're saying I can't fight, Asterius? Even though I had no difficulty besting you within that maze of yours?! Come on, let's do this fight!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, worm! Come fight us, I suppose. And take fullest advantage of the havoc that you sowed! We are no team! We're merely two combatants, simultaneously booked to be here, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: King, I think you are over-reacting, here. Try to be reasonable. And be more considerate about my point of view. Don't think I am asking for too much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're asking the impossible of me! But, let us fight. And let us lose, I'm sure, because if we are not a team, what are we, then, Asterius...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: King, I think you are over-reacting, here. Try to be reasonable. And be more considerate about my point of view. Don't think I am asking for too much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're asking the impossible of me! But, let us fight. And let us lose, I'm sure, because if we are not a team, what are we, then, Asterius...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll have to excuse the Champion, there, short one. He hasn't been himself. Though he'll still fight you to the death, I'm sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's good, because you had me worried for a moment, there. Hey maybe I can knock some sense back into him, what do you think?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not so sure. I've tried. But I know better than to underestimate you. Fight us, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll have to excuse the Champion, there, short one. He hasn't been himself. Though he'll still fight you to the death, I'm sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's good, because you had me worried for a moment, there. Hey maybe I can knock some sense back into him, what do you think?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not so sure. I've tried. But I know better than to underestimate you. Fight us, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please fight with me, again, Asterius. I mean, just like before! You must forgive me my indecencies of late. This blasted fiend! His lies and treachery get right under my skin. Or the phantasmagorical equivalent!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Swear something to me, king. That you'll discard your fears about our bond. The short one here is never going to break it. He doesn't even understand it. The only one who can break it is you, yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... oh, my dear friend, Asterius. I see, of course, you're right, you're right. You're right! And I solemnly do swear to you, indeed, that I shall never again doubt our brotherhood! Nor shall I ever listen to this fiend! Together, now and always!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please fight with me, again, Asterius. I mean, just like before! You must forgive me my indecencies of late. This blasted fiend... his lies and treachery get right under my skin. Or the phantasmagorical equivalent!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Swear something to me, king. That you'll discard your fears about our bond. The short one here is never going to break it. He doesn't even understand it. The only one who can break it is you, yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... oh, my dear friend, Asterius. I see, of course, you're right, you're right. You're right! And I solemnly do swear to you, indeed, that I shall never again doubt our brotherhood! Nor shall I ever listen to this fiend! Together, now and always!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come forth, blackguard, and you shall soon be crushed under the massive wheels of the finest chariot the world has ever known!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You only have that chariot because of me, you know. It's all because of a condition of the Pact of Punishment! Nothing you did or earned. So drop the act!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahahahah, what?! You claim to be my benefactor, when in truth, you are my figuratively mortal enemy?! I'll do the chariot-equivalent of trample you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come, blackguard! And be crushed beneath the raging wheelwork of the Macedonian Tau-Lambda, once again!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Theseus, you do know you look even more ridiculous than normal wearing that mask? I get the chariot and the unsporting weaponry, but why wear that thing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bah! This blessed mask was crafted by great Daedalus, himself! A work of art, and my entitled claim as champion! What has he ever done for you?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well now, Asterius, he's returned! And this time, we shall have to vanquish him without the aid of our divine armor! A worthy challenge, no?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be cautious not to underestimate him, king. He has proved troublesome before.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nonsense, my friend! For how can one underestimate that which deserves no esteem whatsoever?! Together, now, attack!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, you senseless monster, I suspect you're not so pleased with yourself, now! Behold!! For my glorious chariot has been restored!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, indeed, nice work! Though must have cost a fortune in gemstones and diamonds, restoring an old Macedonian. I thought it was totaled after last time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The only thing which shall be totaled here, you heartless property-destroying scourge, is you yourself! Asterius!! Together, let us break him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My chariot and I stand ready for you, daemon! And I assume Asterius, as well! I feel it in my phantom heart, we shall not fall to you this time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, my opinion of the Macedonian Tau-Lambda has fallen precipitously of late. Though perhaps it's not the chariot but the driver.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Silence!! Show me a finer chariot-driver anywhere within Elysium, why, you cannot! I'll run you down for such an insult to my pride!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ready yourself and your fine armor, friend Asterius! I shall drive circles around him, whilst you dispatch him with your mighty axe!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your strategy might work a little better if you didn't shout it loud enough for me to hear. Though I have to say I'm impressed you can drive, fight, and shout all at the same time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And I, fiend, am impressed that you yet live and breathe! A temporary state Asterius and I shall soon alleviate! To war!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's here, king. Activating armor. It's fortunate repairs on your chariot were completed in time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nonsense, my friend! We could defeat this vile hellspawn with or without the additional divine protection we've been granted here! Get him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Avert your eyes, fiend, lest the shining bronzework of the Macedonian should strike you blind! We are prepared to face your devilry!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prepared for me, really? I've dismantled your ridiculous chariot before. Even Poseidon knows you're just a blowhard with a fancy ride.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How dare you to invoke my Lord Poseidon's name?! And, to besmirch our complicated past! No god shall ever favor you as he has favored both Asterius and me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold, fiend! You'll walk not one more step toward the light of day, so long as I am here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Two against one. Seems hardly fair.... Ah, well! <Snort> Let's kill him and be done, king.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Theseus?! The Bull of Minos?! You two are legends! I'd be honored if we had a sporting contest here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahh, a naked attempt to sway me from my convictions. Defend yourself, you blackguard! And may the gods show you some mercy, for I shall not!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I warned you, short one. Now you face a foe more terrible even than I. The only other foe whom I have ever faced, who bested me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold, fiend! You'll walk not one more step toward the light of day, so long as I am here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Theseus?! No way! You two are legends! I'd be honored if we had a sporting contest here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahh, a naked attempt to sway me from my convictions. Defend yourself, you blackguard! And may the gods show you some mercy, for I shall not!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beware, short one. Now you face a foe more terrible even than I. The only foe whom I have ever faced, who bested me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold, fiend! You'll walk not one more step toward the light of day, so long as I am here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Theseus?! No way! You two are legends! I'd be honored if we had a sporting contest here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahh, a naked attempt to sway me from my convictions. Defend yourself, you blackguard! And may the gods show you some mercy, for I shall not!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So! The fiend returns to challenge us again, Asterius! Despite having experienced such a thorough thrashing by us last time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know full well that wasn't a fair fight. Face me yourself and we'll see how you fare.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Silence, you monster! I'll hear no more such wicked lies, half-truths, or quarter-truths! You, however, soon shall hear my blessed spear! Specifically, the sound it makes whilst sliding into your exposed midsection! Defend yourself!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So! The fiend returns to challenge us again, Asterius! Or, rather, to besmirch the honor of this competition!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Besmirch what honor? You're just complaining that you lost. Even though I was outnumbered!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Silence, you monster!! I'll hear no more such wicked lies, half-truths, or quarter-truths! You, however, soon shall hear my blessed spear! Specifically, the sound it makes whilst sliding into your exposed midsection! Defend yourself!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are those bestial gloves of yours, blackguard? Beginning to show more of your true and savage nature, here perhaps?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. He bears the Twin Fists in the aspect of a king called Gilgamesh. That king, he, too, wrestled a beastlike man, who then became a friend. Maybe that's why I knew this fight would come.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you telling me, Asterius? Now is certainly not a good time for waxing philosophical, I think! And, surely this King Gilgamesh of whom you speak is much more competent a fighter than this filth!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are those bestial gloves of yours, blackguard? Beginning to show more of your true and savage nature, here perhaps?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. He bears the Twin Fists in the aspect of a king called Gilgamesh. That king, he, too, wrestled a beastlike man, who then became a friend. Maybe that's why I knew this fight would come.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you telling me, Asterius? Now is certainly not a good time for waxing philosophical, I think! And, surely this King Gilgamesh of whom you speak is much more competent a fighter than this filth!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, hellspawn! You seek to break through to the surface of the world. But you shall not achieve your goal, whilst I yet live and breathe! Or the equivalent of it, here in the splendors of Elysium!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then you leave me with little choice but to make you shut up, already. And your bull-headed manservant there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That Minotaur whom you address is my dear friend, you preconceiving stain upon the earth! Asterius and I are brothers here in death as we were enemies in life. Not that you could ever understand fraternal bonds as strong as ours!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah-hah, the fiend comes crawling back once more, drawn as he is much like the unassuming moth unto the flame of righteousness!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh no! Not the flame of righteousness! Are you finished? Let's get this started, I've come a long way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hear that, Asterius? Our fiendish visitor is begging us for mercy. Begging us, no doubt, to drop our guard!! Together now, my friend, let's vanquish him, and may the glory of Olympus guide us!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And where do you think you're going, fiend?! Thought you might scoot right past Asterius and myself without a fight?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, on quite the contrary I've been under no impression that avoiding conflict is an option here. So say your piece, and let's get on with it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You, hellspawn, shall not traverse that gate behind me whilst my compatriot and I equivalently live and breathe! Prepare for death!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, hahaha, you are just in time, Fiend from Lowest Depths! Asterius and I have trained extensively since our last skirmish here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So all you do here in Elysium is train for martial competition? You're constantly awaiting your next fight to the death?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And who are you to judge, you misbegotten, shameful, unfilial maggot? It is an honor to have the opportunity to spend my afterlife perpetually standing in your ruinous path!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: See here, Asterius! The god-hated fiend is back once more to be destroyed by our joint, righteous fury!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: God-hated? You'll have to be more specific. I have the gods on my side. Though I suppose you do, too. Why can't they make up their minds?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They have made up their minds! They stand united against darkness, as do I! With the exception of Asterius, here, who serves the light! Let's serve it now, my friend! To battle!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Upon my word, the fiend again darkens these halls! Alas, Asterius, it seems I was mistaken and he hasn't learned his lesson after all!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And what's this lesson that I ought have learned? Is it to always slay you first since you're so damn insufferable all the time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your lesson, monster, is to never, ever take up arms against those favored by the gods themselves! You shall never see the light of day as I once did! Uh, no offense, Asterius.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, hellspawn, you stained my honor last we battled here. But as you plainly see, I have returned! As has Asterius! And we've no shortage of honor left to spare!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shouldn't I  be the Champion of Elysium, now that I've beaten you? Isn't there someone else around to challenge me, say, Heracles? Someone less chatty?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, hahaha, very clever, fiend. Invoking Heracles' name, in an attempt to drive me to a jealous rage. It shall not work! But you shall dearly pay nevertheless!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The monster has returned, in a vainglorious attempt to wrest the title Champion from me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I couldn't care less about your title. Though, shouldn't you share it with the Minotaur? He's more than half the reason you've been any trouble.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll not drive a wedge between us, fiend. Asterius and I share a fraternal bond forged from the strongest bronze! Nay, adamant! But you have caused us both offense, so, die!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have recovered, as you can plainly see, monster! As has Asterius! And this time we are filled with renewed vigor, to destroy you utterly!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So we're locked in an endless cycle of violence, basically. I guess that's one way for you to pass the time here in this stodgy place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You take that back about Elysium! Or, better: I shall make you eat those careless, inappropriate remarks! Come, Asterius, to war!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're well-equipped to deal with you, short one. Though I know better than to disregard your might.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Speak for yourself, Asterius! I, for one, know only pure contempt for this foul daemon and his underhanded fighting style! A style we shall easily dismantle, now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're well-equipped to deal with you, short one. Though I know better than to disregard your might.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Speak for yourself, Asterius! I, for one, know only pure contempt for this foul daemon and his underhanded fighting style! A style we shall easily dismantle, now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What hope have you, monster, versus the blessed bonds of brotherhood?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Best not belittle him, king. He is more powerful than he appears. We must remain alert, this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I am perfectly alert right now, Asterius! And were I still alive, I would be positively salivating at the thought of running through this pustule with my spear, or whichever means I had available! Now, let's go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What hope have you, monster, versus the blessed bonds of brotherhood?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Best not belittle him, king. He is more powerful than he appears. We must remain alert, this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I am perfectly alert right now, Asterius! And were I still alive, I would be positively salivating at the thought of running through this pustule with my spear, or whichever means I had available! Now, let's go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Theseus, before you flap your ghostly gums at me again, I'd like to hear from good Asterius this time! He almost never gets a word in, thanks to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The king speaks for the both of us, short one. Though if you wish to hear me say something to you, I will oblige.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And I, too, shall oblige! That is, oblige my trusty spear, which yearns to penetrate your soft and vulnerable, altogether pallid flesh! Now, die!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, look, Asterius, the fiend returns! The rumors that he fled to haunt the surface must have been mere lies!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well no, in this case, those rumors must have been quite accurate, it's just, I'm back! Realized I didn't want a future for myself that didn't include crushing you repeatedly like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, hoho, such clever excuse-making from one so versed in treachery! Well, if you are indeed contained within this realm, then we shall be delighted to make sure it always stays that way! Now come and fight!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you yet heard, monster?! The Queen Persephone is back! To rule the Underworld in all her terrifying grace! Perhaps one of these days or nights she shall be present in the stands, to witness your destruction at our hands!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, about that? She's my mother. So maybe watch your fool mouth with me, or else I might just put in a bad word!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you disgust me, daemon, that you would even dare to say such things about the Queen! Prepare now to be vanquished in her name!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's this, Asterius? This blackguard thinks that he can saunter in here whilst bleeding profusely, and confront the two of us?! A hollow fool!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ran into trouble on the way with your combative friends here in Elysium. One more unfair advantage in your favor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How would you know of fairness, fiend? You belong in the lowest depths, forgotten in the mists of time! Come, let us send you there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look at this contemptible fiend, stumbling half-dead already into our hallowed colosseum! What transpired, monster, did perchance my Exalted brethren trouble your dark path?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Theseus? I would appreciate it if you could be more considerate of the substantial effort necessary just to reach this point where I can make you shut your mouth.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Effort, pah! You shall be imminently slain, and effortlessly, I am quite certain of that! Asterius, to arms!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What hope can you possibly have of vanquishing us, hellspawn, when you are visibly upon the verge of death? You are, more than usual, a miserable sight!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanks for your concern, there, Theseus. But I trust I have plenty of life left in me with which to destroy you, if not your companion as well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah! What would you know of trust! Being a vile, grievously-wounded-already creature such as you are! Asterius, let's end his misery!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's this? Our enemy has come to mock us, Asterius! He holds the Yarn of Ariadne, and would flaunt it in our faces!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, this? I just picked it out of a Well. Was supposed to help me get here. No offense intended, more than usual. What's it to you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As if you wouldn't know! That Yarn is a token of days long gone. When Asterius and I battled in the Labyrinth, to the death! Together, we now face a greater threat. Attack us if you dare!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Again you mock me with the Yarn of Ariadne, blackguard. You ought know that woman's name means absolutely nothing to me, now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You seem pretty put off by a random bit of twine, there, Former King of Athens. Care to share your innermost thoughts on the subject, or best keep them bottled up?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nothing shall be bottled here, you filth! That she became enamored of me was not my responsibility, besides! She was naive! The same as you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That blasted Yarn of Ariadne, once again!! Have you no shred of dignity at all, monster? Or would you stoop to any desperate means to draw me out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just happened to have it on me, Theseus. But it seems to keep upsetting you. Maybe you should seek this Ariadne in my father's realm, and make amends?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe you should shut up!! That Ariadne's dead to me. She has been since we were alive! I cherish her memory, yes. But only because, if not for her, I'd not have met Asterius! Now, meet his axe!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, look, Asterius! It seems the fiend has brought some sort of nondescript yarn-ball! Not seen the likes of it. Indeed, it holds no sway on me, at all!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: King. The princess Ariadne was my sister, if you don't recall. Please do not denigrate her memory. <Snort> You're making me upset.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, no, my friend! I meant you no offense! But I'd no love for her, was that my fault?! Pff, forgive me. I... I shall seek her out. Someday or night. But first!! This daemon has to be destroyed. Together, no?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, look, Asterius! It seems the fiend has brought some sort of nondescript yarn-ball! Not seen the likes of it. Indeed, it holds no sway on me, at all!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: King. The princess Ariadne was my sister, if you don't recall. Please do not denigrate her memory. <Snort> You're making me upset.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, no, my friend! I meant you no offense! But I'd no love for her, was that my fault?! Pff, forgive me. I... I shall seek her out. Someday or night. But first!! This daemon has to be destroyed. Together, no?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now hold a moment, fiend! Asterius made me aware that you recently asked of him an autograph. A tribute to his fame! As I am Champion, I am prepared to generously offer mine, as well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! No thanks. Appreciate the offer, though. How about a fight, instead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, pffsch, you...! 'Twas merely a jest! I'd not have given you the cloth about my loins, much less my name! But a fight you certainly shall have!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ready yourself, Asterius, my friend! For our most hated enemy has come to challenge us again, before this loving crowd!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't understand this place at all. How is it you're still champion after all this time? After losing repeatedly and often, I mean.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What would you know of it?! There's more, much more, to being champion than empty victories! It is a way of thought. A bearing! A certain dignity which you shall never have!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The gods are testing us once more, Asterius! For, how else to explain this fiend approaching us, bearing such blessings as would normally be fit only for heroes such as we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You do know I'm related to them, right? The god of the dead is my father? I'm sure word's gotten around. Not that I want deferential treatment from the likes of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good! For you'll get nothing of the sort. The gods are on my side, not yours, monster! What business would they have, abetting you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beware, Asterius! The daemon comes! The daemon, who would sever the fraternal bonds we share, if we so much as drop our guard!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? You think I'm here to ruin your friendship? Look, to each his own in that regard, though since you bring it up, I really don't see why Asterius puts up with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You see? Just as I said! Cover your bovine ears, Asterius, for this monstrosity would poison us to get the upper hand!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, hellspawn, I have been thinking on this for some time, and I've a declaration I must make: I shall hear no more of your silver-tongued lies. You come here, and we fight, and that is all!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you even talking about? I barely get a word in edgewise, much less Asterius over there. You know what? Fine. I've had it with you, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And I've had it with you! Now, come, Asterius, let's shut this blackguard up! Or shut him down, whichever you prefer.
label: CHARACTER
