dialogue: There is but one thing I shall give to you, blackguard. Other than the razor-sharp point of my blessed spear! You are resilient. Time after time, you challenge us! Sometimes I fear I shall develop some sort of grudging respect for you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've no such fear, myself, Theseus. Though, I appreciate you noticing. You're quite an inspiration, you know? I wouldn't come all this way to destroy just anyone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To be destroyed, you mean! I see you plain, monster. You seek the glory of this fight, before this crowd? You yearn for it! Then, you shall have it! Just as often as you please!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I vividly recall our every clash against you, daemon. Each victory! And even the defeats. But you? You've not learned anything, have you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's all right, Theseus. We have a splendid painting of you back at the House, for those moments when I invariably forget you exist. You were quite dashing with long hair, you know!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, I am honored even in the lowest pits of hell? And yet, remembered in my carefree youth. Not in the wisdom of my latter days! Well then, remember this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, ho, that is a handsome spear you doubtless claimed deceitfully from some more-worthy bearer than yourself!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, this old thing? How nice of you to notice. It once belonged to the hero, Achilles. A little past your time, but maybe you've heard of him? Seeing as he's much more famous than you ever were.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How dare you say such things to me! I was the greatest king of Athens in my day! The tales of my exploits with Asterius and many other challenges shall long outlive whatever comes of you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me something, monster: Whence did you steal that kingly blade you're brandishing about? It seems ill-fitting for one such as you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, this? I wouldn't say I stole it, so much as naturally wooed the Fates into bestowing it upon me. You could say I'm kind of testing it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahh, well then! I pity whosoever shall lay hands upon that cursed thing, once you are finished with this testing of yours. I think that we can make it rather quick!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There, king! He has the weapons I told you about... the fists of Gilgamesh. Follow my lead this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There, king! He has the weapons I told you about... the fists of Gilgamesh. Follow my lead this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prepare to be sent back into the depths whence you came!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahh, at last! Come, Asterius, let's vanquish this blackguard!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come, hellspawn, and get destroyed by the two greatest fighters in Elysium!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dare you clash against the Champion of Elysium and his most trusted friend?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you seek a swift and righteous death, you fiend, you've come to the right place!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come forth and die, preferably with some amount of dignity!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's time, Asterius! Let us assert our greatness through single-minded combat!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By the gods of Olympus, you'll go no further on your wicked quest!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There is no greater pleasure in Elysium than vanquishing the likes of you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I swear upon my honor, fiend, you shall not pass!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No matter how you try, you cannot shake the bond we share, monster!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You stop right there, blackguard, and make your plans for death!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've nothing left to say to one another, hellspawn! Other than: To battle!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Few others in Elysium are so unwise to take up arms against Asterius and myself!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You challenge us to battle, hellspawn?! Then, Asterius and I accept!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Attack us if you dare, blackguard! Asterius and I stand ready!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see my brethren failed to thwart your advance. Well, you shall go no further!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come forth, blackguard, and be vanquished by my righteous spear!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Asterius and I shall smite you back into the lowest depths of hell!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are beneath the notice of the gods, monster! Whilst I have earned their favor!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You return at your peril, hellspawn. You'll get no quarter here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Upon my faith, you'll take not one more step toward the light of day!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Face us, filth! However many times it takes, until you cannot stand it any longer!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Behold, Asterius! Our hated enemy has come to be dispatched before a loving crowd, once more!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Try as you might, monster, you shall not shake either my own resolve, or that of my dear friend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our foolhardy challenger approaches once again, I see! Well, then, prepare to be run through!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You face the Champion, and me. Ready yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You face the Champion, and me. Ready yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let us destroy him quickly, king. Or, perhaps slowly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let us destroy him quickly, king. Or, perhaps slowly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Waste not more words with this one, king. Let's fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Waste not more words with this one, king. Let's fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is as the king said. You will not leave Elysium except through us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is as the king said. You will not leave Elysium except through us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look who has managed to come crawling back, Asterius? Let us deliver him again!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Try as you might, monster, Asterius and I shall stop you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must take sick, appalling pleasure in defeat, hellspawn!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall never yield the title Champion of Elysium to the likes of you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think that you can get through me again, hellspawn? Come try!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I always shall rise up to thwart your wicked plans, monster!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: About damn time I finally got you, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Champion and I will reign forever.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May this defeat fill you with vengeful fury.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will be waiting for you to return.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It will take you more than that to vanquish me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is the fate of those who challenge me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Return to the bowels of hell, short one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can I get some applause or something here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hope you enjoyed the show out in the stands!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess I win this round.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was my friend, you bastard!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was my friend, you bastard!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Observe this gleaming coat of bronze with which I am adorned, now, short one. <Snort> Your doing, as I'm to understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My father is to thank for that, not me. I've proven difficult for him to contain, so now I'm beneficiary of his latest Pact of Punishment. You're welcome!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hadn't thanked you, as of yet. Though, come. I'll repay you suitably for having me encased within this... suit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me, short one, where is your own armored suit? I would prefer not to do battle against one who's ill equipped.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, my father keeps the dress code very strict down there in Tartarus. No armor in the House! Never tried the stuff.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dress code. <Snort> I, too, follow a code. And it's a code that strictly states I cannot let you pass without a fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even with this armor I was unable to best you one-to-one. Perhaps I lack as yet the necessary training to take full advantage of its benefit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't suppose you have some good acquaintances with whom to train, until such time as you see fit to face me once again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. <Snort> King Theseus is occupied with preparations of his own. You are my good acquaintance now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am returned once more to my more-earthly capability, short one. And I am able to move freely once again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine change of pace, Asterius! Who needs that old, spectacular, custom-fitting suit of legendary armor, anyway?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mock me. Yet you know nothing of being trapped; enclosed in something and unable to break free. I need no armor to fight you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You haven't spoken to your fist-weapons yet, have you, short one? 'I see you overcome the wild and make peace with death.' That's what you're supposed to tell them. I'm sure of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just been a little tied up lately is all, but I will get to it, Asterius! I guess you'll want to know the result?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Here, I'll give you this chance to get home quickly, if you want to know, yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There, on your hands... the weapons you call Malphon. They're just as I saw in my dream. Monstrous. Like me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Former property of someone called Gilgamesh. The beast-man he fought, Enkidu... you said they became friends? What said your dream about us on that front, sir?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It didn't say much. Only that we would fight. Just as that Gilgamesh and Enkidu once did. Maybe the outcome will be the same, maybe it won't. We'll find out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You come from the bowels of hell. This is not your place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Agreed on both counts! Just passing through, so if you'll excuse me...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will not. <Snort> The Champion of Elysium would never back down from such a contest. Neither will I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, you're not the Champion of Elysium...? You're the Bull of Minos! I can't imagine who's even stronger than you. Is it Heracles? Tell me it's Heracles.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will not. <Snort> You talk too much, short one. Come get destroyed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You come from the bowels of hell. This is not your place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Agreed on both counts! Just passing through, so if you'll excuse me...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will not. <Snort> The Champion of Elysium would never back down from such a contest. Neither will I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have met the Champion, the king. Let us see if you are fit to face him once again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean face both of you, together. Which doesn't seem particularly fair.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Life isn't particularly fair, short one. Nor death. I'd have expected you to know as much. But here, have your fair fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let us clash here again before you face the Champion. We never will allow you through without a fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're nothing like Theseus. Why go along with everything he says and does? You're your own man. And bull.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: King Theseus slew me in life, and saved me in death. I was cast into Erebus. A monster. He found me when he died. And used his influence to bring me here, with him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's nice of him and all, but sounds like you're even to me. Seeing as he killed you in the first place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No; we're not. And I will fight for him, and alongside him, for eternity. As recompense for helping me to understand exactly who I am.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You bested the Champion, himself. Which means that I have little hope of vanquishing you, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So then, why bother fighting me? You don't have to do this. That Theseus is a highly questionable influence on you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see you plain, short one. I, too, was born of darkness. But, I chose the path of light. Even in death, it was not too late. <Snort> Not even for a monster, such as I. I trust your deaths will likewise be enlightening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This heat... it reminds me of when I was young. Living in darkness. Learning to fight. To kill.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose you're about to put that learning to practice in another moment here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am. The heat fills me with strength. Let's see if it has any effect on you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah. I sense another furious battle here awaits us, short one. Although you're more inquisitive than usual...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Uhh, oh! It's just, I have an odd request. You see, the god of slumber, Hypnos? Colleague of mine. Huge fan. He's in desperate need of your autograph. Little personalized message? I don't suppose you'd be so kind. It'd mean a lot to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Autograph. I see. Then, it appears there are such gods as favor me. I will inscribe a bit of parchment for your colleague, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The god-forsaken Minotaur impresses then upon a parchment a brief message to the god of sleep, and gives it to the favor-asking Prince.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Know, short one, that this favor is for you and not for Hypnos. Though he may challenge me himself, at any time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Huh. You mean to fight with me bare-handed this time, short one? I'm not ashamed to say the Champion himself defeated me in such a manner back when we drew breath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wouldn't say the Twin Fists of Malphon counts as empty-handed, sir, though it surprises me to hear you could be beaten in such a way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was hungry and unprepared. Inexperienced. No longer. Come.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must take pleasure in having to fight against me, short one. I, too, have come to look forward to it. Even if I end up falling to your strength.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I was going to say, I'd much prefer we settle this more amicably, couldn't we? Perhaps I could interest you in a fine bottle of Nectar? Ambrosia, even?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, thank you. These battles are enough. Besides... you won that Ambrosia from us, fair and square.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, you're back, short one. Or Prince. Whatever they call you. I'm not much for formality.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not much for it either, here, Asterius. Though, speaking of which, how would you prefer to be addressed? The Minotaur, the Bull of Minos? Those aren't offensive to you, are they?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They don't mean anything to me. They mean something to others. I have my name. You know it. Use it if you want. Now, enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, you're from Crete, originally, aren't you, Asterius? I know this is a stretch, but... I don't suppose you ever heard of a commander by the name of Schelemeus? Captain of the Cretan second fleet, something like that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The king of Crete commanded the greatest navy in the world. Even I knew that, having never seen the light of day, the ships, the sea. Schelemeus, huh...? I might have heard the name. So what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, Schelemeus was a real person, then? But, Skelly said... ah, you know what, it's nothing, Asterius. Shall we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see you overcome the wild and make peace with death!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've come, short one. I dreamed of this very moment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Asterius, we've fought how many times already? What's there to dream about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. I dreamed. And in my dream, there was something I had to tell you. Rather... something you have to tell the weapons you wear on your hands. Tell them, 'I see you overcome the wild and make peace with death.'
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, I know what that is, that's a waking-phrase. So I'm to speak it to Malphon. Wait, why are you helping me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know whether I'm helping you or not. But in my dream... an ancient hero fought a beast of a man, barehanded. They became friends, in the end, after a great battle. I long for a fight like that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wonder something, short one. You keep coming back. But I don't know why. You're trying to get out of here, aren't you? But something's killing you up there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've deduced more or less correctly, Asterius. And yes, let's say there are some challenges remaining once I get out of Elysium. Though I'd best say no more of it than that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's fine. It's good to know you've fallen just as often as I have. I may not be the one to kill you. But I'll soften you up for whoever does.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ever make it out of here, short one? I wonder, sometimes, what it must be like... the outside.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've never been outside? Oh, right... the labyrinth thing. You lived in a horrible maze all your life. I haven't seen much of the surface, but... it's beautiful. Cold. When I'm there, though, I... feel out of place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Out of place. I understand, I think. I don't see why you'd want to go somewhere like that. It can't live up to the stories. Why ruin it? Speaking of which...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everyone's saying that the Queen is back. Do you know what that means, short one?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, for me, at least, it happens to mean quite a bit. I'm her son!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It doesn't mean a thing. We're still here to fight. Though, for what it's worth... my mother also was a queen. May yours treat you better than she treated me. Better than I'm about to treat you, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I smell the blood on you, short one. <Snort> You are severely wounded. This will not be a fair fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An unfair fight is not worth having, then, wouldn't you say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I would not. An unfair fight is better than no fight at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're hardly in a state to fight against me, here. Won't take too long to bring you death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Great! Thanks for the encouragement, Asterius. Don't let me keep you waiting on that, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If mere words can sap your will for battle, short one, then know this: You never stood a chance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You look as though you withstood many foes in getting here this time. Barely withstood, that is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They took a lot out of me, yes. But you have no idea just how long and arduous a trip it is from Tartarus to here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What would you know of arduous? Try living in an ever-shifting maze of countless passageways. Now let me finish what your foes began.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We meet again, short one. For further battle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Short one?! That's a low blow, sir. I thought you were the big-honorable type.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mock my sense of honor. <Snort> Common tactic. Now prepare.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You choose to challenge me again. Not many in Elysium so dare. Then, I accept.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, I never challenged you! The entrance to your chamber looks like any other pathway in Elysium. I have no quarrel with you, sir!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To step into my chamber is to challenge me. <Snort> It is a custom since the time I lived and breathed in darkness. I will send you into such a darkness now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My next opponent has arrived in short order.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Short order? That was another jab about my height, wasn't it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do not jab. <Snort> All of my strength goes into every strike. Observe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have returned to my chamber. I trust you are familiar now with what this means.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It means I've challenged you to a battle of strength and glory, because apparently that's all there is to do for fun around here for those such as yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That... <Snort> Yes. Essentially that is correct. Prepare.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It would seem <Snort> that the time for additional fun has arrived.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, yes, my favorite pastime: Getting butchered by a giant double-bladed axe. And sometimes trampled.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then, good. You have much to enjoy in store.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, short one. It seems I must attempt to maim you here, so that the king and I might finally stop you at the gates.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, you hurt me with this 'short one' business almost as much as with that axe. Why isn't Theseus 'short one'? We're the same height!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. The king is greater. He is the greatest king of Athens! What are you? A willful son of a fickle god. I am beneath your father's notice. And you are beneath the king's. Now fight me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is not often that my challengers return to face another slaughter at my hands.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, well. You're kind of in my way. What choice do I have?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your choices led you here, and they will lead you to defeat, again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are more skilled than I expected, short one. A re-match is most certainly in order.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're going to force a rematch each time I manage to defeat you, aren't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We and our victories are all impermanent here in Elysium. We live, such as it is, for moments such as these.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your challenge is hereby accepted, short one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I accept all challengers. No prior notice necessary.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have returned. <Snort> I'm always ready to oppose you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You enter my chamber once again, short one. Then, good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I expected you to reappear. <Snort> Let us fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Appears it's time we challenged one another once again. Prepare.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. <Snort> It feels as though I haven't crushed the life from anything in ages.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Returned to battle me for glory, short one? <Snort> Excellent.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come fight me again, short one. We have eternity to grow stronger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, short one. <Snort> Few in Elysium dare challenge me repeatedly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The short one from the bowels of hell has finally returned.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard you had again entered Elysium. <Snort> At last.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold nothing back against me, short one. Now, come.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let us grow stronger in the ways of battle, short one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I always am prepared to fight whoever dares oppose me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let us battle now before you face the Champion, himself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You seek the Champion. You must confront me, first.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hrmm. <Snort> It has been long enough since my last fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've been waiting for another round against you. Let's go. Now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They said you were headed this way. <Snort> I said I'd stop you. Though, we'll see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Each time we fight... I think I learn a little more. Let's start.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I had a feeling you would cross my path again. I've been looking forward to this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going to run you down, or run you through. Your choice, short one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Told the king I'd try to stop you on the way. He thought I'd have no trouble. <Snort> We'll see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, short one. I've been waiting too long for this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know what it takes to leave this chamber alive, short one. <Snort> Come on and fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have my armor, short one. Let's see what you have.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's see if you can cut through my coat this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This armor's heavy. But makes me even faster than before. <Snort> Watch.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are resilient, short one, I will give you that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm prepared to slaughter you again, short one. Come fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Interesting. <Snort> Most never challenge me again once I destroy them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What hope have you against the Champion, if you can't get through me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have tenacity, short one. I have to give you that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You do not take all your defeats to heart, do you? That's good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're quick, short one. Let's see if you can get past me again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, short one. I'm curious to see if you can best me once again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A worthy challenger returns. Let's see you defeat me again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Glory and honor to you if you can vanquish me again. Come!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I welcome the taste of defeat, short one. It is akin to feeling alive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm still learning all your tricks, short one. Come show me more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's see you get through me again, short one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm the one to challenge you this time, short one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have looked forward to repaying you in kind for our last fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're strong, short one. But I am just as obstinate as you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Champion awaits, short one. If you can get through me again, that is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good. Now I can get you back for last time. All I need is one clean hit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well fought. Though, your technique pales in comparison to that of the Champion of Elysium. I expect you'll soon see for yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I respect your strength, short one. The Champion of Elysium awaits. Until such time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You were a worthy challenger. Most welcome here. Until we meet again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have earned your passage. I go now to recover for the next occasion that we meet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you for sparring with me, short one. I'm glad we've made a habit of it thus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Urgh... the might of Gilgamesh... I understand it now. But I won't make his friend's mistake. We'll fight again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Such strength... the strength of Gilgamesh. Thank you for the battle, short one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought Achilles taught you to be quick.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Kick and scream all you like.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think you can keep this up?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not yet persuaded to go back I see?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My foolish brother cannot help you now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another contribution from my brother Zeus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be thankful that my brother favors you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Poseidon ought not meddle in others' affairs!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't appreciate this, Brother Poseidon!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Brother Poseidon making time to meddle here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Poseidon must assert himself at every opportunity!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Athena cannot save you from me, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll slay you once her shield falls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Athena would be wiser to stay out of this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How good of wise Athena to join in!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where would you be without Athena's aid?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pah, that meddlesome goddess of love!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think of her at such a time as this?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Must Aphrodite get involved in everything?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To Aphrodite all of this must be some sort of jest!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The hunting-goddess ought choose lesser prey.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Artemis! This hunt is well out of your league!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are the prey, not me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll need more arrows than that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Boy, you're the one who's being hunted here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The goddess of the hunt ought know when to retreat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Predictable the war-god would be here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'd best stay out of my affairs, Ares!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This shape-shifting of yours won't last for long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This must be a delight for your dear cousin Ares, boy!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That Ares can turn any small dispute into a war!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That drunkard's power means nothing to me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are you staining my clothes with wine?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think this cause for celebration, boy?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You cloud your senses with this foolishness!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is a battle, not a time for revelry!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You would seek aid from drunken Dionysus, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Demeter had best stay out of my affairs!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That cold witch worsens the weather still?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The cold is of no consequence to me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My foster sister must have better things to do!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That Demeter ought tend some other plot of land!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll not indulge such outbursts from you, boy!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'd pit my own kin, against me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How vile that you'd drag Olympus into this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You leave Olympus out of this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems you need all of the help that you can get!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, yes, my dear family being of such help!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So this is how Olympus is assisting our domain?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How cordial of Olympus to appear!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Megaera, what are you doing here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why spring to his assistance, Megaera?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't bother to assist him, Megaera!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get back to your assignments, Thanatos!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you have mortals to attend to, Thanatos?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No need to listen to him, Thanatos!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Distracting Thanatos from his duties, I see!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You needn't drag poor Thanatos into this mess!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Return immediately to your post, you wretch!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You shall be very sorry for this, wretch!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Was that a boulder from the blasted sky?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your handiwork, I take it, Brother Zeus?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Was that your foolish doing, Poseidon?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another of your blasted boulders, boy?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A collapse from the Temple, nothing more!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Was that the blasted boulder from before?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean to mock me with such tricks?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A laughable excuse for an assault.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Foul weather is the only kind!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This isn't what we compensate the gorgon for!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Return immediately to your post, gorgon!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're a custodian, not a combatant, gorgon!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is the gorgon doing here again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You summon our custodian for help?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Begone with you, back to Elysium!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The famous spearwork of the Myrmidons!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've still some spark, then, Shade?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Invite more of your friends, why don't you, boy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Leave that one out of this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who else shall you drag into this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Down, boy!! No treat. No treat!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bad boy! I mean.. good boy?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't have to do this, boy!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fight me for real, damn you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's see you deal with this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall not fall to you again!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you beat me, I'll just keep coming back!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Consider that a reimbursement for last time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are somewhat stronger than expected, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How arrogant of you to think you are superior to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am still more than capable of besting you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How many times shall you make me do this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Keep trying vainly as often as you like.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your flailing attempts against me are embarrassing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're stubborn, boy; however, so am I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do not become too prideful with me, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I expected more from you than this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where was your savage strength this time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I expect more consistency from you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You could have done better than that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beats listening to incessantly complaining shades.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I still have some of my old strength, it seems.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You did make it this far at least.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be mindful of the House while I am gone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps next time you shall fare differently.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sometimes one's best is insufficient, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Next time, I shall expect better results from you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not even the combined might of Olympus was enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Seek better help from all your relatives next time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would that you applied yourself to something worth the while.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I send you home now with nothing to show for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're as disgraceful as our kin upon Olympus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I told you, boy, that there is no escape.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Someday or night you shall look back on this, and thank me, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If this must be the way to teach you discipline, then so be it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mind your manners once you return to my hall.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You well could have expected this result.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Weakling! Remember that I vanquished Titans, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Supposing I shall see you here again some other eve.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that we're finished here, I can get back to work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I, uh... I'll just be over here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You now know that, even if you are able to surpass me, you shall ultimately perish, soon enough. And yet you still persist! Utterly senseless.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I found her, Father. And I'm going to find Mother again. And again, and again, until I have some answers, finally. She'd like some answers, too, beginning with why did you never tell her that I lived? You let her go, and left her to her grief!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Silence, boy! Save all your ignorant and baseless accusations. You seem incapable of heeding my request that you not blather on about a matter you shall never understand. Then, I shall save my breath for this fight!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You were never supposed to live. Took all of Nyx's strength to circumvent what should have been a certainty. Now you cannot stay dead. Such is the wry humor of the Fates.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx saved me.... So according to the Fates I was never meant to be born, since neither you nor Mother are of the Underworld, something like that? Or was that just another lie you told, to Mother and whoever else?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bah! You think everything a lie. The realm beneath our feet was appointed to me on certain conditions, not that I had much of a choice. Among them: A one-time surface-dweller such as I would never have an heir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You really believed that? Then why attempt to have a child, anyway?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't know anything! Why anyone would choose to have a child is a mystery to me. The Fates said I would never have an heir. Perhaps this was all they meant.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To think Olympus has been aiding you. You must be so grateful to them for their aid, without which none of this would have been possible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, about that. Father, did... did you let Mother go because you feared Olympus would find out? And... not respond well to the circumstances if they did?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsch. Be grateful they have not found out as yet, for all your meddling. You do not know them as well as you think. Ask yourself why she left Olympus, and how. Or better yet, ask her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, she seems quite lovely, so... knowing you, you probably tricked her into signing a pact to come join you, or something. Since you weren't allowed on Olympus, why not have Olympus come to you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah! Surprisingly not distant from the truth. I took her, boy! I took her down with me. Is that what you wish to hear? Does that anger you? Come, bring forth that anger, then!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, boy. Did you ask her? About how she came to join me in the Underworld. Did you confirm all your suspicions, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You didn't drag her down to hell, yourself, apparently. You're not going to tell me who did, though I can well imagine. Your brothers got to reign forever on Olympus, while you got sent down into the Underworld. So they gave you a consolation prize... didn't they?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You make such accusations, knowing next to nothing. Careless as ever. Poseidon had nothing to do with it! He knows even less than you. If you value her existence or your own, you would be wise to keep it that way. And to turn back!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...She was the Queen. Queen of the Underworld! My Queen. Commanding reverence, and awe, and fear. She was not just... what was the term you used? A consolation prize? You are as disrespectful to her as you are to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, what would you even know?! You claim so much respect for her, yet you didn't even respect her enough to tell her what happened after she left! But... what am I saying... I know you love her, still, Father. That best explains all the terrible choices you've made.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...All the terrible choices I've made. By the time you have existed for as long as I have, pray you will have made fewer. Although I fear you shall surpass me in at least this one regard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I have done virtually everything within my power to prevent this. All of it... for nothing. The Fates were not content to saddle me within the earth; they mock me, still.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe they just think you're in the wrong. And that you're an obstinate, overbearing, miserable excuse for a husband and father. Don't you understand I'm trying to fix the problems you caused? Since you're so unwilling to do it yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're right. I was unwilling. I made my choices, in all this. I loved her, yes. I loved her terribly. But now... it seems I am merely delaying the inevitable. Go, then. Go to her. But, should harm befall her... I shall bring my worst wrath upon whomever is to blame... including you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? You're letting me go, just like that? You're just afraid of getting struck down again. You're serious?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heh. Confronting you like this... it's different now. Still... it is a responsibility, just as before. There is to be no escape from my realm. Ultimately, I must see to that, myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's the spirit, Father! As for me, I find the candor of our interactions here to be rather refreshing, I must say. Especially the interactions between my weapons and your physique. You're tough, but you're an easy target.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And you are scrawny, though slippery, blast you. All that pent-up rage behind your smiling words... come, unleash it once again. I expect you to go all out. To the death!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was reviewing the terms of the Pact of Punishment to which you are bound. Even when my servants resort to extreme measures, they were still unable to surpass you, then. So now, it is my turn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Caught you unprepared, did I? After Theseus and his Macedonian, I half-expected to see you thundering around on some golden chariot of your own, drawn by sable steeds, that sort of thing. But it's just you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is just me, indeed. However... that should be more than necessary, here. No holding back this time, Zagreus. Are you ready?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What have you done with my ancient weapon, boy? I sense Varatha's form there in your feeble grip, but... there's some garish power you've awakened in it, haven't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, just took a splash of Titan Blood at the right time was all. There's more to your ancient weapon than you gave it credit for, I guess. Though let's not keep it waiting, no?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, let's not. Gigaros is the mightier weapon, with none of the treacherous past. It needs no fanciful shape-shifting tricks to run you through. Behold!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never had any respect for Stygius, that blade you bear. Perhaps unfairly, due to Brother Poseidon's sloppy form when once he wielded it. But now it seems quite different in your care.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think we've grown quite close to one another, yes. Enough to where I've come to know a different side of this fine blade right here. This is the aspect of some Arthur fellow! Maybe the two of you could get acquainted properly?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Arthur! No name either of gods or kings of any realm I know. Then, introduce us, as you say! To this new amateur, to whom your blade rendered its services.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The bow is the weapon of a coward, boy. I said so even to Hera's face. I'm unsurprised that you are drawn to it, and yet... something has changed about it, I can tell.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, you mean that Coronacht has taken on the aspect of a divine preserver person of some sort, of whom I've seen mere glimpses but seems definitely very capable, and really rather brave?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know not why the old Infernal Arms endear themselves to you. And, I entirely care not in whose weakling aspect you bring them forth, only to fall to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There you are, bearing my brother's blasted shield... flaunting it about so recklessly. Though, what have you done to it, now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not much, really, besides awakening the aspect of a supposedly unstoppable, dragon-slaying warrior called Beowulf. If it has the power to protect him against a giant lizard, I figure it may help me against you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You presently shall find I'm no mere giant lizard, boy. Though we shall see whether this Beowulf is any help to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Resorting to mere fisticuffs with me... though, how you got Malphon to look like that, I've no idea. Pray tell, whose monstrous claws are those? A manticore's?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: These claws, I'll have you know, Father, belonged once to an ancient god-king known as Gilgamesh. You ever meet?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hrm. Provided he was flesh and blood at some point, then he resides within my realm. Presumably within Elysium somewhere, sadly bereft of his manticore claws, thanks to you. Come, show me what they can do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You approach me with that loathsome Rail, boy. Emanating a hellish fury more even than usual, at that. Little surprise you took a shine to it. It was the weapon that I hated most of all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, someone called Lucifer apparently thought differently, and took a crack at his own father with it, once. This one's for him, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Invoking names you know nothing about. Presuming, all the while, far too much. You take that monstrous artifact for another friend? You would be wiser to be wary of its influence. But, let us fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, but there you are, boy, finally. Despite my knowing you are always late for everything, here you've outdone yourself by quite some time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh shut up, and get your fork, and burn away that regal cape, and let's get to this, then. I'd no idea you had all these capes to spare! Must have a whole entire storage chamber full of them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your mockery of me may temporarily embolden you, but achieves nothing useful, in the end.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This cold white substance falling slowly from the heavens. Snow, they call it. Look carefully upon each fleck. Tiny crystals! But structurally weak. They melt! This surface realm... it is held up by mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you're quite finished teaching me about this snow phenomenon, can we get on with brutally trying to kill each other, here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wish to have your mortal-colored blood spill once again upon this bed of snow, then fine. Let us proceed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You still have yet to see the sun itself. You know only the light of Ixion, but the sun? It is positively blinding. Hideous.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It has been snowy nightfall every single time now that you mention it. I didn't know it snowed so much up here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It hasn't always. But, that's of no consequence to us. Especially when there's a raging battle to be fought.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you are here, then... the Olympians must still be lending you their aid. Just as before! I scarce believe the Queen's preposterous idea worked. That all it took to settle an old score was a blasted family feast.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Father, even you must have enjoyed that feast to some extent. We ought to do it more often! Good thing you trusted Mother's judgment on that one. So, then, to the death, once more?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed. To the death, as always, boy. Zagreus. Ready yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. You're going home, not me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I never grew accustomed to the air, up here. It gusts senselessly whichever way it pleases. I suppose you must prefer it to the stillness of the air below.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, you're right. The air up here seems pretty good so far. But I will reserve judgment till I've had my fill. I have to say, though, Father: The Helm of Darkness suits you. I'm touched you'd dust it off on my account.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It should not have had to come to this. For all your antics with me and around the House, I always kept my temper, have I not? Unlike you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, let's see. You've berated me repeatedly and often. You've lied to me. Mustered your wretched forces to kill me, over and over. But, sure, I'll grant you that you've always kept most of your anger bottled up. All that's about to change, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're gods, boy. Killing one another is our lot. Although, I always thought I was above it. I told you that you cannot leave this place. It seems I must enforce my rules myself. I'm sending you home, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. You're going home, not me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I never grew accustomed to the air, up here. It gusts senselessly whichever way it pleases. I suppose you must prefer it to the stillness of the air below.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, you're right. The air up here seems pretty good so far. But I will reserve judgment till I've had my fill. I have to say, though, Father: The Helm of Darkness suits you. I'm touched you'd dust it off on my account.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It should not have had to come to this. For all your antics with me and around the House, I always kept my temper, have I not? Unlike you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well let's see. You've berated me repeatedly and often. You've lied to me. Mustered a bunch of incompetent wretches to try to kill me. But, sure, I'll grant you that you've always kept most of your anger bottled up. All that's about to change, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're gods, boy. Killing one another is our lot. Although, I always thought I was above it. I told you that you cannot leave this place. It seems I must enforce my rules myself. I'm sending you home, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know now what you're doing here is without any purpose whatsoever. Even if I don't slay you myself, you'll simply perish when you cross that threshold there. And yet you still persist?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do. Besides, making these treks helps pass the time during the ongoing Underworld renovations. And I'll be in tiptop shape once they're complete!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would that we had a little more support; the renovations could have been complete by now! As ever, you think only of yourself. But if you must insist like this, then you will find me waiting for you once you get here. Every single time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why? Why do you keep showing up? In spite of knowing that the outcome shall be just the same as how it always was?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beats having to toil away under your overbearing supervision. And besides, as you may be aware, I've recently made up my mind to leave this place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eughh... utterly incorrigible. When next we meet here, then, we'll keep it brief. I have grown weary of our aimless conversations. Now prepare!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You bear the Sigil of the Dead. I wear the Helm of Darkness. Even devoid of artifacts as these, we fight here without witnesses... in shadow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If only everybody knew you had a mighty son most capable of cutting you down to size, with or without the ability to vanish suddenly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A very boastful son, who often thinks too much of his ability. Come, then! I'll make you vanish suddenly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...That pomegranate blossom... I caught its subtle scent as you approached. The Queen has her mother's strength. And much more self control.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, you're afraid of a little flower, now, Father? One that imbues me with the fiercest might of Olympus, granted, but still! It looks harmless, at least.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I fear your little flower there much more than you. The Queen and her mother... they possess power over life. Thus, power over death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Extreme measures permitted, even still? You must have forgotten to change the conditions of your Pact of Punishment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wasn't an oversight. You're strong, Father. I want to be as strong, and more. Not that I'm taking after you, or anything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wish to test yourself against the full extent of my wrath, then very well. You have earned that right. Besides yourself, only the Titans have. Now, then... attack!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You vanquished me... even when I threw everything I had at you, and more. I fought you as I fought the Titans themselves, and still I failed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, don't take it so hard, Father. There's always next time, right? Meaning, this time. Maybe I won't be so fortunate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of that, I am most certain. Come, let us see the limits of our abilities, then. I warn you: I shall hold nothing back. To the death!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Nary a whif of Mount Olympus on you, this time. How is it that you clambered all this way, without the generous support of your dear family? Doubtless you merely purged their blessings for some coin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, I resent that, Father! I'm more than capable of getting here all on my own, now, thanks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Such arrogance has led to many a mortal's downfall... and many a god's.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Odd. No stink of Olympus on you, this time. Have you truly come all this way without assistance from your relatives? Or were you overzealous at a Pool of Purging?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wouldn't you like to know? Not even Nyx believed that I could come this far without aid from the Olympians. Maybe I just have a knack for proving everybody wrong.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have a knack for being struck down in various, ignoble ways, that much is certain. Come, then! Show me what you, yourself, can do!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be still. These waters... teeming with Poseidon's river denizens. That one there, before me... it's been taunting me, I think, for quite some time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You offering to take me fishing, Father? Sounds more pleasant than having you slaughter me again, or the other way around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mistook my meaning. First, you shall have my spear. Then, that thing shall, if it has not yet come to its senses. Though, if you vanquish me, I'm certain your uncle shall not mind if you extract it, yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is a testament to the awful might of Demeter that, even with the surge of heat created by the Pact of Punishment you toy with recklessly, this place remains a frozen waste.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Pact did make the road here a little more fraught than usual. But if it couldn't stop me, I can't imagine it could stop Demeter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forget her, and the blasted Pact. I'll stop you, myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enjoying the delicate warmth of the surface, b Zagreus? Apparently, the generosity of the goddess of seasons knows no bounds.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does feel a bit different, maybe. Though, Demeter said something about how this spot, in particular, would remain bereft of warmth, as a reminder. Do you think she knows what happened with Mother, really?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Demeter may harbor vengeful feelings and suspicions, but she is no fool. Experience teaches us to know when to quit. Though, evidently, that is a lesson you have yet to learn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look at yourself, boy. You barely stand, and yet believe you can surpass me in your current state?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not exactly easy getting here, you know. But I'm not going back. Not yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps not yet. But very, very soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Varatha... I recognize its presence, now. That's not just any three-pronged lance you wield. I could never stand to look at it, once my brothers and my sisters and myself... once our foul work was done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean once you'd chopped up your cruel and overbearing Titan parents, right? Shame you threw it out. It's quite useful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps the Fates decided that its wielders ought to all eventually wind up on its receiving end. Come, then! Let us see what the great Achilles has taught you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So! You think that you can vanquish me with my fool brother's old, forgotten blade. Poseidon was never any good with Stygius. Grew envious of my spearwork. Now he's famous for that fork of his! Always taking credit where none is due.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Must be hard, knowing that everybody's going to think you learned your spearwork from Poseidon, not the other way around. As for Stygius, I can assure you it's in good hands now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your assurances mean nothing to me, boy. You think yourself quite capable? Then show me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You come here bearing brother Zeus' Aegis. I wonder how much more insulting you could be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? I haven't even started to insult you here yet, Father. Flustered by the old Shield of Chaos, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Doubtless Zeus does not even remember wielding it. I never should have relied on him for anything after that! Then, come. Let's see if you're any better with it than your great uncle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hrm. It grew distinctly colder just as you arrived. So Demeter has been in contact with you, then. That witch. Tell me how much she knows.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? I don't... wait, this everlasting winter, it's her doing, isn't it? Why? Don't mortals die when it's cold? Sounds like a lot of extra work for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then you are ignorant. Keep it that way, with her. Lest you risk everything, you understand? The consequences would be far worse than a foul stretch of weather. But, enough talk, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hrm. It grew distinctly colder just as you arrived. So Demeter has been in contact with you, then. That witch. Tell me how much she knows.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She lost her daughter... who's my mother. But, Demeter still thinks I'm Nyx's son, and... what have you done, Father? This everlasting winter, it's her doing, isn't it? Freezing mortals to death. Why don't you stop this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The two of you know nothing, then, it seems. Keep it that way, especially with her. Lest you risk everything, you understand? The consequences would be far worse than a foul stretch of weather. But, enough talk, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...The sea... the heavens, and the earth. All of this belongs to my brothers. We are their kin by birth. But we are foreigners in their country.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. No mournful speeches. Now get out of my way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You impertinent brat. Fine. Impulsiveness runs in the family.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There was a time when Cerberus would never have permitted any soul to exit through that gateway there behind you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, that can't possibly be true! What about Orpheus, Theseus, Heracles, Odysseus? Countless tales of brave men delving into the Underworld, then leaving whence they came!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They left on my authority alone. Nor did they take for granted my good graces. You believe you are entitled simply to walk out of here. From your birthright and your responsibilities! But I am here to tell you, no.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My brothers and my sisters and myself. We, too, wanted to slay our parents. The Titans. Bastards. And worse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And you succeeded. Chopped up some of them into many tiny bits, and sprinkled them throughout the pits of Tartarus so that they can't regenerate! Or so I hear. Inspiring, really!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We had no recourse at the time, save to collaborate. Developed a specific plan, and saw it through. And, the Titans...? You think me cruel, yet know nothing of cruelty. But, here, you want something to hate, then have it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must admit to something, boy. Achilles taught you reasonably well. I expected that if anyone could train you into martial competence, it would be him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Though you didn't expect that, one day, I would end up using everything I learned from him against you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I anticipate more than you know. But Achilles merely practiced against mortals. Now, you practice against me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come all this way again, to fall to me? Would that you paid me such respects back at the House.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it going to take for you to understand that your place is in the House?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall give you no quarter, boy. Although I doubt that you expected otherwise.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The sea and air are very still this eve. Though I suppose that is about to change.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Know only that I take no pleasure in what I am now forced to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There you are. Then let us now commence this ugly business yet again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The heavens and the seas belong to my brothers; but know that you are still in my domain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You bypassed Cerberus again, I see. Unfortunately for the both of us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I had other pressing business to attend to. But I cannot let you leave.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No matter how many times you try, your stubbornness shall get you nowhere with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're back, with Stygius in hand. Come then, and show me your technique!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Blade of the Underworld cannot help you here, you realize that, boy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your heart-seeking Coronacht may have brought you this far, but shall not help you, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That heart-seeking bow you wield... it is nothing but a tool for cowards, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, Varatha and Gigaros are to clash again upon this empty field. Let us have at it, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew someday the Eternal Spear would turn on me. Let's see you wield it, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Shield of Chaos... what a monstrous thing. How suitable for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You bear the Aegis so much like your uncle Zeus once did.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think the Rail of Adamant can vanquish me? We'll momentarily find out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You would take aim at me with Exagryph? Then, very well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You would attack me with the savagery of the Twin Fists? Then, come.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Again, you seek to use the power of Malphon against me. Fine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are predictable in your arrivals here. Less so during the fight itself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was just thinking on when last I vanquished you. Come, refresh my memory.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No matter how often you defeat me, I shall face you here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Remember, I can always get here much, much faster than you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No matter how quickly you're able to get here, I shall be waiting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Again, you draw me from all my responsibilities back at the House.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I cannot let you go, boy. Some night such as this one, you'll understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall be interested to see if you can vanquish me again, here, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come, show me everything you've learned of how to fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've slipped by Cerberus again, I see. Then, draw your weapon, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see it's time again that we begin our bloody business here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This blasted place... how can you even stand it on the surface, here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who shall be first to return home this time, do you suppose?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems it's time again I sent you home, myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your rampage through my realm ends here and now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought you might arrive right about now. Then, let us have our fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll go not one step farther past this threshold, boy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The world beyond my realm is not for you. You're going home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wonder, boy, who's going to kill whom this time around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I cannot fathom why you wish to die repeatedly like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Already here? It seems our Underworld still has many failings I shall have to deal with, after this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come show your father what you've learned of late. Do not hold back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would that you cleaned your chambers with the same devotion you show getting to these heights.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Untold murderous wretches in my realm, all at my beck and call, yet still you made it here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thus having once more gained the surface of his grim-faced father's realm beneath the earth, resourceful Zagreus makes his way toward the one-time abode of radiant Persephone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is a journey of considerable distances, which he has already completed many times, and which has always ended in the same result. So... imagine he made it there with just time enough to water the crops and tidy up a bit, before...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once more, tenacious Zagreus achieves his lofty goal, and, just as every time before, except with some sort of new twist of Fate, perhaps, he goes a little distance, then he dies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Having already seen the splendid cottage of Persephone sufficient times, the stubborn Underworld Prince nevertheless attempts to go there once again. Although, his memory of it shall have to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Reflecting on his victory, Prince Zagreus observes how death can take hold in so many different ways, at times quite slowly, and at other times
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The master of this realm, Lord Hades, states that death is inescapable. There is considerable credence to his claim.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Imagine, if you will, the Underworld Prince soon meets one of his typical, ignoble deaths.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Underworld Prince is getting rather good at this. But let us say he perished anyhow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There are a myriad of tales to be told, of both great deeds and of vainglorious defeats, and this has been a tale that falls somewhere in the middle, overall.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Having gained the surface once again, Prince Zagreus breaths deeply of the wildflowers, and the roses, and the like, among which one of them contains an allergen so intolerably potent, that it causes this:
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As he journeys to his mother's cottage in the cold, loudly-speaking Zagreus calls out to hear the echo of his voice, the blast of sound causing a substantive amount of ice and snow to break off from a nearby mountaintop, and fall, and fall, and...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So complicated is the path to the well-hidden cottage of Persephone that surface-walking Zagreus on this particular occasion sadly zigs instead of zags, plummeting from off a precipice into most-familiar waters...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Amid the wondrous ever-springing garden of Persephone, Prince Zagreus discovers a greenish plant of some sort, supple-skinned and covered all in spines, a bit too small to see, until it is too late...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The limitless variety of fauna dwelling on the surface brings to Zagreus no shortage of delight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Though, when he makes an effort to communicate with one, its eyes so full of calm intelligence, he learns that bears are not as gentle as they seem.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Horned creatures are familiar to Zagreus, having fought countless Satyrs and the like; but he discovers, this time, that not even Satyrs possess the sheer, ferocious power of a startled mountain-goat...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Snakes and serpents rank amongst the creatures somewhat known to Zagreus, due to their presence in the Underworld.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So it is with delight that he approaches one upon the surface, greeting it as a familiar friend. It greets him venomously back, using its fangs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alas, the wisely-spoken Zagreus... stumbled upon a pit of deadly spears, perhaps?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prince Zagreus proceeded onward toward his certain doom, entirely too graphic to describe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beyond this point lies such a horrifying fate that we had better speak no more of it for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just then, erm, how about a very small yet very deadly beetle landed upon Hydra-slaying Zagreus, ending his attempt?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The never-learning Zagreus then... carelessly fell off a precipice, or something, plunging him into the rapids of the Styx.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Although there are innumerable ways for one to die, our danger-seeking Prince has come to know a sizable variety.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The clever-minded Prince again eluded certain death, up to a certain point, but then, predictably made one of his fatal mistakes, again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The oft-impatient Zagreus appears to take repeated deaths in stride, and so, here comes another one for him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Having ventured successfully much farther than before, the surface-seeking Prince encounters setbacks far too hideous to be described.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just then, the carefree-running Underworld Prince runs headlong into a thick and deadly wall of stone, painted to look like the way out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Filled with such confidence, the Prince neglected to avoid, erm, stepping on a toxic strain of fungus, so rare you'd not have heard of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Having somehow defeated grim Lord Hades in a thrilling fight, Prince Zagreus discovers... it was all a dream! A rather deadly nightmare, actually.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Despite having transcended past the confines of the Underworld yet again, Prince Zagreus proves utterly unable to get past this point.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Imagine that Prince Zagreus experiences some sort of joyous outcome, for a change, in contrast to the arbitrary and unfortunately painful death he shall experience... now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After defeating his lord father, yet again, Prince Zagreus begins to shiver, and catch cold. And, as is well known, there sadly is no cure for such a thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As he explores the wonders of the world, Prince Zagreus discovers a quaint farm, in which he carelessly trespasses, stepping on a farming-tool, which swoops up and strikes him in the forehead, fatally.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One might suppose the Prince's tale most likely ends akin to other tales of the heroes of our time, like so:
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The favor-doing Zagreus then walks into a chamber, black as night, but with a blood-red pool, and from it comes a voice which says: Would you mind diving in these waters, Prince? To which the Prince replies, Oh! Sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mere moments from his final victory, the Prince, in his great haste, ignored surveying each side of a rather busy crossing, where a swiftly-passing chariot collided with him, very forcefully.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The often-dying Prince, having achieved his purpose, then reflects upon his life and deeds, remembering his many past demises with such vivid clarity, that this occurs:
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In his great hurry to explore the country-side, the hapless-footed Prince steps on the peel of a most-exotic sallow-colored fruit, and tumbles backward with such sudden, violent force that you-know-what occurs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He cannot kill me like this every time, believes the Underworld Prince. He shall eventually have no more ideas. But the Prince, as often is the case, is wrong.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just when his victory was all but certain, a fissure opens underneath the feet of the ill-fated Prince, and from it vents a cloud of superheated water-vapor; steam, as it is known! And probably you know what happens next.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Upon the surface realm, the mortal-loving Prince would doubtless find that death still comes in a variety of different forms. One of the most common, yet perhaps least interesting, involves simply waiting... long... enough... until...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Having achieved his goal, the Underworld Prince discovers that the mortal realm is utterly bereft of the life-threatening excitement to which he has grown accustomed, and the lack of anything of note to do, the sheer mundanity, results in this:
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then, erm, valiantly striding Zagreus was set upon by seven Bloodless Slam-Dancers, and slain. Or something of the sort.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So joyfully did Zagreus attempt to gain the surface that, why, he just rose too quickly; and we know how that one goes, from Icarus' tale.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I have no new tales left to tell. But do not think that you have won, Prince Zagreus... for any tale worth telling... is a tale worth telling again, and again, and again. Bye-bye!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The duty-shirking Prince then met another of his fated deaths, in fashion best left to imagination.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One of these days, or nights, not so very long from now, the Prince may finally traverse beyond this point. And then, what shall become of him and I? Well, hopefully, not this:
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The unrelenting Underworld Prince again vainly attempted to proceed beyond the current limits of this tale.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The hint-ignoring Prince again attempted to transgress, to no avail, into domains not yet prepared for his arrival.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thus having somehow vanquished his own father, the grim god of the dead, defiant Zagreus is finally set free to seek the hidden place in which his long-lost birthmother resides.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How shall that all work out for him? Alas, it is as yet too soon to say.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pretend for now that the Lord Hades absolutely clobbered him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beyond this point, our tale of the Underworld's determined Prince cannot further continue at this time. But time does not stand still, and more, much more, shall someday be revealed....
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For now, there is no more to say or show from here, so let us say instead that Zagreus was cruelly killed, again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The trials of Prince Zagreus have only just begun...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our tale of the Underworld Prince is far from finished. But the rest of it shall have to wait until another time.

label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The myriad of challenges and dangers that await beyond the flame-hot river shall be revealed and overcome upon a later time.

dialogue: The burning fields of Asphodel again proved unable to stop the flame-resistant Prince, but then, misfortune struck, just like it always does.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thus did the fate-confronting Prince traverse Elysium, where he discovers to his great dismay such horrors as can only be detailed at some other, later time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As hero-thwarting Zagreus approaches perilously closer to the surface, he... perhaps gets caught within a rockfall of some sort.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: With oft-undocumented dangers of Elysium well behind him, now Prince Zagreus faces an even greater threat... one which I shall get back to you about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So stifling is the thick darkness past Elysium, that the ill-fated Prince there bumps his head extremely hard, and dies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beyond the splendors of Elysium, the ever-patient Prince shall find his fate, eventually, but not right now, becauseoh no, watch out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whilst well within arm's reach of victory, the bull-defeating Prince succumbs to a large pack of sinisterly harmless-seeming rodents.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see your prideful fall down from the heavens to the flames...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, look, Zagreus, here comes brave Athena, first to reach you among all my kin, in all her shrewdness. So proactive, you contacted Zagreus prior to even telling me, my dear!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Father, would that I could settle even more such matters quickly and discreetly, so that only the most vital of them rise up to the level of your notice, sir. Though, I'm certain Zagreus and I are very grateful you have intervened.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nephew! By my divine authority, my oft-misunderstood son, Ares, now shall lend you a small token of his power. I'll make him helpful yet!

dialogue: It shall be exactly as you say, Lord Father. Your wishes are identical to mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Young man, I know you'd like to get to know the comely Aphrodite face to face, or I don't know, you can decide once you arrive at last! He can decide, isn't that right, my Lady Aphrodite, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, I never, Lord Zeus! That sounded rather like a crass remark, from you! How shocking that the golden standard for the rest of us should have such words for me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, Zagreus, once you arrive, we'll have to find for you a suitable mate, won't we? Fine young man such as yourself! Normally, there's much to choose from around here, with some exceptions, of course... such as my cunning daughter, Artemis. Willfully uninclined to take a mate, at all!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, Zagreus, in spite of all these perfect, chiseled prospects everywhere about, yearning to marry or embarrass me, for some reason, I prefer to spend my time mostly alone or with my nymph friends in the woods!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, now, young man, whatever you have heard about good Demeter, I'm here to clear the air. She's like a sister to me, yes, but only thus. Although her Titan parents and my own met the same fate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, Foster-Brother Zeus! Such an unlikely bit of candor there, from you! Almost as though you felt compelled to speak the truth only whilst I'm directly within earshot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you encountered Exagryph and said to it the waking-phrase I gave to you, young man? Why, I'd tell Exagryph myself! Remember, it's I see your prideful fall down from the heavens to the flames.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that is an entirely unusual design, even for Exagryph! So then the waking-phrase has worked. That aspect's bearer, Lucifer, was it? Struck his own lord father! Tried to, anyway. A not uncommon story it would seem.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I gather Lady Demeter's already got her frigid hold on you, certainly not the warmest member of the clan, now, is she? But do be patient with her, she's been through a lot.
label: CHARACTER
