dialogue: My good sister Demeter already tried to poison you against me, as I understand, young man? Oh, foster-sister she prefers I say, loath as she is to accept her role as part of our great family.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must forgive the Lady Demeter her scornfulness, Nephew, for she is still recovering after the sudden disappearance of her daughter, though it was quite some time ago the girl, poof! Just vanished. I try to lighten up the mood around it every now and then, but no, a sore spot, still!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Poor Demeter, young man. We still wonder what became of her fair daughter. Ran away with mortals, there, perhaps? Some of the tales, even more preposterous. Don't go believing everything you hear, and do be sensitive about the subject, hm? Demeter, she's been through quite enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Lady Demeter still prattles on about her missing girl, Zagreus. But I want you to understand something, all right? She's gone. We all have grieved. Perhaps Demeter shall finally accept what has occurred, and we can move forward, having grown stronger as a family.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure hope this works.... In the name of Hades! Olympus, this is an official message! For you, in all your splendor, Lord Uncle Zeus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My, what is this you have for me, young man? Appears to be a message of some sort, bearing my thunder sigil! Though, there's one for everybody on Olympus? Have they as yet received their own? I must know what it says... it's from your father, who else could it be? I'd better check on this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I eagerly await learning some more about the contents of that fascinating message you had sent up here, Nephew! How mysterious, indeed. I'll be keeping an eye on all the others that come in!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to tell you, Zagreus, that it was wonderful to meet with you, at last! We were so pleased to learn Persephone was safe! And Nyx, why, she's as stunning as they say. Shouldn't have lied to us about your parentage, but, I know things get complicated, here, and that what's done is done!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Poseidon sought you out already, hm? My boastful brother gets on with Lord Hades even worse than I, so let me put a little spark into his storms for you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My brave daughter Athena beat me to you this time, has she? No matter, with her blessing and my own, you shall be nigh unstoppable!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Has lovely Aphrodite put you in a trance already, Zagreus? Or might I offer you the blessing of Olympus to intensify her catastrophic power with my own?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So my elusive Artemis has shown you favor, has she? The little scamp, she seldom shows respect to anyone, not even me! But I'll enhance her blessing nonetheless.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Getting along with Ares, are you, Nephew? Heh. Would that you were my son instead of he, but no, I jest, I jest! Here, take my blessing, please!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It pleases me to know, young man, that you and Dionysus have been getting on so well. He could use a level-headed friend, and you could use my blessing!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm! You've traveled rather quickly to this point... which reminds me, I've not seen swift Hermes anywhere of late! The rascal's likely dallying about!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nephew, I have somewhat of a favor I must ask. You tell your father, if you so happen to run into him again, that his brother Zeus forgives him, and would like to reconnect, and welcome him into the family again. You tell him for me, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you are son to Hades by that Nyx, the night-goddess, is that correct, Nephew...? Well I suppose she's closest to a queen as your lord father's like to find down there. I tried to match him up with some more wholesome types, but no, and here we are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After we learned about your plight and your existence from the goddess Nyx, all of us on Olympus rallied to assist you just as best we could. A family such as mine protects its own!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My brothers Hades and Poseidon once fought bravely by my side, you know that, don't you, Nephew? We prevailed against the Titans and established law upon the earth. Your father then descended to the land of death, and we've not seen much of each other since.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father must have told you that his governance over the Underworld is due more to the weaving of the Fates than by his choice. Admittedly, he got the short end of the stick. Whereas Poseidon and myself, why, we've been doing rather well indeed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My brother Hades always was a lonesome man, you know. I pitied him! But I could never quite extract him from his thorny shell. Now he stews resentfully down there. You needn't bear the brunt of his frustrations.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Old Hades has continued to ignore my every effort to reach out to him, young man. Ah well, but he is obstinate, indeed. You are wise to seek your family's better half.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By the way, Nephew, I hear-tell your mother Nyx is quite the catch! If you'll forgive my saying so, of course. Your father's never had much of a sensibility around companionship, though perhaps this concubine of his brought something out in him, at last!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If and when you reach the surface, Zagreus, you call upon me then and there, all right? I'll personally see to it that you'll be escorted up to Olympus, and your quest shall be complete!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know just how much you must want out of there, young man. And I want that as well! Heh. Good thing for you, as I get what I want around here. Ask anybody!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You fight your father's legions with Varatha, the Eternal Spear? The irony must not escape him, for he long ago stood by my side against the Titans, with that thing in hand!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems the bow called Coronacht is safe and sound there in your hands, young man. I've not seen that old thing in quite some time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That shield of yours, called Aegis, why, in fact, it's mine from long ago, young man! I've no more need of it, of course, though how you found it, you shall have to tell me once you're here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, if it isn't the one and only Rail of Adamant in your possession, there! To strike one's enemies from afar is really the only way, I think, and it's about as good a substitute for lightning bolts as you're likely to find!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, isn't that Malphon the Twin Fists there in your possession, Zagreus? Last god I saw bedecked in those old gloves was Demeter herself, oh, way back when! She was a real fighter at the time, not just a naysayer!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, now that's the Aegis that I know and love! Or used to love, at least, the dear old thing! Now I quite love these shocking bolts of mine. Though I am proud you've given Aegis a good home, and bear it in my name!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hark, young man, for I've a vision I must share with you! A waking-phrase for Exagryph, to be precise. Please beseech the weapon thus: I see your prideful fall down from the heavens to the flames. An odd connection to a past or future bearer, apparently one who defied a god!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nephew, I wanted to mention, it was odd how by every account you'd come quite close to breaking free from there at last, of late... only to be abruptly cut off from our contact! I suppose having suffered some ill fate? Perhaps your realm's guardian, Cerberus, is even deadlier than reputed!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your dear mother Persephone is a shrewd woman, Zagreus. More than an equal to your mighty father! I'm pleased to know you've made amends with her, and taken new responsibilities within your House! Naturally, I'll continue to pitch in. And, I hope that we'll meet again, someday!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must say, Nephew! Although it pleases me that we, here, reconnected with your father's realm... just between us, it pleases me even more that you are able to keep sticking it to him! You keep that up, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus, you have a clever mother in Persephone! A very clever mother. And a lordly father! They make quite the team, that's evident! True rivals for Hera and me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The lord and ruler of Olympus and the world, why, he needs a healthy sense of humor, no, young man? Now there's an awful lot of spoil-sports out here, can't take even a little joke, well, I know all their mothers, fie on all of them, I say! Let's joke away!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose even down in the Underworld, you would have heard such tales of me, young man. They're all untrue, hahaha! Except the tales of my bravery. Those are completely accurate, though all too modest, in most cases, I must say.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, must be my gleaming Thunder Signet that I transferred to you! Why, I could feel its call from all the way up here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why you look positively dreadful, Zagreus. That place is doing you no favors, I can tell! Luckily, I'll do you favors aplenty!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You seem in dire need of some assistance, Nephew. So, of course, I dropped what I was doing and then sought you out as quickly as I could!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus, you must have left most of your lifeblood back the other way, hahahaha! Oh, I jest, I jest! But you look terrible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, no one likes to die, young man! But since you seem about to any moment now, you keep your head held high, do you hear me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, let's face it, Zagreus, you are as good as dead right now. But you'll just slosh right back out of the River Styx, and give it a good try again, won't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Remember, young man, dying is for mortals. So don't go making a habit of it, there! But if you have to do it, do it fighting, like a hero would!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wonder, Nephew, whether you're prepared as yet to harness the surpassing power I shall grant you now? Don't take this blessing lightly, and may you use it well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about, young man, we cease with all the trifling down there and cause a real storm for once? Take now the fiercest of my powers, and you show your no-good father what you're made of!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is this really him? OK. In the name of Hades! Olympus! I accept this message.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Greetings there, young man! Look, your father's always been rather difficult, and he's not so much as called in quite some time. You'll have a better home where you belong, here on Olympus! And to help you on your journey, have my blessing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We meet again, young man! Yours isn't my affair, I know, and yet I cannot help but take an interest in your plight. Your father cast his lot; he need not take his anger out on you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hello, young man, and might I offer you a little taste of the heavens themselves? Though, don't go telling your old sulky father I've been spoiling you rotten!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I and all of us upon Olympus are anticipating your success, dear Nephew! Now let me see if I can't help spur you along.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, my nephew, you're admittedly in quite a bind down there, but what is life without its struggles, hm? You'll make it here, eventually, I'm certain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I like the fire in you, Zagreus, and I have every confidence you'll someday clamber from the shadows there into the light!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here on Olympus, Nephew, we take care of one another and support each other, quite unlike how it must be there in your father's grim domain. No wonder you intend to leave!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd ask you offer my respects to your lord father, Zagreus, but I suspect you won't have such a chance anytime soon, considering how far you'll come with my support!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Remember you've as many chances as it takes, young man, to fight your way out of the dark and join us in the splendor of Olympus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your grim-faced father's such a spoilsport, Nephew, the way he keeps impeding your escape. Ah, well, just keep at it, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My greetings, young Nephew, and more importantly, my blessing and my strength be with you as you journey towards your rightful home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Faith and courage, Zagreus, for each and every one of us upon Olympus is behind you all the way throughout this whole affair.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can I say, young man? You may not make your father very proud, but it is just the opposite with me! Now go, get out of there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, Nephew, how about we put both of our backs into this one, and see to it that you go farther through those depths than you have ever managed yet!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Know that many mortals ask me for my blessings constantly, and I mean all the time, young Nephew, but for you! You needn't ask at all!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Far be it from me to raise my hand against your father, dear Nephew! Although I do suppose old Hades has it coming, doesn't he.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've every confidence in you, young man! Now you remember that, and take my blessing here, and fight your way on out of there for me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nephew, I want you to go and show that surly Hades everything you're made of! And, I've arranged for you a little bit of help along the way!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How is old Hades doing, anyway, Nephew? I suspect he's every bit as prickly as ever, whereas you are nothing of the sort!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I eagerly anticipate getting to meet you face-to-face someday, dear Nephew, just as soon as you can up and out of there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good Nephew, I return once more to lend to you my power! I'd like to see your discontented father try and stop you now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is my solemn wish, dear Zagreus, that eventually we settle up our differences with your lord father. But for now, we fight!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hail, my most honorable, beloved nephew, and I bring to you the blessing of Olympus, so that you might finally get out of there, already!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I just know you'll reach the surface here eventually, Zagreus! And I look forward to our meeting when you do!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll keep you safe here from your father, Zagreus! But while you're still inside that Underworld, there's only so much we can do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've a good head on your shoulders, Zagreus, so stay positive, stay healthy, and let nothing stand between you and your goal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wish you well in your continued quest, and offer my sincerest blessings, and of course my power, there, Nephew!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've seen the sheer destructive power of the heavens! Just imagine what it's like above the surface of the earth!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Someday when we'll be resting easy on these heights, why, we'll look back at this and laugh, I'm sure of it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahh, but if it isn't my most favored nephew! Striving always toward the surface of my world. Your father cannot possibly believe he can contain you, can he?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have my blessing now as ever there, young man.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust you shall be getting out of there in due course, Nephew.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall be watching over you, young man, though it is dark down there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May the might of Olympus guide you through the shadows, Nephew.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't let your father get to you, young man, and climb on out from there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus, we won't be giving up on you, so you keep at it, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall make the heavens themselves now aid your ascent, Nephew.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll watch yourself down there, won't you, young man?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All of us, we're here for you, young man!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please do be careful not to make your situation any worse, Nephew!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm here for you, young man, so you take heart, and more than that, take this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All of us believe in you, though certainly no one so much as I!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here's something I can do to help, young man!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You just take all the time you need in terms of fighting your way out of there, young man!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, don't lose heart, young man, and we'll keep at it with you here, as well!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As my kin, you are a born fighter, Zagreus! So put your back into it, and you climb right up!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It shall be glorious, indeed, the day you finally burst from that oppressive den into the light!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know you have it in you to surpass your father, Zagreus. Assuming you are anything like me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How fares your lovely mother? Things still good with her and Hades, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You tell your good lord father that his brother Zeus shall be always watching over you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust your good lord father's treating you all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know you're busy, Zagreus, though someday you shall have to visit us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm never quite so busy that I can't make time for family, young man!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're all in this together, aren't we, Nephew?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see the boatman of the Underworld has found the means to reach you with my blessing, Nephew. Such strange alliances we forge these days!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why here I am, young man, in such strange circumstances I might add! Luckily the boatman Charon is much easier to get ahold of than your father!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, so then the boatman Charon came through for us after all, did he? Whatever means we have to reach you, we'll employ!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your Charon there must drive quite a hard bargain, Zagreus, if he would keep you from your victory just for a bit of coin!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought that ferryman would be content to transfer souls across the River Styx, not rob you on your journey to the surface, there, Nephew!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My blessing isn't good enough for you, is that the way of it, young man? How impetuous of you. Oh, I never!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It isn't wise to go against me, Nephew, both in matters large and small. I am not known for being charitable to the insolent.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps you have defied me here in jest, young man. Though in such cases pertinent to my authority, you'll find I lack a sense of humor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Audacity runs in our family, Zagreus, but my advice to you is that you keep it carefully suppressed in your relationship with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What have I done, good Nephew, to deserve such scorn? Your lapse in judgment here is not so easy to forgive, yet easily punished.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father likewise turned his back on me before, Nephew, and we both know what has become of him. I'd caution you against this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Apparently, the consequences of displeasing me have slipped your mind, young man. A harsh reminder is in order, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did not restore order to this world, and claim the heavens for myself, only to be insulted by my own nephew!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, Nephew, is this all some sort of jest to you? It isn't one that I appreciate!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nephew, when presented with a choice to side against me or not to be such a fool, do be sure to choose the latter next time, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't say I didn't warn you, young man! I only wish that I could say you didn't insult me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is outrageous, Zagreus! Even your father would agree that actions such as that can't go unpunished.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Young man, I don't know why you would do this to me, though I trust you're going to think twice, next time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You overstep your bounds with me, Nephew! But I shall make you fall right back in line.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, very well, good show, young man! And I think I shall let you off the hook, and take you back under my wing, for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Commendable of you to live through that, and I suspect you shall think twice next time before so brazenly defying me, won't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, now, no need to hold such grudges any longer I suppose, but you just mind yourself around your Uncle Zeus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do not spurn me again like that, do you hear me, young man? I think you do, so let's put this to bed and move along.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh Nephew, but I simply can't stay wrathful toward you, much as I might try! Though, better not to tempt me, just in case.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, all right, let's call the score between us settled up for now. Just don't go spurning me again, you understand?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, this is becoming unproductive, Zagreus. As you were!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I don't have the heart to keep exacting vengeance on you, Nephew.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I say, such petty squabbles. Aren't we better than this, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, young man, I'd say it's best we put this little slight behind us, wouldn't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pah! All is forgiven and forgotten, Zagreus. What were we even going on about back there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahaha, that is quite enough, that's quite enough, I say! You're still alive, aren't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Zeus, erm, Uncle? Please accept this offering, and all my gratitude.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Goodness, Nephew, that's an offering, indeed! I'm thankful for your piety to me, and as a show of generosity to you, in turn, I present this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thank you, my Lord Uncle Zeus, for your benevolence and your thunderous might.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You honor me, young man, as well you should, for I am ruler of Olympus, am I not? Such courtesies are shown me constantly, yet I appreciate them all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Zeus, I bid you please accept my humble offering, for all you've done for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, that is rather generous of you, and I'm grateful for it, Nephew! How good of you to make attempts at reciprocity!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This offering is but a trifle, Uncle Zeus, for all your magnanimity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So fine a gift again, my dear Nephew? Would that my sons and daughters on Olympus here would show me such respect from time to time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please, Lord Uncle Zeus, accept this gift of Nectar in your honor, though it is such a pittance in comparison to all the generosity you've shown.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm very pleased to see a show of such respect and admiration for your uncle, Zagreus. You'll go quite far here on Olympus with an attitude like that! Not everyone's as mannered, nor as wise.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you can hear me, mighty Uncle Zeus, I wish to make to you this simple gift, and with it send my humble wish that someday you and Father settle all your differences, and be at peace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, most splendid of an offering, young man. And while we've yet to even meet in person, I already feel as though the two of us are close, why, closer than you must be even with your father! Oh, hahaha! Perhaps we ought go telling everybody I'm your real father, am I right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you can hear me, mighty Uncle Zeus, I wish to make to you this simple gift, and with it send my humble wish that someday you and Father settle all your differences, and be at peace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, most splendid of an offering, young man. I already feel as though the two of us are close, why, closer than you must be even with your father! Oh, hahaha! Perhaps we ought go telling everybody I'm your real father, am I right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: King of the Olympians, Lord Zeus! Forgive this offer of Ambrosia, for I know you have no limit of it there. But here, it is the finest gift that can be given, and even still it isn't anything compared to all you've done for me. Thank you, Uncle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, now, Nephew, you are most generous, indeed, in showing all this deference to me. But we must keep some distance, shouldn't we? Lest all the others here, why, they would be most jealous if they caught me playing favorites! Even though you are my favorite! Presently, at least.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now is the time to strike!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hoh, you watch this, young man!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll strike them down right now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can take care of that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't be a fool, young man.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You truly are my brother's son.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Best not to make me angry, my nephew.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I ought to strike you down!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now you ask my favor, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A generous offer, Lord Uncle Zeus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't say no, Lord Zeus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A swift death is a mercy of a retribution.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did not become ruler of Olympus by forgiving trespasses, young man.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How do you do, young man.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How fares my brother's son of late?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well I don't see why not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, my hellborn kin, I have to say that there are times I wish I could have been acquainted with your father somewhat more, if you'll forgive my saying so. My father and my uncle, here... they're predisposed quite differently than I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps if you were not so odd, and made more effort to be somewhat more approachable, Ares, then we'd have more in common, you and I! Should you need any tips on that, why, you just let me know!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wished only to speak to you in private once again, my kin, except, you see...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Except you see, dear Cousin, that some members of our family are predisposed toward the unspeakable. I caution you around my half-brother, is all. Now carry on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You interrupt me once again, dear sister. You know I do not care for that. I warn you to stay out of my affairs. I shall aid my kin as I see fit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You only do as you see fit, Lord Ares. Mind that you continue pulling in the same direction as us all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I so anticipate the day you finally arrive upon Olympus. There are few amongst us here with interests such as those I think we share.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There are at least a few of us who share such interests here, isn't that so, Lord Ares? As for you, dearest, you take all the time you need!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wars waged over love, my kin... can you imagine that? The lady Aphrodite and I can endlessly discuss such circumstances. I trust, from time to time, you stop to ask yourself how come you choose to fight. Not that you need a reason, of course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Lord Ares, truly there isn't the need to cloud our little godling's thoughts and judgment with such comments, is there, hm? Let's give him what he wants, and we can carry on in private, about that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, my kin! I was just inquiring with Lord Dionysus here, under which circumstances are the greatest mortal feasts of all prepared? Because I have a certain hunch, regarding that...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, yeah, Ares, I will hand it to you, man. There's nothing like a feast after a war, all right! Provided you're on the surviving side, that is! Otherwise I guess they'll be feasting with you down there, Zag!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The cold of death is quite becoming of the Goddess Demeter, do you not think so, my death-dealing kin? She is becoming well accustomed to it, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think that you forget yourself, Lord Ares, sir. For I am much your elder; my famines had already slain the mortals by the tens of thousands by the time such thoughts of doing so first crossed your mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ten thousand souls have fallen to you, now, my hellborn kin. I am rather beside myself, I must admit. Fine work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here goes, then. In the name of Hades! Olympus, this is an official message! Lord Ares, please consider our proposal... once you're able to decipher it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My, what is this, my kin? Some sort of invitation for me, I presume. Not just for me... this symbolizes all the others, here? Most intriguing. I shall investigate the meaning of this as quickly as I'm able, then. But first!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wish to tell you once again I had a splendid time during our recent shared festivities, my kin. At last, I've finally seen your death-filled realm firsthand! I learned a great deal. And I look forward to learning more from our successful collaboration, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Zeus has gotten to you first, I see? My father's gifts are generous, indeed, though... I think I can help in my own way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The blessing of your uncle Lord Poseidon might have helped you to this point, but here: My gift shall see you further still.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You bear the blessing of Athena, yes? She would protect you from your enemies, whilst I would rather that you slay them, and be done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mm, I see you have the Lady Aphrodite's blessing there already. Love and death, together, hand in hand? Sounds most agreeable to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So Artemis, my lonely half-sister, got to you first? She merely helps you hunt, whilst I shall help you kill. Observe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That drunkard Dionysus cannot help you near as much as I, my hell-born kin. Compare the gift he gave to what I offer you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our messenger Hermes has been in contact with you by now, yes? Perhaps you shall not see him very often, for my work keeps him rather preoccupied, shepherding souls and such.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I faintly sense the mark of Goddess Demeter upon you, hm? Her power over plentitude is opposite to mine in some respects. But, lately, she has channeled it in manners more agreeable to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, you bear your own father's blessing, my kin? Such a surprise... I know the two of you are now in league, and yet... I am still quite accustomed to the thought that you harbor war-like hatred for one another. Perhaps there's still a trace of that, though, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did you happen to know, my kin, that you have slain more than a hundred foes since you began your quest? You have! For I am keeping count. And I am most impressed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are a most impressive death-dealer, my kin. For by my estimation, you have slain at least a thousand souls down there! Souls mostly having died before, but still.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know that you have many aspirations, my good kin. To be plain with you about my own motive for a moment: As long as you continue bringing swift and steady death, you shall have my unyielding support.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The more you slay your enemies, my kin, the stronger the bond between us, I think. Can you not feel it, too? Though, perhaps your lust for blood overpowers your other senses, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps you know a god called Thanatos? The two of us are very close associates, you know. Do give him my best wishes, should you see him soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust that Thanatos is doing well? Although he brings to mortals merciful release, whilst I most certainly do no such thing, I do appreciate his take on it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is my understanding that you have grown rather close with Thanatos, my kin? A perfect choice of mate; though I confess I'd not expected Death to have affection for another save himself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You traveled rather far down there since last we met, my kin. And that means you have dealt incalculable death. I must commend you thus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahh, my kin! I sensed fresh bloodshed from you recently, the real kind! For you have slain the living near the surface, have you not? Mere vermin, yes, but good enough for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Recently, there was a burst of violence on the surface, near to where you are, but higher up. 'Twas altogether odd, but must have forced you to return once more. No matter; time is on our side.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sense so much death at the gates of your father's realm, of late, my kin. Now, I know that seems perfectly ordinary on the face of it, except... there's something more. I wonder if you know the reason why...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know your efforts to come here have repeatedly been thwarted, my good kin. However, we have caused such violence in the intervening time, that we must take this as a real victory. Let us continue for however long it takes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Surely you've heard rumblings about a war which has erupted on the surface, here? Doubtless you've seen an influx of fallen mortals. It's quite a decent one, I have to say! Though, unlikely to rise to the ranks of the greats. Too few armies involved in it, I fear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: War's such a wondrous thing, my kin. It solves so many different problems, whilst perpetuating its own inevitability. Let's keep it up, then, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you ever think to yourself that you were born a bit too late, my kin? For my part, I wish that I could have been there myself when my father and the others waged ferocious war against the Titans. Ah, it must have been a sight!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sense that you have forged a greater bond with your instruments of destruction there, my kin. Then that is very good. And may their altered forms serve you quite well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, I believe that is the Frost Fair Blade you bear! I understand it shall become the instrument of choice of yet another god of war, someday. I long to meet him, this fellow student of death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, that blade of yours... it looks as though it could relieve a mortal of his head with ease. Excalibur, is it? I've studied all the Fates' designs, and this one is among my favorites.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The fated bow Sharanga, in your grasp! That is not a form I'd expected you to wield. You have exquisite taste in weaponry, my kin!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that the fire-eating shield of the great warrior Beowulf, which you have there? I knew the Fates had plans for it, but I did not expect for you to be a part!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Those are the gauntlets of the fated king Gilgamesh, are they not? A bringer of destruction, and an agent of the Fates. You are full of surprises, my kin!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You bear the warring instrument of one called Lucifer, I see. I've little to go on about him, but it is clear he knows a thing or two about destruction, is it not?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, you bear the Blood-filled Vial which I granted you! The mortal's blood contained therein... I drew it myself! Too seldom am I able to become directly involved in such matters.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Know that I admire your Lord Father very much. For his grim work lets me continue mine. I trust that one day you shall settle your dispute.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are the son of Night herself, they say? A fascinating character, ill-liked upon Olympus, although I myself have always longed to meet her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, my favorite Underworld death-dealer. I so look forward to the pain you shall inflict this time around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would that a sudden scourge of war would help you out of your predicament. Why, I would stir one up for you without a second thought.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, my closest kin in all the Underworld, I see you there, I think! What sort of violence shall we sow together this time, you and I?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's so much insufferable talk of peace up here, my kin. It is quite the relief to focus on much more important things, with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must know I often hunger for destruction, almost uncontrollably at that. Though I am finding you are able to sate that appetite of mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May all the death you bring become the stuff of legends told in fearful mortal whisperings around the world, my kin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would that I knew the goddess Nyx, myself, my kin! So many of my wars are waged by night. I am most grateful, and I wish her well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How is your mother Nyx of late, my kin? Have you yet given to her my regards? For I should think that Night and War would share a common ground.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How is Nyx of late, my kin? Have you yet given to her my regards? For I should think that Night and War would share a common ground.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do tell your mother Night Herself that I am often thinking of her here, although we haven't met. She must believe that there are those upon Olympus who admire her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do tell Night Herself that I am often thinking of her here. She must believe that there are those upon Olympus who admire her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps once all of this is over, my good kin, you might arrange 'twixt myself and your dark mother, Nyx, some sort of chance to meet? Do think upon it, and declare to her my interest if you please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps once all of this is over, my good kin, you might arrange 'twixt myself and the goddess Nyx some sort of chance to meet? Do think upon it, and declare to her my interest if you please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your mother Nyx and I, we have begun a correspondence, my good kin. I do appreciate you putting us in touch. She is a lovely specimen, if you don't mind my saying so, perhaps?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The goddess Nyx and I, we have begun a correspondence, my good kin. I do appreciate you putting us in touch. She is a lovely specimen, if you don't mind my saying so, perhaps?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You shall be pleased to hear that your own mother Nyx and I, why, we intend to meet. I'm quite excited to exchange ideas in the flesh.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You shall be pleased to hear that Nyx and I, why, we intend to meet. I'm quite excited to exchange ideas in the flesh.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please send your mother Nyx my warm regards, won't you, my kin? Would that the others on Olympus knew and understood your kind as I now do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please send the goddess Nyx my warm regards, won't you, my kin? Would that the others on Olympus knew and understood your kind as I now do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, my kin, I had misunderstood that Nyx was your mother. But, Persephone? I never took her for the sort to have an interest in your realm. Alas that we never had opportunity to discuss the subject here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your good mother, Persephone... dread Queen of the Underworld! I certainly misjudged her when we had occasion to interact whilst she resided on Olympus. Perhaps I, too, should consider a life there in your realm...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You bear Varatha, the Eternal Spear...! I thought it lost! Have you any idea how many lives it drank during your father's glory days?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, you wield Coronacht, the Heart-Seeker. It pierced three Titans in one shot back in the war amongst our kind. Please do take care of it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have the Shield of Chaos, Aegis... quite unlike the one my good sister Athena likes to flash around. You have much better taste.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, you are wielding Exagryph, the Rail of Adamant! A most fascinating device. Imagine the new face of war, should its secrets someday be revealed, and spread to mortalkind!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well if it isn't Malphon, the Twin Fists, bound to your very capable hands! So many weapons are so indirect, I think. With Malphon, you are about as close to the destruction as can be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The greatest wars require great alliances, my kin. And so, I shall entrust to you some of the greatest methods of destruction I've devised thus far.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The winds of war blow fiercely on the surface now, my kin. Thus I am able to confer upon you even greater power than has been my custom.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You seem to be upon the verge of death, my kin. I cannot wait to hear of it! The experience of death, time after time! You are one of a kind!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, my kin, but you have suffered terribly to come this far. No matter, for we soon shall pay your enemies in kind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So much letting of blood, so much of it, your own. Let's see to keeping you alive and in the fight a while longer, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're on the verge of yet another brush with death, I see, my hell-born kin. Do send some others down with you, would you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A mortal surely would have already succumbed to injuries such as the ones you've suffered, there. Impressive how you carry on, like that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This one was bound to show up I guess. In the name of Hades! Olympus! I accept this message.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've got quite the fighting spirit in you there, I have to say. Most intriguing, and yet no surprise for someone born in hell itself. You come on out of there, and tell me all about it. I'm a fellow student of death, you see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must say you deal death rather exquisitely. Though, perhaps I could be of some further assistance in such matters, yes?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah! I figured that you must have been the source of all that bloodshed underneath the earth. Let me see if I can make your death-dealing a little more efficient.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, my hell-born kin, my blessing now is yours to do with as you wish; provided you inflict a little suffering for me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've just the thing for you this time, my kin. May I present my instruments of pain?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I surely hope your bloodshed's going well, and long that there shall be no end to it. I am, as ever, here to serve your benefit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How fares your endless war against the dead? Let it be known that I am happy to take sides in such affairs. Please, I insist!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Death rears its head in all too many forms, I'm sure you know. Though you may never find them all, I nonetheless encourage you to try.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The wretched dead you face perhaps forget themselves. Go, then, remind them of the agony which brought them to your realm.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Life and death are inextricable, and war is often what connects the two. Don't you agree?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This world has a limitless capacity for pain; and so, it truly is no inconvenience to help you to bring out a little more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The living and the dead alike desire what I represent. Their appetite for bloodshed cannot easily be sated. A goal to strive for, no?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps the dead you stand against have long forgotten the experience of anguish and despair. I trust that you shall soon remind them for me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beautiful, isn't it? The strife which follows you. You have a real knack for this, and I for one am happy to assist.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Some would question the destruction which you sow, but I shall never do so. I fully understand your impulses. Allow me to indulge them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not once has your Lord Father thanked me for delivering vast portions of his clientele. Surely you shall be more grateful for my gifts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you suppose the dead feel pain unlike the living? This is for me an endless fascination, so go on, and give me more to think about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you continue waging war against the dead, I gladly lend you my support; family to family, no questions asked.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is a veritable crime your father distances himself from all the rest of us. It is fortunate that you yourself are not so disagreeable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let us together deal some death, shall we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shall we continue our campaign against the dead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you say we bring the dead some pain, for old time's sake?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The devastation you have caused has not escaped my notice!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We stand before a golden opportunity, to inflict pain. Let us proceed!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There is no problem war cannot sort out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah there you are, my kin! I have a gift to aid your bloody work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My blessing be with you, and may death follow in your wake.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please spread some suffering down there for me, my kin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall empower you to acts of greater violence than before.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: War needn't carry out solely above the earth, my kin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust that the destruction which you sow is going well?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The recent devastation which you caused, that was impressive work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whenever you bring death, why, you've my full support.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How fares the ceaseless slaying of your foes, quite well, my kin?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps my blessing shall let you deliver death still more efficiently.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father's realm shall be quite full, I think, once you and I are through.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The finest instruments of death at my disposal shall be yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like to offer you a choice amongst my most exquisite tools which inflict suffering.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What say we start our next war with a special flair, my kin?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've not seen ample blood spilled recently, so let's please make up for lost time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There are so many types of death... and yet, the sudden, violent kind is unsurpassed, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am quite eager to commence jointly killing your enemies, my kin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you say we start another of our famous killing sprees, my kin?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not been long since last I saw bloodshed... but far too long for me, nevertheless.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My finest implements of death I now avail to you, my worthy kin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let us make this blood-letting truly one to remember, then, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May you sow such destruction as to shake this mountain to its core, my kin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall now give to you the means to wreak such havoc there, my kin!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was quite pleased to hear again from Nyx of late, my kin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May the wondrous goddess Nyx continue to watch over you, and darken the eyes of your foes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To think you have the goddess Nyx's aid, as well as mine!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew that foul boatman would come through, and you would find amongst his wares this gift!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I give to you this token of respect, buried though it must have been within the boatman's hoard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust the river-boatman Charon has been keeping plenty busy lately thanks to me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The boatman Charon ought invest into a boat of more substantial size if he's to keep up with my work, my kin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your boatman there is a reliable deliverer of death, it seems. And that makes three of us, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You reject my generous offering of aid? Hahahaha, you must not know me very well. Death shall come, regardless, either to your enemies, or you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You would deny such aid as I would offer you? How rather disappointing. You've more to learn about the art of dealing death, it seems.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An incorrect decision, there, my kin, to side against me thus. Blood needs be shed, and yours is going to suffice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems unwise of you to thus dismiss my offering. Suffer, then, a while by my hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your choice leaves much to be desired here, my kin. My temper I shall keep in check, but only barely so.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A disappointing choice, my kin, and there are consequences to such choices, every single time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your course of action here was ill-advised, my kin. For war shall come to you no matter what, as I shall presently reveal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The whims of our kind are unpredictable, my kin. But you shall find responses to such acts to be the definition of consistency.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll not abide such disregard of our past companionship, my kin. In war, one must take sides, and you had best choose mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: War shall be waged here, no matter what, my kin. But even still, I am dismayed you would have sided against me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wish to have a taste of what a war against me would be like? Well, then, I shall oblige.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did I detect some hesitancy on your part just then? Perhaps you knew that you were making a mistake. No matter; you'll learn now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You shall not goad me into anger with a petty insult such as this, you know. Nevertheless, there is a price which must be paid for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A sacrifice in blood is fully paid, and we are squared away. Though think you twice next time before you cross me, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well haven't you withstood my murderous intent! Resilience as this deserves reward, and I am feeling rather generous.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is not often I attempt to kill someone and they survive. Bravo! Our score is settled up for now, so let us carry on as friends.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You capably survived my wrath, and I commend you for it. Let us continue on, as friends and kin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think that we are squared away, for now. Though, do not test my patience further, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You crossed the fields of death impressively back there. Though, you are fortunate I'm in a giving mood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When blood is spilled and death is dealt, I simply cannot remain discontented for too long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What I could see of that display of violence you just sowed was thoroughly commendable, my kin. Then, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your sacrifice to me just now has moved me to forgiveness for the time; thus shall we call a truce.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A war can only last so long, my kin. This one is not worth the pursuit, I think, when we can wage a greater one, together.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, after a show of violence such as that, how can I possibly remain upset, my kin?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your slight against me is already forgotten; for I was more than pleased to witness such a monstrous show of force.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Ares, please accept this offering, for giving me such strength as necessary to succeed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are a flatterer, my death-inflicting kin. And I am feeling generous, as well, so here! A small token for you of my affection.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Ares, I honor you for all the strength you've given me to overcome my foes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Such a splendid offering, to me! How very thoughtful, there, my kin. I am taken aback, though I accept!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Ares! Please accept this token of my deep appreciation for your generous support.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An offering, for me? Indeed! How gracious that you keep me in your thoughts. Know that, likewise, I keep you in mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Ares, it is my privilege to have met you, and have learned your death-inflicting way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do appreciate this gift to me, although you really shouldn't have! The suffering which you inflict is ample compensation in itself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have shown me nothing but respect and granted me your favor repeatedly, Lord Ares. This is the least that I can do, in kind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Most often when I'm given offerings, it is with wishes that I lend my favor in a coming war. Yet from you, my kin, I sense no such motive. I'm quite taken aback by that, I must admit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Ares! As bloodshed has become somewhat of a necessity in my situation, I am very grateful that you're with me in this. I know never to take it for granted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're most gracious with me, my kin; and I remain enthralled as ever by your blood-soaked way of life. I trust the violence I have wrought on your behalf has been quite satisfactory?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I offer this Ambrosia in your name and honor, Lord Ares. To the god of war! How many foes have I vanquished with your aid and guidance? But more than that, I'm pleased to know you, and to be your cousin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, such an exquisite gift this is, indeed. Yet, the destruction you have sown, the sheer carnage... nothing can surpass that, I should think. Should you ever go to war, my kin... genuinely go to war, I mean... do look me up. I imagine I would take your side.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have my thanks, Lord Ares.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pain and suffering upon you all!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Blood and death, together hand in hand!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whom do you take me for.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must know mercy simply isn't in my nature.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is a war without its tragic losses here and there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is unwise to side against me in a war.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Greetings, fellow bringer of death and so on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How is hell treating you today?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How fares your war against the dead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see you drawn in the arms of the seventh avatar...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsk, um, Zagreus... rather than greet you as I normally would do, instead, allow me to present you my illustrious, kind, generous lord father, your greatest Uncle Zeus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, thank you for the introduction, Daughter! Now, you run along, go frolic with your nymphs, or something! Leave me to assist my nephew, here. Bestow on him your faint blessing, if you must.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know my father and my uncle, by now, right, Zagreus? I don't know which of them is worse. Uh, I mean... superior! Superior, despite technically spending most of his time in the seas, beneath Olympus, isn't that right, Uncle?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Artemis, you needn't boast to little Hades there on my account! Besides! Whether you're in the sea, above it, or beneath, makes little difference to your measure as a god! You two are young as yet! Keep at it, and you'll soon be practically as great as I!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, uh, Zagreus! There's something I've been wondering, and don't take this the wrong way or anything, OK? Oh, no. It's her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, Artemis, you're absolutely tongue-tied! Due to our little godling in the Underworld, or a little due to me? Hm-hm, you shall figure it all out I'm sure!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, what was I, ugh, just, never mind. I'll talk to you some other time, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, Zagreus, despite my hunter's instincts here, it seems I was unable to elude Aphrodite in this particular case, who insisted that we present ourselves to you at the same time, for whatever reason...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, come now, Artemis! I'm sure you're very capable of hiding from a common beast, but I can see you plain. Why not be honest with yourself, next time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus, I wish we all could hear you so that good Lord Ares here might be persuaded that my powers are entirely for different purposes than his!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps our skillsets once were meant for different purposes, dear Artemis; but who are we to doubt the end result? Observe what shall transpire once we grant our kin our combined might.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus, I was just hoping for a little privacy before this hunt, which is consistently my preference here, except, you see, Lord Ares always seems to come sniffing about, first sign of any hunting instruments!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, my dear Artemis, the hunt is but a prelude to a war, is that not so? For if all mortalkind knew naught of hunting, why, they would not be nearly so adept at killing one another.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, Lord Ares, if I lend you better marksmanship ability, you think that you could bother someone else?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, great, it's you, Zagreus! Here, let me offer you some fine new Boons, as well as Lord Dionysus here, who I am sure would love to talk your ear off just as much as mine!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eh, tells me I'm being awful loud, and to back off, all sorts of nasty stuff like that, what can you do, though, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, hi there, Zagreus, I was just failing to persuade the Lady Demeter to ease up off the snowy stretch that we've been having for a while. Some of the mortals are quite weary of it now, and it sure doesn't make the hunting any easier!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The mortals are resourceful, Artemis. Their one redeeming quality, perhaps! They'll find a way through our long winter here. They ought to, since they brought it on themselves.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Um, Zagreus, did you attempt to chat with Coronacht just yet? Remember, tell the bow I see you drawn in the arms of the seventh avatar! Something good's supposed to happen if you do, some divine archer-person's aspect I should think? You going to try it soon, or not?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, look at that! The message must have worked! Practically can see that shiny bow from here! I've never wielded Coronacht myself, at least not yet. Though if the Fates are sending visions to me of its past or future bearers, why, I guess I'm bound to get my shot eventually!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Found you, Huntress, here. In the name of Hades! Olympus, this is an official message! Especially for you, Lady Artemis!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Some kind of special message for me...! Oh, looks like there's one for everybody on Olympus, then. Felt rather special for a moment, there! And now you're making me check in with all the others. Great!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have to say, I had a pretty decent time with everybody at our little visit recently! Met you, Uncle Hades, even great Achilles! Still don't quite appreciate you tricking us, but eh! I can get over it eventually. Anyway, you still could use assistance from me, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, good old Father Zeus, he must have blessed you with his lightning bolts, did he? Always looking out for everyone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Uncle Poseidon blessed you, didn't he. To think that big, fat oaf is your own father's brother. I'm told to be respectful near him, but it's hard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You met Athena earlier, I guess? I'd never trade my bow for all that pomp and armor, but... I guess to each her own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're pretty close with Ares, aren't you? And here they said it couldn't be done. If I were you I'd watch myself with him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So Aphrodite reached you first, did she? Sounds exactly like something she'd do. She has a knack for trouble. So, let's just stay focused, here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That lush and lecher, Dionysus, counts you as a friend? I'm hoping that there must be some mistake, yeah, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You seem particularly light on your feet, there, Zagreus. I'd figure Hermes, himself, was speeding you along, except I've not seen him about in... been a while, really.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So even Demeter's become involved in this! Didn't think she would. Though you'll be glad she did! Provided you stay on her warm and fuzzy side, of course. Working on that, myself!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Something's troubled me a little, about you. You fight so desperately. At first I thought you simply lacked in patience. But now I see it's urgency that drives you. What is it that you're after, really...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's see. You blundered headlong into danger for the past six chambers or more. And you made such a racket I could almost hear it from Olympus. I have to say, your hunting skills are rather unconventional.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm with you every step till you arrive here, Zagreus. Then I will probably ignore you like the rest. Just warning you ahead of time, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, were you hunting vermin near the surface lately, Zagreus? That's practically just like the real thing! It must have been a thrill!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've become a right accomplished vermin hunter, Zagreus! Maybe you'll get to use those skills against worthier creatures soon enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That Fury down in Tartarus has been a real problem, hasn't she. I see the huntress instinct in her. She thinks she knows your weaknesses. Don't let yourself become predictable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, I once heard Lord Hades has in his employ the greatest hero of the Trojan War, you happen to know anything about that? I'm kind of a fan. You see Achilles, tell him he's the best for me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, I have heard that Achilles, himself, taught you how to fight! No wonder you can hold your own down there, that is amazing...! You be sure to honor him from time to time, got it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Living on Olympus here, I'm surrounded by my family, but I always felt alone. I know that's not the same as your experience, but, I'm just saying I relate to what you're going through.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think you might enjoy it on Olympus, there's... a lot of feasting here, I guess, and the air is cool and crisp, and it's much brighter than it is down there. Sounds like a dream, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope that once you make it to Olympus we'll go hunting sometime, you and I, you know? I like being on my own and all, but it's been nice, talking to you like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I grow so tired of the others here, you know? Much rather be out with the woodland nymphs than with these gods upon this mountaintop. You must know what it's like.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not everybody on Olympus is a total disappointment, Zagreus. Why, someday maybe you could meet Callisto, she goes hunting with me all the time! Bet you don't see many woodland nymphs down there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Zagreus, that Nectar you sent? Callisto and the nymphs and I, we popped it open recently, and it was really good! Had us positively frolicking about. So, thanks!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must have a friend or two, don't you? It's hard being alone all of the time. At least I have Callisto and the other nymphs, and... I have you! A distant friend is still a friend, isn't that right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hope you don't mind, I told Callisto all about you recently! Don't worry, I was quite discreet about it, the two of us were on the hunt, not like I just shouted out your story from the mountaintops!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus, if only you could turn yourself into a woodland creature and just fly or burrow out of there! My Callisto, she can turn into a bear, you ever seen those? Monstrous, furry things, quite huggable, if they don't kill you first!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've never even seen the woods, have you? I hope you do, someday. You could meet Callisto and the others! It's quite beautiful, and green, and calm, it's... anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't know what it is about you, Zagreus, but I feel like I can be me with you, you know? Maybe it's that you don't constantly talk over me like everybody else, besides Callisto and the nymphs I guess. Not that I can even hear you, but, you know what I mean, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, how'd you get your hands on a nice bow like that? You take good care of Coronacht for me, so I can try it too once you're up here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have to admit, you're very capable with Coronacht. Now I can hit a bull's eye in my sleep, but you'll be right there with me if I don't keep practicing I think!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, that's the Eternal Spear, Varatha, isn't it? Your father used to use that, didn't he. A bit ornate for hunting, but a spear's a spear, is what I like to say!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, that can't possibly be the spear once wielded by the great Achilles, there, can it?! The shape is unmistakable, I mean, have you even the slightest just how many mortals got completely slaughtered by that thing? Oh, it has seen some use!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's not the Coronacht I know, isn't that... Chiron the centaur's bow? So that was Coronacht, as well? Seems every decent bow was just a version of that thing! Except for mine, of course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, that's the bow Stepmother Hera herself once wielded, isn't it? Her aspect of Coronacht! I'd know it from the... frankly rather sinister skulls all over it. It's very Hera, trust me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When did you get your hands on Malphon, the Twin Fists? Hands in, I ought to say! I heard that one time, Demeter, she smacked her father right square in the face with those! Bet you can probably relate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, look at you, with Exagryph, the Rail of Adamant! Seems much too noisy-complicated as a hunting weapon when you could just use a nice quiet bow, but hey, to each her own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now listen, Zagreus, admittedly this is a little strange, even from me. I have a message for your bow! That's right, just go on up to Coronacht next time, and tell it with a firm, commanding voice, I see you drawn in the arms of the seventh avatar! Let me know how it goes, OK?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, that's my Adamant Arrowhead on you! Normally, it's for killing things, but in your case it makes it even easier for me to hunt you down, even in the dark. Now that I found you... here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your name, it means 'great hunter', Zagreus! I guess your mother Nyx must have expected someday that you'd pick up a few pointers from myself!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, hold a moment, Zagreus, I could have sworn... you were so close, before, but now you're back? Ah, must have tripped up just when victory was close at hand, it happens all the time. We'll get you out of there, you'll see!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, you all right there, Zagreus? Wouldn't do to have you die on me just moments after meeting here like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! Look at you, you're hurt there pretty bad, but, just stay focused on the hunt, and it'll help to keep the pain at bay.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, I'm just goddess of the hunt, not medicine, so... I don't know if this is going to help right now, but, here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your hunt has evidently not been going very well so far, I see. Though, maybe we can still turn it around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, one good thing about all of the blood you've lost is it was even easier to track you down this time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, get ready for this, Zagreus, because I seldom share the greatest of my hunting secrets like I am about to.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, no need to keep on toying with your prey. Here comes one of my finest blessings, now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't reveal my greatest hunting techniques for just anybody, Zagreus, so you better appreciate what you're about to get, and use it to go far!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about we not take any chances this time, Zagreus? So here, this is the best I've got. You better not waste it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's only one heavenly archer I know of. Well, several, really. Anyway! In the name of Hades! Olympus? I accept this message.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard about you. Look, I'm not like all the others on Olympus. The power of the hunt helps keep me company, so... maybe it'll help you, too!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey. You're not alone. You're not alone down there, OK? Here, let me show you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The dead must make a rather easy target, wouldn't you say? Let's see what you can do to them, given your choice of these.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You busy, Zagreus? Thought maybe I could interest you in some of these old hunting tricks of mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How fares the hunt this time around, OK? I bet it could be better, so, erm, here! Maybe this'll help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's take a little hunting expedition, yeah? You'll do most of the work, but hey, I'll be with you in spirit!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry you're still stuck down there. Sometimes I feel stuck myself, but, a good hunt always sets me straight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When I am on the hunt, my mind is clear, and nothing stands between me and my target. Though, have a blessing just in case you can't relate!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd love to know about your life down there. I'll try and help you live through it this time so that way you can tell me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The wretches whom you face down there have died already, sometimes more than once. Should make for easy targets, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've never come across a target I couldn't take down. I expect the same of you, you hear me? Hopefully you hear me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good hunting, Zagreus! The sooner you get out of there the sooner you can save me from my insufferable relatives. Please?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Zagreus, good luck out there, this time. I'd tell you 'may your aim be true' but I can guarantee it, actually.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The hunt requires utter concentration, so, I'll leave you to it, and... just watch your every move in silence over here...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want to make it out of there, you... don't have to listen to a word I say, to be quite honest, but... my huntress blessings ought to help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Zagreus, you getting out of there this time, or am I going to have to keep on hunting by myself for the time being? Probably?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Looks to me like you could use a little help, so I'll just have a look in my big bag of blessings here, and, oh! Here's just the thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The hunt comes down to kill-or-be-killed. Except for us immortals, who have to live with our shame, which is worse?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Those wretched things harassing you throughout that Underworld just won't give up, will they? Well, just keep killing them, I guess!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Need a hunting partner, Zagreus? Not that I'm able to join you myself down there, or even hear you respond for that matter, but, anyway, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus, it's me! I'm here to join the hunt with you again. Let's show them what we can do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hello again, you ready for this hunt? Me, I've been looking forward since last time, so, let's get on with it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stay on your guard, tread lightly, and all that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Keep a sharp eye out there, won't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you hunting this time, I wonder.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll be looking out for you. If you don't mind of course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about I join you for this hunt, OK?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, you take care of yourself, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got you something I bet you could use.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The finer points of hunting are not easy to communicate, though you're learning from experience, at least!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My senses sure are going to be sharp if I keep trying to keep up with you like this in all that dark down there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A good, clean shot is all it takes, most of the time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You getting anywhere down there yet, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you waiting for, let's get to hunting, then!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not much of a hunt when your prey knows exactly where you are, but it'll do!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope your every strike cuts to the vital bits of all your prey, there, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I brought some hunting gear for you to try, if you could give me your attention, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, Zagreus, catch your breath, decide, and then what say we get you out of hell maybe?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are we hunting this time, Zagreus? Don't tell me wretched dead, again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You see how easily I tracked you down? Unless you went out of your way for me, that is?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a Boon for you, here, Zagreus, though just be sure you don't embarrass me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, perfect timing, Zagreus, now stock up and head out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want to make it out of there, my Boons are just about the only way to go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you let your father or let anybody push you around, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bet I can help you break out of your father's realm in no time, Zagreus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Decided I would pack you something extra for this hunt, if you can handle it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough toying around with our prey, there, Zagreus. What do you say we finish it, this time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know it must be such a struggle for you, Zagreus, so here! In case this helps.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A great hunter ought to have great tools, Zagreus, so here! Please allow me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wish I could hunt with you myself, but here's the next best thing, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know how long it took Callisto to become a master of the hunt? I'm sure you can still learn a thing or two!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was about to head out with Callisto for a hunt, though I can spare you a quick Boon, I guess!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to meet Callisto soon, but it won't take me but a moment here to get you on your way!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Someday perhaps you'll join me and Callisto for a hunt! But as for now...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Greetings to you from the forest! Callisto and the woodland nymphs say hi!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'd make a real asset on the hunt, I think. Not that Callisto and I need assistance, though.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, one thing I'll say for Charon there? He doesn't talk too much. And since neither do you, I'm letting you have this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess this means you must have paid the boatman's ransom here, and whatever price he charged you, it was worth it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even there in your Underworld, it seems quality hunting gear doesn't come cheap, apparently!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you're quite done with shopping, Zagreus, what say we cut straight to the chase from here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You hunted down a real bargain there in Charon's shop, though how about we try a slightly bigger deal on for size right now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why would you side with...?! Ugh, why do I even bother with some lesser god!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought we had an understanding, Zagreus. But, this wouldn't be the first time I was wrong about someone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Huh, so that's your choice! Maybe you're more like my relatives than I'd care to admit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good shot, there, Zagreus! I guess you got me. Now why don't you go take a shot at this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't be messing with my feelings, Zagreus. My loyalty's hard-won, and quickly lost.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You really missed an easy shot, here, Zagreus. But I will not. You'll see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, good! Just when I had almost forgotten what an arrow to the back felt like!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Am I some kind of pushover to you, Zagreus? Is that what you think?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, look, turns out it's time for target practice once again! Start running, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What made you think I'd stand for this, from you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah-hah, I knew you'd pull this old maneuver, Zagreus. And I am ready for you, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're getting quite predictable when you betray me like this, Zagreus! Start running, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh really, that's the way it's going to be? You Underworld gods are all alike!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine, I'm not angry anymore, not really anyway, but you just watch yourself with me, you got it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh you're still there I see. Well then, all right, let's call it even for the moment and get on with this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, all right, I'm going to forgive you now I guess, no need to beg, you just think twice next time OK?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got to say you handled yourself pretty well back there. I can't stay mad after a show like that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good hunting just now, Zagreus. You passed my little test, so now we're good, just like it never happened.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you survived, so what. Here, why not take a Boon, and then be off?
label: CHARACTER
