label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd say I've bickered with you quite enough for now, Cousin. Let us continue down a more productive path.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've better things to do, I think, than fight amongst ourselves over a matter such as this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I would very much prefer to think we both know better than to let old grudges stew forever, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You see I have my father's temper, Zagreus. I am able to keep it in check, though I expect you to do your part.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Conflict between the members of our family is inevitable, Zagreus. All we can do is learn and grow from it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see no benefit to staying angry, Cousin. I promised Nyx that I would help rather than hinder you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father also made some questionable choices, Zagreus. But all of us are family, after all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm indebted to you, Goddess, for all that you and your side of the family have done for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well it simply isn't in my nature to allow such offerings to go unanswered, noble Cousin. In turn, I wish for you to have this, with my compliments.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For you, Lady Athena, without whom I would assuredly be lost.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is an unexpected gesture, Cousin! I do appreciate it, though please do not feel obliged. I offer you my friendship, not a loan to be repaid.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a simple token for you, Goddess. Although it's insufficient thanks for all the aid you've given me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are most gracious, Cousin, to extend this offering. You honor me, yet I would ask you think of your well-being for the time, not mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Goddess Athena, please accept this gift. Your wisdom ever guides me toward the light.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My, how very generous of you, to offer me this gift! I'm very grateful, though I ask that you not go out of your way on my account. Let's please stay focused, here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As I remain committed to my task, Goddess, I'm reminded none of this would have been possible without your aid. And so, I must give thanks, even if through a meager offering.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know there isn't much that you can do to show your gratitude at present, Zagreus. But I would ask that you save it for when your task is complete. You've more important matters to attend to now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As I remain committed to my task, Goddess, I'm reminded none of this would have been possible without your aid. And so, I must give thanks, even if through a meager offering.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know there isn't much that you can do to show your gratitude at present, Zagreus. But I would ask that you save it for a better time. You've more important matters to attend to, now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lady Athena, I know there's more at stake for you in this than just my plight... you care so much about this family. That care and your determination spurs me on. I'm ever grateful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps there really is no time quite like the present when it comes to showing thanks to one another, my dear Cousin. You've opened my eyes to the possibility, though I remain steadfast in my resolve to fight for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know this Ambrosia originated on Olympus, Lady Athena. Though through its long voyage to these depths, I trust its savor is more worthy of your grace. No one's ever had a greater cousin. And I'll never forget what you've done for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus? When Nyx revealed herself to me and I first learned of you, I saw it as an opportunity to bridge the great divide between Olympus and your father's realm. But, having had all these glimpses into who you are, it is an even greater honor to have forged this partnership with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are untouchable for now, Cousin!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just let them try and stop you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I ought not help you thus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ask me now to aid you, is that so?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you quite serious about this, Zagreus?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps next time you shall cooperate with me again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wound the pride of an Olympian, and pay the price.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Know that this could have been avoided, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've come to offer my support.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I commend you for your efforts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, little Hades, you have met my brother Zeus! He's sometimes known as king of all the gods! Although, in many ways, he's not as powerful as I! Nor anywhere as dashing. Why, I, oop!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, Brother... you know better than to say such things about me, I should think. I know that tact does not come easily to you, though I'd be careful what you say to our good nephew, there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Buh, erm, anyway, as I was saying, little Hades! Brother Zeus is king of all the gods! And the most dashing, powerful, and hey, let's face it, godliest of all!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you can see by now, we are a big and clever family, little Hades! My niece Athena here being the cleverest of all. You'd never know that she was childless, the way she looks after and cares for all of us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Surely my cleverness comes from your brother and yourself, Lord Uncle Poseidon. And I would only add, my feeling is we've more than enough children in this family, thus no further need for more of them, for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, little Hades, you must know by now I've other nephews here, don't you? For instance, Ares comes to mind, the god of war! Some mighty wars have taken place at sea, is that not so?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed, they have, good Uncle Poseidon. Mortals show great ingenuity when war is concerned; it drives their sense of progress, more than anything at all. Perhaps someday they shall wage war even in Father's skies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The thing about me, Nephew, is I get along with everybody, here! A skill apparently that's rather rare! Take my niece Artemis, for instance! Can't ever take a simple jest, at all! You won't easily attract a mate with such a sour look about you, girl!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, and wouldn't that be such a pity, Uncle Poseidon. I wonder what could be the cause of this sour look that I perpetually have up here? Maybe Zagreus knows.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahaha! See exactly what I mean, Nephew?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My foster-sister Goddess Demeter, despite her stern approach, she often likes to make good sport of me, Nephew! Why, here she is right now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you're quite finished blathering, Poseidon, our young Zagreus has more important things to do. He needs your blessings, not your point of view. Don't you, young sprout?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah-haha! I knew that I could count on you, Nephew! So the ungrateful Theseus, the winsome prize he earned was just some chariot, correct? And he was vanquished on it, anyway! That's what he gets! Boasting his prize was greater than any in his mortal days, pah!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah-haha-hah, little Hades, I was certain you'd the wherewithal to thin the ranks of the betraying river denizens who fled my surface-seas to your father's domain!! I bid you good fish-hunting forevermore!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, here goes. In the name of Hades! Olympus! This is an official message! Uncle Poseidon, hope you can make this out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's this, Nephew? Why, isn't this a note? Or, part of one, addressed to me, but it appears there should be other pieces, for the others here? Ah, it's like a sunken treasure, then! Which means I must seek its mysteries at once!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, Nephew, I had a positively raucous time down there, with your old father, and Persephone, was she a sight! I never thought I'd see her again! So then, we're one big happy family, at last! But you've a job to do, and we upon Olympus, we'll do our fair share!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, Nephew, my honored brother Zeus already has endowed you with his thunderous might? Well you shall soon forget about all that, after a taste of this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahh, you've received a blessing from Athena there already, little Hades! So careful all the time, that one, but here, I'll help you live a little, just in case!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh-hoh, so you've already heard from Aphrodite, have you, Nephew? Understandable, but first things first, now let me add a little something to all that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hoy, Nephew! It's my understanding you've been blessed already by one of my other nephews, Ares! As you can see, not all of us are cut from the same cloth; and thank the Fates for that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sense that you've been marked by the elusive Artemis, correct, Nephew? She shies away from most of us, so if she's taken somewhat of a liking to you, great!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whenever Dionysus calls a feast, I'm turning up sooner or later, hear me, Nephew? So make room for one more blessing, and, let's go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Little Hades, it appears that you are moving right along! Almost at an uncanny pace!! I wonder how you got to be so fast! Aquatic exercise?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nephew, how is it you're navigating your cruel father's realm at such a blinding speed?! There's only one Olympian who moves that quick! Besides myself! Where is he, anyway?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, little Hades, there's a certain chill about you, meaning you received an ice-cold blessing courtesy of Elder Goddess Demeter, correct? Now, personally, I think water's best in liquid form, but who am I to judge?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've come to know your Uncle Zeus, by now, correct? Just want to let you know, good Zeus gets very busy on the regular, so you just stick with me, I've always time for you, Nephew!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nephew, your cruel father, Hades, he's my elder brother, you know that? Not exactly the expressive type, and never was. We seldomly saw eye-to-eye on things!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I daresay, little Hades, you've some spunk in you! Why, I think you take after me more than my crusty elder brother! You'll get away from that old codger yet!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My crusty elder brother Hades must have tried to poison you against us lot! I can imagine it as clear as water, Nephew! I'm proud that you've resisted his undoubtedly most-twisted words!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Last time your father and I spoke, he told me I was all washed up, can you believe the nerve of it, Nephew? Why, he took the words right out of my mouth!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's likely, little Hades, that you currently reside just underneath one of my boundless seas! Normally you'd have to be submerged to use this power, but you know what, close enough!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know I've many vitally important things to do besides lending my aid to you repeatedly, Nephew? But, all of that can wait! Family comes first!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you should ever make it here, Nephew, know this! I shall be pleased to stand in for the father figure I can tell you never really had. We can engage in all sorts of aquatic competitions, solve riddles, visit the sea-nymphs! Oh, it would be great, wouldn't you think?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nephew, why, the seas up here, they're just about as widely feared as your vast Underworld down there! For water can be deadlier than bronze!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My oceans, they are filled with danger, not just water, little Hades! Many of the dead you face, they met their mortal end at sea, and not on land!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahh, it seems to me you've had yourself a spot of lady trouble, lately, isn't that correct, Nephew? I mean the Fury down in Tartarus, of course! You going to let her keep on bossing you around?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah! I heard you showed that good-for-nothing Fury after all, I knew you'd handle that old crone, Nephew! And if she troubles you again, you just remind her who's in charge down there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good tidings, Nephew! I've learned that you have managed to get all the way to Asphodel, fine work! Now, you just keep on going!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ohh, Nephew, you've stood against the Bull of Minos, have you? Well I must apologize for any inconvenience there, because, he was a living testament to my revenge! Long story, boring really, rather sordid, too. Stay strong!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Word reaches us that you've come very far, indeed, Nephew! Striking distance from the surface! You just keep at it like that, and with our help, we'll have you out of there for sure!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wonder what monstrosities await you near the surface, little Hades? There's your father's terrifying hell-hound, for one thing! Ah, well, I'm sure you'll find a way to sail past whatever's in your way!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now don't lose heart, Nephew! Because in spite of all your efforts, it is probably the case that you still have a long and painful road ahead!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, I thought for certain you were well on your way out of there last time, Nephew! But, no matter, we'll just get you on another voyage to the top!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Little Nephew, why, I could have sworn you made it to the surface recently, and yet, you're all the way back there, again? Must be some sort of terrible monstrosity preventing your way out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll tell you, Nephew, I was quite taken aback to learn Persephone, she was your mother all along! Just disappeared up here, one day! Ran off, I figured, as she's got some mortal blood in her. But she was with your father! That rascal is my brother, after all!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So how is crusty old Hades faring down there of late, Nephew? Fewer worries there upon his brow? That Underworld of yours all running smoothly, and all that? We'll keep on pitching in from over here. Least we can do!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Persephone, she says you're really stuck down there, born of the Underworld, something like that? Well, if you ask me, that's no kind of attitude to have! You can do anything you set your mind to, Nephew! Take it from me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you do ever get the opportunity to spend some time up here, Nephew, know I shall take you on a grand tour of the surface! From the depths of my seas to the height of Olympus! Sure, maybe not today, or tomorrow, or even the next aeon! But sometime, we should go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Been nice to see my brothers getting on again, just like old times! Well, not exactly like old times, and come to think of it, there always was a bit of tension there between those two, but still! It's better than before!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your good mother Persephone, she's here all safe and sound, thought you should know, there, little Hades! Shame you can't be here with her, too, but ah! Doubtless we'll someday meet again!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah-hah! I sense you have in your possession that fine shell I sent to you, a little gift plucked straight out of the sea! You keep it close so I can better track you down!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My, my, little Hades, you brandish Exagryph, the Rail of Adamant! That weapon's power was so terrifying that we sealed it away. Oh well! Surely its mortal-damning secrets shall be safely guarded in your hands!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Huh! Why, if my eyes do not deceive me through those murky depths, you brandish Malphon! Let me tell you, little Hades, those old gloves have done some dirty work before your time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, little Hades, it is awful murky where you are, but if I'm not mistaken, and I never am, you wield fearsome Stygius! She once belonged to me, you know! Not quite my type, but we sure had our times! You take good care of her for me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, is it me, or do you bear your father's ancient spear, Nephew? I always wanted one a bit like that. And now I have one even better. Hah!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This time, Nephew, let's really show your father what you're made of: Water! For the most part! Mortals, at least, are mostly made of it. Bet you did not know that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The mortals like to give me thanks for all my generosity, Nephew! But little do they know, I have been saving up a bunch of it for you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, word has reached me that you squared against one known as Theseus, now champion there in Elysium? He was a handful even when he lived! So much so that my honored brother Zeus, he took to calling him my son, can you believe the nerve?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, little Hades, doubtless you have seen that we upon Olympus also lend our favor to the mighty Theseus, who bars your passage from Elysium! Now, don't you take it personally, there, because our blessings go to all who deserve them. Although, we try to save the best for you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That scoundrel Theseus! Apparently he earned himself some sort of winsome prize, for all his blustering there in Elysium! Though, I'm quite certain that, no matter what he and his bull friend have at their disposal, you've the power to defeat them, utterly! So go do it, surely I'll get word!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, Nephew, you've procured the Rod of Fishing, I detect! Fine handiwork if I say so myself! Its line is nigh-invisible and causes denizens of my domain to flock to it like mortals to temples of mine! Good fortune with that thing!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm told a number of the underwater denizens from my domain were captured fair-and-square through your surpassing skill using the Rod of Fishing, little Hades!! They're yours, I've millions more!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All these river denizens you've caught, little Hades... it can only mean we share a deep connection, don't you think? I, with my power over the entire vastness of the seas! And you, with the power to ensnare a hapless fish with but a flick of the wrist!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, what exactly is that very mighty-looking spear I think I faintly see in your possession there, it's... why, I've not seen a thing like that except on very distant shores! It's almost as impressive as my trident here! Almost, I say!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You bear some sort of splendid-looking weapon, there, Nephew! Must be another aspect of fair Stygius, my old discarded blade! Never did see that one myself, but, I saw many others that were splendid, too!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hoh, you look positively in atrocious shape, there, Nephew! What's the matter, one too many run-ins with the wretched dead before I intervened?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Seems to me that you're in dire straits, there, little Hades! Why, you're bleeding everywhere! Here, let me try and do something for that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, what happened to you, little Hades?! I can tell even from here that you've been beaten like a skiff during a storm!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, don't go dying on me, yet, Nephew! You have to live! Or else the Boon I offer you shall go to waste!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your hated enemies, they almost got the best of you, I fear! But you can still turn it around, especially now that you have my aid!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ohh, have I got something for you this time, little Hades! Something special I have saved for when you really proved yourself!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's nothing stronger than the sea, Nephew, neither above it nor below!! And, if you are in need of further proof, behold: The greatest of my blessings, just for you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's uncle number two, it's got to be. Then, in the name of Hades! Olympus, I accept this message.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hoy there, little Hades! You recognize your uncle, do you not? We've a lot of catching up to do, but first things first, you get yourself out of that dour Underworld! As for me, I'll see if I can stir things up a bit to cover your advance!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hoy, Nephew, it's excellent to see you once again, and in good spirits, still? Then, come, let's make some waves!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahoy, little Hades, it is I! The greatest of your uncles! Here to aid you in your daringest escape attempt! And I do admire your persistence!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good tidings once again, there, little Nephew!! It is I, returned as ever here to make a splash against your many, many foolish enemies!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahoy, Nephew! I bet you have your hands full dealing with your enemies down there, so let me see what I can do. And I can do a lot!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems you're getting somewhere, little Nephew! Good, but here, allow your favorite Uncle to bestow a little boost!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, hahaha! Found you down there, Nephew! Now let's overwhelm your enemies in a typhoon of godly might, what do you say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Little Hades, have I ever told you I detest the dead? Well, I admit it, I just cannot stand a mortal past his due. So how about we get you far away from all such filth, agreed?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you say, there, Nephew, ready to get wet, or no? Oh I suspect you are, so let's get to it, and dispense some liquid justice!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How fares your feud against my crusty elder brother lately, good? Big Hades, he is disagreeable with all of us, not just with you, so, don't you take it personal, and stick with me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Looks like you could use the power of the sea, wouldn't you say so, little Hades? Good thing I'm here, so that together, we might wash your enemies away!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough kidding around without me, Nephew! I am here, so let's go bust you out, much like a raging river through a frail little dam!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're looking somewhat stronger than before, there, little Nephew, but you're much too scrawny still, to be quite blunt. So, here! Let's fatten you right up!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hoy, my nephew! I think I have kept you waiting long enough, so then, let's go! And break our enemies to pieces, like so many ships upon the shoals!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll have you know, the power of the seas themselves is yours once more, Nephew! So how about you put it to its rightful purpose, and go smash some stuff!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you perchance in need of godlike aid, Nephew? Well, excellent! Because I happen to command the sea, and I shall hereby let you take it for a whirl!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who dares to mess with little Hades? You simply point me at them, Nephew, and we'll leave them shivering and sopping wet, you'll see!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At last I found you once again, Nephew! You eating well and getting strong, correct? I'll help you with the latter category in a moment. Here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The awesome bounty of the sea is yours to do with as you please, Nephew! I've mustered forth a sample, anyway!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hoh, little Hades! I'd heard you were preparing to rain terrible destruction on your enemies! So I got here as quickly as I could! I'm not too late, am I?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All of us must sail through troubled waters now and then, correct, Nephew? Fortunately, navigation is my speciality, so let's be on our way!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your victory's most certainly at hand now that I'm here, Nephew! So long as you make sure to take advantage of the absolutely awesome power I bequeath!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, if it isn't the most favored of my nephews, stuck as ever though you may yet be! We'll get you from there, little Hades, don't despair, Uncle Poseidon's here!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good tidings, my most favored nephew! All is relatively well, I hope? But hope alone is worthless without action, is it not? So here, let's act together!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just wait until you see the seas, Nephew! My underwater realm is the most glorious of the world's habitats. It positively teems with life, and it's much cooler there than in that sweaty Underworld of yours!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Nephew, supposing it's high time for the high seas to lend their might once more?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your uncle's offering to shake things up once more, what say you, little Hades?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No more dallying about, now, little Nephew! Time instead we really got somewhere!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good tidings, little Hades! It is I! And I am always here to help!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fear not, Nephew, it is I, your uncle! Come to wash away your troubles, here and now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just point me toward your enemies, Nephew, and they'll become sworn enemies of mine!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's get you out from underneath the sea, there, little Nephew!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahoy, my godly Nephew, I've arrived, so set aside your worries and let's drench the dead!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about we set you up here with some real water-power, little Hades?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I take it you could use some liquid courage at this time, no, little Hades?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about a swim, there, little Hades? A swim, that is, within the Pool of Blessings! Now, dive in!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm here, Nephew, to aid you in your time of need, with this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard that you could use the awesome power of the sea, Nephew!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go on and make a splash for me, why don't you, little Hades!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The treasures of the sea are limitless, so here! You take your pick!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you say we make some waves, right, little Hades?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't let the wretched dead dampen your spirits, little Hades! Dampen theirs!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here comes another cool, refreshing blessing for you, Nephew!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Water can even cut through solid stone, with enough time! So you keep at it, there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know that you can do it, little Hades! Whatever it may be!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's darker than the bottom of the sea in there! Are you alive, Nephew?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The secrets of the sea can all be yours! Eventually at least, I have just three for now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You still alive down there, Nephew? Because if so, why, this ought to keep it that way!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Must get so stuffy in that dreary place, Nephew! So why don't you cool off a bit, with this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have a dirty job down there, Nephew, but I can help you to clean up a bit!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All that I ask, here, little Nephew, is for you to do your best! As I would do!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahoy, and now prepare yourself! For I've a rare treat here, especially for you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am ever impressed with your will to succeed, Nephew, so here! Great blessings be with you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've earned only the very finest of my blessings, little Hades! Why? Why not!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you are ever going to get out of there, only the mightiest of all my blessings will suffice!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My favorite Nephew ought have access to my greatest blessings, should he not?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah-hah! You found me, little Nephew! Strewn among the inventories of that most disturbing river-boatman! That means you win my blessing!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, well, my plan to get ahold of you via the boatman worked out flawlessly! Harness the might of the sea, then, why don't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Nephew, I know that salty Charon can be difficult. But I am certain that whatever price you paid, you got a deal!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nothing comes freely for the mortals on the surface, Nephew! And from the sound of things, it isn't any different with that Charon character!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me just say, Nephew, that money-hoarding boatman best be fair with you! Because I'd hate to see anything happen to that little boat of his!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whaaaa, you think that you've a chance in hell without my help, am I to understand?! You made a big mistake there, little Hades, just you watch.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How bold of you to throw your lot in with my relatives instead of me, given the choice, there, little Hades. But don't you ever bet against this horse!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, now, it seems to me your strength outweighs your smarts, there, Nephew, if you're prone to picking other sides than mine!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A word of caution, little Nephew: Never turn your back against the sea. And, while you're at it, never take up sides against your greatest uncle!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Augh! I'm absolutely flabbergasted, Nephew!! I offer you the finest blessings of the earth and sea, and they're not good enough?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Apparently my crusty elder brother failed to teach you any manners, if you deign to thusly spurn my offerings! But I can teach you yet!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Betrayal, little Hades!! Of all my nephews, you should know better than this! Or perhaps I should. One of us, at least!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's definitely not the choice I would have made, Nephew! Because, for me to side against myself, why, that would make no sense at all!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nephew, what you have just done is tantamount to spitting in my face! Let me remind you, then, the ocean can spit back!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wound me, little Hades, with your callous choice! It's fortunate I'm quite impervious to harm. But I don't think the same is true for you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know the saying not to play with fire, don't you, Nephew? You'll find the same is very much the case with water, too!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Again, you would defy me, little Hades? I'm beginning to see why your father might be very frustrated, indeed, having to deal with you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems that you require yet one more gentle reminder not to scoff at chances to accept my blessings, little Hades! Now remember this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sometimes I think, surely my nephew takes to heart my strongly worded threats about my distaste for his little acts of treachery, but no!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I could have sworn I told you never to take the power of the sea for granted, little Hades? It seems the time for words is over, then!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, very well then, little Hades! Uncle's going to let you off the hook this time. Just mind your manners next we meet!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must hand it to you, little Hades! I did not expect that you would weather such a storm! I'm mightily impressed!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, I can't stay angry! Let us call all that unpleasantness back there water under the bridge, what say you, Nephew?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My, a show of strength like that deserves a commendation I should think! Although, for next time, know my favor's not a thing to trifle with!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, that's quite enough, I take it you have had about enough of that, correct? You're pretty good! So here, why don't you run along!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, hoh-hoh, you've got some fire in you, don't you, little Hades? Here! I've just the thing to cool you down, fresh from my own domain!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah-haha, my fits of anger come and go just like the tides, Nephew! Now take this from me, and get out of here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that was truly finely fought, indeed, Nephew! And I've a suitable reward here, just for you! Don't even know what I was mad about!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can I say, Nephew? Sometimes our tempers get the best of all of us. You're fortunate mine didn't get the best of you back there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You weathered the storm, there, little Hades, and the sea is once again at peace. And you'll make every attempt to keep it that way, correct?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, no need to fight about this any longer, don't you think, Nephew? Here, take my blessing, like you should have in the first place!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now let's not set a bad example for the family, Nephew! We're better than all that. Besides! They've many bad examples as it is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Uncle Poseidon, it's been excellent to know you, sir, so, please, this is for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh I am positively moved by your affection, little Nephew! Though, I think I have just the thing for you, in turn! Here, I shall transfer it to you!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Uncle Poseidon, this here is for you. Would that my father were as easygoing as yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah-hah! A show of generosity from my most favored nephew! Your gift is mightily appreciated!! I'll just go ahead and add it to the pile.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mighty Poseidon, greatest of my uncles, arguably, please accept this gift!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For all the times I'm offered gifts or sacrifices, little Nephew, I still always very much appreciate it! I mean, look! I'm grinning ear to ear!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Uncle Poseidon, I have a special catch for you! Although it pales next to your sheer awesomeness.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whaaa, now would you look at that! Is that an offering to your most favored uncle, me? You know what, Nephew? I've decided I shall take it! Thanks!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I salute you, Uncle Poseidon! Your strength and confidence inspire me, and you accepted me as part of the family without question. It means a lot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahh, Nephew, but you needn't shower me with offerings and praise, you know! Why, I've no need of showering at all! Not when I've the sea itself, to do with as I please!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whenever I encounter you, Uncle Poseidon, my spirits lift, and I feel there must not be anything that can stop me. I only wish we met sooner, though I'm grateful to have met you at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought I told you, Nephew, not to make such offerings to me? Ah, probably forgot! Or getting you mixed up, perhaps, for I have many other nephews, thanks to Zeus! Though, between us, I don't like any one of them as much as you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Uncle Poseidon, sometimes I wonder what my life would have been like had you been a part of it sooner. Your encouragement, your enthusiasm... it means a lot. To you! This Ambrosia's been to hell and back!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hohhh, but isn't this a kingly offering, indeed, my little Hades! I know how difficult it must have been to get, so distant from Olympus as you are! I'll never understand how come your father's cruel to you, for if you were my son, I would be proud! Proud anyway, but you get the idea.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can do this, little Hades!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's time to make a splash!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My tolerance has limits, little Hades.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who do you think you are!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You cannot treat your uncle like THIS!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You call for my aid, now?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, now you want my help?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You drive a hard bargain, Uncle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I warn you not to trifle with me, Nephew!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh you shouldn't have done that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Next time, Nephew, best not be such a fool!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You disrespect the sea, and it is liable to swallow you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do not forget yourself with me next time, Nephew!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahoy, my nephew, it is I!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think you're going to like this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait... Persephone... Mother... is Demeter's daughter?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Winter... that's when it's cold, or something, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait... Persephone... Mother... is Demeter's daughter?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, now, young sprout, you've met the so-called King of the Olympians, and I. Whom do you now suppose is genuinely ruler of this snow-encrusted mountaintop of ours?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, hah-hah-hah, Lady Demeter! Your wit is just as dry as the earth lying quite fallow in your care! Perhaps you should go tend to that again, though let's we go ahead and help our young man first!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, little sprout. I was just notifying Lord Poseidon here that all of his domain exists because it pleases me; remember, my good foster-brother, I could freeze your oceans solid if I chose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, hahahah! Excellently stated, venerable Goddess Demeter! I'm reminded once more of your vast experience, though, I think we all prefer our oceans liquidy, isn't that right, Nephew?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To think, young sprout, our strategist Athena, warrior-goddess, sprang from Zeus' head! I would expect that no high intellect could come from there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please do not mind the Lady Demeter's good-natured sense of humor, Zagreus. She and my father often like to jest with one another, even in the most difficult times.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Young Zagreus, once you arrive, do tell Lord Ares here that his great power's not worth anything without my own. Wars have their causes, among which, many I control.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do not question that your influence can stir a mortal's impulses toward war, O Goddess Demeter. At least we can agree that our domains are quite compatible!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Remember something for us, Zagreus. A frozen heart holds no sway over anyone at all. Isn't that right, oh Aphrodite, dear?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I don't know, my dearest Demeter! The frozen heart has tendency to thaw, and then begin to beat with renewed vigor after that. I trust your time shall come! It can never be too late, except for mortals, the poor things.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, Zagreus, my gentle Artemis here was just saying how concerned she was for your predicament! I'm sure she'd like it if we both could help you in this case.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Concerned? I don't see anyone concerned, you have this, Zagreus! You don't need anybody's help, and you can get through this all on your own, though just in case, and I mean just in case! Um, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The crops shall wither and decay so long as I may please, young Zagreus. Although we do have those upon Olympus who take issue with my reasoning...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, yeah, milady, I take issue here! I mean how are the grapes supposed to grow and wine supposed to flow when you are so uptight, now, just ease up a little there, let's see what we can do!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see the noble King of the Olympians has reached you prior to me, Zagreus. I wonder which of all his many lies he's told you last.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My foster-brother's wayward son appears! I, too, once lost a child, Zagreus. I was quite foolish with her from the start. Her father was a baseborn farm-boy; worshiped me! He's gone as well, of course. Only the cold remains.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My daughter to a baseborn farm-boy, she... why, little sprout, I wasn't very kind to her, I think. Certainly not once her father passed. It was her mortal blood that made her weak! Born to mortals, taken by mortals, I suspect. So now, they pay.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't suppose... no, it is nothing, little sprout, it's just... I hear such wicked rumors now and then, about my daughter, lost to me, and what became of her. Kore, we called her, then. Persephone is what she called herself. Before she vanished utterly, leaving no trace....
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After my daughter Kore disappeared, I left this mountaintop. Wandered the earth, in search. For naught, of course. It was a necessary journey, I suppose. May yours fare better.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hope Mother knows what she's doing, in the name of Hades! Olympus, this is an official message! Lady Demeter, this is for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's all of this, young Zagreus, a message of some sort, for me, indeed? I... can't decipher it, although... it bears the marks of my two foster-brothers here, and... well! It seems we'd better compare notes!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, little sprout, young Zagreus... my grandson! I can scarce believe it, still! To think that, Kore, or... Persephone, my daughter... she had been with Foster-Brother Hades, all this time! A match I wouldn't have expected... or approved. That's why she left! Our blasted hearts do what they want.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My little grandson, little sprout, I've thought... if my Persephone's alive, why then... this winter, hasn't it endured for long enough...? It's grown to have a certain stubbornness, but I... I am the goddess of the seasons, Zagreus. Perhaps it's time I changed them once again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've lifted the cold from the earth, much as I said I would, grandson. But, near your father's realm... I have decided it shall stay the way it is. Bereft of warmth. As a reminder to us all, about all this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You bear the blessing of Poseidon, Zagreus? Someday I shall remind him of his place, and freeze his watery domain entirely.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Athena has imparted you her wisdom, Zagreus? A simulacrum of the real thing, at any rate. True wisdom only comes with age, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All of the love and beauty in the world can wither in a season, Zagreus. Remember that when next the goddess Aphrodite makes her promises.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Ares already got hold of you, has he? He's good at making mortals kill each other, yes. But he has utterly no knack for subtlety.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The gentle Artemis already found you, Zagreus? She takes my orders well; one cannot blame her, for she'd have nothing to hunt if not for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You stumbled into Dionysus, Zagreus? One of these days I shall prevent his vineyards all from ripening; put to the test his carefree attitude.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The mark of Chaos is upon you, isn't it? A force older than I! Yet one which you ought not trust so readily. No rhyme or reason to that one at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that the bloodlike stain of pomegranate on you, Zagreus? A hardy fruit resistant to a winter's chill. How fascinating they survive, down there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't often divulge such blessings as I am about to, Zagreus. Don't thank me for it, but make certain that you use my power well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have affection for you, little sprout. No need for reciprocity, but now I'll offer you the fiercest of my capabilities.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must admit I have grown fond of you, young sprout; nevertheless, I shall not spoil you like some ill-mannered child.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My, but you're as determined as my foster-brothers were, when my sisters and I stood with them 'gainst the Titans way back when.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our family, why, I think we understand something of loss, now, don't we, Zagreus? Unlike the mortals on the surface. Always begging me for plenty. They'll get none. But as for you, I have a plethora to offer!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are entirely too young to have had meaningful experience with loss, young Zagreus. Pray to me that you never have to learn.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You live within the bosom of the earth, and know its warmth. But there is no such warmth up here, young Zagreus. You truly wish to feel the bitter cold of the outside? Then, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Someday, you'll gain the surface, Zagreus; and you shall see firsthand what mortalkind has wrought. You'll find it has some commonality with your domain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Motherhood's a curse, young Zagreus. Be thankful you're immune. You sprang from Nyx herself, or so I hear? I sprang from Theia, whoever she was. And I once bore a child, too. Long gone. A mother's work... isn't it such a waste?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father Hades and I share a common fate, each having lost a child fully grown; except that he's a hollow fool, whose child left! Whereas my daughter never would have. Ever!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father always had a sternness to him that his brothers lacked. Thought him a decent sort, comparatively anyway; though evidently he is no such thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Should you achieve your goal, and see this surface-world, Zagreus, I've but one bit of knowledge to impart: Don't ever fall for mortals. Use them if you must, but do not waste your love on those who waste away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a brother, Helios, the Sun. A nonsense-talker with a flaming chariot. Why, he once told me that my Kore, that she went into that Underworld of yours! Preposterous. The clouds now blot him out entirely.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This land is not unlike your own in certain ways. For, Helios the Sun has not shone down upon it for some time. How long, I really couldn't tell you, little sprout! Long enough for mortals to take notice, certainly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My sisters Hestia and Hera surely would assist as well, young sprout. Except they and our foster-brothers haven't been getting along of late. Though as for me? I'll never leave this mountaintop of mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We all are willful children, are we not? I'm daughter to Hyperion, you know; a Titan so obscure and hated that Lord Zeus, he started calling me his birth-sister, so much did he dislike this bit of truth! And to get a rise out of me, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As seasons give to one another, so do generations, I suppose. Hyperion, my father? He'd not a one redeeming quality. My sisters and my foster-brothers and myself; this world owes us a debt for ridding it of him and his kind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I ought to warn you that my foster-brother Zeus, he has just a disgusting sense of humor, little sprout. He'd have you think he sired half the countryside! I have to shudder at the very thought.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's so much nonsense that the mortals say to one another of our family, Zagreus. How viciously the rumors spread! Whether from that oaf, Zeus, or likely from the mortal drunkard-poets with no better use of their limited time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I warn you, Zagreus, best not to make attempts to grow much closer with me, thus. I'm much your elder, after all, and you're my little sprout. What say we keep it that way, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... I am so very moved, I... have a daughter once again. And... I've a grandson, too! I thought, I felt something when first I met you, but... I brushed it off. Just like a fleck of snow...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Someday, my little sprout, you'll gain the surface of your father's realm, and see my handiwork. Until such time, I'll come to your aid as I can. It's quite the entertaining pastime, honestly!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By the way, we had entirely a lovely time within your father's house, Grandson. And, to see Kore once again, it... warmed my heart. I'm beyond grateful that your mother's safe. And that you've an important job to do. Here, I shall help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I meant to tell you something, Grandson... you needn't have deceived the rest of us. You could have sent word that my daughter was with you down there, all along! Ah, but families are a complicated thing. Just swear that you'll be candid with us, next time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must visit us sometime up here, Grandson! I understand the surface hasn't been agreeable with you... though perhaps if not in this age, then the next, we shall have you over. It's brisk up here... but nice enough, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Young sprout, I cannot fully understand my daughter's choices, such as what she saw in your gloom-filled father to have eloped with him. But if you are the result, then she is clearly wiser than I estimated.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I made mistakes raising your mother, sprout. When she was my Kore. I was blind to the possibility that she could have left me, but... I see it now. If you become a parent yourself, someday... may you listen more than I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You tell my Kore... erm, Persephone, that is... the Queen! You tell her that her mother sends her warm regards. You tell her that. And you take care of her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Grandson, my daughter Queen Persephone, she sent me the most precious message, courtesy of Hermes, as of late. I'm pleased to hear that you are getting on all right. Though, I know you're at work, so here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Frostbitten Horn which you bear once overflowed. It holds a certain power still, of course. But never again shall mortalkind take it for granted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The heat has risen quite considerably there, is that not so? Then if my foster-brother's tampered with the temperature, I'll have to cool things off.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The heat of your surroundings must be difficult to bear, my little sprout. It's fortunate I've just the thing for that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That chill sensation I detect must indicate that you are near the surface, Zagreus. If you can overcome the final challenges ahead, you soon shall see the long winter yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's Sister Hera's Heart-Seeker you have! The very weapon which she used to put our predecessors down. It hasn't lost its potency I see. Fear not, I shall not mention this to her, if I see her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, isn't that there Sister Hestia's oddly constructed armament you bear? She always was so predisposed to flame; I thought she'd never give it up! If it's to be in any hands, then may as well be yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I scarcely can see... are those the Twin Fists that you bear, young sprout? I once made ample use of them myself, if you'll imagine it. Wielding the cold since has been adequate for me, but you? May you put them to work as I once did.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, you've the look of one who has endured a terribly long winter, Zagreus! I trust you'll cling to life a little longer, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sense your grip on life is coming loose, young Zagreus. Now turn that cold you feel against your enemies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You seem to be in dire need of some assistance, Zagreus. I think perhaps I have a bit to spare.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're in the winter of your current stretch of life, aren't you, Zagreus? Do try and live a little longer for me, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You waste away just like a common mortal, Zagreus. How rather unbecoming of a god.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The flame of life is easily extinguished by the cold, young Zagreus. Surely you feel the warmth within you giving way?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cold comfort for your terrible predicament, young Zagreus, but I am here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Last time I felt a chill like this was... on the surface, but, who...? Well, one way to find out. Then, in the name of Hades! Olympus, I accept this message!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand, young Zagreus, that you would seek to leave that bitter darkness for this bitter cold? Quite honestly I fail to see why. But I'll aid your plight, why not? For I can offer plenty of assistance, and you soon shall grow fond of it, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I once had plentitudes of blessings I would offer readily, young Zagreus; but I am feeling not as generous of late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did you detect perhaps a certain spirit-shaking chill within the air, young Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Plenty of blessings left to go around; although, only for you, young Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your enemies shall have no shelter from the cold whilst I am at your side, young Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's something to the barrenness, where you reside; perhaps someday it shall be more like that up here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your realm there is much like the wind-swept surface here. Mostly devoid of life, such as it's been of late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Olympus must seem like a distant paradise to you, young Zagreus; it is a frozen waste to me. But still, it's home.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your foes shall more than catch cold by the time we're through, don't you agree, young sprout?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All those who stand opposed to you, why, we shall shatter more than their resolve, I think, young Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One of these seasons I suppose I ought to double-check the mortals haven't gone extinct without my intervention at each step.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: None can endure an everlasting winter's chill, young Zagreus; not even your father's lifeless servants there beneath the earth.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The seasons have a certain beauty to them, I suppose. Though struggle onward, and you needn't take my word for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've known your father and his brothers here for many seasons now; they bicker endlessly with me and one another.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to tell you something, little sprout. I take cold comfort knowing that my foster-brother Hades is no better at his parenting than I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd gladly scour all your father's realm if doing so would free you from his clutches, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll have you know something, young Zagreus: The bitter cold and frost is just as inescapable as death itself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The seasons turn relentlessly, without regard, and thusly should you doggedly push forward on your path.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall bring desolation upon those who wrong you, little sprout.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope that you're aware how seldomly I give my blessing as of late, young Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no escaping from the bitter cold, you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your adversaries soon shall know something of loss, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let us see to it your foes are left with nothing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There shall be only souls for harvesting this day, I think, young Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My warm regards, and all my blessings to you, little sprout.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The bitterness of cold and death go hand in hand, I do suppose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When all is taken away, the cold yet remains, young Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am not feeling quite so generous of late, young Zagreus, but nevertheless: Choose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your lifeless foes must foolishly believe they've nothing left to lose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go with my blessings, Zagreus; though you may take but one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Decay is the inevitable state of things; we are merely helping it along.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The cold of Mount Olympus shall bring utter ruin on your enemies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Death and cold, they are irrevocably bound together, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The climate in those depths needs cooling, then, I take it, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You bring with you the season of decay, young Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your foes shall all wither before you like unwatered crops.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The frost eventually shall cover everything, young Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll find that life gives way quite easily to cold, young sprout.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look carefully upon my blessings, Zagreus, and take no more than one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust that harvesting dead souls is not unlike the harvest we have on the surface, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're like a little flame there in your father's realm; easy enough to spot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems to me your foes are ripe for harvesting, young Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Any who stand against you soon shall wither from the cold, young sprout.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I seldom feel too generous of late, and yet for you, young Zagreus? Why not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I once offered the mortals generosities as this in much more copious supply.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It soon shall be exceptionally cold down in the Underworld, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd never give out blessings such as this to merely anyone, I hope you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've quite the harvest here from which to choose, my little sprout.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Soon, the season there shall turn exceptionally cold, young Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is particularly cold outside, today; and soon it shall be so in there for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, my little sprout, we shall have to get you through this winter's cold.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A crisp and pleasant winter's evening to you, Zagreus; now, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My finest winter blessings to you, little sprout.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Grandson, it's growing rather cold, don't you agree?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm here to ease some of your burdens, my young sprout. That's what we grandmothers are for.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust you're keeping yourself warm enough in all of this, Grandson?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When all this is over, please do come and visit us sometime, Grandson.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd tell you not to work too hard, Grandson, although your family is in need of more hard-working sorts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Foul weather's on the forecast for your foes, Grandson.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't let my foster-brother bully you about, you hear, Grandson?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's cool down that hot head of yours a bit, why don't we, Grandson?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My best regards to Queen Persephone and your lord father, little sprout. You keep it up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust your mother Queen Persephone is faring well if she has as fine a son as you, young Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your mother sends you all her love from Mount Olympus, Grandson.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All the best from Queen Persephone, young sprout. She misses you, you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Persephone is doing well here on Olympus, Zagreus. You ought to visit, too, sometime.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be thankful that the rivers to your realm have not yet frozen over, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust your ferry-boatman Charon has no qualms about the freezing temperatures up here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My message comes to you by river-boat this time, young Zagreus. At least that Charon is amenable to our attempts to contact you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My blessing's seldom given and ought not be so readily refused, young Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am accustomed to such disrespect from all those blasted mortals, Zagreus, but you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you are so disinterested in my generosity, young Zagreus, then you shall have my wrath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't recall if I yet warned against this type of attitude, although it doesn't matter either way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you believe I give my blessings liberally, Zagreus? Well then I've news for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Offend me, and I'll drain the last traces of color from those cheeks of yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was an ill-advised decision, Zagreus. I'm past quickly forgiving such mistakes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You truly think you can withstand the ravages of winter, Zagreus? That I would like to see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A harsh winter is coming for you, Zagreus. And I'm afraid you've brought it on yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For that decision, Zagreus, it is about to be a very cold day down there in your Underworld.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A careless choice you've made, there, Zagreus. As you grow long in years, perhaps you shall learn better judgment as to whom to trust, and whom to never, ever disrespect.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps you'll exercise more wisdom in such interactions moving forward, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It ultimately isn't my intent to leave you in the cold like this, young Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The freezing cold ought to have drained the life from you; but I've allowed it to relent, for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Next time, young Zagreus, perhaps I'll take every last bit of warmth you've left down there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am the eldest of Olympus, Zagreus. And I expect for you to treat me suitably.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The harsh of winter's gone for now, young Zagreus; and so take heart, but also you take heed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you survived a little winter's chill, didn't you, there? Be careful, though; next season could be worse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Remember, next time, Zagreus, that on my whim I can take everything from you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am quite capable of making your life plenty difficult, you do now realize, young Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps a few more winter seasons such as that might teach you more of how this world works.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough; I do not hold to grudges, Zagreus. You've my good graces, and my temper's cooled, for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good Lady Demeter, you've shown me warmth and generosity, and I am very grateful for it. Please, accept this as a small token of my appreciation.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An offering well suited for the season, there, young Zagreus! In turn, as you are honorable and obedient, you'll have from me what the mortals have not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A little offering for you, good Lady Demeter. I'm deeply grateful for your willingness to aid me in all this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must acknowledge and accept your thoughtful gift of Nectar, Zagreus; would that the mortals showed deference thus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May this small offering bring you some joy there on Olympus, Lady Demeter. Thank you for all your help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A conscientious gift, my little sprout; and I am grateful for your generosity. A bit of Nectar cuts straight through the cold, I say.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your power and your wisdom has been of such help, good Lady Demeter. I'm honored, and this is the least I can do in exchange.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was quite certain that the youth today was lacking any sort of tactfulness, young Zagreus. For once I'm thankful to be proven wrong.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lady Demeter, I am forever in your debt for the affection that you've shown to me, and for the power you've bestowed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The everlasting winter means that Nectar's been in rather short supply; that you would think of me for such an offering is duly noted, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I often remember that there's sweetness in this world only by your grace, Lady Demeter. I'm thankful that we've grown closer through all this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You would make further offerings to me? Even though I have made quite clear I've lately not been at my charitable best, young Zagreus? You're either naive or you're much too kind, or both.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, Grandmother? If you don't mind I call you that. Knowing we're related like this fills me with pride. Your power over life... I think I've some of it in me! And I could not have come this far without your help. Please, for everything... this is for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, Grandson, how you honor me, with this... I am so very grateful that we've met, and that... you're you, if that makes any sense at all. I have my sisters, but... I'd no one else, for very long, indeed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm in your debt, great Goddess Demeter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No comfort from the bitter cold!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shiver and rot, for all I care!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't refuse this, Lady Demeter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good Lady Demeter, I must accept.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have no tolerance for disrespect.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I warned you not to side against me, little sprout.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Respect your elders next time, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My greetings to you, little sprout.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A winter's greeting to you, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's going on, there, Coz? Can I call you Coz? Got something here for you should make your battles to the death end that much quicker!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, boss, my pop had pressing matters to attend to. But I'm here! Relaying you that message, and relaying this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here to tell you that Poseidon's on his way, boss. Sometimes he is a little slow. But you'll meet up with him again eventually!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Expecting someone else, there, boss? A certain half-sister of mine perchance? Well, tough break, I got here first. Want one of these, or not?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Soon as I heard you were looking to see Ares, boss, I got here as fast as I could! He's never going to beat me. Much less in all that armor.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aphrodite said she's running just a little late, Coz, though I'm sure you understand. Besides, I'm here! In spirit anyhow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wanted to let you know my sister Artemis is out looking for you. You should be running into her in any chamber, now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Afraid that Dionysus couldn't be here for you, boss. Though punctuality has never been one of his stronger suits.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That chill you were expecting in the air, that wasn't Demeter this time, here, boss! No, that was just me whisking to you in a flash. Makes for a little pleasant breeze I think!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You did it, Coz! And by it I'm referring to the act of beating down my seemingly invincible boatman associate, who fancies himself pretty tough as Underworld deities go! He wasn't sure you had it in you, and if I may be so bold, neither was I!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey looking like you're getting some good use out of that fancy plume of yours! Keep going like that, maybe someday you'll be half as quick as me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I got a keen eye, boss, so I happened to notice that you've got a certain tooth you're carrying about. Know you're from the land of the dead and all, but don't you think that comes across as just a little odd?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heard that you finally got out of there, Coz! Big congratulations due for that: Congrats! The secret's safe with me, of course! The others here, they think you're still at it. Though, I guess you are!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard a certain someone's back at home with you down there now, Coz! I'd call it wonderful news, except it isn't news, at least not yet! Though if the time comes that you want to spread the word, just give the signal here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I get to be the messenger this time. In the name of Hades! Olympus, this is an official message! Lord Hermes? Got here as quickly as I could.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, that looks like you've got a message just for me, this time, how special is that, boss? Some sort of invite from the looks of things. You sure that I'm supposed to have this, seeing as I'm not officially involved?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got to tell you, Coz, that was a real something of a feast back your place! A little awkward, having to pretend we just met, but hey, I'm an Olympian! Means I can posture with the best of them. Good times, Coz! Glad it all worked out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Afraid your regularly scheduled Olympian could not be here right now, because I'm that much faster, boss!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You might have been expecting someone else, here, boss. But I just couldn't help beating them to the punch this time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got here just as quickly as I could, Coz. Which turns out to be quite a bit faster than my relatives!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure that keepsake that you brought will come in handy soon enough, there, boss!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My relatives are normally quite quick to heed the call of anybody bearing one of their keepsakes! Huh!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I may not be the god you're looking for right at the moment, boss, but I will get you on your way to them in no time here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You heard already from my pop, haven't you, Coz? Wonderful guy. Don't get to spend a lot of time together, though! You know how that is. Well, see you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, Coz, my pop never gives his lightning blessings to me! He's quite invested in what happens to you, isn't he?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Want to bring you in on something, boss. Reason that Uncle Poseidon got to you before I did is, I let him. He's under the impression he's as spry as ever! Hah!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So then Athena's looking out for you, that's good, that's good! She likes to put a lot of thought and stuff in everything, it's all a little much, if you ask me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know who keeps me awful busy, Coz? Ares. Nothing like a good old war amongst the mortals to create demand for lots and lots of messages to go around!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did Artemis manage to locate you already, boss? She's pretty good at that, I have to say. I'm faster! But she's fast, she's pretty fast, all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aphrodite's really something, don't you think so, Coz? Normally I'd stop for no one here. But when it comes to her, exceptions must be made!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ever get the feeling life's been moving all too quickly for you, boss? Well Dionysus doesn't, as you're probably aware. Throws quite a feast, though!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Been downright chilly up here lately, Coz! We've Demeter to thank for that! Me, I try to stay out of her way, she doesn't think I'm of much help to her. Although I'm sure she's warmed to you at least!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, isn't that your father's blessing on you, Coz?! I almost can't believe it, but you've done such a good job of things, how could he not approve?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa, what's good, there, Coz? Though, who am I kidding, we can cut the small talk. I don't mind. I interrupt my brothers and my sisters all the time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Boss, you've probably caught yourself thinking: Hermes sure is quick! So how come it took so long for him to show up in the first place? Well, I'm afraid that's not for you to know. But! It's not because I was late. Not late for anything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, uh, could you do a little favor for me, Coz? My brothers, sisters, family, and whatnot, they're unaware I'm working with you, here. It's no big deal, but let's keep it that way for now. All right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Happened to be in the area, boss! Seeing as the mortal folk up here keep dying off, and someone's got to bring their souls to your domain, now, don't they.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Know that saying 'don't be hasty', boss? That comes from me. I swear! A little way to stave off competition, masquerading as the wisdom of a sage. Those stupid mortals will buy anything!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not that I really know exactly what you're up to, Coz, but! If I did, I don't think anybody on Olympus is aware of it. Or, if they are, they're keeping their mouths shut. The same as me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ever wonder how I got this fast, Coz? Lots of practicing, I'll tell you that! And being born unnaturally quick, I guess!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once took a skinny little chap down to the Underworld, got the business end of a sharp spear, he did! He had it coming, though, a lot of lying, cheating, and the like. Last that I heard, he's still making his amends down there. Eh!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Boss, I know you've heard a certain rumor from a very skinny individual who's uninclined to move. You best keep that one to yourself, all right? Or else our jig is up, and your father wouldn't like that, nor would you. So, cheers!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, you're in good with what's-his-name, the one who gave you his lucky tooth? So he's an all-right sort, then. Has to be, if you put up with him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, now you've found me out, haven't you, Coz? Heard from the big boat-man himself. Well, good! We're pleased to be of service. And we've got a lot of dirt on you, so you be sure to keep our secrets, too. All right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So my professional associate, the fearsome boatman on the River Styx? You got to know him pretty well in all of this, right, Coz? Hard getting through to him, I know, but his heart's in the right place! It's why I'm working with him, after all this time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heard you've been seeing the Fury, Megaera, Coz? Got the impression she was quite a handful, though I guess the same can probably be said of you, there, huh? You two have fun!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't believe you got into a fight with my professional associate, you daft or something, Coz? Just about everybody that I know, they're all at least a little bit afraid of that one and his boat, yet you think you can take him, huh?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you took on my good professional associate, is that right, Coz? And you beat the big boatman himself! I knew you were pretty tough, but not that tough! Impressive work! He's impressed, too. He isn't even mad!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, uh, so I kind of placed a bet with the old boatman, my associate that is, that you could beat him in a fight, twice in a row! No pressure, or anything, but just in case you prove me right one of these days, I would appreciate it, Coz!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Message from Olympus for you, boss! It says, 'It sure is nice up here upon this mountain, not having to escape the Underworld! Come join us soon, won't you?'
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Message for you, boss. It says, 'You're rather slow. If only somebody could help you out with that.' Huh, fancy that, what a coincidence!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got you a message, Coz. Says here, ahem: 'Hurry up and get out of there already.' It's from the surface of the earth, says so right here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another message here! It says, 'One small spoon dried oregano, two spoons extra virgin olive oil, one large onion, minced, a dash of salt to taste,' wait, this isn't for you. Though you should try it sometime if you ever make it out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Message for you, Coz, it says, 'On behalf of all Olympus, we would like for you to know that was a right good bottle of Ambrosia that you offered to the god of travel, Hermes, who appreciated every drop.' Sincerely, me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another message for you, Coz, this one says, 'Hey, mate! If you ever do make it up here up on this mountaintop for whatever reason, we should hang out, all right? I can show you around.'  Your friend, Hermes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, boss, just between us? Out of all special delivery recipients I've had over the ages, here, I've got to say, you're the most interesting one!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, Coz, all this time that I've been bussing souls across the borders of your father's land, it's good to have the chance to help somebody out the other way!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Coz, you're now well accustomed to our little chats, but I want you to level with me here. You're the boss, if you prefer, I would be happy to shut up, no harm no foul. Just give the signal, hey?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perish the thought, Lord Hermes. It's been great hearing from you from time to time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, all right, boss. Just making sure that I'm not interrupting anything!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that you mention it, Lord Hermes, yes, let's keep our interactions nice and quick.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hear you, boss, we'll cut straight to the chase next time, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahem! Pardon the interruption, boss. You let me know if you prefer that I pipe up again next time, more like I used to!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I miss hearing from you, Hermes. Let's carry on like we did before.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah, sure thing, boss. It's good to have a chat from time to time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Appreciate you checking in, Lord Hermes. I think we should keep at it like we have been, nice and quiet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No problem whatsoever, boss. Just checking in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thought I'd check in again real quick, there, boss. You want my witty conversation next time, or straight to the Boons?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, yes, let's go back to having witty conversation from you, Hermes. That sounds great.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah, good! I like these little chats! Take care, now, boss.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Straight to the Boons, Lord Hermes. We both appreciate cutting straight to the chase.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I get it, boss. Words are too slow, aren't they. Won't bother you again word-wise, but I'll be seeing you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thought I'd check in again real quick, there, boss. You want my witty conversation next time, or straight to the Boons?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Definitely witty conversation, Lord Hermes. Boons are more than welcome after that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah! Good, I like these little chats! Take care, now, boss.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Straight to the Boons, Lord Hermes. We both appreciate cutting straight to the chase.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I get it, boss. Words are too slow, aren't they. Won't bother you again word-wise, but I'll be seeing you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Met your father face to face only the one time, Coz. Despite rendering services to him for quite a while. Memorable experience, I'll give it that! Seems like he's not done anything with all the messages my side keeps sending him.
label: CHARACTER
