dialogue: You're pretty close with Thanatos, aren't you, boss? We don't often run in the same lanes, though our duties sometimes intersect a bit. Odd chap. Seems good at what he does, though!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Saw Thanatos again lately, here, boss, and want to tell you, almost looked as though he cracked a smile when he mentioned you! Never seen anything like that with him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hear you're close with Orpheus down there, you get the chance, you tell him I said hey! He's pretty decent with that lyre of his, last time I checked.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey boss, in all your travels there, you happen to run into a lass by name Eurydice? Hope she's all right! I feel bad because we didn't get a proper send-off last we met.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I caught wind you found Eurydice down there, that's great! Long as she's on the up and up, I can eject her from the tiny worry center of my mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's quite a nice Bone Hourglass you got, there, boss! So you're in good with my professional associate, as well. A real gentleman!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, look at you, there, boss! I recognize that fancy plume you got! Just an iota of my speediness in there, but still! Much more than most can do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa, what's gotten into all those lifeless wretches that you're always fighting with down there? They're really moving lately! Whatever's made them go all out, it wasn't me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got all your father's lifeless wretches hot and bothered, going all out all because of that Forced Overtime condition of his, isn't that right, Coz? Well, if they're interested in getting things done quickly, I am sure you can oblige them in a bit!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Looks like those lifeless wretches you're contending with down there are really on the move this time around, aren't they, boss? Oh, well, you're faster still, I'm sure!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Somebody's on a tight deadline, I take it, Coz? Courtesy of your father's Pact, well, you believe me, I know how that is, so I won't keep you, just keep moving, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I realize you're on a tight deadline, there, boss, so let's dispense with all unnecessary chit-chat here and get you on your merry way, posthaste!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You racing against time to keep things interesting, or what, there, boss? Turns out that time goes pretty quick. I like racing against it, too!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah! Can't help but notice you've been timing yourself, boss! Good habit that. Keep an eye on the time, you'll get faster and faster! Not as fast as me, mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, Coz, since you're timing yourself, case you haven't noticed, doesn't count against you when we stop to have these chats! Insisted on that little rule myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, you stopped timing yourself, boss, everything all right? If that's not a cry for help, well, I don't know what is. Um, here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good, boss, I can see you're clocking yourself once again. Little term I like to use, means beating yourself up whilst keeping time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, Coz, if you aren't always going to time yourself, that is a choice of lifestyle I have to respect. And learn to understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another message from Olympus, boss. This goes, 'Zagreus, take absolutely all the time you need making your way to us; we know the going must be treacherous, and we assure you our support, however long it takes.' Well, how about that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heard you got through pretty quick last time! Not bad, not bad!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'd think that once you break free to the surface we could see you from Olympus a bit more than usual, but no! It's like you're shrouded in eternal night up here, hm? Something like that. Odd, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, you beat your fastest time fighting through all of that! Not that I'm keeping track! I'm keeping track.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Coz, that last run-through that you did, I almost can't believe how quick you pulled that off! You're really pretty good!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, you got out of there in practically no time at all before! Let's see if you can have another go like that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're getting faster, Coz, keep at it, just like that! Can always go a little faster than before is what I always say!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Coz, looks to me you beat your fastest time climbing up out of there! That's nicely done! Can you go faster still?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you know, you beat your personal best time escaping recently! I hope my blessing helped a bit with that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well look at you, Coz! Rushing to victory after successive victory. Caught wind of your accomplishments down there! Well then, let's keep the streak alive!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heard the news you broke your streak of victories of late, boss. Happens, right? You seem the sort to bounce right back, though. Let me help with that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you get to keep breaking out of there, time after time, so that your father can keep finding ways to make it even harder to escape? Something like that? Sounds like an interesting assignment, Coz!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everybody on Olympus, they're still going on about Persephone, Queen of the Underworld! They had no idea she was down there all along, none whatsoever, Coz! And as for me, now I can deliver you my blessings more officially, I think!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even though everything's out in the open, now, and all my brothers, sisters, and whatnot are going to keep helping you fight your way out of there, I've still been keeping to myself, of late! That way nobody slows me down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Some members of the family up here, I know they haven't helped at all, but just don't take it personal or anything, all right? Think of it this way: You've got more of us getting along and talking properly than I have ever seen!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your mother got from there just fine, don't worry, Coz! She had me looking after her, and such. Seemed real nice! Told me to tell you hi.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, I never knew the pomegranate seeds down in the Underworld held such power if not for your mother mentioning it, Coz! And here I thought they were just tasty, that was it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thought I'd check up on you, there, boss. You doing well, everything good and all? Can't hear you one iota, mind, so then, don't answer that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come quickly, boss! You need to hurry up and get out of there, you're running out of time!! You're not, really, but it's a bit of motivation, hey?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you ready for this, boss? Got you the Premium Express this time. Absolute cream of the crop right here! You're going to go real far.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Guess what, Coz? It's the Premium Express, delivered straight to you, fresh from the richest mountaintop up here! You're going to like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Express-delivered message for you, Coz. It says: 'Congratulations! You're my hundredth customer today.' And here is what you get!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eugh, I have to tell you, you look awful, Coz. You're barely holding on! Let's see if we can't perk you right back up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whew! Looks like times hit you hard since last we had a run-in, Coz. Well, when life is tough, just hurry through the rubbish bits, I say!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa you're a hot mess, there, Coz, what happened getting here? Ah well, I hope your travels run a little smoother here on out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's a fine line between being quick and being hasty, boss. And if you're hurt as bad as I think, I think you might be on the hasty side!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, good news is you got to me, but I can tell you hit a lot of bad news on the way! You stay alive, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oof! What happened getting here, boss? Let me guess, you got whipped, burned, beat up with spectral clubs... something like that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're looking worse for wear, I hate to tell you, boss. But, we can pick you up and get you going here, I think!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This mark, almost like a bat wing. In the name of Hades! Olympus! I accept this message.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey boss, found you, good. Hermes, at your service. Pleasure! You are the talk of Olympus! Normally I wouldn't get mixed up, but for you, I will be making an exception. Now, come on, we both got places to be!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, Coz, here's the goods, fresh from our mountaintop. Take all the time you need deciding! If you want to be a slowpoke.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Won't need but a moment of your time, here, boss! And you'll more than make up for it right quick, you got my guarantee!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, Coz, express delivery to where-in-blazes are you at right now? Anyway take one of these, and go about your business!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know you're kind of in a hurry, boss. But let me show you what a real hurry's all about in just a moment here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Package for you, boss! And I think you know what's inside. Well, maybe not exactly, but... just pick something, will you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Coz, you can do this! And furthermore, I think you can do this rather quick! Now go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's you, boss, that's good! But you're standing still! That's bad. Let's get you up and moving about again, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, boss! Not much to report up here. But I've not exactly come this far to bring you news, have I?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Afraid there's no one faster than myself, here, Coz. But good news is, you are about to close the gap a little bit!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Slow day so far, there, boss? Well all of that's about to change, you got my guarantee!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How 'bout we pick the pace up just a little, Coz? Or maybe by a lot! Whatever you've the mood and stomach for right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Last thing I ever want to do is slow you down, boss. So, enough chit-chat. Now pick and go. Go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've got a ways to go yet, boss. Good news is, the slowest part of this particular trip is hereby over... now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All's well enough here on the surface, Coz. Though, sooner you can make it out of there, the better it'll be!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another go up to the surface, boss? Might suggest that you be very quick about it. And might give you this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's hustle, shall we, boss? Honestly, I don't know how the rest of you can stand it, trudging about like you don't have someplace to be!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hiya, boss! I'd ask what's new, but I already know! I have my ways. And you have to get right on out of there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wish I could just fly in and haul you out of there, Coz, but there's some rules even I can't break. Though nice to see you have a go of it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I come with urgent tidings, boss! Unfortunately not addressed to you. But someone got you these!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, Coz, no messages this time. Guess that's what happens when your whole existence is kept secret from the world!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's not much new worth mentioning up here, though looks like you have got your hands full down there, boss!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've got a tough climb up ahead, Coz, so you just pace yourself, all right? Just kidding, go as quickly as you can. It works for me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, now, boss, let's get you moving here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got here in practically no time at all, boss. Ready now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Coz, package for you here. Knock yourself out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got a customary care package for you, Coz.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, what's it going to be this time, boss?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Coz, let's pick up the pace a bit!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go get yourself out of there in a hurry, Coz.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No rush, but go on and pick one of these, boss.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Message for you, Coz: It says 'Take one, it's free, enjoy!'
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's going on, there, boss? Are things all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want the usual, or what, there, boss?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Special delivery and all that, boss! Here, take your pick.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey boss! You take one of these, and go for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just so happened to be in the area, here, boss!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Making sure you got this, Coz. You got this, Coz!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here comes a little boost to get you up and out of there in no time, boss!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, don't just stand there, Coz, pick one of these and go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your quickness is my number one priority, here, boss.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No time to waste and so on, Coz. Now, choose!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Caught wind you need my services here, boss?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thought I'd check in, Coz. See how things are going. Slow, right? Not for long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ready to hustle? Good! I'll take that as a yes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's get you quickly on your way, there, Coz!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Message for you, boss. It says: 'Here, choose one of these, and go!'
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another message for you! This one says: 'Hey boss! Take this!'
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just thought I'd check up on you, boss, and bring you this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hope you enjoyed the life of being slow, because all that's about to change, right here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, boss, here, let's get you on your way!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Past time we got you out of there, right, boss?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just thought I'd drop by, give you this, and go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll have you racing out of here in no time, Coz!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How goes it underground of late, there, boss?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nice day we're having on the surface! You should see it, boss!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another day, another race up to the top! You ready, boss?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, here we go again! Let's go, then, boss!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got here as quickly as I could, boss. Now what say we get you promptly the hell out of there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Coz, gathered you were just about to make another go of breaking out of there! Thought I'd stop by and give you a boost.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're raring for your next trek out of there, right, boss? Well then I guess I got here just in time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heard you were heading out again, boss. Changed my schedule around a bit, not a big deal, and figured I'd drop in!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're off again, are you? All right well then safe travels! Or swift travels, failing that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ready for another go at this, Coz? Well then think I can speed you on your journey there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, hello, Coz! Odd that we're running into one another here! Among the wares of my professional associate, I mean. Must be some sort of clerical mistake!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, hello, boss! Odd that we're running into one another here! Among the wares of my professional associate, I mean. Must be some sort of clerical mistake!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're well familiar with my professional associate, there, with the boat? Souls of the recently departed got to make it over to the Underworld somehow. Part of my job! I bring them in, he takes them down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess I'm used to these one-sided chats here, boss, thanks to my work experience with my professional associate down there! You tell him I said hi, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A word of caution, Coz. Don't ask too many questions about me, or my professional associate down there. I hand souls over to him, and that's it, you understand?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wouldn't you know it, boss! I was just minding my own business, handing off a few dearly departed souls to my professional associate, and who shows up, but you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My heavy-breathing professional associate was gracious enough to drop me off here with his other stuff, and for quite an affordable price, at that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, then, let's go make that spend of hard-earned coin well worth your while! What do you think, Coz?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd tell you not to ask too many questions of my good professional associate nearby, but then, who are we kidding, boss? Not like he'd answer you those questions anyhow!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Message for you, boss, from my professional associate, who wanted you to know, and I quote, 'Hhhrrrrnnnngggggghhhhhh.'
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Been working with my good professional associate, the boatman there, since I-don't-know-how-long. Though, let me tell you, Coz, we haven't had a job quite like this yet!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Among the many ways in which you could parlay your earnings into better chances of survival here, I'm flattered you would think of me this time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How strange of a coincidence that you keep running into me along the riverside like this, don't you agree, there, Coz?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't normally go selling off my blessings to the highest bidder, boss, but your bid there is good enough for me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Hermes, please accept this gift as a small token of my appreciation. Thank you for always keeping me on my toes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! Mighty keen of you to leave a tip, there, boss. And I've a tip for you: Don't be slow! Maybe this will help with that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Hermes, please accept this gift as a small token of my appreciation. Thank you for always keeping me on my toes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Hermes sir, you've asked for nothing in return, and so, please take this humble offering, because... it's nothing, really!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well now, that's awful kind, there, Coz! No need to thank me, though. Not so profusely anyhow!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Hermes sir, you've asked for nothing in return, and so, please take this humble offering, because... it's nothing, really!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hermes, my friend? May I call you my friend? I hope this modest offering will lift your spirits but won't slow you down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I look like I got the sort of time to sip Nectar, Coz? Well, guess what, I do! So, cheers!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hermes, my friend? May I call you my friend? I hope this modest offering will lift your spirits but won't slow you down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ever since we met, Lord Hermes, life here in the Underworld has been much faster-paced, and I am ever grateful. This is for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, boss, I appreciate the tip. But just as a reminder, all my services are paid in full already! No need for special thanks. Though... cheers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ever since we met, Lord Hermes, life here in the Underworld has been much faster-paced, and I am ever grateful. This is for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never could have come this far this quickly had it not been for your tireless support, Lord Hermes, sir. I'm in your debt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, Coz, I got to say I had a few concerns when we first met, your father being who he is and all. But you're all right!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never could have come this far this quickly had it not been for your tireless support, Lord Hermes, sir. I'm in your debt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This one's for you, swift and sure-footed messenger of the gods! You make what you do look easy. But I know you're going out of your way. Thank you so much, Hermes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My rule is not to let things get too personal as far as work-related matters are concerned, Coz. But you're family! And, well, you're a right decent chap, I think. Offering up a bit of Nectar to me in the middle of all this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This one's for you, swift and sure-footed messenger of the gods! You make what you do look easy. But I know you're going out of your way. Thank you so much, Hermes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I salute you, Lord Hermes, with this rarest of delicacies! Pretty rare here, anyway. You never show it, but I can only imagine how hard you must be working to back me up. Cheers, mate!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, the last time anybody offered me Ambrosia from the Underworld was never, before now! That's quite a gesture on your part. You could have just as well taken my services for granted and I'd not have minded in the least! But, thank you, Coz.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I salute you, Lord Hermes, with this rarest of delicacies! Pretty rare here, anyway. You never show it, but I can only imagine how hard you must be working to back me up. Cheers, mate!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Message for you, Lord Hermes! It says, 'This offering is dedicated to the incomparable god of swiftness, from whom the news is always good, because he's bringing it. You are a real mate, you know that? I really owe you one.' Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, Coz, I am going to accept this choice Ambrosia from you one last time, all right? But from this point, I am doubling down on all professional responsibilities, here. Strictly business between us! Although, secretly, you're one of my best mates. Want you to know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Message for you, Lord Hermes! It says, This offering is dedicated to the incomparable god of swiftness, from whom the news is always good, because he's bringing it. You are a real mate, you know that? I really owe you one. Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Hermes, I am in your debt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see you stand your ground against the serpent's flame...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Um... yes? Was I supposed to respond there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sense that you have not yet spoken with the all-seeing artifact you call Aegis. Tamper with the Fates' design, then, all you like. But if you change your mind, do speak the words to it: I see you stand your ground against the serpent's flame.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have not yet used the waking-phrase that I imparted? Or perhaps you merely chose not to present me the result. I would quite like to see it, at some point. Remember, Son of Hades: Say to the all-seeing artifact, I see you stand your ground against the serpent's flame.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Out of the infinitely spanning possibilities, here before me stands the Son of Hades, bearing my all-seeing artifact, appearing in the aspect of a bearer yet unborn, who shall be known throughout the north as Beowulf. How very droll.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I faintly sensed that you were able to confront your father while in possession of my small round catalyst. It seems my asking you, and your success, was in accordance with the Fates' design, as well. The result is more amusing even than expected. Thus, thank you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have detected some unusual activity within the reaches of the Underworld, Son of Hades... vast sums of Darkness, collected in an ancient catalyst, which I see now almost like a beacon, shining in the night. This either is the work of Nyx, or you, or both. I am anticipating the result.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It pleases me immensely, Son of Hades, to have seen the goddess Nyx again. The significant amount of time that has elapsed since last this happened dulled sufficiently old pains, I think. Thus, it becomes a basis on which our connection may, in time, take shape again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As we become acquainted, Son of Hades, I shall make myself quite clear in one respect: I fear I have a lack of patience for discussion. When visiting, please merely listen, then accept my mark, and then depart. Respond only when necessary. Or when prompted. Yes?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Merely listen, so it's just like when I get those messages from the Olympians. Wait, you did just prompt me, Master Chaos, didn't you? Or should I have remained silent just now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I cannot offer you advice. But you were prompted, yes. You may speak freely, then, or anytime, despite my wishes that you not do so. Absolute silence is my general preference. It may not be yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand that Zeus and all his kin on Mount Olympus think that you are born of Hades and the goddess Nyx? I was amused to learn of this deception. Nyx has mothered many of the Underworld's own, so, why not you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She isn't my birthmother, no, but she is like a mother to me. Do you know her?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I know the goddess Nyx quite well, of course. Though, it has been a while since we last communicated, and I fear... well, I was not the charitable sort, back then. It is my hope that Nyx is faring well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew you would arrive. But only in the moments prior to the fact. Thus, I am experiencing residual surprise. Your movements through the Underworld are as though a veil of darkness enshrouds you. The goddess Nyx's influence, perhaps? Respond.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... do not know how to respond to that, exactly, Master Chaos, but, Nyx, yes, she has been aiding me, in my attempts to flee my father's realm.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You move in darkness, not as infinitely black as hers, but reminiscent to me, nonetheless. I would invite her to try to elude me, and then attempt to locate her. A minor amusement for the both of us. Now, I have you for this, I see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lately, Son of Hades, I have sensed what I would call a sort of shift within your father's residence. Did something noteworthy occur, perhaps? Respond.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Master Chaos, it's Persephone, my mother. She's returned! She's chosen to return. So... things feel different, certainly, with her around, although... I didn't feel any sort of shift.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You may not sense these shifts as I. The lightness of this space bends and adjusts with time. What you describe... it must have been the cause. I trust that the occasion is a welcome one. And I am pleased that you returned, nevertheless.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Again I sensed some sort of shifting in your father's residence. You seek to ask something of me about it, do you not? Respond.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I'm glad you asked, it's just... my mother, she's... we're reaching out to the Olympians. Trying to reconnect the family. It's been a while, relatively, since she and Father saw the others, but... in case a gathering occurs, I did wish you to know you're cordially invited, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cordially invited...? A generous proposal, Son of Hades, though unless your gathering is to occur within my space, please understand it would be difficult for me to bring the full entirety of my presence there. However... I think I can arrange to be with you in some capacity. Thank you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It pleases me your gathering of the Olympians occurred. I must inform you... I had never once before detected quite so many of my offspring in a single space. At least not without violent intent. I appreciate that you included me, and that you have returned. Shall we continue, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It pleases me your gathering of the Olympians occurred. I must inform you... I had never once before detected quite so many of my offspring in a single space. At least not without violent intent.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You bear the blessing of the great Lord Zeus. He still believes he holds dominion over both heaven and earth. I think, perhaps, he has forgotten about me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Poseidon offered you his blessing, it would seem. He can be rather boastful and belligerent, exhibiting the most unattractive manners of your father and Lord Zeus alike.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This wise goddess Athena has imbued you with her charms, I see, O Son of Hades. Perhaps to her you are a tool with which her broken family may as yet be mended.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is not unexpected that you consorted with the violent Ares, and now bear his Boon. He still worships me, you know; yet, I would say he does not know me very well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The charms of goddess Aphrodite are upon you unmistakably, although I shall be curious to see if her command over one's sense of love shall have any effect beneath the earth.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand the hunting-goddess Artemis recently has turned her gaze towards you. It is unexpected she would offer her assistance, even to a relative in need.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The drunkard Dionysus offered you his services, I see? He can be rather unpredictable, and therefore offers me a source of some amusement.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Swift Hermes spurs you on, I see, O Son of Hades. Beware the narrow distance between hastiness and swiftness; a distinction I am not so sure the god of travel fully understands.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Embittered Demeter has reached you, hasn't she? She once was full of warmth, you know; but lately, as I understand, she is more prone to taking it away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have met many of the Olympians by now, each spurring you toward their mountaintop. They place such value on familial bonds, yet none of them remember who I am. Do not place too much faith in them, O Son of Hades.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I ask you listen but not speak, O Son of Hades, whilst the Olympians? They do not ask at all. They merely send their messages to you, unprompted, providing a choice of blessing, but no say. I seek to understand their point of view. But it is difficult.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When you extend an offering to the Olympians, for a fleeting instant, it appears as though they are able to hear your prayer. Or so I have observed. How interesting that your thoughts are capable of breaking free, yet you cannot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father and his brothers, when they sealed the Titans in the darkest reaches of this world, that was the last they saw of me, as well. You are dissimilar from them, and I feel safe communicating thus with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was at times uncharitable with the goddess Nyx, when we were closer, long ago. After she bore her first children, I nevertheless expected her attention to remain undivided. I kept creating. When finally I slowed, I realized my mistake. But our connection had been severed, by that point.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sense that something is the matter, Son of Hades. Speak, then, what is on your mind? I can decipher some of it without your telling though would rather hear it from you voluntarily.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, Master Chaos? The goddess Nyx, she... seems to want to speak with you again. I wonder, would you maybe contact her sometime? She seems convinced it is your move to make if you so choose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The goddess Nyx wishes to hear from me...? Now that is unexpected, Son of Hades, and I wonder if, perhaps, this is a jest of yours. Though, your intentions evidently are sincere. Then, I shall make no promises in this, except that... I am considering the possibility.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Son of Hades, should eventually you spawn your own offspring... I recommend maintaining sub-infinite distances with them in space and time. Even if they are most tiresome, there always seems to come a point when one wishes to be in their presence once again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After some consideration, and on your recommendation, I attempted lately to make contact with the goddess Nyx again. She is quite distant from me now, of course. If you happen to know... did she receive the message well? Respond.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Master Chaos, she can be a little difficult to read at times, but... I got the impression she was quite surprised, even excited to have heard from you again. She said that she would think about how to respond. Or, whether to respond.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. Well, she shall find a way, if it is warranted. I always did expect the world from her. There were times when I expected her to shine as bright as day, though she is Night. When she achieved a certain level of ability... she left. And I could not find her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My daughter, the goddess Nyx. When I learned the Olympians mistakenly assumed she was your mother, I did not fully consider the possibility that she essentially was a mother to you... the technicality of birth, aside. She cares for you to the extent a mother can.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prior to your intervention, Son of Hades, I expected that the goddess Nyx had forgotten about me... whether purposefully, or from passage of time. I believed that to be forgotten was the one true inevitability. Perhaps, however, I was incorrect.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I find that it is difficult maintaining my connection with many consciousnesses, such as yours, and that of the goddess Nyx. Yet I am also finding that this difficulty is fully warranted. Our connections give me much to consider as I await our next exchange.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, here is my favorite among those immortals dwelling underneath the Earth. How may I change your life today, O Son of Hades?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May you enjoy a moment's peace within my space before venturing on in uncertainty. To my surprise, I must admit I do appreciate the company.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you grown trusting yet of the Olympians, for all their generosity? Perhaps you ought to let them know the truth about your journey's goal. They are vain, and think that it is them you seek.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll never get out of here if not for their help, but... I can't let them know about Mother. She wants to remain hidden from them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A difficult position to be in, Son of Hades. The Olympians may not appreciate being misled. But you can trust that I shall keep your secret. I wish to see how your predicament plays out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Such darkness emanates from you, O Son of Hades, that I once again did not entirely anticipate you would arrive just now. I suspect even your father must have difficulty keeping track of you through the domain he calls his own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You move in darkness, practically unseen, Son of Hades. It is quite difficult even for me to sense your presence at times. The Olympians catch their glimpses now and then. But you are always in a shroud. Thus is the influence of Nyx.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How strange it is to be subjected to the Fates. But do not fall into the cognitive delusion that they have already made your choices for you, Son of Hades. Rather, they are keen about anticipating every choice that everyone shall make. Such as the following.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sense your consternation, Son of Hades, as you look about this space; you have another question, and are free to ask.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, it's just... I sometimes wonder, Master Chaos... if you created all of this, then... who created you? What was this place before you arrived?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All of this simply came to be, and so did I, presumably after a former time had finally reached its end. I hesitate to say it was an act of will. It was more like a sudden shift, as when a conflagration happens from a spark. I arrived at such a time, and all else then arrived, from me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When you expire, and then suddenly return to life within your father's residence, perhaps it is akin to when I first gained consciousness so long ago. Perhaps I, too, had just expired, only to reawaken.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You may have wondered, Son of Hades, how it is you came to find me in this space, when I have gone unseen by most for quite some time. I have wondered this, as well, and think that our connection to Goddess Nyx is the most likely answer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Son of Hades, I believe I have deduced something I ought have sooner recognized. Your mother must have been one who called herself Persephone. Her stay within the Underworld was brief, from my perspective, but impactful, nonetheless. You seek her now? Respond.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do. She's somewhere on the surface. That's why I keep on finding you like this. I'm trying to find her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope that your attempts achieve success. She is beyond my senses, presently, though of course I am still able to assist you in your journey, thus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Son of Hades, I believe I have deduced something I ought have sooner recognized. Your mother must have been one who called herself Persephone. Her stay within the Underworld was brief, from my perspective, but impactful, nonetheless. You seek her now? Respond.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Master Chaos... you should know I have located her, already. Though where she is, I cannot stay for long. So I am visiting, as often as I can. It's... not unlike our visits here. Only, somehow, even harder to get to where she is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. Then, it is good to know that you have been in contact. And I trust that your successive visits shall be worth their while. Not unlike our visits here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Son of Hades, if you locate the one who called herself Persephone, shall it then come to pass that we no longer see each other in this way? Respond.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! I... Master Chaos, I don't know what to expect from there. But, to be direct with you, if I could leave the Underworld forever... I think I would. Though, I would miss you. Many others here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I would miss you as well. Thank you for telling me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me something, Son of Hades. If the one who called herself Persephone is back, then... why do you continue to return? Respond.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Master Chaos, it seems I've developed something of a talent around breaking out of here. Or, there, I mean, the Underworld, so... it's become more of an official role for me, I guess. If escape shouldn't be possible, then someone needs to find the gaps.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed. Then, you shall visit with me still, despite accomplishing the principal object of your journey back when first we met. Good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am impressed that you were able to procure a specimen out from the flowing currents here in my domain, with nothing but a simple instrument. I shall look forward to your subsequent attempts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust the small round catalyst which I provided you has been of value, Son of Hades? It is my hope it makes your journeys to this space less difficult, perhaps inducing them on a more frequent interval.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have arrived within a certain shroud of darkness, Son of Hades. The goddess Nyx's ancient shawl. I had not sensed its void in a considerable amount of time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have traveled recently beyond my senses, Son of Hades. I persist here only in the fathomless depths. I know what lies out there, having created it. But I know nothing of what it is like, right now. Do not tell me. I prefer to think of all the possibilities.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: From the rumblings of the earth, I have deduced your father, himself, stands against you when at last you are about to leave these depths. It must be quite an interaction between you. Have I deduced correctly? Respond.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's right, Master Chaos. My father personally takes it upon himself to stop me in the event none of his underlings beat him to it. He... can be a handful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, then. Consider bringing to one of your future interactions the small round catalyst, which I provided you. The one in the shape you call an egg? It shall serve no purpose there at all. Yet if you succeed, then it shall bring us some amusement, shall it not?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems to me that you are very close to death, O Son of Hades, and yet you deigned to visit me within my space. I could hasten your demise, if you so choose?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I almost did not notice you, O Son of Hades, for you are closer now to death than life. Perhaps, though, we can stave off the inevitable for a little while.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your deaths are but a temporary setback, Son of Hades. Though it appears to me you are quite close to having such a setback, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your next experience with death seems to be imminent, though let us see if I can hasten or forestall it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It may seem cruel that I would wish you death, O Son of Hades. But from my perspective, it means you are much more likely to return to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Although you may succumb soon to your injuries, please make the most of your remaining life, rather than anticipate the next. The future is uncertain to all save the Fates.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You come to my domain bearing an all-seeing artifact that sprang from me after the dawn of time. It is considered a defensive instrument, I do believe. Though, I suspect you have discovered, or soon shall discover, it is nothing of the sort.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I expected your arrival, Son of Hades. For I am able to see through you. Rather, through the all-seeing artifact, which sprang from me after the dawn of time, and now resembles, in your hands, its foremost form. Respond.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, you must mean the Shield of Chaos, here? Your shield, Master Chaos, I should say. It's a remarkable artifact. Imposing, too! Your original creations must have been astounding.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your response is acceptable. And I am grateful to have had my recent firsthand glimpses of this vast domain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, you have that all-seeing artifact of mine, but in the old guise that the great Lord Zeus once used when he retaliated violently against his parentage. I watched his movements through it for some time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I bear a message for you, Son of Hades. One recorded in an age when certain concepts it describes did not yet all exist. Remember this: I see you stand your ground against the serpent's flame. A waking-phrase, to which you and the all-seeing artifact of my creation may respond.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A waking-phrase... and an all-seeing artifact, you must mean Aegis, right? So I'm to say to it, I see you stand your ground against the serpent's flame, and it'll wake right up. Though, can you tell me what it means, or who?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I can tell you almost anything. However, I would much prefer it if you learned most of the answers you seek by yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is not someone I recognize... so, in the name of Hades! Erm, hello? May I ask who's calling?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...The Olympians have all grown soft... would you not agree?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, we have met, in a way. I know everybody, here, and there. You wish to leave this place? Then, it is my wish to make your doing so a little bit more interesting... and, if you encounter the Olympians someday, do give them my regards.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sensed a certain rumbling here within the bowels of the earth. It is as though it had ingested something that did not sit well... perhaps the earth itself wishes to spit you up and out...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Olympians are vying for your favor, are they not? So often they forget themselves. They force their blessings onto you, whilst I? I merely offer you a choice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your path is yours to shape as you see fit, regardless of the Fates' design. Together we may twist that path a bit, if you would like.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I both expected you to come and am surprised to see you, Son of Hades. Where shall your journey take you from this point?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please tell me how my power over all existence may be of small assistance to you this time, Son of Hades?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The tremors underneath the earth foretold of your arrival at this very moment, Son of Hades; and, I have anticipated it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You chose to visit me again within these darkest reaches of the earth, as I, in turn, now choose to offer you the means to alter your reality.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Back when I conceived the world and the immortals, Son of Hades, I did not expect you would be standing here before me now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have arrived at last, just as I wondered how we might best alter one another's courses of existence here today.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Son of Hades, let me welcome your return here to my space within the Underworld, and bid you choose an alteration to the fabric of reality.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It pleases me that you are here again; for, through you I can tinker with reality, along the fringes that are not yet fully formed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your presence never ceases to intrigue me, Son of Hades; for you are not like the Olympians on high, who have forgotten me, or thusly choose to act.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: From my perspective I have summoned you, whilst you believe you came of your volition; both statements can be true, is that not so?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come forth, O Son of Hades, and together, let us sow my namesake through the depths of what your father thinks his own domain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How fares these days the never-ending cycle of rebirth and death for you, O Son of Hades? Sufficiently amusing, I should hope?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Out of the infinitely spanning possibilities before us, Son of Hades, I have arbitrarily selected only three again from which to let you choose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Fates have much in store for you, O Son of Hades. Perhaps, however, we can tamper with their weavings here to some extent.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let us conspire to expand and frustrate your lord father's sense of both what is and is not possible within his Underworld.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Infinite possibilities can be tedious to choose from, so, let me provide you with a significantly smaller set with which you may yet change the Fates' designs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Through the expanse of time, I often wondered, is it necessary to be fair? The immortals are my offspring; surely I should treat them equally. And yet I find that there is little sport in doing so.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Among infinite possibilities, consider only these.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Choose carefully, in general, and now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We are the sum of all decisions that we make, and that are made for us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This space grows far more interesting when you occupy a small amount of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How you evaluate decisions is of limitless interest to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The burden of the passing time shall force a choice from you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is there not pleasure in determining an outcome, Son of Hades?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My mark be with you, Son of Hades. You need merely choose its shape.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Though the waters of the Styx may wash away my mark, I can restore it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The rhythm of your visits here over the course of time is pleasant, Son of Hades.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are already back, and you are always welcome, Son of Hades.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please visit me as frequently as you would like or dare.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I find myself anticipating your arrivals, Son of Hades.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I require no exchange of words with you. Merely a choice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Once more you have returned to my domain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a proposition, Son of Hades.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I bid you welcome here within my space.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How fares the solitary Son of Hades?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What shall we do for one another, Son of Hades?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are within my presence, Son of Hades.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What brings you here to me this time around?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your such visits are agreeable with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How may the force of Chaos alter you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have arrived before me once again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see that you are here, and so am I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You stand before me, Son of Hades.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How shall we alter the intentions of the Fates?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How might I mend the fabric of existence for you, Son of Hades?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There need not be a reason for your visit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How may I shape reality for you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are always welcome here within this space.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What occupies your mind at this occasion?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Among infinite outcomes, I propose these three.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Choose how to circumvent the Fates' design.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am amused to see you once again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have descended to my space once more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your presence is appreciated, Son of Hades, but please leave us here, for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forgive us, Son of Hades, as we are amid exchanging memories.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Son of Hades, I am pleased the goddess Nyx returned to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forgive me, Son of Hades, but I must continue this discussion with the goddess Nyx.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I had not seen the goddess Nyx in quite some time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am quite unaccustomed to having all this company of late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My daughter was just in the midst of telling me the latest occurrences about your House.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you are able to observe, the goddess Nyx and I are in the midst of conversation now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps you did not think that I would seek you out among the boatman Charon's trifles, which precisely is the reason I have done it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The boatman Charon understands my whims, and his loyalty is purchased easily by one for whom base wealth is meaningless, so, I am here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Master Chaos? Everyone makes offerings to my relatives upon Olympus. I wish to make an offering to you. Thank you for... everything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How droll of you to make attempts to tempt me with material things. Here, then, please in turn allow me this attempt at reciprocity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is for you, Master Chaos. Everyone beneath the heavens and earth enjoys this stuff.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You honor me in making such an offering, though please; it is not necessary to endear yourself using material means, for it is the thought alone which counts.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Master Chaos, forebear of the gods, it is an honor to have met you. Please, accept this gift.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Seldom do mortals or immortals think of making offerings to me. As I do not expect such token gestures, I am very much amused, and I accept.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Master Chaos, I pledge never to forget you or your good graces. May your wisdom and your whim forever guide me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is this an offering of fealty or friendship, Son of Hades? I do not wish to know from you the answer, so that I might dwell on it and all the possibilities.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm ever-grateful that my journeys through the Underworld mean that we can get to know each other, Master Chaos.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your repeated generosity with me is starting to become a bit predictable, and yet... somehow, I nonetheless appreciate it, still. How very odd.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Master Chaos, it's little wonder all existence sprang from you, because I see the noble qualities in so many I've met embodied in you. Please, accept this gift.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If it is unclear yet, Son of Hades, I shall not be giving more to you in exchange for your repeated offerings. You give them to me knowing it shall serve no purpose and achieve no end. I know that there are some among both mortals and your kind for whom this is quite unacceptable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is the greatest delicacy of Olympus, Master Chaos. It's for you. I think normally it would be difficult for the Olympians to get it to you here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You make an even greater offering to me, knowing it shall produce no material result. You are aware that I am not persuadable? Yours is a squandering of resources and time. Although, of course, we do have each of these in great supply. Now then, respond.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I just think the act of giving isn't quite the same as an exchange. I know I won't be getting any sort of other talisman or something in return. But, through these offerings, I can express my thanks. That's worth it by itself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I see. So then, the action is akin to theft. For you are getting something in return that I did not intend to give. I still have much to learn from my creations, Son of Hades. So let us say that we have made an even trade. My learning for your worth.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you'll forgive me, Master Chaos, this Ambrosia is intended to be given to those whom I care about, and I can think of few recipients I'd like to have it more. Please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall accept this, as a final offering, O Son of Hades. For I have given it additional consideration, and decided that my previous analysis of your intentions was too narrow, too inaccurate. And, I regret comparing what you have been doing to an act of theft. Respond?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't even mention it, please, Master Chaos. All of this is new for me, as well. I try never to overanalyze... my father does enough of that for all of us. I just know, when I encounter the primordial creator, I am going to give thanks. For everything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I see. Then, your response is quite acceptable. And, since the act of giving is not an exchange, let us say that you already had my gratitude.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This was one of the potential outcomes of my gift.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All of this was in accordance with the Fates' design; or perhaps not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I expected you would perish soon; but I knew not exactly how.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your demises are unfortunate and yet a source of some amusement.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be careful with me, Son of Hades.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time to mix up my style.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's just the edge I need.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's see what I can do with this sword.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time to tune up this sword.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now to fix up this spear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This spear's due for a little maintenance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Should get this bow back into tiptop shape.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This bow could use a little fine tuning.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Should put some extra punch into this shield.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This shield's about to get a whole lot stronger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: New styles for the Twin Fists.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time to fix up these Fists.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Some modifications to the rail are in order.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's see how we can modify the rail.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Daedalus, wherever you may be right now, thank you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Need all the firepower I can get.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A blade fit for a god.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They'll fear me with this spear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: These Fists are hungry to fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your foes shall have to watch their backs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, I heard you, boy!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That looks like a Daedalus Hammer!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Looks like I'm due for an upgrade.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You hung the painting where I asked?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Suggest you hurry in there, lad...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...the problem that I have with that wretched shade is his attitude.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I don't know which of them is worse, I swear to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...He truly is an idiot, I'll give you that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That takes care of that, I guess. See you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stupid boy. I told you nobody gets out of here, whether alive or dead. Though, how was your wanton ransacking of my domain?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Greetings, Father. My ransacking was a delight, thank you for asking. So, I'll just be on my way, again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be on your way, indeed. What do I care? You shall never reach the surface. Go, see for yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it, now? I've a mountain of infernal parchmentwork.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Out of my sight, now, go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To what do I owe the pleasure, boy? For I'm unaccustomed to being approached by you here in my House.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you know. Just thought I'd check in, see what you were up to. Parchmentwork going all right, I'm sure?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh yes, the parchmentwork is going splendidly. Would you care for some? There is no shortage of it, you see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father, what happened to the lounge? The only place for anyone to have a little fun around here, and you seal it shut.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I had little choice about that, boy. You see, after you fled the first time, Cerberus, why he was very much upset. Utterly tore the place to shreds. It's now under repair. All thanks to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're really blaming me for not minding the dog while I was out, and while you all were here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I lay the blame entirely upon you, yes. Who else? It's fortunate that Cerberus has calmed himself since then! Come to his senses, I should say. May you yet come to yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who's that sniveling shade to your immediate left, there, Father? Already found someone new to do the busywork. And here I thought I was utterly indispensable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That shade, boy, is my newly designated contractor; one whose responsibility is to work on this House. Though, who shall pay for everything my subjects here demand, I do not know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're trying to guilt me into funding the exorbitant furnishings you desire.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps once we are finished with repairs for all the carnage you have sown throughout my realm, then we might finally have time for all the needed renovations that have piled up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have been keeping our contractor rather busy, I must say. Commissioning these frivolous projects around the House with the wealth you wrest from my domain. What are you hoping to achieve?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you know, just giving back to the community. Figure if I'm to keep getting dragged back here it might as well be somewhat livable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Livable! When last I checked, making the Underworld livable was not among our top priorities. Just remember, in your brazenness, whose House this is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have been keeping our contractor rather busy, I must say. Commissioning these frivolous projects around the House with the wealth you wrest from my domain. What are you hoping to achieve?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you know, just giving back to the community. Figure if I'm to keep getting dragged back here it might as well be somewhat livable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's quite a lot of renovating to be done, isn't there, Father. Your House Contractor there has shown a wide variety of pending jobs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've ordered Nyx to supervise that list. Entirely her problem, boy. And likely yours. How does it feel, knowing that your rampages create the need for so much maintenance?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Feels pretty good, now that you mention it. Keeps everybody occupied, no?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, Father! I must say ransacking your domain beats having to toil endlessly in the administrative chamber. Far less painful, really.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah! Is that your way of asking me for your old job back, boy? You were a scourge upon every administrative duty to which you were assigned.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, please, Father, give me back my old, wretched job, won't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Privileges are earned not begged for, boy. Unless you plan to reimburse this House for all the income that we lost because of you, then you shall not so much as set foot in the administrative chamber, again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How much is the reimbursement fee, anyway?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whichever exorbitant amount the House Contractor has on record, now leave me be!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So help me, boy, I cannot fathom why you would have bought back the authority to enter the administrative chamber once again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I knew you thought I'd never do it under any circumstances, Father. That seemed reason enough. Though, fear not, I've no plans to reapply for a position there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That does alleviate a deeply rooted fear of mine, in fact. The scene you caused in your brief time there yet remains a widely talked-about event among the shades who toil for me still.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Always wanted to ask you something, Father. Whose skull is that there on your shoulder? If it's not too personal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did not chronicle all Typhon's wretched offspring, boy. No one did. Some of them sit upon our shoulders now, lest we forget that things could easily have turned out rather differently, and much, much worse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So these are just the remains of the spawn of the most hideous monstrosity of all time, which you and your brothers slew, got it. I guess putting the dead in their place is all part of the job. I can hardly imagine what it was like before you and the Olympians took charge.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be certain that you take appropriate precautions with the Sigil of the Dead that you now bear. Should some misfortune come to it through negligence, it cannot be replaced.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't imagine what I'd do without your blessing, Father! But, thank you again. I don't often inherit Fate-appointed honors, and will take good care of it. Though... what if the Olympians catch on? Wouldn't do for everybody knowing that you're aiding me even a little, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Correct. It would not do, at all. Fortunately, the power of the Unseen can remain well-hidden as it pleases. What is it your instructor always says?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Those Chthonic Companion things you have from Nyx, or whoever they ended up with... I know they have been benefiting you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, well... I'm to attempt to escape this place by any means necessary, right? I figure if I can call on Olympus for aid, maybe some of my friends can help me in a pinch, as well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not what I mean. Some of your friends have been reluctant to engage against me during our scuffles on the surface. Know that I have authorized them to proceed, if necessary.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, really? You're saying it's OK for your own loyal subjects to side against you up there? You won't take it out on them?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I consider it an expansion of their responsibilities. Now, go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: See to it. And... well done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So tell me, Father. Just how much did it hurt your soul knowing my face is up there on the Featured Houseservant Board, for all in the lounge to see?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Has it occurred to you that I, alone, have final say about whose countenance is shown up there? Although, others who shall not be named did put in a good word for you, repeatedly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Blood and darkness... all my life I thought that board was a joke. But seeing my face up there... it felt good. Thanks, Father. Maybe it won't be the last time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indulge me for a moment, boy. Why bother to construct a sundial, there? Knowing full well it was my wish to have one installed. To demonstrate your awe-inspiring authority? Or to deny me the small pleasure of doing it myself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe a little of each? Or maybe you ought not second-guess my every motive and decision, constantly, searching for some sinister agenda that has yet to cross my mind?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pah! I would have chosen an entirely different marble texture for it, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, it's no trouble at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Guess what, Father? The lounge is all tidied up. Your House Contractor there is quite efficient once you muster up the necessary funds. You should try it sometime!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you expecting words of thanks because you paid the contractor to fix a bit of devastation that you caused? I fear it shall take rather more than that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if I replaced every furnishing in this blasted place, would you treat me any better then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose, boy, that there's only one way to find out. Though I suggest you save yourself the trouble.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see you've decided to come home. Changed your mind yet, or looking for more pain and suffering?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: More pain and suffering, for sure. After all, you taught me to appreciate the finer things.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You keep telling yourself that, boy. But, mark you my words, sooner or later, this life that you have chosen for yourself shall teach you I was right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well that was quick. What news, boy, ready to give up, or no?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'd like that, wouldn't you? Lucky I've got other family who believe in me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be careful whom you give your trust. My brothers frolic on Olympus while we work. While I work! You're just like them. No wonder they like you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In that case, I'll spare you the details.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fine. Your failure is quite easily imagined. How often it recurs! Almost as though my realm is built to keep you here. You, and every single soul that's ever lived. But, by all means, continue struggling.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's all right, Father. I'm not feeling very hungry at the moment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I've asked repeatedly for the construction of a sundial, but every time, they tell me no, can you believe it? Your impertinence with me inspires all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's all right, Father. I'm not feeling very hungry at the moment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I've asked repeatedly for the construction of a sundial, but every time, they tell me no, can you believe it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Blood and darkness, but this place is falling apart... nobody works an honest day down here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father, everybody's dead. Give them a break.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What would you even know of honest work? At least the wretched dead yet honor me as Lord. I cannot say the same for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you yet satisfied your foolish urges? Perhaps a lashing from the Furies' whips would set you straight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I had it out with them already, thanks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Such nonsense. First you defy me openly, and now you lie. On my next meeting with the Furies, we'll have a word about all this, you rest assured.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, I can scarce believe my eyes, is that you, boy?! Cerberus, look who it is, he's back!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cerberus looks mournfully toward the Prince.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No need to drag the dog into this, Father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Anything you say to me, you say in front of Cerberus! You might even learn a thing or two from him of listening, and of obedience!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's back already, Cerberus! Just as I indicated.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry he disturbed your rest again, Cerberus, you've done a good job. The realm is well defended still, to the high standard that you set.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What did I tell you, boy? Ever wasteful of your time, and mine. How fares my Underworld, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know how you can stand it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, at least some things are running smoothly still. Next you go to die again, do give the tortured souls out there my warm regards.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, for shame, boy. I thought perhaps you'd finally made it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really...? I mean, oh, wait, you're not serious. That famous sense of humor shining through.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I jest, of course, you'll never make it out; as I keep telling you to no avail. But you've gone farther than expected. So, who knows....
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going to find Mother. No matter how long it takes me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For the last time, you're not to speak about that woman in my House. You want to know of her so much, you go find her, indeed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know that Nyx has been abetting you. You wish to take advantage of her pity? I care not. Her powers have their limits, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How can you... Nyx is the Night Itself, and can do as she pleases, isn't that correct, Father? You think I asked she get involved in all this business?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You, boy, have already dragged this entire household, not to mention my fool relatives, into this mess, which you've created. Which you dare call business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, tell me something, Father, if you please. Since we're more candid lately in regard to matters of my birthright here, and all... did you and Mother... how to put this? Any brothers or sisters I should know about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought I told you never to invoke her here! Be thankful that you have no blasted kin. You've such weak blood, and such a temperament... why, then, would you think I'd risk another, such as you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure, that's fair enough, it's just not all such things occur as planned, as I am told. From tales of your brothers and so forth.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, blast my brothers, and blast you, as well! All those who know me know I have no heir. You could not rise to the occasion if you tried! And, there is no one else. You've only me. And I have only you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Contractor, mind locating the Court Musician's Sentence when you get the chance?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You call my chambers a mess, look at your desk, Father! Whatever happened to your court musician, huh, where's his sentencing parchmentwork? Stuck in Tartarus, all because he stopped singing for you on command?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My desk is far more organized than you, boy! And if you're so concerned about our court musician, why don't you commute his sentence, yourself? Seeing as I haven't gotten around to it yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure, happy to oblige. I'll just ask the House Contractor since you're too busy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your methods didn't seem to do the trick.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand you have attempted to persuade our court musician to resume his craft. That is among the relatively useful tasks to which you have applied yourself of late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't be completely sure but, what you said just now I think contained some of the component pieces of a compliment?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm certain that your boasts and twists of words shall soon inspire him to greater acts of compositional superiority, one of these days or nights.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I had a feeling that our court musician would eventually come back to his senses and his talents, boy. Here, yet again, my intuitions were correct. Though, you appear a bit perturbed. Don't like the song? It's about you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It says I'm really the bastard son of Zeus, but also indelibly connected to the god of wine, and how your parents tore me to pieces, giving rise to mortals, but that I'm always going to be stuck here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You fill Orpheus' mind with nonsense, he produces nonsense. Nonsense I presume shall spread from this place far and wide, so everyone might know that I have nothing to do with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not worried. Orpheus plays for a very small audience.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father, I met an oak nymph called Eurydice. You know her name, I think. Is it really true what happened between her and Orpheus? They say you almost let her out, so why not me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pah! Orpheus is a talented musician, and a fool. I knew he would never get his beloved wife out of here. There's no escape for her, or anyone, including you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you tricked him. Or maybe offered him a deal in bad faith. No matter. What's it going to take to waive the separation order between them?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's non-negotiable, boy. Waiving a separation order! That's a veritable fortune in dues alone. Off the table. Now, go mind your own affairs, and leave the waiving and the ordering to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who knows, they might surprise you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father, have you ever considered that Orpheus might be much better as a court musician if you permitted him to see his muse again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have considered many possibilities, boy. And I trust Orpheus considered many possibilities before he signed away his rights to see his so-called muse when once he invaded my realm!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you're forcing him to stay here for eternity just because he signed a contract with you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Contracts with me are binding! Until such time as they dig themselves out of the archives and tear themselves up! And I don't see that happening anytime soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father, let's say, hypothetically, that I could pay the dues to waive the separation order between Orpheus and Eurydice. Would you honor the new terms, or spitefully cheat me out of a fair deal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I honor the terms of my commitments, boy. The rules we put in place are all that keep this Underworld in any semblance of a shape! But, what you ask is utterly absurd. The costs of processing a separation order are well beyond your means.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You voided the contract with our court musician. Used your own authority against me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what if I did? Just gives him a bit of break from time to time. He's still your court musician, isn't he?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He is. And he knows better than to undermine me, I think. Out with you, then! I'll deal with your insubordination some other time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You voided the contract with our court musician. Used your own authority against me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what if I did? Just gives him a bit of break from time to time. He's still your court musician, isn't he?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He is. And he knows better than to undermine me, I think. Though, I suppose the Queen would take your side that he has paid his dues in full, by now...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father, let me ask you something work-related, here. I know the shade called Sisyphus once wronged both you and Thanatos, and has since paid a heavy price. But don't the Fury Sisters now have better things to do than torture him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You come to me to question how I allocate my resources? Preposterous. I care nothing for that wretched shade. That he is tortured for eternity is but a technicality resulting from his arrogance. The terms of his incarceration are long lost!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So then if I could somehow find those terms, then theoretically, I could grant him a pardon...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you could somehow do your job, and enact miracles, then yes! You could do anything, then, I suppose. Including waste your time on those of his undeserving ilk.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You altered one of my own pacts, without so much as seeking my consent... undoing terms that were agreed upon. Do you intend to undermine everything in this House, boy? Or only me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Only you, Father. Good thing I've inherited some of your Fate-given authority, being your son and all. Otherwise some of your most loyal subjects would be bound by exploitive terms for eternity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Terms that they chose, themselves! Terms to the benefit of this House. What if Achilles were to leave his post for the green pastures of Elysium, what then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You could find a replacement? But it's a pointless question anyway, because he's here! He isn't leaving. He might even do better at his job, now that he has increased ability to step away from it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A naive hope, at best. The more you step away from your responsibilities, the less you shall want anything to do with them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Megaera tells me that you surpassed her while out there. How utterly embarrassing for her, to say the least.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose you're going to punish her in some cruel fashion, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I've already seen to that, of course. You think she volunteered to deal with you? Nobody did. That's how ignoble a task it is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me something, boy, did you enjoy the searing heat of Asphodel? You must have thought that you'd be more resilient to it.
label: CHARACTER
