dialogue: I'm open to a change of climate. Even if it gets a bit uncomfortable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know nothing of discomfort, yet. Making it out of Tartarus is nothing in comparison to what lies ahead for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand that you created quite a stir within Elysium. An all-out brawl within eternal paradise!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You call that paradise? It's just a bunch of shades bored out of their former skulls, itching for a chance to feel alive again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What would you know of it! The greatest mortals have their every need fulfilled within that place. I dread to hear what they shall say of all of this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: See you up at the Temple then, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me something, boy, because my own set of ideas on the subject is beginning to run dry: What, exactly, is it going to take for you to understand that you're not leaving here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps you ought to have me bound next to Prometheus, and have the dreaded Eagle peck my liver for eternity?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You would have me resort to such barbarity? Blast you, boy. Punishment is not the path to rehabilitation; it is for its own sake. I'd have expected all your trips through Tartarus to have taught you as much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm truly sorry that he's troubled you again, Cerberus. I know how much you value resting here, and yet, I have no better means to bar the entry to our realm than you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought you'd figured out by now that guilting me into abandoning my quest won't work. You're the one who should feel guilty, forcing Cerberus to block my path.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What would you know of it? Cerberus cannot be forced to do anything. He simply understands he has responsibilities.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, verify something for me, here, boy. According to the latest reports... you attempted unsuccessfully to shoplift from Charon, himself? And were consequently slain? Utterly ignoble end, even for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, I was borrowing, OK? Not shoplifting. Why didn't anybody ever tell me Charon was such a monster? I thought the boating mercantile thing made for a peaceful life.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You incur the wrath of ancient chthonic gods, and then are surprised to be destroyed by them? Have you learned nothing, after all this time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How are you finding my old trusty spear, then, hm? Or perhaps you have a preference for my brothers' and my sisters' former arms. Kept under lock and key, and yet, they're now in your possession, it would seem.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The weapons in the courtyard. Of course you know about them, by now. I stole them. Why not just take them from me? I'd be stuck.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The thought has long since crossed my mind. However, I'm not fool enough to tamper with those cursed things. They go where they please. They cannot be contained. Like you. Now, why don't you go entertain each other more?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Didn't think things could get any more awkward with her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Megaera and her sisters ganged up on me that time. I didn't think anyone could talk her into working with Alecto and Tisiphone again. Or even be in the same chamber.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can be quite persuasive under certain circumstances, boy. Though my advice to you, not that you'll take it, is not to discuss the matter openly. Megaera is a professional; but she has made her feelings on the matter clear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is woefully infrequent that I've cause for this, but I do have to thank you, boy. You've culled the Satyrs and the vermin bringing ruin to our Temple, there! Blasted creatures multiply at an alarming rate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They're not doing your bidding, yet they're every bit as bothersome as all your wretched servants I've met. I'm surprised you aren't getting along.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They are a plague upon this realm, although we have them well contained, for now. And once they are rightly dead, they tend to swear to me their fealty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father, you always said the Olympians wanted nothing to do with our kind. But doesn't Charon work directly with Hermes? Maybe it's you who wants nothing to do with them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I want nothing to do with them, correct. My hasty nephew assists Charon out of necessity, alone. Not even Thanatos is able to keep up with the rate at which mortals expire and must then cross our borders.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Want me to pitch in? Just give me your blessing and I'll head straight for the surface.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahaha, no. I think not, boy. You are born of this realm. The surface is a wind-swept waste. You don't know how good you have it here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, Father. I'm not afraid of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She is gone, boy. She is gone. You are never going to locate her. I thought you would have come to that conclusion for yourself, by now. But apparently it must be said.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean Mother. How would you even know? You said reaching the surface was impossible as well, and I'm in striking distance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is my final warning to you, boy... to cease this mindless quest. Or else, the consequences shall be worse than what you have experienced thus far.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whatever you did to my blasted seat is of no consequence to me. From my vantage-point, I can't even see it! A foolish prank and waste of valuable resources, nothing more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's more for everybody else than you, Father. Think of it as a tribute to Cerberus! Besides, you really should think about changing up the look of this place from time to time. Keep things fresh!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The limitless work keeps things fresh enough as it is. Though if making aimless changes in this House is how you choose to spend your limitless time, I'll have no part of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father, of all the skeletons and such in your direct employ... you wouldn't happen to have any here around the House, would you? Out in my courtyard, for example?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Skeletons! I'm sure they'll welcome you when next you visit Asphodel. You may not realize it, boy, but we have a certain standard of decency we uphold around here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's certainly a way of looking at it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ever think of giving Thanatos a break, Father? He seems to have more than his fair share of work of late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Blame the blasted mortals for perishing so easily, or blame Lord Ares, prior to accusing me. With their surface wars, not only do they kill each other readily, but also often subsequently perish from the consequences of it all!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What wars, what's going on up there? Why don't the other Olympians do something?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pah! How should I know? The mortals are equipped to settle their petty differences by any number of means. We have to make room for them all sooner or later, regardless.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, you had a run-in with the Minotaur out in Elysium, did you? Perhaps the only soul within this realm more bull-headed than you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How long have you been waiting to use that line, Father? Wouldn't put it past you to have sent the Bull of Minos to Elysium entirely so we could have this conversation now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You give me too much credit, boy. The Minotaur resides where he resides because of an entirely different arrangement.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's working for you, isn't he? You think he can stop me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Most in Elysium jump at the opportunity to do my bidding. Not that you know what that is like. Now go, see how you fare against the bull.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They should have asked the expert I suppose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How goes your heated rivalry against the greatest king of Athens lately, boy? Your battles with him and the Minotaur must be the talk of the Underworld of late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Admit it, Father. Theseus was the only hero you were able to recruit to stand against me. All the while he gets to boast about being the champion. What, was Heracles too busy for the task?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Speak not to me of Heracles. You know these heroes by their deeds, not by their character. Heracles is fortunate he's in my brother's favor. Else he would be in Tartarus where he belongs. The mortal concept of what constitutes a hero is absurd.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know what you did. Stay out of Nyx's affairs next time, boy. She is needed here! Not wallowing in the primordial dark.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're just angry because some of us still want to have anything to do with their parents.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Parents, pah! You know nothing of what parents are capable of. Conspire all you like against my wishes, I care not. Get out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you were able to dispatch my Hydra, boy. Right down to the last hateful head. It's an accomplishment I felt was certainly beyond your talent set. Though, here you are again, nevertheless.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You cheated me. There wasn't anywhere that I could go! I could have gone much farther. All the way to Mother!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You shall do no such thing. Besides, if you were any help to me, you'd know vast portions of my realm are presently still under renovation. You won't be getting farther than you have.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can wait. You can't just keep this place on lockdown for eternity. The mortals up there wouldn't stand for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They have no patience, yes. The same as you. Then wait, with all the rest of them. It matters not to me. For I have other work to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now you begone from here, get yourself killed some more for all I care.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, boy. Word has reached me that you were able to dethrone the Champion of Elysium as well as his bull-headed companion. Tell me, how did you accomplish such a thing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: First, you tell me when I can get out of there. The path guarded by Theseus was sealed! Is there even a surface? Is the outside world all a lie?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, now you are asking the big questions! Comforting to see such growth of character. Well if there is an outside world, you shall not be seeing it for quite some time. You know why, don't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ongoing Underworld renovations. Now go and let King Theseus drive that sharp spear of his into yourself some more, until such time. The mortals soon shall force me to reopen, and then what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now you begone from here, get yourself killed some more for all I care.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are late, boy! Have you any idea what time it is?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Wait, what? I just vanquished you in single combat, and that's all you have to say to me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vanquished me? Hah, hahaha, nonsense. Don't you think I would recall such an event?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can't be serious. You're going to pretend as though it never happened?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everything is as it always was. And so shall it be, until the Fates determine otherwise. Or until our ongoing Underworld renovations are finally complete. Whichever comes first.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you're really not going to answer my question about Mother from the other time, until the Underworld renovations are complete?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know not what you're going on about, there, boy. Although, my focus is entirely upon our renovations, yes. Perhaps someday or night when this place is in proper working order, I shall have more time for your insipid questions.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know where we can continue this discussion, then...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are late, boy! Have you any idea what time it is?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Wait, what? I vanquished you in single combat and finally found Mother, and that's all you have to say to me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah, haha! Nonsense. Don't you think I would recall such an event?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can't be serious. You're going to pretend as though it never happened? She wants answers, same as I do. She demands you let me pass! Let me go to her again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Silence! This discussion is over. I hardly think this is the time or place to indulge your overwrought imagination.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No! I'll hear no demands from you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I told you, boy. I told you! There's no escape from here. Learned that the hard way, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You could have told me more important things. Mother left because she never even knew I was alive. Thanks to you! She's got a lot of questions, herself, as you can probably imagine. I'm headed back to her. You going to cooperate?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahaha, nonsense! Listen to me: If you have any sense remaining in that head of yours, I caution you not to discuss this here and now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me go. Let me find her. She demands it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Quite a mess you've created, I must say, Father... after being of no help whatsoever when it comes to disentangling it all. Though, this isn't the place to talk, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No! It most certainly is not. Though, I take it it shall not be long before another of our private meetings, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Until such place and time, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Something the matter, there, Father? You seem a little quieter than usual. Dare I say even a little somber and remorseful, for some reason?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Silence, boy! And better yet, why don't you get out of my sight? I've more important things to do now than indulge your boastfulness. We'll have to catch up at some other place and time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I'm certain I shall figure something out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, Father, while I'm sure you don't appreciate all the distractions as of late, your ceaseless toil has had some noticeable effect. Is it my imagination, or are the ongoing Underworld renovations almost complete?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There you go, getting ahead of yourself, again. The final stages of renovation are some of the most vital! Second only to the initial planning. There's a great deal of important work ahead!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wasn't saying it wasn't important, I was just saying maybe there's finally an end to it in sight. What are you going to do with all your spare time, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the giant pact posted out in the courtyard, Father? You offering me a job?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perish the thought. It's so that all your toiling can be more painful, nothing more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why would I want my toiling to be more painful than it already is?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who knows, boy, or better yet, who cares? To make the mortals up there worship you for all your labors? Go on, then, go get yourself dispatched some more, so I can make well certain that my realm can properly contain you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My records indicate that you've collected earnings based on some of your accomplishments, there, boy. I suppose you need an income of your own, having decided to cut ties and all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, you mean the bounties that you've offered up to anybody capable of beating Meg and all your other guardians out there? Don't you think that puts a lot of undue pressure on them, knowing that you've turned them into targets?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They must do better than they have, else they shall be replaced. If they're to grow in their respective roles, they have to know their weaknesses. And so do I. That you collect the bounties for it matters not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What about the bounties for vanquishing you? Who's your replacement going to be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My records indicate that you've collected earnings based on some of your accomplishments, there, boy. I suppose you need an income of your own, having decided to cut ties and all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, you mean the bounties that you've offered up to anybody capable of beating Meg and all your other guardians out there? Don't you think that puts a lot of undue pressure on them, knowing that you've turned them into targets?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They must do better than they have, else they shall be replaced. If they're to grow in their respective roles, they have to know their weaknesses. And so do I. That you collect the bounties for it matters not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be sure to add those to the list of words you'll eat someday.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Saw your new Pact of Punishment out in the courtyard, Father. Impressed that you could find a parchment large enough to fit all the unpleasant stipulations. So you're taking even harsher measures to contain me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whether you consent to the terms of the Pact is entirely up to you, boy. But, in all your comings and goings, it is important that we have full knowledge of which property is being carried from the premises.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've taken more advantage of the Pact of Punishment than I would have expected, boy. I almost wish to commend you for doing such a thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Almost? I've been rampaging through the worst your realm has to offer. Causing you untold inconvenience and likely a fortune in repair costs. I thought you'd be upset.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Upset? Heavens, no. Through your repeated bumbling, you have revealed a number of shortcomings in our operations, which my underlings are busy working to address.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know you sound especially despicable when you say underlings, don't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't let me keep you any longer, boy, go forth! Try to escape again. You're helping make the Underworld a better place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Explain to me something: How did you do it? I mean the Pact. For all of the conditions it imposed... you still surpassed me. How?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Plenty of practice, regular exercise, a positive attitude, the blessings of assorted family members you don't like, and your discarded Titan-slaying weapons I suppose. Nothing special. Why do you ask?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To think that you would squander such a talent on frivolous pursuit. You do not even realize what you have achieved, do you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, wait wait wait wait, care to repeat that first part that you said back there? The talent part?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would that you had a talent for listening. Begone for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Back to your senses, then, boy? The Pact of Punishment is not something one ought to trifle with unknowingly, in case you've yet to notice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father... the Pact... you were so blasted strong. I had no idea! All those other times we fought... I can't believe that you were holding back. You were desperate to stop me, you could have!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We are bound by the Fates to this realm. It is ours, and we belong to it, in turn. And... I did not hold back against you. Rather... I had forgotten my old strength. Some of it since returned to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Must have been all our vicious battles to the death? Or maybe it's from Mother being back in your life?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pointless to even ask. What motivates us is a complicated thing. But if you long to face me with the power I once held during my own youth... you have available to you the means.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Urgh... come, get your gloating well out of the way, so I can get back to this parchmentwork. It piled up, in my prolonged absence!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not here to gloat, Father. Well fought back there. I can't believe I got you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Nor I. Next time, the Fates may not decide to favor you like that. If there shall be a next time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father... look, Lord Uncle Zeus, I've been in contact with him, and he wishes to make peace. He asked for me to tell you. To tell you he forgives you for... whatever happened.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My brother Zeus... forgives me? Zeus forgives me?! How dare that blasted little brat! His beard may be luxurious but he's as much a child as are you. Forgives me, bah!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What did you do...? What happened between you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: None of your business! Go on now and frolic with that Lord Uncle of yours, the both of them! And don't you ever speak of him to me again, you hear me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Question for you, Father. The name Kore happen to mean anything to you, by any chance?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, where did you...?! Ahh, the cold witch brought it up, did she? Never repeat that name again, not here, nor anywhere, you hear me, boy? Know only this: The one called by that name despised it even more than I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So let's see. Demeter's daughter went missing. She wound up down here. I... happened. Mother left. Demeter, and everyone else on Olympus apparently, has no idea. That about right? Tell me what happened.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll tell you nothing! Keep meddling in matters that you cannot understand, and you'll incur the wrath of Olympus on all that you hold dear. And, know that it is not for my sake that I'm warning you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it now? I see that sneering look upon your countenance, which must mean you have yet another one of your insipid questions, haven't you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, this one's not insipid in the slightest. Let me get this straight. My mother's Persephone. Her mother's Demeter, but her father... evidently was some farm-boy? My red blood comes from him? And my propensity to die I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You blame your ancestors for your own weakness? You should be thankful you were born with immortality! Though, your meddlesome curiosity and constant need for affirmation must certainly be from your mortal side.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then, Mother, did... she grow older with age? Is she just going to expire as the mortals do? With demigods I hear it can go either way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I said never to speak of her, blast you! You said, yourself, she is the daughter of the goddess of seasons! Use your fool head, for once.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Greetings, Father. Ran into Lady Demeter out there, on my last outing. Or should I say, my grandmother? What's she to you, then, ex-mother-in-law? Source of abject terror? Hard keeping track. Our family's rather complicated.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do not invoke her name inside my House, you hear me, boy? You do not know at all what she is like. Though I can see why you two hit it off. She hated her father. Though understandably, as he was worse even than mine. Even than yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do. Your mother the Queen is working on that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Greetings, Father. So! I can just... head on out there again whenever I want? Don't need to stick to any rigid schedule?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your unpredictability is one of your assets. Our defenses must always be on guard. So, yes: Go about your business as you best see fit!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And the Olympians are going to keep helping me, thinking I'm trying to get away from you, to them. We can't keep this up with them forever, you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me something, boy... Zagreus... why did you do all this? Return the Queen. Go to such lengths. At a certain point... you must have learned the way I felt about her. Yet still you persisted. If I were you... I'd not have done me any favors.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I didn't often stop to give it much thought. I just knew I needed to find her... and then as soon as I did, I knew I needed her in my life. In other words, doing you any favors was never a priority, Father. Just ended up that way, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I see. I appreciate your candor. Nevertheless... I thank you. I do not know how you accomplished what you did, but know that I am grateful for the outcome. Even if I fail to act like it, much of the time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, Father... back when you drew lots with your brothers, and wound up with the Underworld, rather than the heavens or the seas... which would you have claimed, if the choice was yours?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do not deal in hypotheticals, boy. Each realm has its host of unenviable problems. You have never experienced the cold and sopping sea, or the blinding heights of Olympus. I have. And I assure you, you're not missing much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Didn't you try to leave the Underworld, yourself, at some point? You once gave me that impression. I always thought it was because you hated it here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hate not having any choice. Enjoy the freedoms that you have. As you grow long in years, you gain more burdens and responsibilities, until they bind you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds like you've got it all under control.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father, all these shades... aren't they going to let on that Mother's back? What if word spreads... and the Olympians find out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are so well-accustomed to defying me that you forget there are no others, either living or dead, who would so dare. None in this House shall speak of this until we are prepared to make any announcements, on our own terms.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Regarding your responsibilities: Our Resources Director is available to you. In my private quarters. Normally, it would be I, alone, transferring excess resources back into our realm.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The fabled Resources Director! So, now I get to give away the hard-earned resources I've painstakingly gathered over time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You get to do precisely that. It is not necessary that you do. But if you wish to rise above your current station, you shall do it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the point in rising above my current station? I thought our work was to be done in secrecy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is. There is no point but pride. And pride is dangerous. Do what you will. I care not, as long as everything gets adequately done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Regarding your responsibilities: Our Resources Director is available to you. In the administrative chamber. Normally, it would be I, alone, transferring excess resources back into our realm.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The fabled Resources Director! So, now I get to give away the hard-earned resources I've painstakingly gathered over time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You get to do precisely that. It is not necessary that you do. But if you wish to rise above your current station, you shall do it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the point in rising above my current station? I thought our work was to be done in secrecy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is. There is no point but pride. And pride is dangerous. Do what you will. I care not, as long as everything gets adequately done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Briefly, now, boy: Our Resources Director informs me you've advanced in rank. Commendable. That's all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are advancing through the ranks of your position, and returning to our realm the vast resources you have claimed. As well you ought. Carry on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We cannot speak of this, except... Unseen One... the highest ranking that we can bestow. I never once imagined that you could achieve that rank, yourself. Or any rank of note.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You always thought too little of me, Father. Though, thank you for taking note of that. I figured I ought to give back to the realm that made me what I am.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. For this is the only world we know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father... all this stuff with the Olympians... will you just tell me what's going on, for once? How did Mother come to join you here? What's your problem with Uncle Zeus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought she already told you...! Urgh. Come with me. Now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Swear to me that you shall never repeat what you are about to hear. Swear it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, all right, I swear. I swear, in your own name, I'll keep what you're about to say between us.... So?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So... you had it mostly right, before. After I inherited the Underworld... your Uncle Zeus felt sympathy for me, he says. Your mother, he knew she was unhappy on Olympus. And... he knew I was drawn to her. So what did he do? He brought her here. Gave her to me as a gift!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You weren't expecting a gift like that. But she didn't want to return to Olympus, and you liked her, so you didn't send her away. And you're angry with Zeus for putting you in that position? Cut ties with him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes!! The blasted fool, with all his flights of fancy! He does whatever he wants! He could have achieved a similar outcome in a limitless number of reasonable ways... rather than resort to what was tantamount to kidnapping! Even if she wanted to leave!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And now if Demeter and the others found all this out, you and Mother... even Zeus would be in a bad spot, wouldn't he? He must have a temper on him to match yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know nothing of tempers if mine is your frame of reference, Zagreus. Now, enough of this! You know the rest. Remember your oath.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One thing, before you depart again, boy. Until the Queen's intentions with Olympus come to pass... not a word to anyone about her presence, here. Do you understand?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do. But she won't have to hide forever.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The work nevertheless has to be done!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, now that the festivities are over with, it's back to work like this, the same as ever?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you have any idea what happens when you announce the Underworld has a Queen, boy? Urgh, damn it! Zagreus, I mean. You become inundated with well-wishes from every blasted shade that wants something.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're responding to well-wishes? Aw. Don't you think some of your subjects are sincerely happy for you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They are very easy to maintain!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never stopped to think about why pomegranates grew here in the Underworld. Mother's doing from before, then? And all that stuff she told the Olympians, about how they bind you to this place... it's all nonsense?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know full well that the pomegranates in my realm hold a certain power beyond the tartness of their taste, boy. The Queen... she has a way with plants, you see. A bit of her own mother's gift, applied more sensibly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You kept them growing all this time... flourishing, even, because of her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, what happened, when Mother first arrived, if I may ask? Some of your residents seem to remember the Queen from before. Yet the Olympians just never found out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They had no jurisdiction here. No knowledge of our goings-on. Well, Hermes did, perhaps, but in a very limited capacity. As far as anybody knew beyond this realm... our Queen was Nyx. Ask nothing more of this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father... how are you doing without Mother around? Will she be all right, on Olympus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Clearly she is more than capable of handling herself. And we here have been well accustomed to not having her about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So everything's back to normal, then? That sounds lovely.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nothing is normal, anymore. Besides! She shall return. Knowing that she shall return, is that not sufficient for you? Be patient, for once.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's good to see Mother's back. Not that I was too concerned, but... I was definitely a little concerned.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shared in that particular concern, and yes... it is good the Queen has once again returned. And she shall have to depart again before we know it, so cherish your time with her, boy!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me, in brief, boy. Our own upon Olympus... are they continuing to aid you as expected?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Still showing up and lending their support. I think some of them are a little disappointed I'm not planning to come join them, though... I think they understand now that they owe the Underworld a debt. We all have to do our part, looking after the mortals. Whether alive or dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed. I half-expected they would disappoint. Abandon you to toil on your own. At least thus far they've honored their commitment, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, are you maintaining better contact now with Uncle Zeus, Uncle Poseidon, and the rest? Oh, and... is it all right for me to speak about them here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Urgh... I'm certain the superficial messages we have exchanged shall taper off, with time. We have always been apart, irrespective of the distance separating us. I know Zeus is content with your mother's version of events. Thus we are at peace, for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, what do you mean, for now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I mean only that our family is prone to causing problems for itself. Never content to leave things well enough alone. But if we have little to do with them... their quarrels, all their nonsense on Olympus... it should be of no consequence.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The latest reports indicate that mortals are fully twice as fearful of ending up in Tartarus as in our last evaluation period, thanks to the destruction you have caused. You are an unseen power in the Underworld. Commendable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Commendable, me? An unseen power, huh. Surprised you're giving me the credit, Father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I give credit where it's due. But the mortals? They know nothing of what transpires here. Only rumblings we permit to escape our realm... rumblings that reinforce their deepest fears about what shall transpire after their demise.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So the more havoc I wreak in the Underworld, the more mortals hear about all the unpleasantness, and... it makes them fearful of this place? If more of them lead upstanding lives, it'll keep Tartarus from overflowing, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whatever you may wish to say, I do not wish to hear it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're interrupting me during my time at work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think I've heard more than enough from you lately.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're willfully wasting my time, aren't you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go, get out. Don't let me stop you.

dialogue: Shouldn't you be getting skewered by the dead?

dialogue: You realize just how much property of mine you have defaced?
label: CHARACTER

label: CHARACTER

label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To suffer such indignity, from my own kin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Such foolishness as yours I scarce can comprehend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've nothing left now to discuss between us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whatever you may wish to say, I do not wish to hear it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have I mentioned that you're never getting out of here?

dialogue: Doubtless I shall get you for that one next time.

dialogue: Another satyr outbreak to look out for next you venture there...

label: CHARACTER

label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, uh, Father. I thought, maybe, you know, here.

dialogue: Have another bottle, why don't you, Father? Not like it's going to change anything between us, right? All the Nectar in the Underworld can't change what's already happened. Or change yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hrm. You're probably correct. You must think it is my age that makes me obstinate. Unable to change my nature. But I have always been inflexible. You think I'm proud of it? You call me 'Father' like it's an insult. I deserve the title only as a technicality, I know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You could start being a better father at any point. There's no one stopping you but you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, well... unfortunately, I am a significant impediment. You should be well aware of that. You were able to stop me. I have thus far been unable to do so...

dialogue: All right. Well, it's a start.

label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The six eyes of the hideous hound of hell go wide at once from having received the exquisite gift of rare Olympian Ambrosia. The creature is rather beside himself.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hits the spot, doesn't it, boy? I know you're caught up in the middle of all this and having to weigh your loyalties more than you'd like. I'm sorry we're putting you through this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Underworld Prince's next attempt to bribe the monstrous triple-headed hellhound into further liking him proves once again successful, as the kingly gift of heavenly Ambrosia is beyond compare.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cerberus, not to get all sentimental on you, but... oh, who am I kidding, look... you've been with me my entire life! I know you're here at home partly because of me, aren't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The bond between a hound and its master is as hard as adamant. Cerberus, the fearsome monster born of hell, and guardian of its gates, answers firstly to the Prince's father. But it turns out, the Prince may be the next best thing.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're the best boy in the whole world. Even if heads Beta and Gamma don't much care for pets, do they? I've got more than enough lined up for you, though. Count on it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No sign of Cerberus for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cerberus must be on duty still.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cerberus must still be back up top.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cerberus is still at work I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good! Now I just need to head off the beaten path here and see what I can find.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The multi-headed Cerberus stands vigilant before the Underworld's entryway; the tales of what happens to those foolish enough to attempt to pass are far too graphic to describe.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So it's really come to this, boy? After everything we've been through. Well then, if this is how it has to be, there's nothing left to say. Except for: On your guard!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahaha, no, but seriously, boy. I know why you're here. There has to be a way to make you look the other way. What if I help you with the Satyr problem, would you let me go? Please. I have to find Persephone... my mother. You know what this means to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: After a moment's hesitation and deliberation, the voracious hound of hell barks once, affirmatively, toward the Prince, who sets off in search of something that can sate the monster's appetites.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not going to budge, are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cerberus puts up with so much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wouldn't fight me, would you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Won't even lift a paw, will you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I ought to be ashamed of myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good to see you, lad, despite the circumstances. Remember your training out there. The pain of death is but another obstacle.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And fear is for the weak. Take care, Achilles.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good to see you, lad. You've been awful busy as of late, there, haven't you? Let me know if there's something I can do, though from what I can tell, you've had a pretty good handle on it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll get the hang of it out there, lad. For all our sparring practice, there's no teacher like the real thing. Now then, I have something for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, wait, you're giving me your Codex? I can't accept something like this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please, I insist. I want your love of history to grow, not just your love of warfare. Besides, maybe you can finish out the rest of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, is it really true that Cerberus ripped the lounge up right after I left? He must have gotten in a lot of trouble.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I only wish you could have seen it, lad. The place looked like a vineyard after a typhoon! Your lord father was livid. But he never gets so angry with the dog. Poor Dusa, though, she's picking the place up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, no... I wondered what became of Dusa. She's always worried Father's going to fire her, even without something like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to say, lad! This place is livelier than usual, of late. Some of the old fixtures of the House getting patched up, new furnishings... it's rather nice, really. We've you to thank, don't we.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, that? It's nothing. Though I'm glad it's made a difference for the better. Our contractor's been doing all the work, I'm just putting in the orders.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And the funds. Your father runs the Underworld a certain way. This old House is lavish, I suppose, but he has long since ceased trying to make it livable, at all. So the changes are appreciated.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Keep at it, lad. I've known great men throughout my life, and I can always tell when someone's better than their circumstances. Fight like I'd fight out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll give them hell as you once did, Achilles. Though, doubtless many of the shades who stand against me first arrived in Tartarus because of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Happen to know whom I should thank for the weapons just outside my chambers, Achilles?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure I wouldn't, lad. Though if I happen to run into them, I'll let them know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your enemy is not the wretched dead, and not your father, lad. It is the Underworld, itself. It has been fashioned to prevent escape. You must have seen, by now, how all the chambers seem to rearrange themselves.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Underworld itself, my enemy... I'll do my best anticipating its surprises, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The sealed weapons by your chambers; your father won't observe their absence, I don't think. They remind him of a time he stood together with his brothers and sisters. He wants nothing more to do with any of that. I think it's fitting you've inherited their power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A power that once sealed away the Titans... maybe it's a power that can break me out of here. Thank you for helping me, Achilles.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The sealed weapons by your chambers; your father won't observe their absence, I don't think. They remind him of a time he stood together with his brothers and sisters. He wants nothing more to do with any of that. I think it's fitting you've inherited their power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A power that once sealed away the Titans... maybe it's a power that can break me out of here. Thank you for helping me, Achilles.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I got acquainted with the Twin Fists of Malphon recently, sir. Fills me with a kind of battle-hunger I'd not felt before. To think the empty hand could have as much destructive force as any weapon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The empty hand has more destructive force than any weapon, lad. It is the only weapon that can wield all others. And without it, all others are nearly powerless. The Twin Fists are a testament to that. Use them with care. Don't lose your head out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll use it to the best of my ability, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I found another weapon waiting for me in the courtyard, Achilles. Exagryph. I never entirely believed it was real.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Between us, lad... I wish it wasn't. Were such a thing available to my enemies during my fighting days, I surely would have come here even sooner. But I trust you have the training to use it well. May it serve you as it served the fire goddess Hestia... she hasn't needed it in a while.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wouldn't mind their help I guess!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to say, lad? Authorizing transfer of the Fated List from the old archives, straight into your chambers... bold of you! And right beneath your father's nose, at that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, that? Just another job from the House Contractor near as I'm concerned, sir. Not like anything on the list was getting done while it was stuck in the archives, besides!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, that's the spirit, I suppose. If there's one thing I know, it's that the Three Fates always get their way; but if you wish to help them go about it, then perhaps they'll pay you back in kind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thought I'd put in a House Contractor order to keep that Codex of yours sorted, lad. Now that you know so many on Olympus, figured it must be a lot keeping track of all their blessings and such.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, that should definitely come in handy, sir! I'm still getting a handle on everything I can do, with all the Olympians' powers fused with mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well! I wasn't about to drink it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, sir? I got a relic of some sort out there... a globule of ancient blood, which formed after I fought with Megaera. Is this really the Titans' blood I found?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As far as I know, yes, lad. That it is. Though whose, exactly, I'm not so sure. You'd best hang onto it, and keep it safe. Your weapons... they shall thirst for it and drink it up. Not yet, perhaps, but soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sell it or keep it, huh.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, look at what I got out there, Achilles sir! A vintage bottle of Ambrosia, plucked straight from Elysium! I hear this stuff is very good, but... can't even open it. I've no idea what to do with it, right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The drink of the gods! I hear it's good, all right. But only for recipients with whom you're close. Perhaps hang onto it until it's ripe for use? Somebody would be grateful I am sure. Or it could fetch you something from the Wretched Broker over there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll have to take your word for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, sir, I have a very important question... why do you detest onions so much? Have they wronged you, somehow?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As soon as you slice into one of those things... it makes you cry. Don't you find that a bit unsettling, lad? I won't shed tears over a cut-up vegetable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, apparently they're pretty tasty if you don't eat them raw.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your extended family, the Olympians... they wish to help you from this place, don't they? I just hope that their intentions are as pure as they appear. They don't get on well with your father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Neither do I, last time I checked. I'll take all the help I can get trying to break out of here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm pleased to hear you say that. I have known too many far too proud to accept help, even when it was sorely needed. You just be careful, lad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Talk later. Best not keep your father waiting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you for the advice, Achilles, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold just a moment, lad. That look... I think I know it all too well. Things getting complicated for you lately, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, you know, just... the usual struggles of battling toward the surface, generally to some ignoble death, though... wait, you mean between myself and Megaera, don't you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think she likes you more than she lets on. You have a certain way, besides. I know you two got off to a rough start. And circumstances lately haven't helped. But, if you love her... follow your heart.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And, what if I don't...? I hesitate to even use the word.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you don't... then cease with giving her such lavish gifts, I ought to think! No need to send the wrong impression, and there is nothing to be gained from such an empty gesture, anyhow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold just a moment, lad. That look... I think I know it all too well. Things getting complicated for you lately, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, you know, just... the usual struggles of battling toward the surface, generally to some ignoble death, though... wait, you mean between myself and Thanatos, don't you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think he cares for you more deeply than you know. You have a certain way, besides. It has been difficult between you two. And circumstances lately haven't helped. But, if you love him... follow your heart.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa, just a moment, there, I mean... I've never said something like that, have I?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You haven't, no. And it is not my business to presume too much. Nevertheless, if your friendship with Thanatos is bounded... then, I would suggest you cease with giving him more lavish gifts. No need to send the wrong impression, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold just a moment, lad. That look... I think I know it all too well. Things getting complicated for you lately, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, you know, just... the usual struggles of battling toward the surface, generally to some ignoble death, though... wait, you mean between me, Meg, and Thanatos, don't you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If I may presume a bit, I gather that they share by now the feelings that you have for each of them; each in their respective way, of course. If you love them... one, the other, perhaps both? I mean, you're gods...! Follow your heart.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa, just a moment, there, I mean... ugh, I suppose you're not presuming much at all. Follow my heart, though? Where?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wherever it should lead; that's how it works. Yours to decide when you've gone as far as you ought, and cease with the lavish gifts. No need to send the wrong impression, and there's nothing to be gained from such an empty gesture, anyhow, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think I see that look again, if I am not mistaken in it, lad. What's on your mind? If you would like to share, I'm listening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, it's just... sometimes, I find my thoughts, they wander between those I care about, it's... not just one. You mortals, typically you had a single suitor, did you not...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So we often told each other, yes. But... you're not like us mortals, or us shades. Nor are most of the others here. You gods... I cannot think of even one who had a single mate. Although, your father... maybe he is one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, you're saying Father, he was never with somebody else besides... my mother?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I of course don't know so very much about him, lad. But that's the way of it, from what I've learned. You needn't follow in his footsteps, though; I think you know that well enough by now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanks, Achilles. That means a lot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Meant to tell you. Recently, I noticed Megaera, and... I believe I saw the faintest smile play across her lips. That anything to do with you, perhaps? Not asking for specifics, mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You really think that has to do with me...? I mean, I hope you're right, and I suppose it's possible, it's just... how can you tell?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps with time, I've grown keen to more than just the weaknesses of my enemies on the battlefield. Especially since I don't have those anymore. I'm happy for you, lad. The two of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to tell you something, lad. When Thanatos returned to seek you out, I was very concerned. Not just for you, either. But you've since patched things up...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think so. I hope so. It was complicated for a while there, but... I think things are clearer for us, now. Not just in the moment, but in retrospect. Ugh, I'm not making any sense.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, on the contrary. I think I know exactly what you mean. I don't know Thanatos particularly well. Wasn't he who brought me here, you see. And he was always very busy, like your father. But, he always struck me as a decent sort.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, I ran into Meg's sisters out there. We didn't really hit it off. Meg said they're not permitted in the House. Not that I'm complaining, but... what's that about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They have not earned the right, lad. Nor expressed any desire to exist here with the rest of us. Your father has assigned them to specific roles that suit their dispositions. They're... not as sensible as Megaera, in my experience.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's what I was afraid of. Although, fear is for the weak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will. You're right as always, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You saw that Thanatos is back, didn't you, lad? He's been over there brooding, when he's around, at least.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I saw, Achilles. I think he's angry with me because of my decision to leave the House. Not that it's any of his business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, don't say that. It isn't everyday or night when one discovers that his closest friend has had it with his temperamental father, and decided to leave home. I think he's struggling with what to make of it. Be gentle with him, will you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not the god of anything, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Achilles, I... uncovered a late passage in the Codex, with regard to Thanatos and me. It says, you say, you think that I'm the god of blood? I'm not the god of anything, I think...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, nonsense, lad! If you're a god, then you're the god of something, I'm sure. It's just an observation, and I genuinely hope it's no offense. But, see... your father, and your mother, and your bloodstones, and your disposition...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not a concern, just a morbid curiosity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, I've been meaning to ask you about the odd skeleton usually standing around in the courtyard. Old acquaintance of yours? A hireling, perhaps?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That one, Skelly, was it? We only met when all this business of escape began. If I have a connection to him, I am unaware. Does he claim to know me? Perhaps I slew him when we were alive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know that that's it. So neither of us has any idea where he's from or how he got there, huh. Can you think of any leads? Nyx doesn't seem to know him, either.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps the gods of Olympus sent him to your aid? Their methods can be odd. And, there are many who support you. Regardless, he does not appear to be your father's spy, if that is your concern.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe both. I've met the sort.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Remember that Skelly character out in the courtyard, sir? Turns out he's been working with Charon all this time. Working for him more like! I had so much help in this, from all of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Charon! Of course. He has a stake in all that goes on in the Underworld. And he probably thinks highly of you. This Skelly character, though... he must have been somebody if Charon's confided in him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He won't tell me. He was either a venerable sea captain, or a petty thief. Maybe both?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In my recent audience with Nyx, lad, she let on that you have mentioned Chaos as of late. Is it true you've met her parent, yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have. Chaos is... not like anyone I've ever met. At first I was a little worried, meeting this vast primordial entity apparently responsible for all creation, but... they seem all right. Chaos and Nyx haven't been talking for a while, though. You don't know what happened there, do you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know a little bit, I think. Nyx, she and Chaos, they just... slowly drifted apart. No animosity, not anymore, at least. It happens between parents and children. And once such ties are severed, they cannot always be restored. Especially among primordial gods as old as time, I suppose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wanted to ask you more about Nyx and Chaos, sir. So they just drifted apart, I mean... why not just keep in touch? I don't understand. How hard is it just to say hello from time to time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It can be harder than you know. For someone like Nyx... she was responsible for no small part of creation, herself. As her relationship with Chaos grew more strained, she gave birth to Strife, Misery, Doom... sons and daughters you don't hear about too much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, really? I've never heard Hypnos or Thanatos mention any of them, let alone Nyx. They sound like a handful. Where are they, what happened?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know, lad. On the surface, I suppose? My point is, Nyx had her own problems to contend with. Dealing with her brood, governing the Underworld all on her own before your father arrived. Her relationship with Chaos suffered for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lad, I heard from Nyx! She said that she was able recently to reestablish contact with Chaos, thanks to you? You're just full of surprises, reforging old bonds between primordial gods like it was nothing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, just took a bit of tampering with the Sigil in the admin chamber. Whole bunch of Darkness, too. But I could tell that Nyx and Chaos, they... seemed to really miss each other, to the extent they are able to miss anybody.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think they're plenty capable of missing their loved ones, lad. The amount of time that either of us have existed... it's nothing compared to either of them. Imagine, being apart from someone you care about, for that long...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That it did most definitely, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, sir? You happen to know whether Father authorized the transfer of a Macedonian Tau-Lambda chariot to Elysium in recent memory? I ran into the former hero Theseus, all joyriding about in one of those.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know the chariot you mean. It's not just any Macedonian. It's modified, apparently by Daedalus, himself. No earthly weapons can do what it does. Though, please don't tell me Theseus put on that mask...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, you mean the golden matching mask? I saw him wearing it, all right. Looked like a proper fool, I thought. What of it, though?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahah, well! I think that Daedalus would certainly agree. Heard that he fashioned that mask and outfit as a little joke. For someone deeply prideful, and well unaware. It must have suited Theseus quite well, then, yes?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In the mean time, I'll take good care of them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, wanted to ask you more about the weapons I've been using. They can change shape! So, they've molded themselves to suit me, and remember their past wielders, something like that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Something like that. They seem alive, don't they? Taking everything in. I think they long predate even your father's time. Some have seen many different owners. Chances are, you shall not be the last.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see you through the eyes of the crimson phoenix...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you may know, lad, I've a connection to the weapons that you use, having once wielded one of them myself. Of course not knowing its significance back then, but I digress. Sometimes, it... well, it keeps in touch. And I've a vision from it to impart.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, you mean a vision from Varatha the Eternal Spear? That's... out of the ordinary, and also a bit concerning. So, what did you see?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well... I saw a great, bearded warrior. Bigger than me, pitch-black hair. Bearing an aspect of Varatha unlike any with which I'm familiar. Then he was gone. But, what still lingered were these words: I see you through the eyes of the crimson phoenix.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see you through the eyes of the crimson phoenix... I don't understand. What's that supposed to mean?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's one more thing. This was not my first such vision. Long ago... I saw one of Varatha's other bearers. It was you. Your Infernal Arms... they must be weapons of the Fates' design. They know already who shall brandish them. Now they ask a favor. Seek Varatha. Speak the words. Go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles...! Something awakened in Varatha when I spoke the words. It revealed to me a form I'd never seen. Wielded by the warrior called Guan Yu. Handsomely dressed! And just as you described. That's no Greek name, is it...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, I don't think so, lad. I don't know who this Guan Yu is, or where he's from. Or even when he's from. But the Fates must have a plan for him, and you. Anyway... I think my part in this is ended. Varatha's served you well, no? I trusted it in life; I trust it now. Fear is for the weak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, sir! I've uncovered the hidden aspect for Stygius! Nyx gave me the words this time, and a vision of a noble leader among mortals. An entire armored legion of them! Arthur was his name. Will be his name, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A future leader among men, wielding that blade? The mysteries of the Infernal Arms run deep, don't they. Although it seems that you and Stygius formed quite a bond.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have this feeling that he will.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, I've revealed the hidden aspect of the Heart-Seeker. Lady Artemis herself told me the words, and... it seems Coronacht belonged to, maybe will belong to somebody called Rama. Peerless with the bow. Even among gods...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Many lay claim to peerlessness with bows in my experience, there, lad, although... I'm not to judge a vision from an ancient weapon such as that. I hope this Rama shall use his weapon wisely when the time comes; same as you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I doubt he would be any match for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, sir, I've revealed the hidden aspect of the Shield of Chaos... thanks to Chaos, themself. Apparently someday it'll protect an armored warrior known as Beowulf from all sorts of dangers... even a dragon! Mortals don't stand much of a chance against those, do they?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Depends upon the dragon, I suppose. I've heard they differ all across the world. Though, that's a fascinating find, there, lad. This Beowulf... sounds like he'll find a way to make good use of all that protective gear. Always preferred mobility, myself, but then, to each his own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know the type. Both types.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Bull of Minos led me to another hidden aspect, Achilles! A beastly form of the Twin Fists, belonging to an ancient god-king known as Gilgamesh. You ever hear that name? He had a half-beast friend, apparently. Like how Asterius is friend to Theseus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Gilgamesh, you said...? That name isn't familiar to me, but... with these hidden aspects, there's bound to be a connection to the future, or the past. Say, why is the Bull of Minos aiding you? I thought he was one of your rivals barring passage from Elysium.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, he is. He's loyal through and through to Theseus, and never holds back when we fight. But he seems to be the respect-for-his-opponent type. Unlike his companion.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll take it as a warning. Even the Rail has its limits.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, I discovered the hidden aspect of the Adamant Rail, after Lord Zeus himself told me the waking-phrase. It's from a winged fellow by the name of Lucifer... apparently had a bit of a falling out with his lord father. Wonder how that worked out for him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Huh! Perhaps it's from a time even before the Olympians rebelled against the Titans. But I've never heard of any Lucifer, with or without wings. Suggests to me, perhaps that falling out of his did not work out so well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It sounds absurd when you put it quite like that... but yes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, something I've been wondering... now that I've discovered all the hidden aspects of my weapons... as far as I know, anyway... I can't see any pattern there, at all. Guan Yu, Gilgamesh, Rama, and so on... any idea why them?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To know for certain, I suppose you'd have to ask the Fates, themselves... and get an answer from them, too. I ask myself how come you found an aspect of mine, among them all. What made me so special, do you suppose?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You were a great warrior! Famous, in your time! It's no surprise to me at all the Fates chose you to have a stint with one of their world-altering weapons.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, that's just it! I was quite famous, yes. Infamous, perhaps, but no matter. Perhaps it's just that these weapons demand to make themselves known, above all. To leave a lasting impression in the hands of their wielders.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think the Infernal Arms just want to be popular? Have exciting stories told about them and whatnot?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't imagine you weren't always a good listener, Achilles.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've had the opportunity to use your aspect of Varatha, sir. So, you once wielded it yourself? It... fills me with a hunger for battle even more so than usual. A bit of your fighting spirit, perhaps.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be very wary of that spirit, lad. It was what brought me here before my time. Although that spear indeed once served me well. A parting gift from my old master Chiron. He cautioned me as I am cautioning you. Though, may you be a better listener.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure his skill did most of the work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, I meant to ask, did you know that Coronacht the Heart-Seeker once belonged to the centaur, Chiron? Because one of its aspects is his own. He didn't have it back when you trained with him, did he...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Master Chiron, truly...? Ah, of course. He granted me a spear, I think you know. If he possessed one such weapon, why not more? I remember his bow shined like the sun. It was splendid, and never missed its mark... though I attributed that to Chiron's extraordinary skill.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well this should help you keep an eye on him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to thank you for the mirror back there, lad. Lets me get a better look at things out in the great hall every now and then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, sir, don't mention it. You're really stuck having to guard this corridor most of the time, huh?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh certainly, it's an important corridor! Think of it, if just any shade could pass through either of those doors back there. Your father's barely keeping it together, as it is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure he's in no hurry to return.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Quite a statue you commissioned over there. I suppose I can think of worse subjects than mighty Heracles for me to have to stand about and stare at.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They say he was the strongest demigod who ever lived. Though, I bet you could take him, sir. Big guy like that, you'd be too quick, I'm sure. You ever meet him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Only in passing. He once died a mortal's death... worse than mine. Had a brief stint down here, but... he's favored by Olympus. Got a special arrangement of some sort, I heard. Haven't seen him since.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't know how I'd ever find something in there, but I suppose so, yes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, looks like I could buy back my right to go in the administrative chamber, there. I never want to go in there again, but... can you think of any reason whatsoever that I should?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah, well. Perhaps we all want what we cannot have. Other than that, I suppose certain documents or records in there could be of some benefit under the circumstances, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That Chthonic Companion you gave me, sir... have to say it's been amazing to see you and Patroclus in action. I thought you said your fighting days were over?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, well... that was before I was reunited with Patroclus, and had the opportunity to help you in a pinch, with him at my side. I trust we were of some small service, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, I... sometimes I fear that Father, if he learns that you've been aiding me, that he will... not be generous with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry about me, lad. Your father's still getting caught up with work that I created for him in my mortal days. Besides... there's nothing he can take from me. We have a mutual arrangement, he and I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... fear is for the weak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, I'm concerned that Father's growing angrier with you. He thinks you've taken sides against him in all this. I don't want anything to happen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's right, lad. I have taken sides. But, as for you not wanting anything to happen... while I know what you meant, I don't want you to say such things again. Do you understand? You're doing this because something here needs to happen. Hold back your fear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wanted to say, the Lady Aphrodite asked that I relay a message to you, sir. She said that she admires you. Mentioned a certain war.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Admires me, does she? Sometimes, lad, I think that Aphrodite is the mightiest of all the gods. Her power is what spurs us all to action. Whether to love, or war. Or sometimes both the two. I'm grateful for the message.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Achilles! I heard from Lady Artemis out there. It seems you have a bit of a fan in her. She wanted me to tell you you're the best! She's not mistaken, by the way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The goddess of the hunt herself said that? That's very flattering to hear. Good thing she doesn't know I'm all washed up, by now. Her memory is of my glory days.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, have you ever run across the shade of Daedalus in all your time? I've found some of his legendary hammers out there, but no sign of him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've never met him, no. Your father keeps him fully occupied with building out his Underworld, and renovating constantly. No wonder some of his old crafting-tools are strewn about. I take it you've been able to make use of them?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, did you ever use to pray to the gods? Make offerings to them and such, back when you were alive?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prayed mostly to my mother, lad. I always had my doubts the gods were listening. That they could even hear. Though, I suppose that if you make an offering, they might be so inclined, just for the moment, anyway. They helping much?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have a worried look about you, lad. Spare me your thoughts?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, it's just... I met the goddess Demeter out there. The blessings that she offered, they... just drained the heat and life from everything. I thought she saw to fruits and grains and vegetables and such? Not that I'm complaining.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All gods and goddesses are to be feared. Demeter, she has the power to give life, or take it. Seems she's more interested in the latter, though. She's the eldest on Olympus, and your father seems to harbor a particular dislike for her. I don't know why. Be careful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, what happened between Nyx and Dusa? Dusa's really gone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx cut her off, lad. I'm sorry. I know you cared about her. I was as surprised as you when I found out. I knew that Nyx had her concerns about Dusa's propensity to overwork herself, but... this wasn't the step I was expecting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Propensity to overwork herself... you really think that's what this was about? I can't shake the feeling it's my fault. Nyx didn't want her talking to me, as though she's beneath me or something! Ugh, what am I going to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look... I don't have all the information on this one, and neither do you from the sound of things. Nyx loves you and respects you. I trust she would want to know how this affects you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, what happened between Nyx and Dusa? Dusa's really gone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx cut her off, lad. I'm sorry. I know you cared about her. I was as surprised as you when I found out. I knew that Nyx had her concerns about Dusa's propensity to overwork herself, but... this wasn't the step I was expecting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Propensity to overwork herself... you really think that's what this was about? I can't shake the feeling it's my fault. Nyx didn't want her talking to me, as though she's beneath me or something! Ugh, what am I going to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look... I don't have all the information on this one, and neither do you from the sound of things. Nyx loves you and respects you. I trust she would want to know how this affects you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did you see, sir? Dusa's returned! Nyx must have reconsidered her decision.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She must have, indeed, lad. I was pleased to see Dusa return. And you know what...? I daresay she seemed rather well-rested, for a change. It might not have been the best of circumstances, though my hope is that some good has come of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand you've made it all the way to Asphodel of late, haven't you, lad?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess word travels faster than I do. Why do you ask, Achilles?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...No reason in particular. Just that it brings me joy to hear of your progress.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I haven't seen you in a while, lad. You made it to Elysium last time, didn't you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did, Achilles. It's crawling with great warriors still looking for a fight. It's not exactly what I was expecting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father's marshalled the most willing ones to deal with you. Doubtless there's much at stake in it for them, if but the pride of having done the task. Although I think that pride will always be their weakness.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's good, then. Glad to hear it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I couldn't help but notice, lad, that Cerberus has been away for quite some time. Turns out your father's put him back to work above. I truly hope you shall not have to come to blows.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry, sir. I've run into Cerberus up top, all right. Even if he's technically Father's pet, he'd never bare his fangs at me. No matter how much Father might wish otherwise.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't wish to presume, lad, but you seem more glum than usual. What's weighing on you, there, if you don't mind?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, it's just... I've never slain a living creature, sir. Until my recent journey to the Temple up above. I know they're just Satyrs and vermin, but... it's not the same as sending wretches to the depths.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look. All mortal life is fragile; it simply is a struggle to survive. Sooner or later it fails to succeed, and then, it ends up here. And we have room enough for everyone, even the Satyrs and the vermin of the world.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that you mention it, I have to say I'm glad we can accommodate all former-living things. And at least mortals get to rest assured knowing what happens once they die! Must really ease the mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I saw your father storm out of the House in his regalia. So he must have confronted you himself, at last. I... see that must have not gone well. You were so close.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, at least I know who will be waiting for me the next time I climb all the way to the Temple of Styx and manage my way out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't lose heart, lad. I did not train your father, only you. He is a god; but he is just a god. If you'll forgive my bit of treason there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is. I have to speak with her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I found her, sir! My mother, she's... alive and well, and... ugh, but I just couldn't stay up there, for very long. I have to get back to her!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You really made it all the way? You must have... gotten past your father, that's amazing, lad. But, wait, what was she like, what happened to you there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She was... she was great! Nothing like Father, more like... you, a little bit, I guess! Though, being on the surface, it just seemed to suck the life right out of me. Even without the wretches of the Underworld trying to do me in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But then, you had a little time at least! Sounds like you have unfinished business with her, there. You got to her this once... surely you're able to again, isn't that right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did it go, lad? You've been gone a while. For good reason, I hope?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I found her, again, sir, and... we were able to talk some more. But, I have so many questions left for her, and Father's certainly not been of any help...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, first of all, good work. I knew you had it in you. Secondly... you know what you have to do. Go find her, for as many chances as it takes. It's not just her you've sought... it's the answers to those questions that you have.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, you can tell me in due time if you decide to, lad. But I do have a question, same as you did, going into this. Why did she leave? Why did she leave you, in particular?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's that she didn't even know I was alive. Sounds as though Nyx revived me sometime after I was born, but by that point... Mother had already left, and... they let her be. For reasons I am trying to find out.
label: CHARACTER
