dialogue: Ah, that's... quite a bit to take in, there. And it explains more than a bit, I think. Look, I'm not one to speculate too much. I trust you'll find the answers that you seek as you proceed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What news this time, lad? Did you find your mother, once again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, I failed, sir. No thanks to Father! Urgh, what am I going to do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just take it easy, now. You got there once, there isn't any question in my mind that you can do it once again. Your father's acting as though nothing's changed, besides. So, don't lose hope. You're capable of this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, tell me something, sir. Any rumors swirling about the House regarding the outcome of a certain interaction I had with my father recently? Involving a great deal of violence? Because I'd like for everyone to know: I won.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wouldn't know of what you mean, there, lad. For there are certain subjects so forbidden here right now that not even rumors can take hold. But, just between us for the time: Congratulations. Truly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, sir. I didn't know whether I had it in me. As for the other bit, I'll keep it quiet, then, for now. I probably shouldn't be tying my sense of self-worth to praise from friends, acquaintances, and strangers, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you. It's mine as well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Queen is back! You did it, lad. You must have lots of catching up to do. Or patching up. And, I'm to understand that your escape attempts, they are officially approved, isn't that so?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's so, indeed, sir. Especially for now, at least, I'm going to keep on fighting to the surface. Helps me to vent a bit, and, like Hypnos says, it makes the Underworld a better place! Though indirectly, I suppose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, then, I look forward to working with you in a more formal capacity. And, it is my sincerest hope that you, your mother, and your father learn to get on better with each other, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey sir, meant to say I hope I didn't get you into too much trouble after letting me in Father's bedchambers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think nothing of it, lad. It was a risk I was willing to take, and for his part, your father looked the other way on that one. Though I did not expect you'd get free rein to go there as you please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, lad, tell me, then. How went the family feast, was everything all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I confess I was perhaps a little nervous for practically the entire thing, but... all in all, I had a good time, and I'm very, very glad it all turned out the way it did. How about yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I quite enjoyed it, too. Last time I was invited to a feast, I was still busy warring on the surface, that's how long it's been. I must say, your mother is quite good with words! Had everybody chatting, laughing...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She really pulled it off! But... for all her confidence, I don't think she knew she had it in her. Because if she did... if she reached out to Olympus sooner... a lot of things could have been different.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't dwell on that. I spoke a bit with Nyx. Your mother had her reasons. No one gets to act on perfect information, right? All we have is what we think we know, and what our conscience tells us. Your mother got to where all this was possible... all thanks to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All thanks to me, sir? I had ample help along the way. For instance, I could not have done it without you. Would have been using an old chair leg as a weapon, I suppose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And what a fearsome chair leg it would be! In any case... you heading out there, soon? Olympus should be more than happy to assist in your security review. If that's what we're calling it now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, I should go. I'll see you not too long from now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahaha, well... you got me there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm so impressed with what you've managed to accomplish, lad. When I was closer to your age... or, the age you appear to be... all I wanted was glory. To be remembered forever. Look where that got me! I'm glad you know better than I did.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So in pursuing glory... you think you lost it? Forgive me, here, but I just disagree. I settled a family squabble. You single-handedly turned an entire war!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A foolish war. Glory comes to those driven to excel in worthwhile pursuits. A happy side effect, not a goal unto itself. Though, you don't need for me to tell you that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If not for all your training and advice, I wouldn't have come this far. You prepared me for this. Wasn't that a worthwhile pursuit? Must mean you got some glory after all, then, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're getting somewhere with that Codex, lad. I'm pleased to see it. My duties to the House have meant that, lately, I can't travel quite as much as once I did.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll try to travel for the both of us, Achilles. I've seen so little other than these walls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, look at you, lad, with that Codex brimming with our history! I knew I could rely on you to fill it out. Back when I was alive, why, no one would have ever believed what goes on down here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mortals must have had their stories, though. About what happens to them once they die, and once they end up in this place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They have their stories, definitely so. They fear your father, understandably. They also fear your dog. But most of them know precious little else. Even their fears, I think, are born of ignorance. As most fears tend to be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, sir... within the Codex, you'd written something, about someone with whom you shared your life... when you were flesh and blood?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Ah. That is a private matter for me, lad. From a time I had convinced myself the Codex would be for my own eyes, alone. My past is not really worth mentioning. And, I am presently on duty, so... begging your pardon, please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. I think. I'm grateful for it, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, Achilles sir, there's something I've been wondering, about your Codex. The words are yours, and yet it's through my actions that I'm able to absorb them. Is that how mortal scriptures always work?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah. You have to understand, lad, I've been here in your father's realm for quite some time. My documented learnings became bound to me, much like this spear, you see? You can undo those bindings over time. Thus my knowledge can be yours. Whatever it amounts to.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I had the strangest feeling, lad, you mind if... can I see that Codex, there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, sir! I've been keeping busy with it, you could say. It's almost complete!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is complete! That's amazing... a chronicle of this place... everything I've ever learned and felt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Still always more to learn and feel, though, isn't there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Achilles? My father's hall back there. I don't suppose you'll let me have myself a look? Lots for me to rummage through, I'm sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know I'd do just about anything to aid you, lad. But my ability to do so hinges on me sticking to my post. Though if I do catch wind of anything back there requiring attention, you shall know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd ask you join me for a drink, lad, but I know you've a task ahead of you, and liquor dulls the senses. Fortunately so, under most circumstances except yours. Leave me to it, will you, and I'll have one for the both of us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Some other time, Achilles. Just checking in on you, but I'll be on my way again shortly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, would you... tell me something more of Patroclus? You mentioned you were very close.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We could have been no closer. The ashes of our bodies yet mingle together somewhere on the surface there. What can I tell you, lad? I loved him with all my heart. And he left me too soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then, surely he must be in the Underworld, somewhere... have you not tried to seek him out? Or asked my father?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah, haha. I tried, lad, I have tried. On both accounts. What you propose is not that simple, it turns out. You've seen what it is like out there... it's difficult to find one's way. But I shall tell you what. If you see Patroclus among the countless shades, you tell him I said hi.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, would you... tell me something more of Patroclus? You mentioned you were very close.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We could have been no closer. The ashes of our bodies yet mingle together somewhere on the surface there. What can I tell you, lad? I loved him with all my heart. And he left me too soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But now you're both here, in the Underworld! Can't you go seek him out? Or alter your arrangement with my father?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ha, hah. I tried, lad, I have tried. On both accounts. What you propose is not that simple, it turns out. But I shall tell you what. When next you see Patroclus on your journeys, you keep speaking to him for me, won't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How fare your labors, lad? You have a certain look about you. Everything all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's just... within Elysium, I happened on a shade, who said he knew you. Said he misses you. Do you know a Patroclus, sir?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What... I... yes. I knew Patroclus, did he... is he all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He... I don't know. He seems like he's known better times than these. Is... there something I should say to him, if I run into him again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Please send him my regards. And... all my love. I think of him always. But I cannot see him any longer. And you mustn't ask me why, do you understand? Now, leave me be, please, lad. I need some time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How fare your labors, lad? You have a certain look about you. Everything all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's just... within Elysium, I happened on a shade. It's your Patroclus. He's all right, but he seems like he's known better times than these. Is there something I should say to him, if I run into him again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh...! Well, then, please send him my regards. And... all my love. I think of him always. But I cannot see him any longer. And you mustn't ask me why, do you understand? Now, leave me be, please, lad. I need some time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How fare your labors, lad? You have a certain look about you. Everything all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's just... within Elysium, I happened on a shade. It's your Patroclus. He's all right, but he seems like he's known better times than these. Is there something I should say to him, if I run into him again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh...! Well, then, please send him my regards. And... all my love. I think of him always. But I cannot see him any longer. And you mustn't ask me why, do you understand? Now, leave me be, please, lad. I need some time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How fare your labors, lad? You have a certain look about you. Everything all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's just... within Elysium, I happened on a shade. It's your Patroclus. He's all right, but he seems like he's known better times than these. Is there something I should say to him, if I run into him again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh...! Well, then, please send him my regards. And... all my love. I think of him always. But I cannot see him any longer. And you mustn't ask me why, do you understand? Now, leave me be, please, lad. I need some time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, listen a moment, lad. I require your discretion with regards to whom we spoke about last time. The shade you met within Elysium.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand. What can I do about this, sir? There must be something. But, you have to let me know what's going on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Simply put, he is the reason that I'm here. Patroclus lost his life before I did. Because of me. I shortly followed, in a rage. When I arrived here, I received a hero's welcome. Your father himself ushered me to Elysium. But that's not what I wanted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wanted to see Patroclus. But, he's in Elysium, while you... oh, no.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I signed a pact, lad. Felt that the terms were good enough. He could live there, while I'd live here, at least for now. Such deals are most uncommon, and their confidentiality must be upheld. But, let's speak no more of this for now, all right? Some other time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, listen a moment, lad. I require your discretion with regards to whom we spoke about last time. The shade you met within Elysium.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand. What can I do about this, sir? There must be something. But, you have to let me know what's going on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Simply put, he is the reason that I'm here. Patroclus lost his life before I did. Because of me. I shortly followed, in a rage. When I arrived here, I received a hero's welcome. Your father himself ushered me to Elysium. But that's not what I wanted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wanted to see Patroclus. But, he's in Elysium, while you... oh, no.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I signed a pact, lad. Felt that the terms were good enough. He could live there, while I'd live here, at least for now. Such deals are most uncommon, and their confidentiality must be upheld. But, let's speak no more of this for now, all right? Some other time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have to tell me more about this pact you signed, Achilles. You and Patroclus... so, you're doomed to never be together, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must safeguard the details of it, lad. Although it's not as bad as you make out. I ensured Patroclus is provided for. We wouldn't have been together anyway. Initially he wasn't sent into Elysium, you see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There has to be a way for me to make this right. Not just for him, for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've other, pressing matters to attend to, lad. And Patroclus and I have ample time to wait this out. I know you mean well, but... do not discuss this matter with your father, now. I fear that it could make things worse. Do you understand?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The... fallen warrior in Elysium we spoke of. He seems like a good man, though... was he always the despondent sort?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, lad. I was that sort, I think, but he was not. He was... one of the only men I knew who did not look upon me as a threat. He saw something in me I never knew was there. And in turn, with him, I felt... how to describe it? Calm. Whole.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah! I'm restless all the time. I can only imagine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He had this wry humor about him. Like he was wise beyond his years. A quality I trust shall see him through his struggles now. Although... I hoped residing in Elysium would mean he wouldn't have to struggle any longer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know that it's a painful subject, sir, but can you tell me... what exactly happened, in the war that claimed Patroclus and yourself? He brought it up. Said you refused to fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Until he died. I did refuse to fight, until he died, but at that point... ungh, look, lad, if we're going to discuss these matters, best we do so in the lounge, not here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...The fool of a king I served... I'd never take up arms, for him. But, Patroclus, he always had a different way of looking at things. As I refused to fight, he rose to the occasion. Took up my armor, led my brothers into battle, in my guise. Fought nobly... but then, he... well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And after you found out... you sought vengeance for him. Took vengeance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That I did. They got me, finally, of course. But, not before I broke them, first. The war soon ended, after that. It is an awful contradiction, that to quickly end war, one need only extinguish many lives at once. I had not realized it at the time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did you... allow yourself to die? So that you could see Patroclus again, here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I don't know. Maybe. I only know that I was filled with rage. Rage that subsided, soon after I arrived here. I felt... empty. I never saw Patroclus again. But, I learned my brothers honored my last request, as my ashes were laid to rest with his. <Sigh> Anyway...! Appreciate the drink.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Suppose I'd best be getting back to standing quietly about. Though, that war, lad? Don't ask me about it again. All right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How is he, anyway, if you've encountered him of late during your journeys, lad? The fallen warrior you've run into in Elysium, that is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's doing relatively well, I think. There's a lot you've told me... that he didn't know. About what led up to his present circumstances, and your own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You told him, then. Without requesting my consent to tell him, first! What, exactly, did you say to him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, I... I'm sorry, I... just told him about your ashes being intermingled, that whole thing? And about the pact. You told me once to send him your love and regards! This brought him no joy, only questions! You told me not to speak to Father, not to him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: <Sigh>...You're right, I... should have specified. Or shouldn't have. Because what you said, probably is for the best. I didn't mean to lose my temper with you, lad, it's just... look, thank you for looking out for him. For both of us. Just, please be careful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a message for you from the fallen warrior over in Elysium, Achilles sir. He says... he simply said to let you know to risk it all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To risk it all. He said to risk it all?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Is... there something significant about that phrase?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When last he said to risk it all, to me... I didn't listen to him, then. But should have. I should have.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's asking you to take another chance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No... he's giving me another chance, I think. I... leave me lad, for now. Thank you for telling me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: About risking it all, sir. Did you come to any decision about what that meant? What you should do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm getting there, lad. In battle, I would operate on instincts, make snap judgments almost instantly. In other matters, though... I need some time. Your patience, please. I'll let you know if I can figure something out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need your help with something, lad. As I'm about to risk it all, I think. Will you hear me out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, sir, what is it? I'm listening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The pact I signed with your father. It must be buried somewhere down in the administrative chamber there. I dared not ask that you locate it, out of fear that tampering with it would only make things worse, except...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Except that fear is for the weak, Achilles, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed. Besides... your father has been more abiding than I expected with how you were able to nullify the Knave-King's Sentence... so, perhaps my case isn't a lost cause, yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll speak with Nyx about it the next chance I get. And I'll be careful, sir. I promise you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need your help with something, lad. As I'm about to risk it all, I think. Will you hear me out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, sir, what is it? I'm listening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The pact I signed with your father. It must be buried somewhere down in the administrative chamber there. I dared not ask that you locate it, out of fear that tampering with it would only make things worse, except...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Except that fear is for the weak, Achilles, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed. Besides... your father has been more abiding than I expected with how you were able to void the pact that separated Orpheus and Eurydice... so, perhaps my case isn't a lost cause, yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll speak with Nyx about it the next chance I get. And I'll be careful, sir. I promise you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need your help with something, lad. As I'm about to risk it all, I think. Will you hear me out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, sir, what is it? I'm listening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The pact I signed with your father. It must be buried somewhere down in the administrative chamber there. I dared not ask that you locate it, out of fear that tampering with it would only make things worse, except...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Except that fear is for the weak, Achilles, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed. Besides... your father has been more abiding than I expected with how you were able to nullify the terms for Orpheus and Sisyphus alike, so... perhaps my case isn't a lost cause, yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll speak with Nyx about it the next chance I get. And I'll be careful, sir. I promise you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm working on trying to find your pact, Achilles. Just need a little more time to sort it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've nothing if not patience, lad. And I shall try to keep my hopes in check. Thank you for your effort around this. When next we speak of it, may it be when you've succeeded.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm working on your pact, Achilles. Just need a little more time to sort it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've nothing if not patience, lad. And I shall try to keep my hopes in check. Thank you for your effort around this. When next we speak of it, may it be when you've succeeded.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles! Your pact with Father is officially amended, sir. Specifically, it no longer has any stipulation barring you from entering Elysium during the indefinite term of your employment. On my authority in the name of Hades, thank you for your service.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, are you... you're serious. I'm able to go. You're right, I feel it. I'm unbound. So I can... simply leave... right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can simply leave, right now. And, might I add... it's about damn time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... should get going then, although... I am unprepared, I... didn't think it would come to this. Not that I had no faith in you, it's just...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Incidentally, there's this one glade out in Elysium I highly recommend... go to him, sir. You've waited long enough. Fear is for the weak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Fear is for the weak. Farewell for now, lad. I can't thank you enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sir, you're back! How was it in Elysium, was everything all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It went well, lad. As well as I could have hoped. Better than I might have feared. Hey, don't take Patroclus calling you 'stranger' personally, all right? He has less charitable terms for those he doesn't care for.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Achilles, I want details, here! What happened with you two? If you don't mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahah, well. Thankfully, your efforts meant that no words really needed to be said, when I arrived. He simply said my name. Then, we just... were. Two souls together in one spot. The way shades linger, it looks mournful, right? But it isn't always.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's wonderful to hear. He seemed uplifted in your presence. You must have lots of catching up to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lots of making up for lost time. And finally we have some time to spare. It's odd, because so many of my memories of him are from a time of war. Now, we can make new memories in peace. Anyway... see you out there again sometime, I hope?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it, lad, what's wrong? What can I do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me in Father's chambers. Please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...That's high atop the list of things I'm not to do, for anyone, and under any circumstances. What is it you need? I've never even been in there, myself...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know, I don't know! But, if I know Father, and I think I do, he's got to have something of hers in there. Of Mother's! She still doesn't get it, doesn't believe me about him, and... I said I'd prove it. That he cares for her!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, slow down, I understand. Look... this can get me in a lot of trouble, like you've no idea. And, not just me, so... be careful, and be quick, while he's still out. Take this and go. Don't leave anything there out of place, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles... if a friend of yours were in need of assistance, but the only way you could assist them was to somehow change the terms of an ancient pact Father probably forced on them, what would you do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I would be very careful, above all. Do you understand, lad? I would not wish to make things any worse. How many pacts such as the one you're thinking of are buried back in the administrative chamber, there? Even your father can't keep track. Although... perhaps Nyx can.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx... you're right. She knows everything! Wouldn't hurt to ask her, I suppose...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold, lad! You've regained access to the administrative chamber, right? I never thought you'd want to go in there again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, believe me, I don't. But I would like to be able to go where I please around here, and confounding Father is another benefit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Suppose I can see that. Well then, on my quite limited authority, it pleases me to say: You may proceed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, now that I have access to the administrative area again, I... well, I've access to the archives, and... I have some authority, to void those, under certain circumstances. So, about your pact...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know you mean well, lad. And, from the bottom of my heart, where once it was, I thank you truly for the thought. However... don't exert your influence on this. Not now, at least. The Fates can twist intentions. I don't want to take the risk.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're sure...? Well then... I'll wait. But I am going to ask you again. We have to find a way to fix this. Patroclus is waiting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, I was wondering, Achilles. Any news of Orpheus of late? I've not seen him around here in some time. He still paying his dues?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That I believe he is, lad. Your father, he was none too pleased with him last time I saw him here. I tried my best to simmer down the situation, but... you know how it goes. I hope your father cuts his sentence short.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope so, too. If you do see him, tell him I said hi.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good to see old Orpheus is back with us. He hasn't changed a bit. Was he always like this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm guessing not. Never knew him when we were alive, but since we met he's always been the melancholy sort. The few times I heard him sing, though...? It was beautiful. I'm not surprised your father's kept him here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...You asked I train him, Master. Prepare him for life's labors. You ordered it! Now you admonish me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be careful of your tone and temper, Shade. You are in my employ. You could be wandering the pastures of Elysium again instead. Or lesser planes, if I so choose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall be giving it some thought. Until then, you just watch that hall. And watch yourself, as well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sometimes the law is not so bad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I understand the terms of your employment have been altered in my name, Shade. Be grateful that you lack the standing for such changes to require my personal approval. Though you remain in my employ, correct?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As far as I'm aware, yes, Master. I'm sworn eternally here to this House, except... it seems I'm now at liberty to see Elysium, from time to time. While off duty, of course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How lenient they make these pacts, today. You are off duty now, is that not so? Go, then, take advantage of the added benefit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...What's that you have there, Shade? That looks like contraband to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is, Mistress. I'm glad you're here, as maybe you can help me quickly to dispose of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let us immediately do so, then. Before concerns arise around the presence of this stuff within the House.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I realize that, Mistress. It's just... I think we've other matters to attend to, such as... emptying the contents of this contraband.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. That's fine. But you will need to face your fears someday, in all of this. You act as if you can't afford to get involved, but it's a little late for that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, Mistress, I shall. By your command.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...You found him after all? Because of Zag? That's... how very fortunate for you, Shade.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mistress, for certain it is more than I deserve. Although, perhaps it's for the best that a forgotten shade ought to be put out with the rest of them. I shall not cause you so much trouble, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, if your journeys take you from this House, then... you are nothing but a Shade, and so... there will be others, but... take care, OK?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Honored to have met you, great Achilles, our royal guard! Good to know whom to turn to, should anything run afoul around here. So it was you who instructed my son in the martial ways?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed, Your Grace. He was a talented student. If only you could have seen his progress. Surely you would have been very proud.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am proud! You know, you were already quite the name back on the surface when I lived upon Olympus. I should think your legend's spread much farther still, since then!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I doubt that... although, thank you, Your Grace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've not the faintest doubt that you can do this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go forth, lad, and do as you must.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll keep an eye on things while you're away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't tarry longer than you need to, lad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've nothing left to teach you, lad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fight as though you've but one life to live.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fight like I'd fight out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't come back anytime soon if you can help it, lad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let your instincts take over while you're out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The House is secure, lad. Go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Experience is the greatest teacher, lad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get back out and finish what you started, lad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx and I have matters here under control.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mistakes are opportunities for learning, lad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have your back. No matter what.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ready yourself, lad, and give it another attempt.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no such thing as lesser gods, lad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If ever there is something I can do, you need but ask.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's nothing you cannot achieve. I'm sure of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do not throw away your life as I did mine, lad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It brings me joy knowing you've found something worth fighting for.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have this, lad. The Fates be damned.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have a good heart, lad. Keep listening to it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Shade here was just regaling me about a famous war.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid most of my tales revolve around bloodshed for one reason or another...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...The spear is competent in the right hands, but it can't stop a whip.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must admit, Mistress, I've not enough experience against such a weapon to refute your claim. Quite fortunately so.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Pour another bottle when you've finished with the one there, Shade.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you say, Mistress! Pardon us, here, lad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Achilles, look this really isn't much, but... here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This really is for me? You beat me to it, then, as I had meant to give you this when next we spoke. Please, take it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, this is for me? You really shouldn't have. You're spoiling me rotten...!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I just happen to think you deserve better than you've got down here, Achilles.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, for me...? I can't accept something like this, lad, you know that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Achilles, live a little... such as you're able. I won't tell if you won't tell.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, now this is something, lad! I'd hate to think that you've returned to bring me this just for my sake. Though I'm grateful, really.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've always been there for me, Achilles. Even when Father pushed me away. This is nothing. I don't think I can ever repay you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lad, all this generosity, I... don't want you to get the wrong idea. I am alone, yes, but my heart belongs to another. Ever since I was alive. I hope you understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... somehow knew that was the case, Achilles. I wanted you to have this, anyway, just... don't drown your sorrows, as they seem to make you stronger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, then, and do not worry about me. I am long since past my sorrow, and the rage I felt when first my heart was broken. Now it's but another scar. They say it's our scars that give us character.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lad, all this generosity, I... I'm just an old killer, yet you treat me like I'm the one who's royalty around here. That's about the last thing I would have expected when first I set foot in this House.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You were a great hero, Achilles, and guess what? You still are! And always will be if you ask me. You deserve so much better than just this. I wish there was more that I could do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, then, and do not worry about me. I'm fortunate to be here, and besides... a teacher couldn't have asked for a better pupil.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, I was wondering if you'd split this with me at the lounge. A small excuse for both ourselves to take a break?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you most certain you have time for me now, lad...? Though, how could I decline. I'll see you there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I was a fool, you see. The gods promised me eternal glory beyond death. I could have stayed out of the war. Stayed home with Patroclus. I threw everything away. And sent so very many to this place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's done is done, sir. In my mind you're the greatest warrior who ever lived. So is it glory you still seek, or is it Patroclus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It isn't glory anymore, lad. I'm sure of that. Patroclus, however, I... fear he's gone to me, forever. Although his shade might yet reside within this realm, we left on terms I'd not forgive if I were him. Though... I had better get back to my post now, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I hope I didn't cast a greater pall over this place back there. I'm very thankful that we had this chance to get caught up. Now you had best be off! Take care out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles, next time you're in Elysium, I thought this might be something you'd enjoy. That you might share.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ambrosia... well I am honored, lad, truly. Although it's I who ought to be bestowing thoughtful gifts upon you, for what you've done for me, not the other way around. And, I happen to have one here, on Pat's and my behalf.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's hard to think of anybody more deserving of this than you, sir. So when next you are off duty, or whenever the occasion warrants, please, enjoy, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose this must be what it's like to be a god, lad. Being shown affection such as this. And getting offerings! Are you quite sure?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I'm absolutely positive. I would never have been remotely prepared for everything I've had to face, if not for all your guidance. And, I don't just mean the violent stuff.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come now, lad. Admittedly I was quite good at it, but I was nothing other than a killer. I would be wary of all my advice, if I were you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: See, that's why you give such good advice, right there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here, sir! To you, and to Patroclus. May the remainder of eternity more than make up for everything it took for you to come this far.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, thank you, lad. Prince. Zagreus. You really oughtn't have. In fact, I shall accept this from you once again, but not a bottle more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really? I mean... I meant no offense, of course, it's just... I thought you enjoyed this stuff, no?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We do enjoy it, quite a bit, in fact. But in Elysium... it's something to be earned more than accepted, and, well... perhaps in being there, a bit of our old pride is coming back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, good. You have much to be proud of, Achilles. You're a great warrior. A great instructor. A great friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...If, indeed, I've something to be proud of, lad... it's that someone such as you can say a thing like that to me, and mean it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My word. How very kind of you to think of me with that there, lad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Least I can do for all your guidance, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, now this is something, lad. I'd hate to think that you've returned to bring me this just for my sake. Though I am grateful, really.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've always been there for me, Achilles. Even when Father pushed me away. This is nothing. I don't think I can ever repay you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lad, all this generosity, I... don't want you to get the wrong idea. I am alone, yes, but my heart belongs to another. Ever since I was alive. I hope you understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... somehow knew that was the case, Achilles. I wanted you to have this, anyway, just... don't drown your sorrows, as they seem to make you stronger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, then, and do not worry about me. I am long since past my sorrow, and the rage I felt when first my heart was broken. Now it's but another scar. They say it's our scars that give us character.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going to be the envy of the House with this, I thank you, lad. I hope you wouldn't mind if I shared some of it around?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's yours, Achilles! Though not only do I hope you'll share it, why, I practically insist.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles might be in Elysium I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles must be with Patroclus now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have a Chthonic Companion! And you're giving it to me?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not here to fight you, lad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do not despair, child. Such setbacks are inevitable, and may be overcome with effort, and with time. You made contact with the goddess Athena. She shall be true to her word.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I believe it, Nyx. I'm grateful that you put us into contact. I know you took a considerable risk in reaching out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The risk is not to me. I expected the Olympians would involve themselves in this, eventually. Reveal to them no more than they already know. Are we understood?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It pleases me to speak with you at last, child. So the goddess Athena was true to her word. You and she were wise to use discretion in your task.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I believe it, Nyx. I'm grateful that you put us into contact. I know you took a considerable risk in reaching out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The risk was not to me. It was inevitable that the Olympians would involve themselves in this. The only question was how.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust that the Mirror in your bedchamber has proved satisfactory, dear child...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Better than I could have possibly imagined, Nyx. You mentioned there was something more that it could do, once I had grown accustomed. I think I'm ready for that now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think you are, as well. Then, it shall be as you wish.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Before you go, my child... your father's mood is rather difficult right now. Perhaps just leave him be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx, this may be an odd question, but... do you know what the Fates may have in store for me? They are your daughters, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Three Fates are my daughters, yes, my child. However, I am no more privy to their workings than the naive mortals living up above. Not even the Olympians can know the weavings of the Fates.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Darkness guide you, child. You have outgrown this House, of that I am now certain. Should you return again here, I shall keep you safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I won't forget you, Nyx. I swear it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is more than all right, my child.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Somehow, I always knew. You know... that you were not my birthmother. I mean, look at Hypnos and Thanatos. There's no way that I could have been related to them, everybody knew, and yet... when I finally learned for certain, it was still a shock.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I always knew, in turn, that you would learn the truth of it, eventually. And I was fearful of what would occur after that time arrived. I'm grateful it has come and gone. Though, tell me. I still find I call you child. Is your preference that I cease to use such terms, from this point on?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, Nyx, please, it's... quite all right. You may not have given birth to me, but you still cared for me. I never doubt that. Likewise, are you sure it's all right that I continue to address you by name?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx, you must know something about why Father broke off ties with the Olympians, don't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That is a question only your father can answer, child. I cannot tell you more than you already know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure we can reconcile our disagreements all the same.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to ask you something, Nyx. What is this debt you owe my father, anyway? Forgive my eavesdropping, it's just, I heard the two of you discussing things, and... it came up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I was here long before your father. The responsibility to govern fell to me. Yet, I could not manage on my own. I shape the darkness; ensure the integrity of the domain. I am less prone to census-taking and administering rules. I receded from such responsibilities.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was too much, even for you. So... when father arrived... you welcomed him? He helped?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was quite skeptical of him, at first. I thought his presence merely a cruel trick of Fate. But... he worked diligently, from the start. Soon there was order where once there was none. I fashioned this House for him, and I maintain it still. We remain in partnership. In interdependency.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He has never taken advantage of you? Of your generosity?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, child. He has not. He can be short with me, as you have seen. But that is the extent of it. We have found ways to reconcile disagreements. Though, your relationship with him... it is more complicated than my own, I fear...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx, all you've done to help me, with the Olympians, the Mirror, the House Contractor, I... I worry that if Father were to know, that he would turn his wrath upon you. I don't want anything to happen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You need not fear for me, my child. For I am not some underling your father has authority to punish if it pleases him. I am the Night; and it is by my grace that this House stands. Your father knows this. Thus, he and I have certain common goals. We are obligated to cooperate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then... if there's really nothing he can do, why go along with his deception? About my birthmother, I mean?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please... that is something I am not at liberty to say. When you meet your birthmother eventually... you shall understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You need not fear for me, my child. For I am not some underling your father has authority to punish if it pleases him. I am the Night; and it is by my grace that this House stands. Your father knows this. Thus, he and I have certain common goals. We are obligated to cooperate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Obligated to cooperate... no wonder I thought you two truly were husband and wife.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father and I... sometimes convince ourselves.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard lately from the goddess Athena, Nyx. She seems to admire you. I thought Olympians didn't like our kind?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They typically do not. But, you are family, child. And I, why... I believed Athena wise enough to understand why someone such as I would seek her, in particular. She has, in turn, made others in her family aware.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah. I see. I guess. I think?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Athena sends you her kindest regards, Nyx. Sounds like you have maintained some correspondence since all this began?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We have, thank you, my child. Goddess Athena is reputed to be wise, and so she was the one I felt was the most likely to listen to reason, understand my view, and ultimately have a willingness to help. It is most fortunate that I was not mistaken about her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But... you told her you're my mother. If she's supposedly so wise... isn't that quite a risk? If she finds out you've been misleading her...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She is wise, child. It is precisely for that reason I expected she would understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Athena sends you her kindest regards, Nyx. Sounds like you have maintained some correspondence since all this began?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We have, thank you, my child. Goddess Athena is reputed to be wise, and so she was the one I felt was the most likely to listen to reason, understand my view, and ultimately have a willingness to help. It is most fortunate that I was not mistaken about her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, Nyx, at first I thought I maybe should ignore this, but I wanted to give you greetings from Lord Ares, who seems rather interested in you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, yes, the god of war. Among all the Olympians, he often struck me as much more accepting of our kind, born of the Underworld.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're not... wait, you're not interested in him, I mean, he's... murderous... polite, though, I don't know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I take an interest in whomever I take interest in, my child. I thank you for the message.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Nyx, erm, Lord Ares wanted you to know, and I believe I quote, that 'I am often thinking of her here'. Take that for what it's worth?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall, thank you, my child. If the god of war is thus preoccupied with me, well then, perhaps he shall be slower to send droves of mortals to our doorstep here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hear from them rather a lot, myself....
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Help me, Nyx. Or rather, help yourself. Lord Ares seeks for me to put the two of you in contact. I mean... I don't know why I'm getting so defensive, here, now that I think on it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do not concern yourself with my ability to navigate my interpersonal relationships, my child. It pleases me Lord Ares told you this. Those of Olympus rarely say such things, to any of us here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx, did you really start a correspondence with Lord Ares, as he put it to me recently? Is everything all right with you and him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: His interest in the Underworld is genuine, and he does not regard me as beneath him, even if the technicality exists. The Olympians and the chthonic gods... we have much left to learn of one another's kind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What of Father? He's forbidden any contact whatsoever!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have repeatedly received such contact, all despite your father's wishes, child.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx, did you really start a correspondence with Lord Ares, as he put it to me recently? Is everything all right with you and him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: His interest in the Underworld is genuine, and he does not regard me as beneath him, even if the technicality exists. The Olympians and the chthonic gods... we have much left to learn of one another's kind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know. I know. You're right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're going to meet Ares, sometime, Nyx? Or maybe you already have?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is your concern, exactly, child? Speak plain with me, or else take not my time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I... it's just, Ares, he's... I don't know, he just doesn't seem your type! And isn't he a little young for you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You do not understand the basis of our friendship, child. Lord Ares may not meet the moral standard of the mortals who hate him, or Olympians who shun him, but to me? He is cordial and eager to learn. I am quite capable of forming my own views on him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, Nyx, I... Ares sends you his regards again. Wanted to let you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, my child. We may seldom have occasion to encounter one another, he and I, but it is good to have another friend upon Olympus. Even if goddess Athena and he are not on the best of terms.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Olympians can't really see me, can they, Nyx? I mean, not very well. I get that they can sense details here and there, but... they don't know the full extent of what's going on. Are we really so far beyond their influence?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are enshrouded from them, child. For your own benefit, and theirs. They know as much as necessary to assist. And I trust they shall, for as long as you require. They are bound to one another as family. And they know that you require aid. Do not be too prideful to accept.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was pleased to see an order pending approval for the release of Orpheus with the House Contractor, Nyx. If Father wants him to start singing again, locking him in Tartarus doesn't seem like the most efficient way to go about it. Besides, I think he's suffered enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father found a certain peace from song, my child. Perhaps with this reprieve, our Orpheus shall reconsider and resume his craft.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're worried Father doesn't have enough live music to enjoy while brooding over his gloomy court?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father's temperament is easier to navigate when he is in relatively better spirits. And my opinion is that punishing the court musician does not further your father's goal with him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you enjoy Orpheus' singing, Nyx? He seems a bit concerned that you might not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am amenable to the consonance of his harmonies, child.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't suppose the name Skelly happens to mean anything to you, does it, Nyx?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It means nothing to me at all, my child. Though, why do you invoke such names within this House? Who is this Skelly, and what do you presume is the connection that exists between us?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I... well, essentially, he is an animated skeleton who shows up just outside my bedchambers, and lets me practice with my weapons on him. I sort of figured that you put him up to it. So it wasn't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles moves throughout these chambers under my own shroud, if you must know. And thus you have in your possession the Infernal Arms. But, I have not exerted further influence than that. Is this skeleton to be trusted, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I finally made it to the surface, Nyx! Confronted Father, there, out in the cold. I couldn't make it past him, but... I was so close!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do not despair, as I told you before. With effort and with time, most any setback can be overcome. Even your father. You have come closer to your goal. Achieve it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father is not here, and you are back. Then, it can only mean one thing. Are you all right, my child?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, I think so, Nyx. Returning here by Father's hand does put a special sting into it, though. So, any invaluable tips on how to vanquish him? Some hidden weaknesses only you know about, something like that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know his weaknesses better than anyone. Better even than he. It pains me to know that the conflict between you could not be settled in some other way. But if this is how it has to be... destroy him for me, next you fight up there. However long it takes. Would you do that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have been served a Pact of Punishment, now, child. I thought to talk your father out of it, at first, but... it may serve to let you grow your power, even more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Something about setbacks building character, I guess? I didn't take you for someone to look on the bright side of things, Nyx.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is a point of fact. If you can overcome the conditions of the Pact, your influence throughout this realm shall surely grow. Though, do not overextend, of course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thank you for the lovely flowers, child. They make my corner of the House hospitable. Such simple comforts never were for me, and yet... now that I am surrounded by them, I have found that I enjoy their presence, more than I would have admitted in the past.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm glad you like them, Nyx. Though if you don't, just give the word, and I will have them removed. Probably incinerated for good measure! Now that you mention it, though, how come you are always in this corner in particular?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This point is closest to the center of the House. To its foundation. And, therefore, to the center of the entire realm.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you ever get lonely down here, Nyx...? For companionship, I mean, because... I mean, just look at you, you're very beautiful, the night herself! There's nothing you can't do. When I was younger, I thought you and father, you know, but... is there not someone else?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How very forward of you, child. I accept your compliment. Although, I am the Night, as you observe. The night conceals all. I know nothing of the loneliness which you describe. This entire realm... it is a part of me. And many of its subjects sprang from me, alone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You appear to have grown stronger since when last we interacted, child. Your bedroom mirror may appear to be the cause... but then of course the real cause is you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sense the growing darkness in you, child. I am so very proud of you. You always have been capable, yet now, you seem to radiate with newfound power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The unfathomable power of the Underworld thrives within you, child. Your godliness has grown since last we spoke; you have learned much of harnessing the dark.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even among those born longest ago within the deepest reaches of the Underworld... I have seldom encountered anyone so united with the Darkness of this domain as you are, child.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: United with the Darkness? I've just... been picking it up here and there. Although, for quite a while, since you mention it! I'm not sure that I feel any different, though.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Surely that is not so. Think back on when you started all of this. You now know so much more. Are capable of so much more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have revealed every facet of the Mirror of Night, child. The full extent of its power. I was aware this was possible, yet... you achieved it sooner than expected.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know where I'd be without it. Probably still in Tartarus trying to get past Meg. I only wish I could get even stronger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Mirror has little to do with your power, let alone your capability. You may deactivate its effects and see for yourself. It merely gave you greater opportunity to learn. And you shall continue to do so.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx... I have to ask you something. Are you certain that my search isn't in vain? My mother, what if... what if she's gone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your mother yet lives. There can be no other explanation. For, if she did not, she would be with us, here.... She was a good woman. Stately, kind. I wished to raise you as I thought she would have.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx, sometimes I get the impression the Olympians look down on those of us born of the Underworld. Is that my imagination, or, what do you make of it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The gods of Mount Olympus tend to think themselves above us, child. Or so your father often likes to say. He alone was relegated to this realm, and grew resentful of his relatives on high.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have met most of your Olympian relatives by now, child. Although the power of their blessings is fleeting here, they shall continue to support you. As long as necessary.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They all still think I'm headed to join them on Olympus. That's why they're helping me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They are helping you because you are family. Family with whom they do not yet have a complicated past.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx... the Olympians have been immensely helpful, but... did they really have to get mixed up in all this? I could have gone off on my own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And you would not have gone far, child. Your father is too proud to accept assistance in personal matters. Do not cede the advantage that you have.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But I'm misleading them. Taking advantage of their good graces trying to find Mother. What if they find out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall do everything within my power to prevent this, as shall you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... I trust you Nyx. I do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx, can you... tell me more about my birthmother? Anything at all. What was she like, when you first met? What did you think of her?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your birthmother left a strong impression on us, child. It was apparent she was from a far-off place, and yet... she brought with her a lightness I had not experienced before. My first impression soon subsided, and I grew to care for her. You possess many of her finer qualities.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finer qualities? Such as abandoning her family members? Why did she leave? Why won't you tell me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please... you must not ask such things of me. I swore a binding oath never to say. I have already circumvented it as much as can be done. Go find her, child. Then, you shall understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx, can you... tell me more about my birthmother? Anything at all. What was she like, when you first met? What did you think of her?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your birthmother left a strong impression on us, child. It was apparent she was from a far-off place, and yet... she brought with her a lightness I had not experienced before. My first impression soon subsided, and I grew to care for her. You possess many of her finer qualities.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll find her, then. I have to.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx, if I can ever make my way from here, out to the surface... how do you know that I can find her? The instructions you gave me... how can you know for sure that's where she is, that she hasn't left, or...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When your birthmother departed, I bent the light for her, shrouding her path, though I myself could see it. I trust she remains there, and that I am not betraying her confidence by telling you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father fell to you, as once his father fell to him. Although, you were substantially more merciful. I know it is a bitter victory, at best. Though, tell me... what transpired subsequently, that you have returned? Did you locate your birthmother?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did, I... she was there. She was... where you said she'd be. And, more than I imagined, but... I had so little time with her. I can't survive up there, for very long. Why didn't you tell me I'd just die, no matter what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, my child... I say this seldomly, but... I did not know. Or... I did not wish to believe... that the surface would have such an effect on you. But it seems you share your father's fate, after all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My father's fate? But he is smugly waiting for me every single time I make it there, and seems quite healthy by then, all in all! Though... maybe the farther we get from this realm... the worse we get. Because he cast his lot... inheriting the Underworld?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So I now presume. You are bound to this realm by powers greater even than mine. Tell me something... if you knew that you could only see Persephone for but a moment's time... would you still make the journey to her, there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Yes. Yes, I would. I had so many questions left for her!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then, go and ask them, child. Steady your resolve, and find her there, again. And use well what brief time you have with one another, whilst you can. As mortals do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father fell to you, as once his father fell to him. Although, you were substantially more merciful. I know it is a bitter victory, at best. Though, tell me... what transpired subsequently, that you have returned? Did you locate your birthmother?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did, I... she was there. She was... where you said she'd be. And, more than I imagined, but... I had so little time with her. I can't survive up there, for very long. Why didn't you tell me I'd just die, no matter what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, my child... I say this seldomly, but... I did not know. Or... I did not wish to believe... that the surface would have such an effect on you. But it seems you share your father's fate, after all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My father's fate? But he was smugly waiting for me up there, and seemed quite healthy, all in all! Though... maybe the farther we get from this realm... the worse we get. Because he cast his lot... inheriting the Underworld?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So I now presume. You are bound to this realm by powers greater even than mine. Tell me something... if you knew that you could only see Persephone for but a moment's time... would you still make the journey to her, there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Yes. Yes, I would. I had so many questions left for her!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then, go and ask them, child. Steady your resolve, and find her there, again. And use well what brief time you have with one another, whilst you can. As mortals do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx... why did you never send word to Mother that I lived? You knew at least approximately where she went. You and Father... you could have spared her so much pain!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I swore a binding oath never to say, child. I have already circumvented it as much as can be done. Know that we... that I acted with only her wellbeing in mind. As well as yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx... you saved my life. Gave me life. When I was born. Father told me. I don't know what to say. Why didn't you tell me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There are many things that I am not at liberty to speak of, child. Through my own binding choice. These circumstances are among them. Suffice it to say that your revival... required the extent of my ability. And considerable time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never should have been born... is that what the Fates wanted? Did you defy your own daughters?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Silence. Tempt not my daughters thus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How is she, child? Queen Persephone, I mean. Has she been well up there, in her abode? What is it like?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She's doing well, I think. It's nice to visit her. Her residence is beautiful. A little home nestled amid the cold. All of these plants, in bloom! It's difficult even to describe. And very bright, as well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That sounds quite pleasant for someone who values brightness, I suppose. Well, then... I trust your visits are worthwhile for the both of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx, my mother was quite concerned to learn Olympus has been aiding me. Did you... haven't you... put her in danger by involving them? Was there no other way?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. There was not. She has been in danger, all along. I concealed her, yes. Even from me. But, it is not enough. I do not think that you could have found her without the Olympians. And, if I did not reveal your existence to them... if they discovered who you are... it would be worse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ugh, what a mess. How are we going to fix this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Olympians maintain belief that you are trying to reach them. I trust we can sustain this understanding for a long, long time. Perhaps not forever, but... long enough to discover a solution. Perhaps with your birthmother's help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've said more than enough. I'll see you, Nyx.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Child, quickly now, before you go. I know how all of this must look. Know that I was true to her. Persephone. And, that I think fondly on the time she spent with us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, Nyx, though... why did she really leave the Underworld, do you think? Besides because of me. So what if she thought I died at birth?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She did not feel that she belonged. It was a very difficult adjustment she was forced to make. And... she feared that she would inevitably end up caught between Olympus and this realm. That she might start a war.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A war... wars have been fought for less, I understand. And, Father must have been a real burden, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You do not know. Ask her yourself, about her time with him. But... I have already said too much. And I cannot say more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is the matter, child? I sense your distress, not the specific cause.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother doesn't want to see me again. I mean... she asked me not to return. Thinks the risk is too great.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh. That is a fair-enough assessment. What shall you do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father loved her, didn't he? Mother, I mean. Faith like that... he's just stubborn enough to hold onto the idea of her, isn't he? Though, what she saw in him, I'm not sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father was different with Persephone, to some extent. He has always been as you know him, yet... her lightness... it affected even him, I think. And he knows... that he was better with her, than without.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds like a lot of pressure on Mother to fix all his failings... but, it sounds as though she cared for him, as well. And you, and Cerberus. She said she misses you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess obscurity does have its perks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx, why is it the mortals come here knowing all about Olympus, while knowing so little about what goes on in our realm? Is there something more we could be doing to help spread the word?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This realm remains enshrouded and obscure by my design and by your father's will, my child. Tell me, what would be the benefit of the attention you would seek?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I... I don't know, it's just, for all the famous gods and monsters and the like, it seems to me that someone such as you, who does so much, why... you should be at least as known as any one of them!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Obscurity is not a weakness, child. Are we understood? Seek to be valuable, not to be known. If you are valuable, then fame or notoriety can be a consequence. Should they become a burden... I can help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have encountered setbacks within Asphodel, have you not, child? The Bloodless shades residing there are eager to bring death to any form of life. Beware of their infernal power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have confronted the Exalted Shades within Elysium, my child. Your father offers them a handsome bounty should they bring your journey to an end. Although, I think the pride of vanquishing you would more than suffice in getting them to take up arms again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do as you must. Your victory is within reach.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You nearly gained the surface, child. Considerable progress. Though, the setbacks that you faced within the Temple... if it is of any consolation, the foes you faced there have been quite a burden to your father, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, Father can't control the pest problem? Never thought I'd be of any help rampaging through the upper levels of his domain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I saw you took possession of the List of Minor Prophecies, of the Three Fates. As ever, I should never have doubted my daughters' expectations. I was uncertain you had necessary guidance to select it from among the House Contractor's many opportunities.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You offer something called the Fated List of Minor Prophecies to me, chances are I'm going to pick it up. Though, you make it sound like there's more I should know about it. Should I be concerned?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know exactly what is necessary, and no more. I know better than anyone never to tamper with the Fates' design. Though, if they had cruelty in store for you through their List... I think that I would warn you, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have fulfilled already many prophecies envisioned by my daughters, child. Although perhaps inevitable, I find it impressive, nonetheless.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, Nyx. Though, they're just minor prophecies, right? The kind that won't necessarily come to pass unless spelled out and coupled with a decent reward to make it worth my while. Not even the Fates are above greasing the wheels of progress, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Fates have perfect knowledge of exactly what is necessary for the future they have woven to someday come to pass. We each are instrumental to their ultimate design. Some more than others, it would seem, of course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sense all of the minor prophecies described within the Fated List have been fulfilled...? I do not understand how that is possible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, it certainly took some doing, and several of those really were rather difficult, and took some time, but... what's so special about getting through them all? It's a list, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Fates are always at their weaving. To have caught up with their designs... well, I should think that they shall have to learn to weave a little faster, perhaps.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Any new prophecies need fulfilling, they know where to find me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sense all of the minor prophecies described within the Fated List have been fulfilled...? I do not understand how that is possible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, it certainly took some doing, and several of those really were rather difficult, and took some time, but... what's so special about getting through them all? It's a list, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Fates are always at their weaving. To have caught up with their designs... well, I should think that they shall have to learn to weave a little faster, perhaps.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Any new prophecies need fulfilling, they know where to find me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it, child? Is something amiss?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, it's just... the latest renovations from the Contractor... Father told me you've been supervising all of that. Look, just between us, and I'll not speak of it again, but... thanks. So much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah. Yes, no need to speak of it again. Though, I am pleased to oblige.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This House is not a place of cheer, child. A certain severity always struck me as appropriate, if not necessary, given our role.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is this about all the House Contractor decorations? Look, it's one thing if Father objects, but if you do as well... just tell me, and I can have it taken down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You misunderstand. I am grateful. These changes... I would not have commissioned them, myself. But, seeing them now... I appreciate their presence. You have a discerning eye.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx, if, hypothetically, I felt that some injustice had been dealt to someone who deserved a better lot... say, that they were subjected to too harsh a punishment for all eternity... don't I have some of my father's authority to do something about it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that you have regained your access privileges to the administrative chamber, child, yes; that is a level of authority you hypothetically possess, again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But how can I possibly find anything in there? The place is wall-to-wall pacts and parchments. I've no idea where to look.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can be made aware. Though, use discretion, if and when you need to exercise this power. And make certain that the time is right. Now, are we understood?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never thought that the administrative chamber would have been so invaluable, Nyx. Though, I have you to thank for all of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nonsense, child. Our records must be kept up-to-date. You merely observed that several were long past due. Not even your father can argue with that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx... I encountered Demeter. She mentioned her daughter... Persephone. You never said she was my grandmother. Didn't you think... under the circumstances... that was something I should know?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Listen to me, child. What you know, or do not know, is for your protection. Your protection, and your birthmother's, as well. Your suspicion and your curiosity are warranted. But I can do no more about them, now, except to caution you. Are we understood?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx, I've come to know the god of swiftness, Hermes, though... it seems to me he doesn't work directly with the others on Olympus. Do you know him well?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Hermes is a point of contact, yes. Among Olympians he works the closest with our operations here, and aids with shepherding the souls of the departed to our gates. Accept his help; for he is faithful to our cause.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well I think you did great, if you ask me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Someday I'd like to meet more of your children, Nyx. Eris, Nemesis... Thanatos told me of several others. Have they ever visited the House?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. They are required elsewhere. It is for the best. Some of my children are not on speaking terms with one another, or with me. As a mother... one has her victories, and her defeats.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx, I was just busy doing some administrative chamber record-keeping recently, and, wouldn't you know, it somehow slipped my mind where I could find the sentencing parchmentwork for the knave-king Sisyphus, forced to toil out in Tartarus? I ran it by Megaera...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He has offered you aid, repeatedly. At first I saw it for a brazen act of bribery, but... try as I might, there was no deeper underpinning to his actions that I could detect. That is to say... the records you seek may be found in section sigma-phi-alpha, lower gamma folder.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I waived the punishment-sentence for Sisyphus the knave-king, Nyx, except... he chose to stay! He chose to stay, in Tartarus, I think in part because he likes getting to speak with me, from time to time! Also his boulder friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That sounds to be an agreeable outcome for him. Though, his liberty is not the end of his rehabilitation. As his friend... please make certain he does not run afoul again of your father, child.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, Nyx, you ever have a burning urge to find the case files for the circumstances under which our court-musician bound himself to eternal servitude here in this House, and forever lost his opportunity to be with his beloved muse? I was wondering if you had a remedy for that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our court musician brings a certain peace to this abode, my child. But, you may discover, once you find his case files in section zeta-pi-omega, upper beta folder, that the consequences that he suffers may be quite in excess of his trespasses...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't know how pleased I was to see Orpheus visiting with his muse Eurydice over in Asphodel. Best of all... I don't think he's left for good. He'll just have some time to visit her now and again! Thank you, Nyx, on their behalf, and mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You need not thank me, child. Your actions made this outcome possible. I merely did what anyone in my position would have done.
label: CHARACTER
