dialogue: Tsk... I've always lacked your optimism, Zag. Anyway... the work has waited long enough, I need to get back to it. Thanks for the drink.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Watch yourself out there, Zagreus. I have to go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanatos, I've meant to ask... is it really the case that many mortals have a crippling fear of death?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is, I'm quite feared, up there. Most of them cannot distinguish between me, and, say, Lord Ares, or your father, even. We fill them with despair. No helping it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why not? I mean, isn't it kind of a big problem that they have such negative associations, here? Can't we... I don't know, do something to educate them all?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've all the time to educate them, here. Their ignorance of death is solved almost as soon as they experience their first. Though I suppose they might be better off knowing before the fact.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Didn't know you saw it that way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Than? I had another question about death. So... why is it mortals grieve so much about the thing, I mean... it definitely hurts there for a little while, but... it's not that bad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They see it as their one and only chance. Imagine if, after you perished, that was it. Back to the infinite Chaos. Everything about you. Returned to how it was before you were even there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But that's absurd. One life? Though... eugh. That's horrible, even to think about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know, right? Some of them know that isn't how it is, and try to tell their kind about what it is we do here, but... it's slow going, getting the information out. Either way! I get to be the bearer of good news.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Than? Something's been troubling me still, with what you said, about how mortals look at death. If most of them believe their life is all they have... how do they live? I mean, I can't even imagine what that's like. I'd be a lot more careful, at the very least!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They live with all their hearts, or at least try. I think there's something to it, truthfully. Though, some of them, they fall apart. They get here without me. On their own, gripped with despair. If only they knew what your father always says about all this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, you mean that 'there is no escape'? From what? The mortals are up there, not here. Not while they're technically alive in their sense, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I mean, you can't escape your problems, Zagreus. You can run from your family, but you can't run from everything. You have no choice but to confront it, and work through it, sooner or later, one way or another. You, and all of us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I'm starting to notice that, yes. Though, to a mortal who has yet to die... don't they think of death as some sort of release? You come to end their misery, something like that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can release them from their decaying bodies. Sometimes, the Fates demand I bring them in sooner. That's about as much as I can do. Some of them get it early on, how to live. It's quite impressive, really, that they learn so quick.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, just how far are you able to shift, anyway, Than? I never could go more than a blade's length in front of me, while you're out there skipping across the entire world probably.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Most of it, yes. Don't beat yourself up, though, Zagreus. It's a practiced skill but I've apparently been able to do it since birth. Mother Nyx says I was a real handful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, what is it you're always staring at out there, anyway, Than? I don't see anything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The River Styx is right in front of you, and you don't see anything, Zag? I can watch it endlessly. Studying the competition, you might say. Most mortals expect to get here by river, with Charon. Not with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you're locked in ruthless battle with a river, searching it for any signs of weakness, that sort of thing? That sounds stressful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I find it rather soothing as a matter of fact. A break from having to deal constantly with mortal souls. Speaking of which... I have to pick somebody up right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Than, my blade, the one I'm borrowing from Father anyway, it... revealed to me an older aspect of itself, of Nemesis. Nyx never mentions her. Have you two ever met?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In case you haven't noticed, most of us who sprang from Nyx, we're not exactly close. Nemesis is fully occupied meting out justice on the surface. Our paths are not designed to cross. And based on everything I know, that's fine with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How's that Rail of Adamant been working out for you lately? Always figured the direct approach was more your style. Though, I happened to have a look at your permanent record lately, and turns out you're doing a lot of work with that thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, Thanatos, you're learning to pry in others' business! The Rail's been working out just fine, thanks. Though, now that you mention it, how well do you know Eris, one of Nyx's daughters, right? Seems she wielded the Rail before me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The mortals call her Strife. She and her children... it's thanks partly to their dedicated efforts I'm so busy all the time. Though, it is best we didn't speak of her, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanatos, I ought have asked by now, but... what's it like? Up there I mean, outside. You never talk about it, I... almost forget that's where you go, for work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can I say? It's... different. I never stay up there for very long, don't think I could, starts making me feel ill. Too many sensations all at once. And when the chariot of Helios is in the sky, it gets so bright that I can barely see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That sounds awful. If it's that bad, why would all the Olympians chat it up so much?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no accounting for their taste, I guess. But, I'm discounting certain aspects that are not so bad. You know what? I'll not spoil the surprise. I have a feeling you're going to see for yourself soon enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanatos, I ought have asked by now, but... what's it like? Up there I mean, outside. You never talk about it, I... almost forget that's where you go, for work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can I say? It's... different. I never stay up there for very long, don't think I could, starts making me feel ill. Too many sensations all at once. And when the chariot of Helios is in the sky, it gets so bright that I can barely see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That sounds awful. If it's that bad, why would all the Olympians chat it up so much?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no accounting for their taste, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's going on with Charon, by the way, if you can tell me, Than? He's... never been particularly talkative, but he really seems to know the inner workings of this place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I correspond with Charon all the time, but even I don't know the full extent of his responsibilities. He's an independent contractor of sorts, been here forever. Your father gives him plenty of space to work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He must be compensated pretty well for having done this for so long. Tending the influx of new souls and all of that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I doubt he's in it for the compensation, Zagreus. There is no Underworld without Charon. I think he knows that, and your father knows it, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, were you ever close with Charon, Than? Seems like no matter how much I try, I can't quite get through to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wouldn't be surprised if you were closer to him than I am. Not all of Nyx's sons and daughters keep in steady touch. Though at least we're not always at each others' throats, like the other side of your family.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did he really think that far ahead...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Than, you're not going to believe this, but... Charon's been helping me. All on his own, apparently! I was so sure that Nyx or someone put him up to it. That Skelly character I mentioned, Charon hired him!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you talking about, Zagreus? Just because Charon's selling you things doesn't mean he's helping you. Wait, are you sure?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure! His helper, Skelly, he's a lot more talkative, and finally let on. Although, he couldn't tell me how come Charon did a thing like this, I mean... we weren't ever close...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm. All I can think of is... Charon's very dedicated to this House. Like some of us. Maybe he thought... he could help settle things, between you and your father. One way or another.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Than, now hypothetically, if I were to have vanquished Charon in single combat after having, I don't know, say, helped myself to one of his wares at no charge, how long would you say he'd hold it over me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everything is an exchange with Charon, Zag. If there was something you refused to pay for, then I'm going to assume that's why you're back here, now. The debt is paid in obols, or in blood. Or their closest counterparts, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Than, level with me on this. You didn't happen to hire a shifty character called Skelly to assist me here and there, did you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who, what? No. Why would you even ask?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Radiance, huh... doesn't sound like Father at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do you remember anything else about my mother, Than? Just, anything. You weren't close, I guess?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We weren't. She kept to herself as I recall, and I would do the same. Unlike my present company, I do not ask too many questions. It was quite clear to me she wasn't from this place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father isn't from this place, either. How was she any different?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sometimes I have to be reminded that Lord Hades wasn't born here, like the rest of us. But Persephone, she... she had a radiance about her, I suppose. Reminded me of the outside, but... I don't mean that in a negative respect.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Than, you don't hold a grudge against old Sisyphus, do you? He seems rather apprehensive about you. I understand you met not on the best of terms.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He is a brazen one, I have to give him that. I hadn't realized that you were close. Despite some questionable choices on your part, I don't think you're the poorest judge of character, and so... maybe I have him wrong.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I only have a faint impression of the man he used to be, although it seems he's changed a lot, since then. Thank you for understanding, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard you stayed the knave-king's sentence. I should be angry with you. Sisyphus must be the only mortal ever to have humiliated me. But Mother Nyx, she... must have backed you, didn't she...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We did what needed to be done. As much as Father likes making examples out of wretched shades, an eternal sentence felt a little excessive in this case. Besides... Sisyphus isn't leaving, anyway. Seems to have found his niche.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh? Well, he's an odd one through and through, I guess. As long as I don't have to deal with him again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You and Achilles ever get to talk much, Than?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have my orders, he has his. What do you think? Even back when he was still alive, there was no real chance I was going to be the one to take him here, given his line of work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Because he was a warrior. When mortals die a violent death, they're no longer your case, are they?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. I tend to those in less of a hurry to come here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is. I think it is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your trainer's been absent from his post, more so than usual. You voided his pact with Lord Hades, didn't you? I don't know how you did it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know he's more than my trainer, Than. As for how I did it, turns out being the first and only son of Hades has its privileges. Now Achilles gets to be with someone he loves. Who loves him back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Love is common among mortals. Is theirs really so special as to be worth the trouble? Not just on your part, but theirs?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've seen a lot of Megaera lately, haven't you, Zag?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not like that, Than. She's there to slow me down. Get in my way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you insist. Although I think it's much more complicated than you say.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah... her sisters are back. They're... hard to deal with. I don't think Meg is on good terms with either one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's not what I meant. But fine, you've told me all I need to know, for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You and Meg go back a long way, don't you? I forget sometimes you two are pretty close.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our responsibilities must have us cross paths often, yes. But I didn't really get to know her until after the whole humiliating affair with Sisyphus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, right. He got stuck in Tartarus after that, under Meg's personal supervision. So you bonded over your shared disdain for Sisyphus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We each had to blow off some steam, yes. That was some of the hardest I ever worked, back then, and her, too, I think. When you go through something like that with someone, it brings you closer, I suppose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Than, there's something that I meant to tell you. Ask you, rather. You're close with Megaera, so, what I mean is... you know about us, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, of course. Why do you ask?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, it's just... I figured since you deal with mortals all the time, I know that some of them, they choose a single suitor. It's a valid custom, if it's yours...!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The mortals have their customs, yes, indeed. Quite a variety, in point of fact. However, none as yet have stuck with me, I think. So don't concern yourself with things like that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're saying you're not angry with me? Or Meg, for that matter?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not any more than usual. Tell her that I said hello when next you meet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Than, you don't take issue with me being close with Dusa, do you? She brings such warmth to this place... I really appreciate having her here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't need to ask me such things, Zagreus. They're your feelings.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Than, what's your relationship with Ares on Olympus? I know he deals in death himself, but... his approach seems rather different from your own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do not care for his approach at all. But he has been professionally courteous with me. More than I can say for most of your Olympian relatives, I suppose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean the rest of the Olympians don't treat you well?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Discounting Hermes, I should say, the rest of them have nothing much to do with me at all. I can imagine why, I know it's complicated with your father here. But as for Ares... I think he's all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Than? I thought you ought to know that Ares, he... I think he's taken quite an interest in Nyx. Keeps asking me to talk to her on his behalf.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finally. It's about time Olympus took notice of Mother and all her accomplishments.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finally? You don't think Ares has untoward intentions or anything like that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He'd be a hollow fool if he did. Why do you think they fear us on Olympus, Zagreus? Because of Hypnos? I don't think Mother Nyx requires your concern. Though, by all means, talk to her about it, if you like.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Least I could do for all she's done for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother Nyx told me you restored the Eldest Sigil, Zagreus. I couldn't believe that was your doing. What you did... it meant a lot to her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was my pleasure. Say, did Nyx ever let on to you of her relationship with Chaos, at any point?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, not everyone is quite as sharing as you are, Zag. Nor as inclined to pry. But still... in this case, sounds like it worked out. So, thank you. If she hasn't said as much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can tell when Mother Nyx is upset, Zagreus. And I know better than to ask her, so I'm going to ask you. What happened?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Probably because Nyx took issue with me chatting with Dusa from time to time. Is that really so unbecoming of me? Not even Father seems to care.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Mother cares! And I, for one, know better than to question it. None of us would be here were it not for her. If she has a request for you, you honor it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're telling me I should just start ignoring Dusa from now on, like you do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're a god. I'm telling you to learn to act like one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry I raised my voice with you last time, Than. I know Nyx puts so much into this place, and has nurtured so many of us here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not me you should be apologizing to, Zag. Although, with Mother Nyx, sometimes it's best to leave her be. As for Dusa... I didn't mean to suggest you should abandon your friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx let her go, Than. Dusa, I mean, she's gone. What do I do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If I were you, I would start getting over it as soon as possible. But, I don't see you doing that. Just remember... maybe this isn't about you. Dusa's job may have been far too much for her. Mother Nyx is strict, but she is fair.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then she should give Dusa another chance. Has Meg heard? She'll be furious.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Megaera will be no such thing. Some of us don't default to questioning every decision from our superiors.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't think we have to worry about that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I saw that Dusa's back. You must have worked your ways on Mother Nyx. Don't know how you do it. Can't remember the last time I saw her budge on anything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx genuinely cares about this House and all of us. She had to come around on something like this. Dusa's one of the hardest workers here. Even if she has room to improve.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Incessant hard work can lead to trouble, Zagreus. I think maybe that's why Mother was concerned. We all know how your father can get. She doesn't need someone like Dusa taking after him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's like an annoying little brother to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Than, you know, Hypnos, he adores you. Besides just driving you to madness, now and then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm rather used to the relationship, thanks, Zagreus. Seems like you got to know him pretty well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, dying repeatedly can end up bringing people closer, I suppose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know what's worse, dying repeatedly or Hypnos. Although, I guess I'm grateful for your patience with him, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got to tell you something, Than. You can be pretty mean to Hypnos! And that's coming from someone who's mean to Hypnos a lot. Believe me, I completely understand, but... still.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's utterly incompetent, Zag. He wouldn't even be here if Mother Nyx wasn't trying to whip him into some sort of shape.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, but... pretty much none of this would be here, were it not for Nyx, right? Anyway my point is not that you should go easy on him, but... there must be some way not to get as frustrated. You'll both be better off.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know, it's just...! You're right. I catch myself feeling particularly horrid after talking to him. He can be very frustrating, and self-absorbed... though, I know he means well. Probably.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Who doesn't have room for improvement, though, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can hardly believe it. Hypnos finally came out on top, huh? Even Father seemed pleased with him. That's more than I get.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can hardly believe it either, Zagreus. But then again, he's one of Mother Nyx's offspring, so we shouldn't be so surprised. Though, I have to thank you for talking to me about him a while back...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, that? I noticed you two getting along better recently. So what's your secret?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He loves lists. Doesn't do well with subtlety, so much, but spell things out for him, and he will get right on it. Long as he's awake, at least. He's still working on that part.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I saw you voided the old pact between Orpheus and your father. So now he gets to see his wife from time to time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He does, and I did, Than. I think we can stand to see a little less of him if it means he can be happier for the remainder of eternity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You really need to learn to stop meddling in others' affairs. Did either of them even ask your help? I can't imagine Orpheus did, and I'm guessing his wife's feelings were complicated, too, from what I know of the circumstances of their final meeting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Orpheus is my mate, Than. And I came to know his muse, Eurydice, as well. They still had feelings for each other, but with no way to communicate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you decided to step in. Tsch. I think my instincts on the subject are just not the same as yours. I know your intentions were in the right place, but... you know what, forget it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I saw the Fated List of Minor Prophecies was requisitioned through the House Contractor, Zagreus. Didn't take you for an agent of the Fates.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Turns out I'm full of surprises, Thanatos. Though, the Three Fates are your sisters, aren't they? Surprised you didn't requisition the List yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Guess it just wasn't meant to be. Though, I don't know them at all. Keep only to themselves, somewhere. Sometimes I wonder whether everything really is preordained, or whether they're making all this up as they go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You took Lord Hades down... you really did. I've never seen him quite like this before. I could scarce believe it when he came up through the Pool of Styx, himself...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Seemed only fair in the grand scheme of things. He slew his own parents at some point, right? I think the Fates enjoy this sort of thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Zag, take some credit where it's due. Though... you'll forgive me if I keep my distance for a little while, as I think you have some issues to resolve. You watch yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...You're really staying, Zagreus? I mean... between the generally ill-conceived attempts to reach the surface every so often.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am. I figured it's the only way I could continue interrupting you while you try to do your job. You work too hard, Than, live a little, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heh. Well then, I'll see what I can do about that. You'll have to show me what you mean by 'live a little', though.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have to tell you something, Than. My birthmother... she didn't abandon me. Or at least... she didn't think she did.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She didn't think she did? What are you talking about, Zag? She left when you were born. Was never seen or spoken of again, until all this with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, it turns out... she never knew I was alive, at all. Complications when I was born. She had been struggling already here, and it was all too much, I guess. By the time Nyx brought me back... my mother was long gone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? But, Mother Nyx, and your father, they... could have sent for her, let her know... they must have known where she went!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx knew. But, Father must have convinced her that my mother... that it would be for the best if she never found out. About me. So she could live in peace. Away from all of this. And away from Olympus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's... a lot to take in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Answer me something, Zagreus. What am I to you, exactly, as of late? Because, sometimes, with you, I...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sometimes at a loss myself, Thanatos. Though one thing I know is it's always really good running into you out there, it's... well, exciting. Sparring with you and all that! And then, I know it means that I might get to see you here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, here I am. But you didn't answer my question. Though, you know something? Forget I asked. I've got to go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Than, tell me something, and forgive the awkward question here, but... are we good? I mean... between us. Any infuriating habits I should know about, that sort of thing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know I don't have time to list all your infuriating habits, Zagreus. Though... if any of them were outside my usual tolerance threshold, I promise to let you know, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So then, we're good. Because I think we're good, but I just wanted to make sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're good. See you, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...It just struck me how much you've changed, Zag. I still remember when you kept trying to singe Cerberus' tail with your feet. Haven't seen you do that in a while.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I definitely learned my lesson there. But, thanks, I guess. You've opened up a lot, yourself, by the way. Talking to you lately, it's a world apart from the first time. You looked like you were going to slice my head off.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It sure must have taken a lot of courage for you to come right up and tell me you thought I looked better before I cut my hair. I still ask myself how come I didn't keep ignoring you after that. Or slice your head off.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, the option is always available, I guess. Hey, you ever think of growing it out again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. It kept getting in my way. Sliced it right off and never looked back. So... plenty of personal growth all around, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How's everything been going with your mother, Zagreus? You've been pretty quiet about the whole thing, is everything all right? You can tell me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you for asking, Than. I don't know how much more I can say right now, given everything. I'm still figuring it out myself. I'm thankful you've been there to help me get to see her from time to time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, if there's something more that I can do to support you in this, let me know, all right? Sounds like you're making progress, at least.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, between us... all your attempting to break out of here, over and over... you're now authorized to keep that up? Exposing weaknesses in Underworld security, huh.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Something like that. I guess I've gotten pretty decent about escaping from a place that's known for being inescapable. Lets me keep in touch with the other side of the family. Work with you from time to time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to say I never thought I'd hear you talking about looking forward to working, Zag. You feeling all right? Spending too much time on the surface, maybe?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh I'm feeling fine. I never thought I was much good at anything, but... if my fated purpose is to be a master of frustrating Father's efforts to make everything strictly perfect, I think I'm OK with that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, then, I'll be looking forward to working with you in a more official capacity. Even if we're still supposed to keep it all under wraps, for sake of appearances. See you out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh I entirely agree with that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have to tell you, Zag. It's different, with your mother around here. Don't mean to be so obvious, but... it's something about your father, I suppose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think they have a lot of work ahead of them. As long as they're trying... he's trying... I think I'm good with that, for now. Though, I am glad she's here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm beginning to think we all are. And, please don't take this the wrong way, but... I think you and your father have a lot of work ahead of you, as well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your mother's very clever, Zagreus. I always thought you got that from your father, now I'm not so sure. So all is well with the Olympians, again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For now, I think it is. But, you know how they are. How we all are, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah! Yes, indeed. Well, then! I guess enjoy it while it lasts, as mortals sometimes say. I'll see you out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Such tardiness is oft to be expected from your brother, but from you, Thanatos? You're practically the god of punctuality.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My lord, I apologize sincerely for the lapse in my performance as of late. I think my duties following the recent war above took more of a toll from me than I expected.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanatos, even we gods require rest from time to time. Someday we might get it around here, once this accursed House is well in order, finally. Until then, I appreciate your diligence. Do not overextend yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, my lord. I am at your service. I'll be getting back to my assignment now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...You have been rather slow about your duties, lately, Thanatos. And I'm receiving incident reports from Tartarus involving you. Remember your responsibilities. And, remember, I am watching you. Now, get out of my sight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've been abetting him, Thanatos. Behind my back! Betrayal. I would ask you why. Well?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My lord, he and I... please. Go lock me up in Tartarus, or deal whichever justice you see fit, but... my loyalty is not subject to change. And I cannot stand by and watch you fight. The matter between you and Zagreus... there has to be some resolution, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You dare to lecture me? Tsch. My loyal subjects are too few of late, I think. This is your realm, not mine; I'll not cast you into that wretched pit. It's not like I have someone to replace you here, besides. Now then, begone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wished to see me once again, my lord? It's been... a while since I had an audience with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It has. The last time, what was it you said? That there must be some resolution to the matter, as you called it, with my son? Well it is settled, now. Isn't it, boy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I mean, you're still trying just as hard as ever to prevent me from escaping past the threshold of your realm, so, I don't know if I'd exactly call the matter settled. But... it does feel different, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And so you see... I would continue in our mutual good graces, if you please. This House can only function if the upper management is in accord. What do you say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I say, you honor me, my lord. I appreciate you telling me, yourself. And I concur that, for the good of all the Underworld, it is imperative that each of us continue to perform at our full strength.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hypnos, really, that is the worst idea I think I've ever heard. Do you understand how little sense that makes?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm just saying, maybe if you just, I don't know, had all the mortals die at the same time, it'd save you a bunch of trips, and then we'd have more time to spend together, huh?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know why I bother with you, honestly. Get back to work, and let me do the same.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You cannot keep falling asleep on the job like this, Hypnos. This is completely unacceptable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh I just nodded off a little while, Thanatos! I rest easy knowing that you're here! But if I goofed, why, I guess you could kill me dead, or something, huh?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't give me any ideas. Pull yourself together, and quit slacking off. The House needs help, and you've got a job to do. Now get to it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Hypnos, this list has a bunch of tasks from I don't know how long ago, I mean... I took several of these last year! And you've already submitted this week's registrations, why isn't that marked complete?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you know it, I was just about to get to that! Then you showed up, and I got so distracted, it just kind of slipped my mind! It happens, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You need to focus, Brother. Or it'll be Lord Hades reprimanding you again, and that is not something you want.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I don't know about that, last time I talked to Master he made pretty clear he never wanted to speak to me again!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hypnos, you're not irreplaceable, you understand? If you don't shape up, quickly, someone else is going to have your job.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh I hear you loud and clear, Thanatos! And, let me tell you, they will have the greatest job in all the Underworld!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I feel like I'm not getting through to you, Brother. Well, after the inevitable happens, don't come telling me I didn't try.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Well, how often do you consult these lists you make? If you're spending too much time just making lists, you're not leaving time to get anything done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I love making my lists... I always illustrate the edges, each one is unique! That way anyone who gets to review the work, it's a whole experience, you know? But... I guess it does take up a lot of time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll have to work around the constraints of your responsibilities. You do take breaks, don't you? Before and after each break, maybe that's a time to make sure your own list of priorities is up-to-date.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, my own list of priorities...? But, you're saying I can just go and make a list... for me? Huh. Whoa. Whoa....
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've heard that your reports have been immaculate of late, Hypnos. I have to know, who's helping you with them? It can't be Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, haha, no, he doesn't help. It's just I took to listing only the important stuff up top, and spending just a bit more time on the priority reports, and... guess it's working out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, whatever the case... the work's improved. It's been observed. You ought to keep it up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Though, what I mean to say is, that... I'm sorry, Hypnos. You're my brother, but I haven't always treated you that way. Would you be willing to forgive me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aww, come on, Thanatos, are you kidding me, right here? We're like two skeletons in a crypt! You're the best, and you're always looking out for me. Even when you're not around for what can seem like aeons at a time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well let's not get ahead of ourselves, here. We each have got important jobs to do. Isn't that right, Brother?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Congratulations, Brother! I saw you finally made the board. You made us proud.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure did! That's something, huh? Though, sorry Thanatos, can't really chat right now, the shades are stacking up, there's greetings to be done, and sign-ins... lots of work to do, you know?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I definitely know the feeling. Well then, let's keep it up, the both of us, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother, is there something I can do to help, with all of this? I spend too much time away from the House. Please, let me know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are already doing what you can to help, my son. Continue doing so. Matters are at stake here concerning you and all of us. Your support and choices in this shape the outcome that shall come to pass.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand, and I will do my best. Thank you for taking care of everything. I've every faith in you, Mother. And in this House. Farewell.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Am I imagining it, Mother, or has this House been running relatively smoothly as of late? Although I know I must be tempting the Three Fates by putting it like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is through a concerted effort that the House thus thrives, for now. Though, it shall do so only through continued diligence on your behalf, and that of many others here. It is a good occasion to take brief reprieve. But we need you working to the best of your ability, here, Thanatos.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well... know that I am ever-grateful, Mother. And I love you very much. Where would we be right now if not for you? I don't take what you've done for us for granted, nor does anybody here. You rest assured.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...But that was then and this is now, and we have work to do.... Uh, anyway, Than, I think we'd best continue this discussion at some other time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're interrupting private conversation, Zagreus. Leave us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, let him stay, if that's what he wants. What does it matter? He's technically allowed within these halls, but he must know he isn't welcome anymore.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know how mortals hate waiting around!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Queen Persephone. All of us, we are most pleased you're back. If there is anything that I can do to ease your acclimation to this House, you need but ask.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, thank you, Thanatos! I'll take you up on that if I can think of anything anytime soon. But my, you've grown! I understand you've been looking after my son, in the meantime?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your son, he... is very capable of looking after himself, it turns out. Although I try to be there, just in case. Though, I must beg your pardon, Queen. Someone awaits me on the surface now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I thank you for your blessings, Queen Persephone. Your son and I... we always were quite close, but through all this ordeal, we've become rather inseparable, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I can see that he has better taste than I do, Thanatos! I have a sense of how industrious you are. You just take care of yourself, please. And take care of each other, too, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you will, Queen. I mean, all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry, Zagreus, I have to go. Lots of assignments as of late. Too bad I can't be everywhere at once.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No use in making idle chat, right, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a job to do, and you've no interest in remaining here. See you around out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't bother, Zagreus. I was just leaving.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope you've thought through all of this. For both our sakes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't keep bailing you out each time you get in over your head.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to say it's quite a mess you've gotten yourself into, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You better know what you're doing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're wasting your time. Just go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shouldn't you be back out there by now, getting yourself killed?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know how much trouble I am getting myself into here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's nothing left for us to talk about.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't talk to me. Just go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Excuse me, I've got work to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not now, I have to go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know what you want from me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to get back to my responsibilities.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are in so much trouble.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll see you out there, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope all this is worth it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope you know what you're doing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can't talk right now, I have to get to work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I need to get to work. I'll see you later.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father's going to have my hide.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am in so much trouble, you have no idea...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What have I gotten myself into, Zag...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Much as I would like to stay and chat, I'd better go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zag, I've got so many mortals on my plate right now...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: See you out there soon enough, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you stay out too long, I'm going to track you down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds like we've both been keeping plenty busy as of late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that you're here, I can finally head out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll have to catch up more some other time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sorry Zag, I'm due to get a bunch of mortals now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Excuse me, Zag, just got word that I'm needed back up top.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hope your father's going to be all right with all of this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We showed those wretches last time, didn't we.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good running into you out there, and glad you made it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Impressive that you went the distance once again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Was good having an opportunity to back you up out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard you did good work out there last time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The shades are murmuring about your latest exploits, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't have a lot of time for catching up right now, here, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're not in too much of a hurry, are you, Zag?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well then... some mortal up there's lived a good, long life.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mind if I practice my ability to shift short distances with someone else?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well... I'd say that test was a success, wouldn't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to shift away from here, though if you'd care to join me...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Too bad I can't just shift you to the top, though this wasn't so bad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey let's get out of here for just a bit, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whew. Thanks for the break, now back to it, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Was just about to go on break, if you would care to join me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good catching up. Take care of yourself, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think you'd better head back to your quarters, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mm. I'd best get back to my responsibilities for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is a private chat, if you'll excuse us, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll see you later out there, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just catching up on things with Megaera here, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We were just talking about you, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well if it isn't our mutual friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enjoy the peace and quiet with us, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just catching up with Thanatos, if you don't mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look who it is, Than. Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've been comparing notes about our latest tasks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're in the middle of a conversation, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Catch up with you some other time, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Looks like you have everything under control. Nice work, Hypnos.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Plenty of time for sleeping once your shift is over, right, Brother?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Heard your latest reports were looking good, Hypnos. You keep it up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...That's the last of the new registrations, but I should have more soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...All right, I'd better get going. Take care, Brother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Looks like you have everything under control. Nice work, Hypnos.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Looks like you have everything under control. Nice work, Hypnos.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you will, Mother. It will be done immediately, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then, very well, Mother. I'll begin right away, and be back soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I hear you, Mother, and obey. I will return when the task is complete.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you for thinking of me for this task. I'll make it happen shortly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...The task is clear to me, Mother. I go. Your will be done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...It shall be as you say, my lord. I will report back soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Yes, my lord. I will begin, and not return until the deed is done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...If that is all, my lord, then I will make way for the surface now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I understand, my lord. I know where they are and soon shall bring them here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I do appreciate your faith in me, my lord. Begging your pardon, please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...This matter will be dealt with promptly, lord. I expect to return shortly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It isn't much, Than, but I got you something.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want me to take that off your hands, fine. But you are taking this from me, and if anybody asks, we're even. Or, scratch that, don't tell anyone about this, understand?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, really...? Come on, what is this, Zagreus. You think handing this to me makes up for everything you've put us through?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's just something I found out there that I thought you might like, Than. Don't think anything of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why bother with such empty gestures, Zag. You've said you're getting out of here; best focus on that and leave me be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not an empty gesture, Than. Besides, if I wasn't trying to stay focused, I'd be drinking it myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You shouldn't be doing this, Zag. You picked sides, and things are not the same. A momentary stab at thoughtfulness can't fix something like that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've been through a lot, Than, and I think we'll be going through a lot more yet. Consider it a token of our kinship.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't know what you're expecting, giving this to me. If there's a catch here, I don't want to know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've been through a lot, Than, and I think we'll be going through a lot more yet. Consider it a token of our kinship.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it with the generosity lately...? Look I'll just stash this with the rest if you really don't have a better thing to do with it than dump it off on me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, that's an idea. One of these days or nights, we'll have enough of this stuff to throw a feast to make all of Olympus jealous.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can't be serious. You're serious...? Eh, you know what, fine. I'll take this and we'll go about our business. Though I don't see why you bother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why I bother? Why, how else can I show you how I feel except by handing you these bottles from time to time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Than. For all the times you've bailed me out, and just, all the times you've been around for me... I thought I'd get you this. The real thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ambrosia...! Zagreus, where did you even... don't you think this is a bit excessive?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You say that like it's a bad thing. Little bit of excess from time to time never hurt anyone I'm sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you would be surprised. Though if you're going to embarrass me, you know what, I am going to reciprocate. Behold!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For you, Thanatos. The Olympians might be accustomed to this stuff but I think we should have our share of it down here. At least you should.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know... the Olympians do have good taste in certain things. The last bottle you gave me... it was... better than expected. Though, I almost decided not to try it at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But try it you did! And now, you'll get to try this one for comparison's sake. Each one's supposed to be different you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Different, huh. Well, then, I guess I'll have to see what you mean by that. Thank you, Zag. You didn't have to do this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope you're ready for some more of the real thing, there, Than, because I got you some, and I won't be taking 'Tsch, what is this, Zag' for an answer.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ugh, what is this? Come on, already, Zagreus, are you just messing with me, now? How did you even manage to get more of this, much less decide to hand it off to me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In order: no, I'm not; by ransacking my father's realm repeatedly; and it's because I like you, Thanatos. In case you still have some misgivings about that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You like me, Zagreus...? I never thought, I... don't know why that sounds so strange, coming from you. Given everything that's happened as of late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah. Look, if you don't feel the same way about me at this point, I would rather know. Cease all these coy gift exchanges, and all that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never said anything like that! You know what, there's... a bunch of mortals I have to go fetch. Good-bye.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanatos, I wanted to apologize for the last time I approached you with a bottle of the real thing, and give the whole exchange another shot. Would that be all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmph! You're asking my consent to give me yet another lavish gift? Sure! Permission granted. Though, what makes you think that your approach this time is going to be any more successful than the last?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know that it will. I never really know exactly where I stand with you. But I know how I feel. And I'd rather be up front with you, even if it means risking our relationship, such as it is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our relationship? It wasn't long ago you were prepared to throw it all away while making for the surface, if you don't recall. But now you're saying that you care for me, and... what, exactly, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, that's what I'm saying, Than. I should not have left the way I did, without letting you know. But when you found me, I... think that's when... that's when I knew. Or started to realize, you know?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... yes. I know, I think, because... when I heard you took off, the anger that I felt, it was... it wasn't something I expected. So... ungh. What do we do now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe we ought to take our time? Unlike the real thing there, that's a commodity we have in good supply. Just know that, if you feel the way I do... you know where to find me. And if not... I'm grateful, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I see. Well, then. The best that I can say for now is that... I'm grateful, too, for this. Take care of yourself, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to hand it to you, Zag, you're really putting in the work to get me to forgive you after all you've done. I'm honestly surprised.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't be. That feast of ours is really going to be something, Than.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Guess Than must be at work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, Thanatos, is this... you're really giving Mort to me? I... I'm deeply honored!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother, is there something I can do to help, with all of this? I spend too much time away from the House. Please, let me know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are already doing what you can to help, my son. Continue doing so. Matters are at stake here concerning you and all of us. Your support and choices in this shape the outcome that shall come to pass.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand, and I will do my best. Thank you for taking care of everything. I've every faith in you, Mother. And in this House. Farewell.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Life and death, one and the same.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Quite a mess you've made here, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Looks like I got here just in time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought I'd find you here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's been a little while, hasn't it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I happened to be in the area.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wretches are coming with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You might want to stand back, there, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think you can beat me, Zag?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can you deal death faster than I?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What say we get things started.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll send you to the lowest depths.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All of you, prepare to die again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You brazen wretches ought to have turned back!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come, wretches, and be returned to dust!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who wants to be the first to die again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You so-called champions could use a lesson in humility.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All in Elysium should know of us by now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's see how quickly we can wrap this up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I doubt this will take very long at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They're coming, Zagreus. Be on your guard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think you can beat me again, Zag?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you say we end this quickly, Zag?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Scared I'll take more of them than you this time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All of you, prepare to die again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here they come, fresh for the taking, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't be too reckless to outpace me, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wretches never seem to learn, do you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Or I'll slay you instead if you prefer!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lesson one: Don't mess with either one of us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No doubt at all from me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll get right on it, Than!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I say: Sure, Than, sounds good to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll be as reckless as I want!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not if I can help it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One of your friends, there, Zag?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why ask for help from him?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I told you to get out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get out while you still can.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was the last of them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This won't go on the record.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're clear of them for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll leave no trace of this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And that's the end of that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's call this one a draw.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You got as many as I did.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, all right, you got me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here, since you did all the work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Guess you had this well in hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How did you get so fast?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was embarrassing for me I have to say.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Save some for me next time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You took more down than I did.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got more of them than I did, huh.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You held your own out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You held your own I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're not too bad at this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're fast, I'll give you that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You earned this fair and square.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You got a lot of them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll take more down next time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hang on to this for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Thought you could just get away from me, did you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanatos. I figured it was only a matter of time before Father sent you after me to do his dirty work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus. Is that really why you think I'm here? Let's see how many of these exalted champions you can send back to their dooms, unless you'd rather I would send you back to yours.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Barely caught up with you, here, Zag. You must have had a little help from Hermes, I suppose.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have the butterfly I gave to you. Stay back, then, and it'll make you stronger once I'm finished here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got little Mort with you, there, huh. Well, there's no need to summon me this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're back. I thought you made it out. No matter.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good to be working with you in a more official capacity, Zag. Shall we get started?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thought I might find you all the way out here. Although, quite frankly, I'm surprised you're still alive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can hold my own in case you haven't noticed, Than.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I haven't, Zag! Now, stand back, and let me show you how it's done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Still at it, I see. You're stubborn. And you are going to get me in a heap of trouble before all is said and done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about another of our little contests, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll have to catch up at some other time. Though good to see you anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a feeling this is not going to take much time at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I only have a little time until my next assignment, but this shouldn't take too long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thought I might stop by and check up on this corner of the Underworld, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've come this far, now let's make sure you go the distance, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard there was a matter that required my attention here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Had a feeling I would find you all alone out here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Want to stand back and watch me work, here, Zag?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This one is off the record, Zagreus. Come on!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Looks like we've got an urgent work-related matter to attend to.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father's forces making trouble for you, Zag?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not a word of this to anyone back home, you hear me, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard you got yourself into another mess that needed cleaning up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll catch up later, now let's deal with these wretches and be done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hope you don't mind if I cut in, here, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What say we go take care of business here just like we used to, Zag?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't stay long, so how about we get this business over with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Figured you'd be up to have another of our little contests. Now let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you say we deal some death together, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't have much time, but let me see if I can pitch in.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Remember, not a word of this, to anyone. Let's go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You look like you could use a hand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's see who's better at this, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I got the feeling you could use some backup here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good, I'm not too late. Got here as quickly as I could.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I got the message that you need assistance, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You left, without so much as telling me good-bye. I suppose you knew I'd catch up with you sooner or later, is that it? No escaping death, and all?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I left when it was necessary, Than. I thought of you and hoped you'd understand. I have to do this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's more motivation than I've ever heard from you. Well, if you won't say it, I'll say it. Good-bye, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've got to hand it to you, Zag. You're easy to track down. The shades of Tartarus are beginning to fear you even more than your Lord Father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh they won't fear me once they get to know me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not so sure about that. Even I'm beginning to fear you, I think. Seems I don't know you as well as I thought.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know what I'm supposed to say when he gets like this...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's with the look? You had your hands full, now you don't thanks to me... Tsch, seems I'm left to thanking myself, since you're too proud to do it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You seemed a little winded, there, no? Not even close to the surface, yet, either.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanks for the vote of confidence there, Than.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're very welcome. Now, I'd better get back, before Lord Hades catches on to this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I told you I don't need your help here, Thanatos.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It wasn't being offered. Just happened to be in the area is all. Carry on, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Still running from yourself, I see. How's that been working out for you thus far?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm searching for my mother. You still live at home with yours. You don't know what it's like.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother Nyx was like a mother to you, too. And this is how you repay her. You should be ashamed of yourself, and learn your place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Listen to me. I don't know how else to put this, but, I want you to come home. Voluntarily. It's not just you swept up in all this nonsense now. And, I know you didn't ask for me to get involved, but, what did you expect?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Than. Home is never going to be the same for me. There's no use trying to pretend. I have to go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't have to do anything of the sort. You have no idea how good you've had it here. Maybe someday you'll come to understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is all right. Thanks, Than.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Outdid me once again, there, huh. Tsch. I have to admit, you're not as bad at all of this as I expected. First I found you, I was certain that you had no chance at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I seem to have this whole easy-to-underestimate thing about me, based on a decent sum of my relationships. In any case, I always welcome your appearances out here. I know it's not been easy for you, Than.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's fair as an assessment, I would say. But then again, it's never been an easy time for me. I know I have to do my job. But I don't have to keep on helping you, like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...What, you're telling me this is it? You're just going to leave me to my own devices, then, I've proved myself to you, something like that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, you deadbeat, I am telling you the opposite! Why do you think I keep on showing up? You may not really need me, Zagreus, but I will take these opportunities to help. I take it that's all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good to see you taking little Mort there on one of your strolls. Means I can better keep an eye on you out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's been great to have around, for sure. Still can't believe you found him after all this time! You used to always carry him around, I was so sad for you when he got lost.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And I cannot believe you still remember that. Regardless, he will not be getting lost again under your supervision, accurate?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: About when we last spoke. I care about you, Thanatos. A lot. Though, you asked what you are to me... how am I supposed to even answer that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ugh, I don't know. Sometimes I miss not feeling anything. Can't always trust what feelings say. I get to thinking, are we only friends, or... look, this is embarrassing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To think discussing feelings would be even harder than annihilating Father's forces. But... I've been asking myself the same thing, Than. If it's any reassurance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, if you come up with any answers, I guess let me know. Good running into you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm glad you did, though, Than.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey. I didn't mean to lay the guilt on you for what you did for Orpheus, Zag. I just worry when we get involved... we can make matters worse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You haven't ever made anything worse, Than. But as for me, I realized what you meant. I was so eager to do something for Orpheus when I first met Eurydice, I... never asked them if it was OK.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At least things turned out well for them. But that was fortunate. Family troubles, personal relations, and the like... it's sensitive business. Though, who am I to talk. You didn't ask me to show up, like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Than, are you OK? I mean, with everything, lately?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am. Though, thanks for asking, Zag. The risk of being close with anyone is sometimes things get complicated, fast. Admittedly it's not a risk I often take, but... in your case, it's been worth it, all in all. We're good, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you doing back here, Zag? You made it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did... but I had to come back. And, not exactly voluntarily. I'll be visiting up there from time to time, though... it looks like I'll be staying here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Visiting from time to time...? I don't understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's my mother. She's alive and well! It's just that I can't stay with her up there for very long! So we'll have to catch up... one visit at a time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. Well then... that's good. That's good, because... it means that I won't have to track you down up top. Because, between us, I can only take so much of it up there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You going to help or what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not your foe here, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not going to fight you, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Give me some room to work!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let me take care of this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't waste this chance you have!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! The Prince himself, you, want to talk to me...? Me?! Oh, wow, oh wow!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I, uh, just wanted to say, the lounge looks wonderful, as good as new. Better! Hope it's not been too much trouble patching up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I, I, I, aah, I have to clean the rafters, I...!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! The Prince himself, you, want to talk to me...? Me?! Oh, wow, oh wow!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I, uh, just wanted to say, don't bother picking up my room today. I'm headed out for a while.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I, I, I, aah, I have to clean the rafters, I...!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I, ah, hope you're having a nice stay! Even though you don't want to live here anymore, Your Highness!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, Dusa? Turns out that I may be stopping back from time to time, like this. But, please don't bother picking up my room. I won't be staying long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, hahaha, sure! But I'll just keep an eye on things in there, from time to time, in case you change your mind, um, so, good-bye!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Um, Prince? Your father, I, I think he's pretty steamed right now, about something, so, maybe you could stay away from him? Or... I could tell him you're not here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's quite all right, Dusa. I'm not afraid of him, and neither should you be. You're the best help he's ever found.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just, ah, just doing my job, here, Prince...!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, um, so, hi Prince! So, is there anything I can get you, or maybe tidy up some more, or... I just thought maybe you'd like something to drink? Sometime?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! A drink sometime sounds wonderful, Dusa, maybe tomorrow assuming I'm not getting out of here by then...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whaa, I mean, it's no big deal, I mean, forget I asked, or anything, I'm sorry, bye!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Uh, um, I just, wanted to apologize, because, I think maybe I didn't act very appropriately last time you spoke to me? But I just really, really like this job, and promise I will always do my very best, so, I just hope I'll have another chance?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dusa, please, there's no need to apologize! You've been doing a wonderful job, really!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... what? You really mean it, Prince, I... thank you, thanks so much!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, um, hi, Your Highness? I, just wanted you to know, that if you do get out, I, we are going to miss you. Around here. OK? So, bye...!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, Ms. Dusa, I wanted to, uh, cordially invite you to an outing in the lounge? Remember when you asked me about a drink?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aaah! Oh, oh, oh, really, what you mean, right now, you're... I... I guess I'm overdue to take a break...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...And, well, since I don't exactly fit the mold of your traditional gorgon, I mean, I have no body for example, I had trouble finding work! That is until Lord Hades took me in, and then, I met you, and, well, I just love this job!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! I can definitely relate at least to some of that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: <Sigh> I, I, I, thanks, Your Highness. Prince. Prince Zagreus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Um, P-Prince, the way you look so sad sometimes, when you come back in here, out of the Pool of Styx? Is everything OK? Because if there was something I could do...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, it's nothing for you to be concerned about, Dusa. I'm just having a harder time fighting my blasted way out of this place than I anticipated. If you'll excuse my language.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I... this is silly, but, I'd no idea anybody could beat you, I mean, the Prince? Greater than the mighty Achilles, more cunning than his father, faster than Hermes! But... you're just struggling, like me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am. And that stuff you heard about me isn't true.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Isn't there something I can do to help...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...sorted the cutlery, wiped the counters, replaced the candles, did the dishes, swept the floor, inspected the barrels, let's see what else, oh!! The Prince, it's you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's me! Dusa, I'm impressed you're able to manage this whole lounge all by yourself. How do you do it, what's your secret?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahaha, secret? I'm two weeks behind schedule with this place, at least! Fortunately, no one here seems very good at keeping time, so, no one's gotten on my case just yet, but... oh, you aren't going to tell, are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course not. What's behind schedule, though? This place doesn't seem any worse for wear than usual.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, that's just it! Miss Nyx, she tasked me with a pretty big project a while back, to make this place worthy of the name, which means... there's so much left to do, I need to get everything ready, please, excuse me, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...patch up the seating, update the menu, clean the stove, stock the honor bar, sweep the rug, dust the rafters, mop the flooring, pay the broker, oh!! Um, sorry, Prince, way behind on my assignment, so if you'll excuse me, please...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dusa, wait, before you fly away... there must be something I can do, to help pitch in with everything? Doesn't matter how good you are at your job, what you're describing, that's more than one individual can handle!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your Highness, please! I know you mean well, but I have this! Wish everybody wouldn't doubt me all the time, like that House Contractor, just gets to stand around, waiting for work orders! Unless they come from me, then nooo.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The House Contractor isn't cooperating with you, huh. No wonder so many lounge renovations are clogged up in the works. Though maybe I can grease the wheels a bit?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: AAH, I completely forgot!! I need to get more cooking grease for the Head Chef! I have to go!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...patch up the seating, update the menu, clean the stove, stock the honor bar, sweep the rug, dust the rafters, mop the flooring, pay the broker, oh!! Um, sorry, Prince, way behind on my assignment, so if you'd excuse me, please...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dusa, wait, before you fly away... there must be something I can do, to help pitch in with everything? Doesn't matter how good you are at your job, what you're describing, that's more than one individual can handle!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your Highness, please! I know you mean well, but I have this! Wish everybody wouldn't doubt me all the time, like that House Contractor, just gets to stand around, waiting for work orders! Unless they come from me, then nooo.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ooh, that might be my fault. I've been giving the Contractor lots of work. Some of those lounge orders must be coming from you, right? This place is really shaping up!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wha-wha, wait, then you're the one who's been authorizing all these improvements?! Oh my, oh my, aaaah!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The lounge is really starting to look nice lately, Dusa! All your hard work is really paying off!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah! Why, thank you, Prince, it's just that, lately, the House Contractor's been slightly more agreeable I guess, working a little faster, maybe, but there's still a lot we have to do, so, you just wait!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Um, Prince Zagreus...? I just wanted to say something, if you have a little time? I know you're really busy... I can come back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, no, now's fine, of course, what is it, Dusa? I'm not so busy, by the way, and always happy to check in. Wait, is something wrong?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, nononono, it is just the opposite, I... can't believe you helped me, with the lounge. I don't think anyone has ever helped me out like you did, cleaning up after Cerberus, and the new rug, and the kitchen, and, just, all of this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was my pleasure, really. All of us use the lounge, don't we? This House can really be a lot, but in the lounge here, things are easier a bit, I think. I'm so glad we have you watching over it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Y, you really mean that, Prince...? But you don't know what this means to me. I'm finally caught up on work! W, what am I going to do? I, I don't know what I'm going to do with all this extra time! I have to go, and plan everything out!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Um, Zagreus? I wanted to talk some more, if you're available? I mean, if you're free. I mean! If you have time to right now. Is that OK?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course, Dusa! Where should we chat? The lounge, or maybe somewhere more private...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Somewhere more private, please, if that's OK? Thank you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Um, Zagreus... so, ever since you told me you had feelings for me, it's been, like... my whole mind is on fire. I haven't been able to think straight, or get anything done. It's all been so much!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, Dusa, I... put a lot on you, and... maybe I shouldn't have, since I'm the Prince and everything, as you point out, and... sometimes, I forget myself. I'd never pressure you, it's just... I thought you had these feelings for me, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do have feelings for you, silly! That's what I've been trying to tell you, it's just... it's just...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's just what...? Whatever it is, it's OK. You can be yourself with me, Dusa, I promise.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm glad you put it that way. I... I'm not looking for an intimate relationship. You're the kindest soul in this whole House. And I have learned so much from you! But, when I really think about my feelings... I'm just, not attracted to you, in that way. I'm sorry. You're a really nice guy!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, hahaha, look, there's nothing to apologize for, not at all. In fact... all this is a relief. I've learned a lot from you, too, and I cherish our friendship for what it is. Do you... do you think that we could still be friends? Or, is it better that you didn't see me anymore...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't say that! Though, I was going to ask you the same thing. I'd really like it if you'd be my friend! Though, my career comes first, so... I don't want you doing any special favors, promise me? I need to see how far I can get on my own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I respect that so much, and yes, I promise, Dusa. So, well, then... friends? For all eternity?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Friends. For all eternity. Now... I had better go. See you, OK?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Zagreus, I... wanted to talk to you again, I... what I mean is, I just, hope I didn't hurt your feelings, because, if I did, you'd let me know, wouldn't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Dusa, please! Remember friends for all eternity? That's a long time, so, there's no need for second guessing. I'm glad we had a chance to talk.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, well, good! That's a relief to hear, but... one last thing, so I can clear my conscience of it, I... I've saved all the Ambrosia that you gave me, and I figured since... I didn't realize, you know, the way you felt? I can be a little dense! I have it here. And I would like to give it back. Is that OK?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... look, if you don't want the Ambrosia anymore, and receiving it made you feel uncomfortable in any way, I'll take it back. It was my gift to you, to do with as you please. Are you sure you don't want it?
label: CHARACTER
