dialogue: My friend, you wrote a song, for me...? Oh, but this is not from you, it's from... Eurydice... I, no, I don't know what to say, I... I...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You sing beautifully, mate. If only Eurydice could hear you singing this right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh. Thanks for the sentiment, my friend, it's just... when I sing this song of hers, why, I've this feeling where my heart once was that, well... perhaps she can.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've decided I should give this singing thing another shot for now, my friend. I hope you like it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You sing beautifully, mate. If only Eurydice could hear you singing this right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh. Thanks for the sentiment, my friend, it's just... when I sing this song of hers, why, I've this feeling where my heart once was that, well... perhaps she can.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you. I shall. I shall!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus! The most amazing circumstances have occurred. The terms of my employment, they've been altered such that... I may visit Asphodel sometimes. May visit her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's great! Orpheus, what are you waiting for, mate? Go and find your muse out there! You two have lots to catch up on, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think you're right. I am so very anxious, I must say. But I must also thank you, for this opportunity, and... for speaking with me all this time. So, how might I repay you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why is it always talk of payment around here? You're my mate. And your songs have lifted many spirits here, including mine. Now go, and make the most of this, will you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Great to hear it. I can only imagine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Orpheus, you're back! How was your trip? I hope it was all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was more than all right, my friend. Why, it was positively inspirational. But I've returned as promised to this House. My love is there, whilst my responsibilities are here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You sound despondent again, mate. You must wish you were there right now. I'm sorry you had to come all the way back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, on the contrary, Zagreus. It dawned upon me that having some distance between my responsibilities and my domestic life, why... it is not so bad. Besides, Charon makes travel to and fro quite simple for me, really.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're doing wonderfully at it, mate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to ask you something, Orpheus. It seems like everything has been all right for you, except... you don't look very happy to me, mate. Is everything all right? Between you and Eurydice, I mean?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, haha, but your concern is much appreciated, friend. I feel I am in everlasting bliss. It simply does not show upon my countenance. Perhaps through song is how I best express myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Orpheus. You know I'm very happy that things turned out well between you and Eurydice, but... looking back, I think I might have overstepped my bounds with you a bit, and wanted to say I'm sorry.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're sorry, Zagreus? Whatever for? If not for you, I fear I never would have seen my muse again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, it's just... when I met her, and I found out the two of you were having problems, I... well, I just wanted to see you patch things up. But, it wasn't any of my business, and you never asked my help. Neither did she. I could have made things worse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But, you didn't make things worse, my friend. And... truth be told, I do not think I ever would have asked for help, at any point, because... I don't entirely know how. So I am grateful to you, and your generous instinct.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall give it some thought, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, Orpheus! I heard what must have been a song of yours, it went something, something, in the blood, you know that one? It was amazing, mate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, that one, yes, I know! I mean, it was a favorite, I was told, by those who listened to the music I created with my muse. It was a most productive time, back when we were alive!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would you ever sing it again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Orpheus. The keepsake that you gave me... it's come in useful, thanks. I can't quite see what's in the container, though. I shouldn't open it, should I?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, Zagreus. Unless of course you wanted to set loose a cherished living memory of mine, and take from me that fleeting bit of joy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Orpheus, the Distant Memory you gave me... it's a bit of your past with Eurydice in there, isn't it. I'm grateful, but... why give me such a precious gift as that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm glad you like it, Zagreus. Some memories are cherished, yes, indeed. But there can come a point where they provide more benefit to others than ourselves. Don't you agree?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you considered doing music-making as a recreational pursuit, my friend? You have such slender hands, why, I believe you'd do quite well at it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not really been at the top of my list of late, mate, but who knows. It's something I've been meaning to try at some point, I suppose. Thanks for the words of encouragement!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Orpheus! I got myself a lyre much like yours, except I'm absolutely miserable when I try to play! Got any advice?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, why, that's splendid, Zagreus. And I can certainly show you a thing or two. First, the proper posture is important, here...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...now remember to practice the plucking technique which I taught you, and mind your off-hand constantly. And, above all, continue practicing! The joyfulness is in the practicing itself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus, I heard your recent lyre-playing from your bedchambers. Let no one lead you to believe it's not a reassuring start.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, come now, mate, I'm terrible and you know it. You pulling one over on me as payback?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm being serious, my friend. It is a challenging pursuit requiring a dedicated state of mind. The progress shall come. You shall discover what I mean.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's almost everything to me, my friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your music-playing has improved substantially. Perhaps in time you shall surpass my own abilities!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I highly doubt that, mate, though thanks for noticing. Creating music's quite rewarding once you get the hang of it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must commend you on the most splendid lyre-playing emanating from your bedchambers, my friend. It seems we have a second court musician, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you for encouraging me to give it a shot, mate. And for the kind words.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...You called upon your humble court musician, as I understand, Lord Hades sir? Referring to myself of course?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Orpheus... if you're quite finished with your little stint within the depths of Tartarus, I'd like to ask again: Play us a song, already. Or else next time I'll not be quite so charitable with your punishment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, that. I must apologize, again, Lord Hades sir. For I'm afraid that I've no wish to sing as yet. In spite of your persuasiveness even. And, that, um, is my final word upon the subject. At this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that so...? Why, then, I'll go ahead and wait. I've all the patience in the world.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Help me to understand something here, Orpheus. Why do I bother keeping such a worthless shadow of a court musician in my House? You prattle ceaselessly, yet I can't get even a single note out of you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If I may be so bold, my lord? Perhaps the merest sight of me still stirs in you a memory of my performances of yore. It gladdens me you used to like my songs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I used to tolerate your insolence. We're finished here. You find your voice. Immediately! You have one hundred years, and not a moment more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Finally returned to your senses, haven't you, Orpheus. A court musician who refused to sing! Such nonsense. I trust there shall be no more insubordination from you, moving forward?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm gladdened that my songs yet stir your soul, my lord. But, I have to confess my choice to sing again was motivated largely by the Prince. And by my muse, of course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Still going on about your so-called muse, I see. You had your chance with Eurydice. You squandered it. And now you're here; a deal is a deal. I expect you to comply with your end of our agreement.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I'm pleased to know my new, more flexible arrangement remains to your satisfaction, still, my lord. I must admit I feared that my departure would result once more in a protracted stay within the pits of Tartarus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't give me such ideas, Orpheus! Instead, you go about your business, there, and play your blasted songs when circumstances call for it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall be happy to oblige, my lord. Eurydice and I are grateful for your magnanimity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...You're much too modest, Lord Achilles, for someone with such a number of heroic deeds and glorious decapitations to his name! You ought to be more like ever-boastful Zagreus, and talk it up some more!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, fear not, Orpheus, I was quite boastful in my day. And would you look at where it got me? Besides, I've not the imagination to come up with tales as tall as those of our Prince Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that you mention it... I can't.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Do you miss it, yourself, Lord Achilles, sir? The freshness of the air. The need to have meals several times a day, and such.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I scarce remember it, my friend. Although your songs do stir up memories, sometimes. I'm used to things the way they are, I think. But you, not so much?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, on the contrary, sir, I am profoundly satisfied. We are most fortunate to have employment even after death. Imagine, merely resting for eternity, when you could work!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Ah, but to think that our esteemed musician of the court is none other than you, Orpheus! In matters of music, at least, Hades and I have similar tastes. Anyway, I don't mean to keep you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall be honored to perform my songs, Your Grace. And, might I add, Your Grace bears many of the striking features of your son? I understand now where he gets his charm.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry I've no will for singing, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I feel a bit self-conscious seeing as I must refuse to sing...!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I remain your humble court musician, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm truly pleased to see you, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would that I could aid you in some way, my friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's awfully quiet whilst you're not around. Still rather quiet now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid I haven't much to say on this occasion, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope your day or night, I guess, is going nicely, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please do be careful out there, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wish I could direct you towards a much more lively court musician.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Normally I'd offer up a song for such occasions, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be strong out there, my friend, OK?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm cheering for you all the way, my friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good luck to you out in that deadly hellscape, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you for checking up on me, my friend, although I'm quite all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm still fresh out of songs or will to sing them, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd ask if you remember what it's like to feel inspired, my friend, but I don't want to know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wishing you a pleasant day or night as ever, my good friend...!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May you emerge from all of this unscathed, my friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust your neverending toil in the Underworld is proceeding well, my friend?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have an optimistic feeling about your next attempt to run away, my friend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May you yet find your muse somewhere out there, my friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Each failure brings new opportunities for self-reflection, right, my friend?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please keep me well apprised of all of your incredible achievements, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It lifts my spirits when we briefly interact, my friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I pray the Fates not ruin all your dreams as they did mine!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm in the middle of a song my friend...!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd best get back to singing, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's talk when I'm not singing, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hello, my friend, let's get back to my song?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm kind of singing at the moment, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Terribly sorry I can't speak with you right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought I'd lost even the gift of music, Zagreus. So, thanks again for helping find that one for me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must say, it's nice having some music in my life again, and hopefully in yours!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We all could use a little song from time to time, isn't that so?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's nice that I no longer have to live and breathe, and can be focused purely on my song...!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You rescued me from an eternity of not getting to sing, my friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope your day or night is just as splendid as my own, my friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I pray the Fates fulfill your dreams as they did mine!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Zagreus, how wonderful to see you once again!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was just thinking of you, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My greetings to my very dearest friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am in concert as perhaps you see, my friend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Begging your pardon, Zagreus, but I'm amid performance at this time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm quite preoccupied with singing all your praises, Zagreus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This hymn is dedicated to your deeds, my friend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I cannot talk right now, my friend, for I must sing!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust my music brings some lightness to our gloom-filled times, my friend?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The tale of your birth is so complex, my friend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I ask you please hold your applause until the end!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To think Lord Dionysus and yourself share such a bond!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May my performances spread wide your fame, my friend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your parentage need not be secret any longer, Zagreus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall keep singing of your praises, far and wide!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've helped inspire me to song, my friend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must stay focused on my singing, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust my hymn provides some solace to your days or nights?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My muse writes absolutely wondrous songs, don't you agree?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, this reminds me so of my Eurydice...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would that I were together with her now...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The songs of my Eurydice are without peer...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is a favorite song of mine, and perhaps yours?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, mate, here. I got this for my favorite court musician.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, my, but you can't simply be this kind to me without retaliation on my part, my friend! And so, in turn, I have a gift for you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, this is absolutely splendid, Zagreus. Is this really for me? It's so very kind of you to think of me like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I want you to have it, Orpheus. You've brightened up our lives down here more than you know. I only wish that you could see that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, why! I'm very much obliged that you have thought of me again, for such a wonderfully thoughtful gift!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's nothing, Orpheus. Thank you for all the inspiration through your song. I love your work, mate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're always much too kind, you know, my friend? Now typically I would express my gratitude through song, except, you understand, don't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand completely, Orpheus. I think we'll both get through this rough patch in due time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You always offer means to quench my thirst, my friend. A wonder that I have such feelings, even now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that you've started singing once again, I figured it was thirst-inducing work! Your music stirs so many souls around here, mate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, mate! What do you say we share this over in the lounge?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I, certainly, why, I don't see why not. I mean, it's not as though I've got something to do that isn't that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...And, anyways, I oughtn't have looked back, I mean, the moral of the story is to not look back when you are told not to look back, you understand, don't you, my friend?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't look back, huh. I'll try not to. Though, you can't be blamed for doing it yourself, just the one time. What happened to you... it wasn't fair. If you ask me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I quite enjoyed our outing, Zagreus. So, I suppose I shall be seeing you around?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am indebted to you, Zagreus, both for your friendship and embarrassment of generosity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And I, in turn, am indebted to you, Orpheus, for your calm demeanor and ability to accept life's greatest challenges. You inspire me, and I wish you the best.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Orpheus, mate! I have something good for you right here... Ambrosia! All the way from the surface. I want you to have it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, but this is splendid, Zagreus. And I must say, apart from my Eurydice, I've never felt as strong a bond of kinship as with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Orpheus, you know I once wrested this bottle of Ambrosia from the Champions of Elysium, defeating them two against one, just so I could bring it here to you personally?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please, my friend! I feel I am undeserving of such a relentless show of kindness on your part. I shall accept, but you'll relent, won't you? As well as forgive me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mate, if that is your wish, then it will be my pleasure to oblige. Though, may this gift symbolize the strength of our friendship for an eternity to come. I've learned so much from you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, my friend. Would that I had capacity to take some joy from this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Orpheus is with Eurydice I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That makes it difficult to sing, my friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I resolved never to fight, my friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I fight only through song, my friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am attempting here to sing, my friend?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah. So, if you would excuse us for a little while, hon? I'm not finished catching up with him just yet. But first, before you go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A splendid compliment, my friend. Doubtless the Fates themselves conspired to ensure Eurydice and I would meet, and sing together. Fall in love. And then be cruelly separated for some time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now don't you start with that again, you get me, Orphy? Got our whole entire afterlives ahead of us! And lots of songs to catch up on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, you're correct of course, my dear. If you'll excuse us, Zagreus? Our calling beckons.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, things are going very wonderfully, my friend. I never thought I'd see Eurydice again, after I...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Orphy still just can't shut up about that time, hon. But we're making progress. Thanks for having him stop by. I'm sure he needed plenty of encouragement.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, it is certainly my pleasure, Zagreus. This song of Eurydice's and mine, I've a connection to it, I suppose. Reminded me of some fond memories!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, nice of you to visit us, Your Royal Majesty! For you!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Orphy and I, we're doing great here thanks to you. You take care, hon!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hope you find yourself someone to sing with, too, hon.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't fret, Your Majesty, I'll have him back to work on time, you hear that, Orphy?,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Orphy and me, we're like your typical old married couple, hon.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you find happiness out there, hon, don't look back.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Things aren't so bad here, hon. Hope you can say the same.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can I say, hon? We like practicing our favorite tune!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well if it isn't the Hades kid come to pay the both of us a visit!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...You must know, you sound as wonderful as ever, now, my dear!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is she not truly wonderful, my friend?,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We sing, and sing, and never once grow weary, Zagreus!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never thought I would see her again. You are to thank for this, my friend.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When we thus sing together, Zagreus, I lose all track of time.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is the singing of Eurydice not the most splendid thing that you have ever heard?,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Shall there ever be a voice as lovely as Eurydice's, my friend?,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It gladdens me that you could join us here, my friend.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Guess what we've been up to lately, hon? Now if you'll excuse us?,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We just finished eating, here! Got plenty left over.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The one thing better than singing, hon, is singing with somebody you love.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Orphy here's just practicing for when he's got to sing next for Hades Senior!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you know, we were just in the middle of a song here, hon!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not much luck trying to teach Orphy to cook, but he can sing, all right!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, Orphy, we've got an audience! So sing your heart out!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't mind Orphy, here, hon. Can't snap him out of it once he gets singing!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know this tune, hon? It's one of our old hits!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We were just thinking about old times, Orphy and I!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thought we'd mix up our singing just a bit here, hon!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got to tell you I've warmed up to this old song over the years!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know that you enjoy this one, my friend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This one reminds me of my days alive with my Eurydice...!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This song had quite a bit of popularity, one time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Orpheus! I got myself a lyre much like yours, except I'm absolutely miserable when I try to play! Got any advice?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, why, that's splendid, Zagreus. And I can certainly show you a thing or two. First, the proper posture is important, here...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...now remember to practice the plucking technique which I taught you, and mind your off-hand constantly. And, above all, continue practicing! The joyfulness is in the practicing itself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsch. The prodigal son returns.... Everyone's saying I went easy on you, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry, Meg. I eventually managed to get home the painful way after all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, I've a reputation to uphold. You get past me again like that, you best go all the way. Now, leave me be, and don't think you're going to be so lucky next we meet out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsch. The prodigal son returns.... Everyone's saying I went easy on you, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry, Meg. I eventually managed to get home the painful way after all. Though... I managed to get much farther than you'd probably expect.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I expected you to not get past me, yes. Look, I've a reputation to uphold. Don't think you're going to be so lucky next we meet out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsch. The prodigal son returns.... Everyone's saying I went easy on you, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry, Meg. I eventually managed to get home the painful way after all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, I've a reputation to uphold. You get past me again like that, you best go all the way. Now, leave me be, and don't think you're going to be so lucky next we meet out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsch. The prodigal son returns.... Everyone's saying I went easy on you, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't worry, Meg. I eventually managed to get home the painful way after all. Though... I managed to get much farther than you'd probably expect.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I expected you to not get past me, yes. Look, I've a reputation to uphold. Don't think you're going to be so lucky next we meet out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, uh, what's that you're drinking, Meg? Anything good?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whatever it is, it's weak. Enough to be mistaken for your blood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nice! Well, I'll just leave you to it, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll tear you limb from limb out there next time, you mark my words.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are your sisters up to these days, Meg? I've not seen them around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're stretched a little thin, as you can see. Some kind of war up there meant lots of business here. I'm left to hold the line. And deal with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are your sisters up to these days, Meg? I've not seen them around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're stretched a little thin, as you can see. Some kind of war up there meant lots of business here. I'm left to hold the line. And deal with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you want from me, leave me alone. We've nothing to discuss here anymore.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was just checking up on you, just... let me know if you wanted to talk, for any reason.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am not interested in having company, especially from you. You stay the hell away while I'm off duty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I told you to back off.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you want from me, leave me alone. We've nothing to discuss here anymore.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was just checking up on you, just... let me know if you wanted to talk, for any reason.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am not interested in having company, especially from you. You stay the hell away while I'm off duty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I told you to back off.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Excuse me, is there something I can do for you, Prince Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's nothing, I just thought I'd say, that was well fought back there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's no returning to the way things used to be, Zag. Now can I offer you some words of advice? Get over yourself. And get ready to die out there next time we meet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus. Good, I wanted to tell you something. Your victories against me? They don't count for anything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds like you've been giving this a lot of thought, there, Meg. How do you figure?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx's Mirror. You couldn't possibly beat me without its help, or hers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not competing with you, Meg. I'm trying to get past you, to the surface.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Call it what you want. You're doing what you have to do. I understand. But you are not stronger than me. You just have more help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Meg, what is it going to take for you to quit treating me like I'm incompetent? Have I not grown even a little since we met? You were supposed to teach me something; what does that make you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsch... why don't you raise your voice a little louder so that all the House can hear. Is that what you want? For everyone to know that you're superior to me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're not hearing me, Meg. I know it sounds a little disingenuous considering we keep fighting to the death and all, but... I never meant to hurt you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You give yourself far too much credit, Zagreus. Leave me alone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Meg, that isn't why I'm here, you know that isn't how I am. Why can't you see it? All I've ever wanted was to prove myself to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsch... you think that you can prove yourself to me by winning in a fight?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sometimes I think that I can never really win with you, Meg. If I held back, what would you have thought?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you think you know me so well, Zagreus, then you ought to know better than to keep this conversation going with me, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I had to see if I could do it, Meg. I've learned so much from you, I... thought maybe this was a way that I could prove myself to you. And to myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prove yourself, to me...? You must not be as comfortable in your own skin as you let on. I can't decide if I like that about you. Now leave me alone while I give it some thought.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, Zagreus. How's it going with that Pact of Punishment you signed? You've made some meaningful improvements to the Underworld.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll fight my way out of this place, or earn it. The Pact is nothing to me other than a way to keep things lively.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are delusional. I'll never understand you or your father. Anyway, if you're looking for more punishment, you know where to find me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, Zagreus. How's it going with that Pact of Punishment you signed? You've made some meaningful improvements to the Underworld.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll fight my way out of this place, or earn it. The Pact is nothing to me other than a way to keep things lively.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are delusional. I'll never understand you or your father. Anyway, if you're looking for more punishment, you know where to find me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus. I heard Lord Hades served you with a Pact of Punishment. You must be very proud.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, you mean the gigantic infernal contract reserved only for extraordinary circumstances? Yeah, I suppose I'm pleased that Father's gone to all that trouble just for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, when you're finished being smug about it? Know that all of us are bound by its terms. You can force a lot of things to change if you're not careful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A lot of things, such as how you refuse to reason with your positively charming sisters, Meg?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Extreme Measures condition... you wouldn't dare. Do you have any idea what you're talking about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, how was it up there, Zagreus? Within Elysium. You'll have to tell us all about it every time the greatest strike you down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've never been there, have you? It's... lush? Is that a word? It feels closer to the surface. Closer to the sky.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How poetic. You could have visited as part of your responsibilities. Instead, you trespass. Incurring wrath of fallen champions in service of your father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, how was it up there, Zagreus? Within Elysium. You'll have to tell us all about it every time the greatest strike you down.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've never been there, have you? It's... lush? Is that a word? It feels closer to the surface. Closer to the sky.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How poetic. You could have visited as part of your responsibilities. Instead, you trespass. Incurring wrath of fallen champions in service of your father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you cleared out some of the Satyr infestation near the surface, then. How come the change of heart? Not like you to assist Lord Hades in such things.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wasn't trying to do my father any favors, Meg. Those Satyrs seem to hate me just as much as him. My one way out involves a detour straight into their dens.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An interesting coincidence. At any rate, that's one less problem for the rest of us to deal with. Until the Satyrs all come back, at least, which won't be long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've been through hell more times than you can count by now, haven't you, Zag. You getting used to it? No wonder that you're friends with Sisyphus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm getting used to it, all right. I'll keep going, for as many chances as it takes. I'll look forward to our next appointment out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Appointment. Indeed. Don't keep me waiting. For all your toil, I'm sure you're not even close.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will not let that happen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus, please tell me that the rumors are untrue. You really vanquished him? Have you completely lost your mind? You're going to destroy this blasted House!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Meg, Father had it coming for some time. What's your concern, besides? The House is safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's not going to take this lying down. He'll find some way to take it out on you. On all of us. You watch yourself, or all of us will pay.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will not let that happen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus, please tell me that the rumors are untrue. You really vanquished him? Have you completely lost your mind? You're going to destroy this blasted House!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, Meg, Father had it coming for some time. What's your concern, besides? The House is safe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's not going to take this lying down. He'll find some way to take it out on you. On all of us. You watch yourself, or all of us will pay.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you doing here? I heard you finally made it out. What, did you break out of here, only to die in some pathetic way on the surface?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Long story, but yeah. Boils down to what you said, more or less.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you're going back out there, again. Well, it's your business, not mine. For your sake... I hope it's worth it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you doing here? I heard you finally made it out. What, did you break out of here, only to die in some pathetic way on the surface?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Long story, but yeah. Boils down to what you said, more or less.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you're going back out there, again. Well, it's your business, not mine. For your sake... I hope it's worth it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: None of my business, I said.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Meg, did you... did you ever meet the Queen...? Remember anything about her, at all?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was not my place to address her. I barely ever saw her. Then, at some point... I never saw her again. And, unlike you, I know better than to get involved in things that are none of my business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How is it that this place has this secret Queen for I don't know how long, then suddenly she just vanishes, and no one speaks a word of it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think that she can be the judge of that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How is she doing, Zagreus? The Queen, I mean. She was... I had admired her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother... she's doing well, I think. She's in good spirits every time we meet. Happy to let her know you're thinking of her, by the way!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't, it's... it isn't necessary. She doesn't need you telling her about this place. Sounds to me like she is better off without.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll make it official, all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just so I understand. Breaking through everything in your path, taking resources from your father's realm, trying to get through me... all officially part of the job description?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I guess that's right... but, before you ask, I'm not doing it for him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I didn't think you'd have it in you. To leave this place for good. But I didn't think you'd take responsibility for anything, either. Anyway... we'll just have to kill each other more officially, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I never thought I'd see the Queen again. I still can't quite believe she's back... and staying? Is that really your doing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's her doing, not mine. So you know her? Because... you could have told me. About her. Who she was to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't know her all that well. But I do know Nyx, and I've been bound to secrecy as part of my oath to this House. I flay oathbreakers and liars, Zagreus. Wouldn't do for me to be no better than them, now, would it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, I suppose not. So what does this mean for Nyx, now that she's back? Or for you, for that matter?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Queen always gave Nyx her space. Your father, though... I don't know what it'll be like for him, if she decides to stick around this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So the Olympians are backing you officially now? Doing their part to help the family business, finally. Lord Hades probably never thought he'd see the day. Night? You know what I mean.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Seems only fair they should help in some capacity. They all work together on the surface, and, let's face it, they're responsible for a good number of shades pouring into this realm. Least they can do is help shore up the whole 'there is no escape' reputation we've got.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: By making you unfairly stronger by the time you try to get through me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Zag? You like things nice and complicated, don't you. Apparently so do I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you're asking if I have any regrets about what happened between us, the answer is no. Being with you... any complications there are worth it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't need to tell me. Two rules, if you want to keep this up. First... we set the personal aside when we're out there. I better not hear a soul say I'm going soft on you. And second... keep up this slightly more mature thing you've had going for you recently.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wasn't planning on sliding back into the insensitive nonsense of youth, so I don't think the second thing will be a problem. But the first... can we really just keep killing each other out there like nothing happened?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsk... Come off it, Zag. Are you really going to act all uncomfortable every time you see me now? More than usual I mean.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, it's just... I felt terrible, turning you away. It's just... I've been so confused lately, and... I trust you. You're someone I can talk to. I guess I'm... afraid to lose that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't be an idiot, and you won't. We've been through a lot together. Grown, maybe. This particular relationship... it can't die so easily, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I feel like everybody knows about us, Meg. Even Aphrodite, herself, seemed to know we were involved. It's not like I've been going around boasting. You wanted to keep things quiet, didn't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus. Are you happy with how things are between us now? Or do you have a problem with it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I could do without the kill-or-be-killed stuff if we're being honest, that part is still a little weird, but otherwise... yes, I mean... I'm happy. You're you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then, that's enough. Let them say what they want. What does it matter? We're gods. The things they say about us... even other gods... you pay too much attention to it, it'll drive you out of your mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But... I know how important your career is to you. This won't create a problem?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've already crossed that bridge, I think. Stop worrying.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Megaera... you ever been in love with somebody?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, thanks. I guess I am.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never in my wildest fantasies did I imagine you'd ever end up on the Featured Houseservant Board, Zagreus. I still can't entirely believe it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa, back up! Can you elaborate a bit about these wildest fantasies, Meg?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm serious. You should be proud. Not arrogantly proud to a fatal fault or anything, but a little bit is all right in a case like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll keep putting up a fight if it's any consolation.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got to tell you something, Zagreus. I'm not getting any more used to losing to you like this. I mean... you don't even stop to rub it in. You know how humiliating that is?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, you're saying you would feel less ashamed about the outcomes of our fights if I were to gloat more about beating you? How does that make any sense?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know what doesn't make any sense? That you keep beating me. I must be getting sloppy if I'm that predictable... too bad none of the other wretches I have to deal with put up much of a fight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You and your sisters really don't get along well, do you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alecto and Tisiphone and I each have a different outlook, I would say. We've learned mostly to stay out of one another's way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That doesn't sound like a healthy basis for a relationship between siblings.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Are you lecturing me about healthy relationships with family, Zagreus? Your family, your father's family, is the most broken and corrupted in the history of the entire concept.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Fair point. I... didn't mean to sound like I had any meaningful advice, there, Meg. We're stuck with our bloodlines and our relatives, aren't we.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your family cut their Titan parents into pieces and then scattered them in Tartarus. Remember that when next you tell me about family.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, while it was brutal squaring off against the three of you, I have to say, Meg... I was happy you were with your sisters. Nothing like a common cause for bringing bitter rivals together, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have your Pact of Punishment to thank for our reunion, there. We have to answer to its terms. But my sisters and I, we got on better than I had expected, I will give you that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you've patched things up, then? Going to start spending more quality time together and all that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hm, let's not get carried away. A work assignment forcing our cooperation is not exactly a big step in the quality of our relationship.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alecto's really something else. She must have been a real handful, huh?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My youngest sister takes a lot of pleasure from her work. I've learned something of that from her. But that's as far as we relate, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She could learn a thing or two from you, I'm sure. About having a little common decency, perhaps.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She won't be learning anything from me. The contempt you get from her is unconditional. I learned not to take it personally.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, so, about Tisiphone, is... uh... everything all right with her? Talk of murder, all the time, and all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tisiphone is charged with punishing the worst that mortals have to offer. More than charged. Her work is everything to her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No time for family or recreation, then, I take it? Pity what happens to those overly obsessed with work.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I get what you're insinuating, Zagreus. I'm nothing like her. Not even close. And don't you dare compare the two of us again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, that's a good way to put it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So you've been trying to give Tisiphone speech lessons between fights to the death. Are you bored, or just naive?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, if her vocabulary consists of two different although admittedly almost identical words, there's got to be room for growth, there. Besides, I feel like... maybe she's lonely, or something. Has anyone ever tried to teach her anything?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Maybe, just maybe, you're projecting your own insecurities onto her a little bit? Tis can take care of herself. Always has. Talking's not her strong suit like it's yours. But if you, in all your wisdom, think you've got something to teach her, you go right ahead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've tried already, haven't you? She's pretty dead-set on the murder thing, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You and Thanatos don't work together much anymore, do you, Meg?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. Though he still brings me my assignments every now and then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oathbreakers, traitors, and the like? Sending them straight to Tartarus, huh. Must be quite an experience going from living and breathing, to... being dead, to being whisked off by Thanatos, straight to you and your whip.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If that's not the experience mortals are looking for, they need only keep their oaths and not betray the ones they're closest to. It's not that hard.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you tried sulking in the lounge?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're not too broken up about how things ended between you and Hypnos, are you, Meg?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm still in a state of shock. I'll have to pick up the pieces somehow, and figure out how to get on with my existence.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You got that court musician to pipe up again. I know you can't shut up, but didn't know it was contagious.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, it was all Orpheus, not me. Can't sing like that without a lot of motivation, inner turmoil, who knows what else. Why, don't you like it? This lounge seems better with a little song.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This lounge is fine. And the singing... not used to it yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not seen the court musician sulking over there quite as much lately. Your doing, I hear?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll just have to sulk for the both of you, I guess, then, Meg. But if you must know, on my authority I have released Orpheus from the terms of his old, rather unfair agreement with Father, so he can see his wife at least from time to time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And Lord Hades is OK with you just picking out old binding contracts and nullifying them? You're exploiting your status.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm doing no such thing. Father wanted me involved in all this business with his pacts, and presiding over the dead, then fine. But I'll do it my way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hoh now let's not get ahead of ourselves, Meg.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you think of all the lounge decor, there, Meg? Looking a little better these days, wouldn't you say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, it isn't bad. Though I have heard the strangest thing, that you're responsible, for all of this? I couldn't understand why you would even bother, honestly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, it's a popular locale for off-duty Underworld officers to take a load off between shifts, and so I figure... least I can do is pitch in and make the place a little better than I left it, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How very selfless of you, Zagreus. Soon doubtless it'll be your portrait hanging on that wall back there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The prism-sphere in the corner is maybe a little much. But the fireplace... the bat-cage... the aquarium... this lounge is practically comfortable. Lord Hades would strongly disapprove.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good thing he never sets foot in here, then, huh? Wait, you don't miss when things were all sad and dreary in here, do you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm still getting used to it. But, no.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How's my little Battie doing, Zag? The one I gave you. Was just a little pup. I figured she'd be better off with you. Please tell me I was right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Battie's doing great, Meg. Reminds me of you every time I think of her. Helps keep me company throughout my little jaunts outside. So you've a thing for bats, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's good. And yes, the bats around here, they and I have always shared an understanding, you could say. I usually care for the pups myself. But Battie? She seemed more your style.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Meg, what's going on with Nyx and Dusa, do you know? I think they've been butting heads a bit lately.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't imagine why. Nyx has her under strict orders, yet you keep on stopping by for your little chats. You think she doesn't notice?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What does she care? I talk to everybody around here at least a bit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not my business, Zag. Not even for Dusa. But you watch yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damn you, Zagreus. She was my friend. And now she's gone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who, you mean Dusa? Like I had anything to do with that. It's Nyx you should be cross with, not me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't think so. Nyx warned you. Ungh, you know I can't go to her myself about this, so fix it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This never should have happened, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You saw Dusa's back, right, Meg? She's getting another chance. Nyx reconsidered!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I saw. Nyx doesn't often change her mind when it comes to this House. But I won't second guess what happened or why.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't sound all that pleased...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm so proud of Dusa lately, Meg! Chief Custodian of the House, was it? That's quite an honor coming from Nyx.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought all the added responsibility would stress Dusa out worse than usual. But she's taking it in stride.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're always looking out for her. Thanks for that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not doing it for you. Though... thanks for looking out for her, yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did not appreciate you sending Dusa after me out there, Zag. You leave her out of this! Though... it was good to see her out of this damned House for a change.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: See, I, too, thought she could use the fresh air. Or... however you'd describe the quality of the air on the edge of Tartarus. You know she'd never mean you any harm, right? In her mind... I think she's trying to keep it friendly between us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eugh, she said the same thing to me. Look, you know what, fine. If that's the only way to get her to take a break from this place, I guess it's for the best.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Meg, I understand you're under orders to kill me on sight out there, but... do you really have to go so hard on Sisyphus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That wretched shade isn't who you think he is. Do you have any idea of the magnitude of his crimes from when he led a mortal life?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He cheated death. Tricked Thanatos and maybe Father, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Before that, he did worse. He was an awful man. I think that is the real reason that your father punished him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if he's changed? Or... is that impossible. No coming back from certain crimes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No coming back from certain crimes, indeed. Though you may have more mercy in your heart to spare than I in mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to ask you for a favor, Meg. And I'm willing to make it worth your while, if you'll hear me out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A proposition, Zagreus? Let's hear it, then. While I'm in a charitable mood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's about Sisyphus. If I can get my father to alleviate his sentence, would you just... ease off of him, a little bit? You and your sisters. I think he's suffered quite enough under your whips.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know what you see in him, I swear. But you don't need to ask such things of me. If you can overturn his sentence with Lord Hades, I'd like nothing better than to never see that miserable shade again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Megaera, I have to ask you something, please. We really need to talk.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...For once, I think you're right. Although, I'm curious, what is it that you think we have to talk about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I still have feelings for you. At least... I think I do. Isn't there... isn't there someway for us to, you know... work through all of this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In spite of everything that's happened, and that's happening right now? What are the outcomes, Zagreus? Either you eventually succeed, and leave this place, or else, what, exactly?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I haven't thought that far ahead. But I don't think it has to be this way. I don't hate you, Meg. I don't think I can ever hate you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Despite my best intentions. Unfortunately, I don't know that I can say the same. Look, I'm at a very difficult point in my career. I need to focus on that now. Do we understand each other?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Megaera, I have to ask you something, please. We really need to talk.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...For once, I think you're right. Although, I'm curious, what is it that you think we have to talk about?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I still have feelings for you. At least... I think I do. Isn't there... isn't there someway for us to, you know... work through all of this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In spite of everything that's happened, and that's happening right now? What are the outcomes, Zagreus? What, exactly?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I haven't thought that far ahead. But I don't think it has to be this way. I don't hate you, Meg. I don't think I can ever hate you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Despite my best intentions. Unfortunately, I don't know that I can say the same. Look, I'm at a very difficult point in my career. I need to focus on that now. Do we understand each other?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Meg, you know what's going on with Than and me, don't you? I just... want things to be out in the open, between us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh I know everything about you, Zag. And Thanatos, maybe even better. Though I appreciate you telling me. It's fine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's fine? I mean... upon Olympus, jealousy runs rampant, as I'm told. But here it's not even an issue, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you prefer the way they do things on Olympus, then I think you know the way. As for me... dealing with jealousy is what I do. Tell me, should I feel threatened by Thanatos?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No... he thinks so highly of you, he... he'd never wish to cause you any harm.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And I feel much the same. He and I, we're not the same to you. I think we both see that, and understand. Now quit your second-guessing me, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Make certain of it, Megaera. I am finding, lately, that the help within this House is much more lacking than it used to be. I trust that you shall set it back on course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...If that is your will, Lord Hades, then it will be done. To the fullest limits of my capability.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Give me another chance, Lord Hades. I can do better. Don't... bring them here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is already too late for that, Megaera. They have been notified and are en route to Tartarus even as we speak.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know what they're like. They are best left to their specific tasks. Not this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Megaera, trust me when I say I know the feeling all too well. However, surely, in your ingenuity, you may yet find a way to get your sisters to see eye to eye.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I cannot work with them, Lord Hades. Please. They don't respect my words, or even listen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enough! Besides, Megaera, this is not your failing. It is mine. I must attend to these affairs more actively.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I've often tried, but never to a satisfactory result. You're asking the impossible of me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...But, I don't understand, Lord Hades. I have fallen to him countless times. How can this be...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You and your sisters have protected Tartarus unerringly. The Prince has proven uncontainable. The fault is mine, not yours. Your duty to this realm must be commended.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You honor me... I have done nothing to deserve this. There must be something more that I can do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There is, and isn't, Megaera. I ask only that you remain committed to this realm. Bar passage in and out of Tartarus. And, if the Prince continues to show up... you give him hell.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Hades, it will be my pleasure, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...We each have our commitments to this House, Megaera. There is no shame in yours. And whilst your sisters are away, you bear their burden of responsibility, as well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand, it's just... am I supposed to keep pretending nothing's changed? This House is cracking at the seams, and no one's going to admit it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The House shall stand eternally, although in what condition, it is ours to decide. Our obligation is to keep the House in order.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know. You're right of course, you're right... I'll do my best. I'll do my best for both our sakes, Nyx.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...We all do that which is within our power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...and so, who else is there to be depended on...? You are a trusted overseer, Megaera. Your station is no accident and there is no one better fit for what you do. I urge you to look inwardly. How you approach your work is vital to the end result.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Thank you for the advice, Nyx. I don't know what I'd do without you. Or what this House would be if not for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...But, how can you do this to me? Blast your Mirror. By taking sides with him, you're standing against me...!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Neutrality ceases to be an option when a crisis rises to a certain point, Megaera. You, yourself, shall have to choose allegiances. I have steadfastly told you this throughout our shared ordeal.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought that both of our allegiances were to this House, Nyx. It seems I was mistaken. Do you have any idea what sort of pressure I am under here...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Use caution with the tone you take with me, Overseer. I am the mother of the Fates, themselves. I do not act by whim or by mistake. Mind your own station, and perform your role. All shall unfold eventually as it must. I like the intervening time no more than you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Nyx, you'd tell me if I made a terrible mistake, or even just a bad one, wouldn't you? I need your guidance on this one, or maybe your approval.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You shall always be the best determiner of what is right about such matters, Megaera. Though, if you seek my blessings or encouragement in this particular pursuit, please rest assured... you have them both. You know the way, from here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope that you are right. You always have been, it's just that... I wish I had your confidence in this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do know where to find you, Megaera.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I think I understand, now, Nyx. You've been here longer than the rest of us combined. You've seen this House go through a lot. Even before Lord Hades took his place. I never should have doubted you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To doubt is an important instinct, Megaera. Without it, we could not conceive of better circumstances than the ones we know. Besides... I am the Night. Others shall always doubt me. You may doubt me again. I ask only that you heed well your intuitions, from now on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will. I promise, Nyx. And if there's anything you ever need that I can do, well... please, just ask of me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...They can't be reasoned with, Nyx. You know that. What use are they to us, trying to manage this? They'll make things worse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They are your sisters. They are part of your life, whether you like it or not. Your relationship with them is yours to mold.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm afraid there isn't much for me to work with. You have a lot more faith in them than I do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a lot more faith in you, Megaera. There are many obstinate personalities with whom we regularly interact. Thus, we do what is possible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Would you look at that, Hypnos. Care to repeat to me the unsolicited advice you just now offered, now that Zagreus is here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, hahaha, well, it is my custom to give pointers to our visitors, who come involuntarily, because, I do pick up a lot of bits and pieces, talking here to everyone! About, you know... dying?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus. He told me that I ought to evade more of your attacks next time. So you just watch your back out there, because I know your secrets thanks to Hypnos here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I think that I can find the lounge well on my own, Hypnos. Or... wait... what is this, did you just ask me out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Me? No, nonononono, no! I'd never even think to do that, Miss, I mean, you have your station, and I have mine. We're from two different worlds, you could say. Fated never to be seen together much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Every time I talk to you, you somehow take it as a compliment, is that correct? Then, let me give you some advice, for once. Stop being an idiot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...You haven't greeted me as often lately, Hypnos. I wouldn't have noticed if it weren't half your job. If there's something you wish to say to me, why not just come right out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, um, well, I, see, the thing is, Megaera, Miss Megaera, mind if I call you that? As I was saying, I just, thought maybe, you know, we had a thing, a real connection, lately, since you keep on dying more and more, and I keep standing here? But then... I always thought you were invincible...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. And so you're realizing now that your entire image of me came from your imagination, is that it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, it's just! I really thought with all my advice that you'd go back to killing Zagreus, rather than the other way around! I just don't think things are working out the way I hoped, you know?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It almost sounds as though you've broken up with me, except... well, are you sure that you'll be all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, yeah! Look, I'm just glad it's one of you two, sure beats having to greet shades nonstop! They never talk to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right, then... you greet me next I'm here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...It was my duty to prevent him from getting farther. If I succeeded... he never would have found you. So this once, I'm glad I failed. I hope you know that, my Queen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hoped, but did not know for certain till I heard from you just now, Overseer Megaera! And, if I may? I understand you have achieved an awful lot since I took my, erm, leave of absence from this House. I see why Nyx and Hades put their trust in you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, my Queen. Then, if there's anything else that I can do to help you reacclimate yourself, I'm always at your service. You are most welcome, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Likewise, you be sure to let me know if my son there happens to make more trouble for you than you welcome in your life. All right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can't you see I'm busy now with more important things than you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May I help you somehow, Zagreus? Because if not, why don't you leave me be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May I help you somehow, Zagreus, because if not, why don't you leave me be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do I look like I'm in the mood to chat?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do I look like I'm in the mood to chat?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've come to gloat, I guess? Too bad I can't just kill you where you stand, within this blasted House.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have I somehow created the impression that I wish to speak with you? Because if so, there's been a terrible mistake.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There must be someone else whose time you could be wasting, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's embarrassing enough having returned here, much less to be seen talking to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sooner or later when we meet out there again, I'll kill you, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If I have something I decide I wish to tell you, Zagreus, I'll make it clear. Leave me alone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father's absolutely right about you, Zag. You are and always will be an insufferable brat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't test me any further, Zagreus. You know the rules, no violence in the House.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Blood and darkness, leave me be, damn you. I've better things to do than occupy your time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to hand it to you, Zag. You've gotten strong. Sending me all the way back here like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx must be worried, seeing us like this. Lately always at each other's throats.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh don't worry, I'll be back in fighting shape in no time, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father's not been very pleased with my performance lately as you might have guessed.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sometimes, Zagreus, I'm almost not detested by the sight and smell of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shouldn't be back here right now. No thanks to you, of course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm keeping careful track of all the times you've sent me home like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At least the House seems well enough in order since I saw it last.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We keep on running into one another lately, don't we Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You got me fair and square last time. Though I'm a little bitter anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know we can't be seen together like this, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I should be whipping Sisyphus' lazy hide right now instead of standing here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't like having to come back here quite this often, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not even remotely interested in chatting with you, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why don't you go get out of here if you despise this place so much?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you so much as dare talk to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get out of my sight, Zagreus. And be thankful violence is prohibited in here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Right now I wouldn't talk to me if I were you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think you'd best be on your way right now, you understand me, Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think you've wasted quite enough of both our time, don't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whatever's on your mind, believe me, it's the last thing that I want to hear right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't believe you got me like that, Zag. I'm going to get you back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just here licking my wounds until we meet again out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heard you made it pretty far last time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You almost got there last time, didn't you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heard you made it all the way last time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're back. Got all the way to the surface back there, huh?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Keep letting down my guard against you, Zag.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Went all the way to the top last time, huh? Not bad at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ugh, I don't remember the last time I beat you, Zag...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Break's just about over. See you out there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hypnos give you any good pointers lately?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Taking a break from putting up with Alecto out there...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got to say, I like what you and Dusa did with this place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Didn't rough you up too bad last time, did I?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You showed Alecto again. She must be so mad.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: About ready to go another round with me out there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to speak with you in private, Zagreus. Urgently.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's fortunate that matter is resolved. I'll see you out there, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's go someplace a little quieter than this. Where we can concentrate.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A little peace and quiet's good from time to time, don't you agree?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't even say a word, and follow me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Zagreus? Take care until we meet again, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus, did you forget about our private tutoring, again? Come on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There. I take it you'll remember what I've taught you, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come with me, Zagreus. Your chambers are past due for a routine inspection.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well! Seems everything's in order. Carry on.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you're available right now, I have some parchmentwork that needs review.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hmm. Less parchmentwork than I expected. Well, thank you for your time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, uh, Meg? Look, I know you're just doing your job out there, and, anyway, found this, thought of you and all that, so... here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... I'll see to it this contraband is put away at once. Now, take your finder's fee and go about your business.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Meg! I, uh, thought I'd better hand this over.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll confiscate that if you really want. Although, I'm warning you, I'm not susceptible to bribes. Many have tried.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey I'm just handing over contraband to the appropriate authorities, think nothing of it, Meg. Just doing our jobs, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsch. You're serious. You're really giving that to me. I mean, I'll take it off your hands if that is really what you want.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's really what I want. And, I sincerely hope we can move past our differences. Not that turning in this contraband has anything to do with that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Such gifts won't stay my whip when next we meet out there, you realize that, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I realize it. And I hope you never change, Meg.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Flattery won't get you anywhere. We can't go back to how things used to be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Flattery never got me anywhere with you to begin with, Meg. Doesn't mean I won't keep trying. I am ever stubborn, aren't I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got you some more of that contraband you like. Don't suppose I could help you put it away or anything...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look at me, Zag.... You think that all these gifts will make things go back to the way they were? They won't. It isn't possible. We may be immortals but we're older now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ambrosia... you know the penalty for attempting to sway an Overseer of the House of Hades with foreign contraband, don't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't entirely say I do, though if it involves lashings and whatnot, I already get more than my share of that, so... figured I would take the risk. So what do you say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I say hand over the damn bottle. I'll see that it's disposed of properly. Now as for you... you wouldn't know who misplaced something like this, would you? On my authority as Overseer... hang onto it. Though if you tell so much as anyone...!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I had this awful contraband I wanted to turn in as soon as possible, if you don't mind taking it from me, Meg.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsch... you still have no idea how to be up front with me, do you, Zag. Why don't you tell me why you're here, and what you want.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm... so the whole contraband thing, you aren't buying it, I guess? Although I see you took the bottle there, now, anyway... I wanted just to talk to you. And patch things up, maybe.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Patch things up. What is it, by your estimation, that could use repairs, between the two of us, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... I was naive. I tried not to get too close, but then I did, and said a lot of stupid things, and then... well, we've since tried to kill each other lots of times, there's that. Look, I am sorry, Meg.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You said a lot of stupid things, all right. And we Furies, we're not much for forgiveness or apologies. But... I can see you're making an attempt. Now, thank you for the contraband. Good-bye.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see. Take all the time you need.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here, Meg. Contraband. I wish I could do over how we started.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I, too, wish for a lot of things. Unfortunately there's no unraveling the Fates' patterns. We can learn from our mistakes or keep repeating them. That's it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if I've learned from my mistakes? Have I ever done anything to hurt you since we've been like this? Discounting the unavoidable and frequent fights to the death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's nothing you can do to hurt me, Zag. It's just a question of whether you're worth my time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well... am I worth your time, then, Meg?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know... let me get back to you on that. I need a little time to think it through.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Meg, you're off duty, aren't you? Look, I was just... hoping you might want to split this with me, best stuff I could find out there, and I would give it all to you, it's just... maybe you wouldn't mind some company. From me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You sound a little tongue-tied, Zagreus. Just like you always used to around me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're not exactly easy to approach, you know. So... how about it, then? Care for a drink with me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Open it up, and we can go from there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And I think, deep down, you are not the heartless harbinger of retribution that you want for everyone to think you are. But I can keep your secret if you're willing to keep mine, what do you say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsch... that sounds an awful lot like blackmail, Zagreus. You'd stoop to that, with me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, I... I was just, that's not what I meant at all...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahaha, I just want to see you squirm. Thanks for the company and for the drink. Guess I'll be seeing you around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Nyx, you'd tell me if I made a terrible mistake, or even just a bad one, wouldn't you? I need your guidance on this one, or maybe your approval.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You shall always be the best determiner of what is right about such matters, Megaera. Though, if you seek my blessings or encouragement in this particular pursuit, please rest assured... you have them both. You know the way, from here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope that you are right. You always have been, it's just that... I wish I had your confidence in this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Prince Z. Must look like I'm slacking off with the old boulder, here, but... I was just getting back on my feet. The Fury Sisters don't often leave me be. Where'd they go, anyway? And... what are you doing here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you know, just out on a little stroll is all. Do me a favor, though, you see the Fury Sisters, let them know I was headed down the way I came from, will you...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh I'll let them know, all right, I hear you loud and clear, Your Highness. I'll just go about my business now, and you take care.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, Prince Z., I'd not expected to run into you again, not after all this time. Something amiss down in the House, or what? Not had much company of late, is all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, something's just about always amiss back home, sir. Figured it couldn't hurt to check up on things in Tartarus a bit more frequently.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well I am grateful for it, I and the old boulder there, in turn. I'm used to going lengthy stretches on my own, but having visitors from time to time would do me well!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If I may be so bold, Your Highness, I was wondering... what brings you back around this way again? Same story as last time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, I have to level with you, Sisyphus. I'm leaving the House. I've had quite enough. You understand, I'm sure. I'm going to the surface.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whew, that is quite an undertaking, Prince. If it wasn't you yourself proposing it, I'd like to call it madness, truth be told. Though you're just mad enough to pull it off! Well hey, I hope you make it. Good fortune out there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Prince how goes the old escape plan, any luck?
label: CHARACTER
