dialogue: You know it's been all right, all things considered. Dying now and then, and it's been hard, but hey, what can you do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, well, keep your chin up. Me, why I quit trying to get out of here a while back, but, if I was a fire-stepping youngster like yourself, perhaps I would have stuck to it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Your Highness, anything the matter, or just passing through? Happy that we get to chat like this of late, of course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sisyphus, don't take this the wrong way, but... why are you helping me? My father's stuck you here for an eternity of torment and even still, you greet me with a smile, time after time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah! Come now, Prince Z., that's just the way I am! Besides, you're not your father, thank the gods! You always seemed a decent lad to me, and if you're saying you want out of here, why, I suppose I can relate, is all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, Prince, it's been good not having to see those Fury Sisters quite as much lately. The main one, what's her name, she's on your case now, isn't she.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean Megaera. She's on my case all right. Under strict orders not to let me out of Tartarus. I guess that means you've got yourself a break! About damn time they gave one to you, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, quick question, Sisyphus, you seen the other Fury Sisters lately?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not seen the other Fury Sisters in some time now that you mention it! Just Megaera, the kindly one, and she is quite a handful on her own. I'll keep an eye out for the other two!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sisyphus, how can you stand it, being here like this? You always seem in such good spirits, though.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You push old Bouldy here sufficient times, and you might get a different outlook on things, too. With the Furies all preoccupied and with my running into you from time to time, I'm positively doing great lately. I like to take what pleasures I can get!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look here, Bouldy, Prince Z. himself has come to visit us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does Bouldy really keep you company? Personally I would resent a giant boulder that keeps tumbling back down a hill after I push it all the way up there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Bouldy's not so bad, I mean, he's a good listener, a good shoulder to lean on, doesn't wield a whip... I rightly can't complain! Good having company down here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know I was just thinking, sir... sometimes I am a little envious of you and Bouldy there. You seem to have things pretty figured out. I still grow frustrated with myself quite often and don't always know whom to turn to.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, hah! Well, I just think you're in a tough spot lately, Prince. But you'll get through! As for old Bouldy, why, by all means do not hesitate to lay your troubles on him if you like! Dumped all of mine on him a while back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So I can just... walk up and talk to him, and chat? That's all it takes?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's truly all it takes to make a friend sometimes, indeed, Highness. Now, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to thank you, Sisyphus, not just for all the help you've given me time after time, but for encouraging me to have a chat with Bouldy there. I daresay I feel a little more at peace of late, and maybe it's thanks to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's a good one, all right, isn't he? Though if you've come to such an understanding with old Bouldy there, why, it must mean you've done some growing on your own as well, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Your Highness, good, old Bouldy there had several things he wanted to tell you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you for listening to him! With all that said, I think I've got something for you right here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Prince, ah, so... you do know Bouldy's just a plain old rock with a few lines chiseled into him, resembling a face, don't you? Chiseled into it, I mean. Just so you don't get the wrong idea...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come now, sir, we both know full well Bouldy's much more than that. You really think I doubt the power of Bouldy after everything we've been through?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahahaha, no. Was just a jest, there, at Bouldy's expense. Look at him! He gets so annoyed when I call him a plain old rock like that. But then he calls me an old lazy lump, and then we're even for a while.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ever meet Alecto, Sisyphus? The Fury Megaera's nastier sister. We recently became acquainted, she and I.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, fortunately I've not seen too much of her, myself, Prince Z. And based on everything that I have seen and heard, I'd like to keep it that way for a while! I hope she doesn't cause you too much trouble there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sisyphus, have you had run-ins with Tisiphone the Fury here before? She isn't much for conversation, I don't think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tisiphone. Why, yes, I have, in fact, Prince Z. She's visited on multiple occasions, truth be told. So she is back, is she?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She is. Although, I think she's back to deal with me. I'll have to keep her plenty busy just in case.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Appreciate it, Prince. Of all the Fury Sisters, she's the one I would least care to see. But if she does stop by, you know, that's how it goes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, Prince, I don't hold grudges, you know that. Push this boulder long as I have, you move past the petty stuff. So, just want you to know, in case you make it out this time, it's been a real pleasure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Feeling's mutual, sir. Someday you'll have to tell me all about how you tricked Father. I might learn a thing or two.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sisyphus, you ever lose somebody dear to you? There's someone out there whom I need to find. That's... all that I can say right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I get it, Highness, and I didn't mean to pry, it's just... I can't remember what it's like to want something so bad, you know? Whoever's out there, I hope you find them soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey sir, I've always wondered, what were you like back when you were alive? Were you always this wise?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Might surprise you, Highness, I've a bit of royalty in me, myself. Not on your level, mind, but I was very much a king. Though I'll be honest, I... I wasn't much of a good man.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Huh! I thought I sensed the royalty in you! Although, I can't imagine you as anything besides the gentleman I know you for, my friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well that is awful kind of you to say. Though, I would like to think my punishment here wasn't without warrant. At least I've had a lot of time to think it through!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, Sisyphus, you mind my asking what you did to warrant this particular arrangement you've got here? Pushing a boulder till the end of time and all. Never heard it in your own words.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, it's a bit of a long story, Prince. My time had come, though I just wasn't ready, you might say. Your father thought he had me in his clutches, but then, shoom! I gave him the slip. Your father's henchman, Thanatos, he'll back me up on that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Outsmarted Thanatos, that's amazing... what happened then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Turns out your father doesn't like us mortals cheating death. Eventually they found me, so, now I'm stuck here with my boulder friend. I push old Bouldy up the hill to the beat of the Furies' whips, then he tumbles down, and then we go again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So then, you're stuck forever, no reprieve. That's terrible... wish there was something I could do to help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You save those sympathies for someone else, Your Highness! I could be Prometheus, spending an eternity having my liver gobbled up, but instead I get to stay in shape, and have these chats with you. Now I'd better get back to it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sisyphus, I've meant to ask, where are you getting all this stuff you give to me? You must be pretty well connected around here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, well, you know! I have acquaintances amongst the locals here, try to be neighborly with everyone is all. It's not just Bouldy and myself as you can see. Sometimes I come across things that'd be better off in other hands than mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to tell you, Sisyphus. Sometimes I wish I knew more about your past. You must have been a great king.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, ah-hah, the thing is that I wasn't, Highness. And that's not modesty from me, all right? All behind me, now. And I'd appreciate it if we left it at that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hear you, sir. Though, whatever you did in your mortal days... you've since more than paid for it, I'm sure.... Wait, is that why you're still here, in Tartarus? Because you think you deserve this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's more like... this is where I belong. Where my path has taken me, you know? Here in the Underworld, you can't entirely escape your past... and yet, it's like you get another life to live. With all the wisdom that you picked up along the way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, Prince Z., you really have a look about you that you know exactly where you're going, as of late. I used to think you weren't near as comfortable in your own skin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you were right. I was never comfortable performing Father's routine Tartarus inspections. Though those responsibilities of mine didn't last long.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nor did we have much opportunity to chat back then, but hey! You always struck me as a decent sort. Wasn't accustomed to your father's henchpeople greeting me with a smile.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sisyphus, I know you tend to be in remarkably good spirits, all things considered, but there must be something I can do to help with your predicament, isn't there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, come now, Prince, do Bouldy and I look like we could use your charity? We're planning to stay put within this chamber for a while. It's hardly a predicament, I'd say.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But, what of the Furies and their torments and all that? They might be back and make all this more difficult for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, yes, the Fury Sisters, well. I wouldn't mind seeing them more infrequently now that you mention it, but either way! So don't you even worry about me. Now, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have good news, sir! I located the contract binding you, and bought it out. It's null and void. You're free to go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! Indeed, then, does this mean, Prince, then... the Fury Sisters, they won't come around as often anymore?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not just that, Sisyphus! You can make your way someplace else, where other decent shades reside! You know, somewhere with fewer chains and torture devices and such?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're much too kind to this old soul, Prince Z. The thing is, this is home. For me and Bouldy, it is what it is. Though, knowing that the Furies won't be visiting with quite their former regularity, that is a load off. Heavier than Bouldy, there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mean you're really going to stay? Even though you don't have to?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that so odd, Highness? Don't see myself lugging old Bouldy out of here, besides! And if I were to leave, why, we would not be having these exchanges now and then. I happen to enjoy them quite a bit! Now, here you go, and thank you, very much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Must say, Prince Z., the free life sure does have its perks down here! This place really isn't as bad as it's cracked up to be.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Glad to hear it, sir. But you're still here... the same as ever. Is it really all that different from the way it always was?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, it used to be I'd have to start heaving Bouldy there at any point, if the Fury Sisters decided to show up. But now? I just get to relax, chat a bit with the other shades, and give you one of these when you're in the area!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, there you are, Prince! I was just thinking about how grateful I am that you got me out of that contract with your father. It's been a real weight off my shoulders, truth be told.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You never seemed particularly concerned even before, sir. Must say you're very good at hiding your worries.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And I could say the same to you! Look, I know you were concerned for my wellbeing. Now you don't have to be. And I'll still be around to help you out. Good feeling, isn't it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must have seen everything there is to see here in your father's Underworld, haven't you, Prince? I figure that there isn't any place nicer than this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh! Well, I suppose now that you're free, you could always see for yourself? It's pretty different as soon as you reach Asphodel. Don't you have someplace or somebody you'd like to see?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll take what's coming to me right here, thank you very much. You're the wayfaring sort, but my wayfaring days are over. It's hard to explain, but... this is a much-needed fresh start for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I will have you know, Prince, that your visits here have become a very important part of my routine!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And what routine is that, exactly, sir?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, the routine of looking forward, of course! I try to appreciate the moment as much as anybody, but you know? It's always nice having something to look forward to. So, see you next time, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard straight from the source the Fury Megaera's been giving you a time, there, hasn't she. Trust me I know the feeling, so, I'm grateful that you're here and that she's not. You give her hell for me next time, won't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh I'll get her for the both of us one of these days. Nights? Whenever.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Prince, I heard you showed that Fury Sister the what-for, is that the truth? Might explain why I've been left here to my own devices for a change.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't think she'll be out of commission for very long. She'd best find you minding that boulder, though at least you managed to catch a break for now. Be seeing you, Sisyphus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now you be careful out there, Highness. The kindly Megaera is out for blood. She kept on groaning 'bout the last exchange between the two of you. You must have showed her good!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think I might have gotten lucky.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Prince Z., I heard the strangest rumor, here's the thing, I'll give it to you straight. I have heard you've been consorting both with Megaera the Fury and with that old stiff, Thanatos, can you believe it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sisyphus, I don't know where you heard that, but... it's true. They're... they're just doing their jobs, and I... I know how it looks, but... you're my friend, as well, and I don't want you to forget that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... look, I do appreciate the sentiment, Your Highness, I'm just surprised. I thought we shared a common foe in them, is all. What can I say, I hope that someday I can see them how you see them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you for understanding, sir. Besides... maybe I can get them to cut you some slack.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sisyphus, I have to be up front with you. The Fury Megaera and Thanatos... I know you're not exactly on the best of terms with either one of them. But they're both close to me. You won't hold it against me, sir, will you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, Prince, it's not for me to judge you, or your friends. The Fury Sisters, Master Thanatos... we got off on the wrong foot, you could say. My fault, entirely. I'd sooner make sure that our correspondence here doesn't make those relationships more difficult.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't even say that, sir. I think Meg and Than know me better than that by now. Well, thanks for understanding, as always.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Certainly, Highness. And who knows? Perhaps as you spend more time together, some of your finer qualities will rub off on those two!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How goes it with old Master Thanatos of late, Prince Z.? Is he at least less stern with you than with the poor mortals he's sent to take in here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Thanatos is doing all right. Much like my father, I think he feels he has some sort of fearsome reputation to uphold. Or maybe he's perpetually stressed over his work. But he's been well lately.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's good, I guess! Always appreciated that he ultimately took me in, rather than having to show up here through much more sudden, much more painful means. Didn't stop me from trying to avoid the trip, of course.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Word is you've caused quite the hubbub in Elysium, Prince Z.! Making the champion up there really work for it, I hear?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You could say that, I guess! Apparently word gets around. That Theseus, though... he doesn't care for me one bit, let me tell you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I bet he'd like you better if you were a regular pushover! Ah, well, he'll learn, I'm sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prince, you've been gone for quite a while, why... I heard-tell you made it all the way outside! And I believed it for a while there, yet here you are. What happened, might I ask?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I made it out of here, indeed, sir. I always said that I was leaving, but... turns out there was good reason for me to come back. Not the least of which is visiting my friends from time to time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I am certainly delighted to hear that! So long as you achieved what you set out to do. But, what brings you back again this way? More than a social visit I presume.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're right. I'm back because... I'm leaving once again. Something I have to do if I get up there, though I should be back before long either way, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Going to try and make it out of here again and again, is it? Well they say repetition is the key to mastery, Prince Z. Now here, I'll send you on your way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, how do you like the surface, hey, Prince Z.? Now that you've finally had a chance to see it for yourself. Not too bad, I hope?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It takes some getting used to, that's for sure. I'm not sure I'll ever grow completely accustomed to it. Do you miss it, sir?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you know. I still have almost everything that matters, and the rest? It makes for precious memories I didn't have up there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, all this time, Prince, when you were battling up to the surface, and all that... you were searching for her, weren't you? The Queen?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was. Although, between us, sir, it's important that you keep that one a secret, please. Did... you happen to meet her, ever?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, just the one time, briefly, when your father decided to put me here. And, you have my word, of course. About the... surface stuff.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prince Z., my understanding is the Queen herself is back, is that correct? Moreover, I have heard a truly fascinating rumor about her...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That I'm her son...? It's true, sir. And she's back with us for now, indeed. I think we're all still getting used to it, but... it feels good, having her in my life.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's wonderful to hear. I'd always heard good things about that one. No wonder such a quality runs in the family.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just one thing I don't understand, Prince Z., if you'll indulge me for a moment, here. If everything is all right for you at the House, then... why is it you're fighting to the surface, still?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you know. Wouldn't want Father to get too comfortable thinking this place is foolproof. It has a terrifyingly ominous reputation to uphold! There is no escape.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure, that makes sense! Well, from a certain point of view. Escape over and over to prove it can't be done! I like that. Well, let's both of us keep at it, then!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not working yourself too hard of late, are you, Prince Z.? Remembering to take some breaks from time to time, and all?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think I'm managing, thanks, sir. Though, back when you pushed Bouldy rather than talked to him... I suppose you didn't have much of a choice, did you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, it was work, you know? Even your Father has to work. Of course, I've since retired! But it seems you and he like to keep yourselves occupied. Whatever makes you feel content.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, that's my Shattered Shackle on your person, right, Prince Z.? I'd recognize that clunky thing from anywhere. It serving you all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey sir, certainly it's been most welcome having something from you with me at all times. Though has it always held this power? And... how did you remove it to begin with?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bit of an odd story, that. Involved a well-timed accident with the old boulder there. Though, I'd best not get into it so that you're not accomplice to that little crime. Surely you understand?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My Shattered Shackle's practically like new, there, Prince! Minus the part where it's still broken, and all that. Nice work!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanks, sir. It's been of help through my repeated treks across this realm, all thanks to you. You sure you don't want it back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hahahahah! Absolutely not, though truly I appreciate the sentiment. I'd rather have a look at the old boulder there than a symbol of the time I first got stuck here, when I wasn't doing quite as well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Word is that the most beautiful music's been heard up in Asphodel, lately, Prince! From the sound of it, why... I think that has got to be Eurydice and Orpheus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You heard correctly, Sisyphus! Orpheus is reunited with his muse, at last. Or at least, he gets to visit on the regular, when he isn't busy at my father's house. So you've heard of them, have you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I've more than heard of them! I'm sure you know how Orpheus once ventured all the way down here, after Eurydice passed on. I'll never forget his song! Even the Fury Sisters gave me a break, they were so captivated by it, then. Ah, good times. For me, at least!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prince Z., it seems you've brought my little Shady back to visit me! How very kind. And I can tell he's in good care of late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He is, sir, and I'm grateful once again to have adopted him. You sure you don't want him back, though? Always seems like you could use a friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All due respect, Highness, but I've the best friend anyone can ask for to my right just there. And as for little Shady, he was more inclined than I to see the farthest reaches of the Underworld. Safe travels to you both!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sisyphus, sir? Have you any idea how Shady works? I'm able to just whisk both you and Bouldy out of here, and to my aid? It must be awfully disorienting.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Prince, I told you that we'd be with you in spirit, didn't I? It's not just Shady's power, I suppose, nor is it Bouldy's or my hidden strength. It's testament to our companionship, is all. You gods are capable of anything!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She's gone... You still in one piece, Sisyphus? Not hurt or anything?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh I'm just fine, thanks, Prince. That Fury Sister, she is quite a lass, I have to say, and very, very strong. Bet she could push old Bouldy here better than I!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've really never gotten Bouldy to the top before?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never got the boulder to the top, not even once. Always tumbles down right at the very end. Lost count after the nineteen thousandth time or so, but you know what? One of these days, I bet it's going to stick.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sisyphus, did I just hear correctly that Megaera has vowed to leave you be for now? Both you and Bouldy there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, I believe you heard just that, Your Highness! Seems the Fates are giving me a break. Although, the Fury Sister did declare that she'll be back to haunting me after she's through with you...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I bet I can keep her busy for a while yet. I'll take it as a bit of good news, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I'm doing very well, thanks, Prince. I'm not afraid of him, I mean, what have I got to lose? Now here, I wanted you to have this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can you believe the nerve of that one, Prince? He's nothing but a blowhard, so, I simply tell him what he wants to hear! He can't stop me from helping you, besides. I'm dead already, what's he going to do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prince Z.! Just missed your stern-faced colleague, feel that stillness hanging in the air? Sounds like he won't be checking up on me again anytime soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanatos really isn't such a bad sort once you get to know him, sir. Though, I suppose you'll have to take my word for that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I believe it, Highness. I should think that bringing death must be a lonely job. Perhaps he ought to try pushing a boulder sometime!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good to see you in one piece, Prince Z.!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Life treating you all right, I take it, Prince?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh I'm hanging in there, thanks for asking, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll make it out of here, I've no doubt about it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nice of you to drop in for a bit!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are a sight for sore eyes, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now you be careful out there, won't you, Prince?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You give them hell for me, all right, Prince Z.?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go get them for me, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got just the thing for you here, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's always good to see you, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You keep your chin up, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Keep fighting the good fight, there, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey you take care, you hear me, Prince?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's both of us keep going, that a deal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's good of you to visit me like this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hope everything's been well enough of late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You watch your step out there, all right, Prince Z.?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hullo Highness, you're looking well enough!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Your Highness, how goes it, how is everything?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to say it's good to see a friendly face!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Always a pleasure, Highness, you take care out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here's my best friend in all the Underworld, how goes it, Prince?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Glad you made it all this way, Prince Z.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think I've got just the thing for you right here, Highness!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A brief hello from time to time does wonders, don't you think, Prince Z.?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Much as I like the company of Bouldy there, you're always welcome, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stop by whenever you're around these parts, all right, Prince Z.?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know it isn't much, Highness, but I do hope this helps!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here's something courtesy of me and Bouldy, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about a little bit of help as you keep on your journey, Prince?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's see if we might make your going slightly easier, there, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Should have something that ought to come in handy for you, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No need for these, so take one off my hands, won't you, Prince Z.?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bouldy and I have got the usual for you right here, Your Highness.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Highness, please take one of these and go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All's well out here in Tartarus, Prince Z.! What will it be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bouldy and I got our usual selection here, Highness!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't let me keep you, Prince, I know you've plenty of important business here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Before you go, Prince Z., a little souvenir from your fine stay in Tartarus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't do anything I wouldn't do out there, you hear me, Prince?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're looking good and ready for whatever lies ahead up there, Prince Z.!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know approximately where to find me if you happen to be in the area again, Prince Z.!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everything's fine as ever here, Prince Z., so you go on ahead, and don't look back!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have a feeling you are going to make it all the way topside this time, Highness!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bouldy and I will always be here in your time of need, Prince Z.!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bouldy says whatever we can do to help, we'll do it, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In case words of encouragement are not enough, have one of these here, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's get you on your way, Prince Z., and in good spirits, too!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you worry, Highness, we have got you covered here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Told old Bouldy here you'd probably be back if only to say hi!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Prince, Bouldy and I will not be needing these, but maybe they can help!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just do the best you can, if you don't mind me saying so, Prince Z.!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Speaking for myself and Bouldy there, we're always at your service, Prince.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You get all the way up to the top and do whatever it is needs getting done, Highness!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know Bouldy believes in you every bit as much as I do, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, sir, thought this might ease your burden for a while.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now hold a moment, Highness, I cannot accept something like this... not without giving back a little something in return, that is!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, my, you're really giving that to me, there, Prince? But, I'm just, why would you...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You better believe it, sir. Now you take care, be seeing you around.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, Prince, you being serious right now, is that for me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You deserve better, Sisyphus! This really isn't much, but maybe it'll help you while away the days. Nights. Whatever time it is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wow, Your Highness, you... you really shouldn't have. Thank you for not forgetting about me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're always a sight for sore eyes out here, Sisyphus. Thank you for always believing in me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm really very flattered, Highness! You didn't have to get me anything, I mean, your company's more than enough for me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I figured you could do with something more than that this time around, good sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, but this is just too much for me, Your Highness, thank you, really. I don't know how I can ever repay you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about you keep on helping me not die as quickly as I might have otherwise, deal?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sisyphus, sir? You've helped me selflessly time after time without so much as asking anything in return. Wanted to say I'm very grateful, and thought you might like to try this. Here, for a special occasion!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, Prince, is this...? It is...! I've not so much as seen a bottle of it, much less sampled it, thank you so much! Although, with all respect, I cannot rightfully accept such a fine gift. Unless...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Unless...? Oh no, you're not making me take something in return, you know this was a gift not an exchange, sir, right? Wait, what is that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This, Highness, is a little friend of mine kept tucked away in Bouldy's care. Wherever you'll be going next, he'll make a worthy traveling companion. And when he's with you, Bouldy and I... we'll be with you in spirit, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prince, that vintage Ambrosia bottle that you gave me, my! That was the greatest thing I ever tried, I think! Even Bouldy enjoyed the stuff!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought you'd like it, sir. And so, I'm pleased to offer you another! Almost a shame we seldom get such imports from Olympus around here. I hope I can appreciate it for myself sometime. Once all this is over with, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? You mean that you've never touched the stuff yourself? You've much more self control than I have, there. Perhaps someday we'll have a chance to share some between us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prince, that vintage Ambrosia bottle that you gave me, my! That was the greatest thing I ever tried, I think! Even Bouldy enjoyed the stuff!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought you'd like it, sir. And so, I'm pleased to offer you another! Almost a shame we seldom get such imports from Olympus around here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, look at what the Prince has brought for us, Bouldy! Perhaps someday we'll have a chance to share some between us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All this, for someone such as me. You know I'm down here for a reason, don't you, Prince? Not just because your father and good Thanatos don't care for me. Yet, from the very first, you showed me decency I'd not experienced since I was a king. Perhaps not even then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoever it was you used to be, sir, I believe you've changed. And I'm proud to say that you're my friend. And Bouldy there as well. It's odd for me to say, but I am glad you're here. I think I've learned a lot from you, about all this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Your Highness, I am honored very much indeed, and having you amongst my list of friends makes it perhaps the greatest such a list a fellow such as I has ever had. Isn't that right, Bouldy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Take it from me, Prince Z., Bouldy concurs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, really, this, this is for me, you mean it, Prince? I mean, I won't say no, I can't say no to such a thing, so, thank you! Thank you kindly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're more than welcome, sir. For all you've done for me, it's the least I could do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I'm really rather speechless, Your Highness. I'm just a shade doing my time. I don't deserve your generosity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come on, sir, what's a priceless bottle of the drink of the gods between friends?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sir, is this a mint-condition Shady you just gave to me?! I'm so grateful. I will keep him safe!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think I can do that, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got that right here, Prince Z.!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, please, have mercy and all that!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That your best shot, Prince Z.?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now don't get frustrated all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You getting ready for the road ahead?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wow you are strong Prince Z.!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pick on somebody your own size, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's one fight you aren't going to win!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Takes more than that to budge old Bouldy, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bouldy can take whatever you dish out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now there's no need for that here, Prince.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Try all you like, there, Prince!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey that's my friend, Prince Z.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's one tough rock you're messing with.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh what did Bouldy ever do to you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've really never gotten Bouldy to the top before?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never got the boulder to the top, not even once. Always tumbles down right at the very end. Lost count after the nineteen thousandth time or so, but you know what? One of these days, I bet it's going to stick.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, Bouldy...? I'm Zagreus, good to make your acquaintance. I know that friends are difficult to come by here in Tartarus, and so, I'm grateful that you seem to be a trusty one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bouldy, while on one hand I know that making offerings to you won't really help get me out of here, on the other hand... maybe it will?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bouldy, how do you handle being trapped in Tartarus for all eternity, doomed to be pushed up and down a hill repeatedly for no good reason?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, erm, there something you like to do for entertainment out here, Bouldy? Or just, I don't know, take it all in, I guess?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the latest, Bouldy? Had any good tumbles down that hill of late?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, I think I'm growing more accustomed to relating to a giant stone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't know why I keep doing this, Bouldy, yet here we are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You take good care of Sisyphus, there, won't you, Bouldy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sometimes a conversation with a friend is its own reward, isn't that right, Bouldy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're looking as stately as ever, there, Bouldy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A tribute to the greatest boulder of all time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May you roll smoothly for eternity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you for keeping my friend company.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bouldy, please accept this humble offering.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bouldy, lend your favor to me, won't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: An offering to the finest boulder in all of Tartarus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cheers, Bouldy! Thank you for brightening my day or night.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bouldy, ever get the feeling that we've had this conversation in the past?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's be sure to do this again sometime, Bouldy my friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Any advice for me on this occasion, Bouldy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bouldy, you can speak up if there's something on your mind, you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're always here for me, Bouldy! Cheers.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How's everything going lately, there, Bouldy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Looks like you and Sisyphus are doing just fine, Bouldy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good seeing you as ever, there, Bouldy.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're a good friend, Bouldy. I'm glad you're here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'd tell me if anything was on your mind, right, Bouldy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Bouldy, what's your favorite color?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Bouldy, what's your favorite form of sustenance?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Bouldy, what do you like to do in your spare time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey Bouldy, how's everything of late?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Go on, stranger. Plenty more shades looking to fight with you out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm just passing through. You seem less warlike than the rest. May I ask your name, sir? I'm Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Names are there to be forgotten, stranger. You shouldn't be here. May the Fates favor your journey. But just in case they don't, here. Why don't you take this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is something wrong, there, sir? I mean, shouldn't you be up and about, competing for eternal pride and glory and all that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the use? Let's say we fought, if anybody asks. Now, go. I've no quarrel with you, besides. I'll just remain here, comfortably at rest, for some untold millennia, I guess. Have a nice... whatever time it is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is something wrong, there, sir? I mean, shouldn't you be up and about, competing for eternal pride and glory and all that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the use? Let's say we fought, if anybody asks, now go. I've no quarrel with you, besides. I'll just remain here, comfortably at rest, for some untold millennia, I guess. Have a nice... whatever time it is.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Still toiling around within Elysium, I see. Battling my brethren, in the name of glory, is that it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm heading for the surface. Though your brethren are slowing me down. Whether for glory or at my father's behest.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father...? Ah, that's right, but you're the Prince, aren't you. You must see plainly, then, what your birthright amounts to: You're no better off than any of us here. Now, go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You again. I told you to stay clear of me. Your father's quite the big shot around here, but that means nothing to me, understand? Go, and tell him he can cast me in the pits of Tartarus, for all I care. It'd be a welcome change of pace from being put to pasture here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was unkind last time, stranger. Forgive my indiscretions there. Or don't. But I wished to apologize.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Think nothing of it, sir. Though if there's something I could do to help, you'd tell me, wouldn't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have no power to release me from this coil, I'm afraid. So just go on about your business, and leave me to mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stranger, I am warning you: If you keep showing up like this, I'm going to have to find a new nickname for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No need to go out of your way, there, sir. We're just acquaintances. I don't know anything about you, either.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And you are better off. This place is for the greatest of the Greeks. Do I seem like the sort to fit in, here? Go on and chat with Theseus, or someone of that sort.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stranger, I am warning you: If you keep showing up like this, I'm going to have to find a new nickname for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No need to go out of your way, there, sir. I rather feel like a stranger around here. I have no plans to extend my stay.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And you are better off. This place is for the greatest of the Greeks. Do I seem like the sort to fit in, here? Go on and chat with Theseus, or someone of that sort.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me, stranger, if it pleases you. How is it you keep running into me...? I thought this the remotest corner of Elysium.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The ever-shifting chambers of the Underworld leave quite a bit to chance. I took our meetings merely for coincidence.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When chance is too far-fetched to be believed, then it's the Fates at play. Or something else. I don't know whether to believe you, but I know that I want you to leave me, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me, stranger, if it pleases you. How is it you keep running into me...? I thought this the remotest corner of Elysium.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The ever-shifting chambers of the Underworld leave quite a bit to chance. I took our meetings merely for coincidence.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: When chance is too far-fetched to be believed, then it's the Fates at play. Or something else.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it this time, stranger? You're quite effective at locating me, but not so good at leaving me in peace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just on one of my little jaunts through paradise is all, sir. Happened to be on the way toward my destination.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You think this place a paradise? At least down in the depths, there are so many other souls with whom to share one's misery. No offense... I know that you're just passing through.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, stranger. How goes willful disobedience of late? Would that I, too, had it within me to defy the gods.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you know, it's going. That I've been able to make it this far means I am getting somewhere, I suppose. No thanks to all your brethren in Elysium.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No use trying to reason with my brethren here. Many of the shades whom you've encountered, why, I watched them throw away their lives when they were men. Yet still they seek to prove to one another and themselves that they are great warriors.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, isn't that the Lethe right nearby? You've been through so much, don't you ever... you could just drink deeply of the River of Forgetfulness, and be done with, no?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It has been rather tempting, yes. And I have taken sips, from time to time. But I've some memories I'm not quite ready to give up on, yet.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ever want to travel past this glade, sir? Elysium in all its splendors... there's a lot to see. Sure you're all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure enough, stranger. I traveled far and wide whilst I drew breath. That got me rid of any wanderlust. This little corner suits me well, I think. I have the statue there, the river... it's quite nice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is that on your wrist, there, stranger? Let me see, is that... a bracer of the myrmidons. But, then...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, this? How did you know? It's just a keepsake from a friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A keepsake? From a friend...? You tell your friend, then, that Patroclus waits for him, and that he holds no grudge, should he return to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is that on your wrist, there, stranger? Let me see, is that... a bracer of the myrmidons. But, then...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You recognize it, then. Of course. It's from Achilles, sir. He gifted it to me. He trained me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see... a gift. Well, then, you let Achilles know Patroclus waits for him, and holds no grudge, should he return to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is that on your wrist, there, stranger? Let me see, is that... a bracer of the myrmidons. But, then...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, this? How did you know? It's just a keepsake from a friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A keepsake? From a friend...? You tell your friend, then, that Patroclus waits for him, and that he holds no grudge, should he return to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is that on your wrist, there, stranger? Let me see, is that... a bracer of the myrmidons. But, then...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You recognize it, then. Of course. It's from Achilles, sir. He gifted it to me. He trained me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I see... a gift. Well, then, you let Achilles know Patroclus waits for him, and holds no grudge, should he return to him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is that on your wrist, there, stranger? Let me see, is that... a bracer of the myrmidons. Achilles...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is his bracer, yes. You recognize it, then. Were you a myrmidon, yourself? I heard they were unstoppable.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, now... if we were so unstoppable, we'd not be here, would we? May that bracer protect you more than its like protected our phalanxes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Must say that's an impressive spear you've got, there, stranger. Rather like the one Achilles held. He gave it to you, then? Followed him beyond the grave, only to be handed off.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's... a bit more complicated than that, sir, though yes. This is the very same as he once wielded. I am honored to carry it now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll bet. Perhaps you'll even come to surpass the body count Achilles piled up with it back in his day, seeing as you seem to have limitless opportunity to use it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, stranger, there was a time Achilles would have killed someone for taking up his spear. But there you are, like you own it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't think anybody owns this spear, sir. I'm hanging onto it for the time being. Though I don't think I'll be the last to do so.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, there's no need to get all philosophical about it. It's a killing weapon. Nothing more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You mentioned something of your parentage, stranger. I have a question on that subject, if you please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I please, sir. What's your question? Ask away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father must have records of the dead. So I was wondering if you might do for me a favor, and look up the whereabouts of someone I once knew.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've done a lot for me. The least I can do is ask around. Who is it that you're looking for?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I seek one called Achilles. Was rather famous once among the living, but among the dead, who knows. I thought he would be here, but he is not.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Achilles... I've heard the name before. And, erm, can I ask why you wish to know of him? In case it happens to come up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's just... I simply miss him, stranger. That is all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Something the matter, there, stranger? Or have you come to torment me some more with idle chat?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know Achilles, don't you, sir. You're Patroclus. Achilles... serves us at my home. He trained me. He sends you his regards and love. He says to tell you he is thinking of you always.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...That name. So then you've seen him, have you. In your father's house. And want me to believe he said all that? Tsk. You'll forgive me if I am a little skeptical. In life, I left Achilles. And in death, he left me. We're even. And we've nothing left to say to one another, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But, that can't possibly be true. There must be some misunderstanding here. You haven't spoken since you died?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We haven't, no. And I don't think we shall. But, you can humor him for me, I guess. Tell him I'm doing perfectly all right, won't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Something the matter, there, stranger? Or have you come to torment me some more with idle chat?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Patroclus. I know who you are, sir. And, you know Achilles. He serves us at my home. He trained me. He sends you his regards and love. He says to tell you he is thinking of you always.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Ah. So then you've seen him, have you. In your father's house. And want me to believe he said all that? Tsk. You'll forgive me if I am a little skeptical. In life, I left Achilles. And in death, he left me. We're even. And we've nothing left to say to one another, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But, that can't possibly be true. There must be some misunderstanding here. You haven't spoken since you died?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We haven't, no. And I don't think we shall. But, you can humor him for me, I guess. Tell him I'm doing perfectly all right, won't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Something the matter, there, stranger? Or have you come to torment me some more with idle chat?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Patroclus. I know who you are, sir. And, you know Achilles. He serves us at my home. He trained me. He sends you his regards and love. He says to tell you he is thinking of you always.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Ah. So then you've seen him, have you. In your father's house. And want me to believe he said all that? Tsk. You'll forgive me if I am a little skeptical. In life, I left Achilles. And in death, he left me. We're even. And we've nothing left to say to one another, now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But, that can't possibly be true. There must be some misunderstanding here. You haven't spoken since you died?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We haven't, no. And I don't think we shall. But, you can humor him for me, I guess. Tell him I'm doing perfectly all right, won't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, how's Achilles doing lately, stranger? I figured you could tell me since you've all this access to him, and I don't.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's forced to do my father's bidding. And sworn to secrecy, apparently. I don't pretend to fully understand. But, all in all, I think he's doing well. I hope... you'll see him for yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't fully understand, but hope. I see. Well, if you do get to the bottom of this little mystery at some point, you'll indulge me, won't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll... see what I can do about it, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's never going to return to me, is he. He's in your father's service now. He's never getting out. Neither are you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. That's not acceptable to me. None of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How bold. So what do you intend to do? You're leaving, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll figure something out. But you do something for me, in the mean time: Don't give in to what you're feeling now, all right? Achilles loves you still, like you don't know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Does he? I'm past the point of making promises, but... I pray the Fates help you in your endeavors, there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's never going to return to me, is he. He's in your father's service now. He's never getting out. Neither are you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No. That's not acceptable to me. None of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How bold. So what do you intend to do? You're leaving, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll figure something out. But you do something for me, in the meantime: Don't give in to what you're feeling now, all right? Achilles loves you still, like you don't know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm past the point of making promises, but... thank you for your words. I love him still, in turn. I pray the Fates help you in your endeavors, there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He's just as obstinate as ever, isn't he? Always refused to budge. He ever tell you of the war in which we fought? I fought, I should say. He could have ended it. But he refused to take up arms.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles hasn't been particularly forthcoming about his mortal days, no. So he wouldn't fight? I've heard that mortals sometimes frown on that, but... why should he have fought if he didn't believe in the cause?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He shared our cause! So what if it was not completely his? If not for his stubbornness, I... well... I would have come here just a bit later, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He blames himself for what happened to you, you know. I figured he failed to defend you or something, not that... he didn't fight at all. Although, he said something about how, once you died, he shortly followed in a rage...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wouldn't know a thing about that, stranger, for you see... I was already dead. Getting my place here in the afterlife all sorted out. Took quite some time, getting accustomed to all this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A question, if you don't mind, stranger? Because, I've had one nagging at me since we last discussed the subject. What, exactly, happened to Achilles, can you say? After I died, that is. I've heard the rumors, but... I don't trust any of this boastful lot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, from what I gathered, sir... after you fell, he was overcome with grief. And anger. He joined the war, just like you urged. And, single-handedly, he almost ended it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So then, he threw away his life. Soon enough after I lost mine. Yet, despite vanquishing an army on his own, he wound up in the lowest pits of Tartarus? Instead of here, among the great?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You should know, sir. You were buried together. Your ashes, that is. It was his final request. As for how he came to be at my father's house, that's something I think he can best explain. And I will do everything I can to make sure that he has the opportunity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Our ashes, you say. Together? Tsk. The fool. We could have lived! Not been reduced to meal for the worms. But... I appreciate the information, stranger. Now... please, go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Forgive me, stranger. For, in retrospect, I was too terse after you told me what became of my Achilles. Tales of his climactic battle, I had heard. The stuff about... his ashes, and my own... that was all new.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No need to even ask forgiveness, sir. Achilles is one of my closest friends, but.. he doesn't care to talk about himself. About those times. It must be very painful. For the both of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, we've all seen our share of pain, by now. But... knowing that he cared for me, in the end... after the end... it dulls the feeling of it, for a bit. As do these conversations, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've meant to ask you something, stranger. Would you mind doing me a favor, please? If it happens to come up along your path. Suppose I ought to tell it to you first, prior to asking a response.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, of course, sir, what is it? What's on your mind?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If I know my Achilles, then he's being rather guarded, when it comes to this predicament we're in. How can somebody be so brash yet hate to take unnecessary risks? Just let him know I said to risk it all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Risk it all? Risk what all? He wants what's best for you. He wouldn't want anything to happen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's already long since happened. I daresay that, right now, provided what you've said is true, then... it appears we've more to gain than lose. Isn't fear for the weak?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought we might run into you, but... how strange to see you face-to-face out here, lad. To see this place myself. I still can't quite believe any of this...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He really can't. Though I keep telling him, it's true. Nothing's accomplished without risk, isn't that so? But, we of course have you to thank, stranger. Our troubles needn't have been your concern.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nonsense, sir. You're my friend. And Achilles... I don't know where I would even be, if not for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, no need to get emotional, is there? We myrmidons, we're not the sentimental type. Achilles is simply on break, is all. From a demanding job. You've a demanding job as well, so here! My customary gift.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well if it isn't the ward of Achilles, come to visit us. I don't know how I can ever repay you, stranger. I'm quite sure that it isn't possible.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I reached more or less the same conclusion, Pat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about you just keep offering me those premium goods you have no interest in when I pass through, and we can call it even, sir?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That I had plans to do, regardless, though... if you should think of something else at any point, please do let either of us know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good, there you are, stranger. Settle something for us quickly, hm? Would Achilles not make for the perfect Champion of Elysium? For I think almost anybody would be better than the current one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think I'd rather maintain watch over a nearly empty hall than battle all the shades around here, Pat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I, too, would vastly prefer having to contend with Theseus rather than yourself, Achilles. Although, that's not to say I disagree that almost anybody would be better in the role than him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems, then, I am overruled. But I know Champion material when I see it, and I see it now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles is returned to work for now... but, waiting for him, knowing he'll return... rather than waiting for the sake of it, for nothing... such a different feeling, stranger. I'd forgotten it entirely, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm happy for the both of you. So, is everything all right, then? The circumstances under which you were separated in life... it's unimaginable, really. How does one move on from a thing like that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Anger fades, I guess, stranger. Even the famous anger of Achilles. Anger burns hot, then burns out. What's left is a dull ache, but... underneath it, there was something else. It felt as though... well, I was still alive. That feeling... it's worth holding onto.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's good to see you again, stranger. You don't mind if I keep calling you that, no? Couldn't find a better nickname for you, after all. Besides... I don't want to cause you any trouble.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't mind at all, Patroclus, sir. Coming from you I consider it a term of endearment.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have my thanks for that...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles tells me that you're here to stay, at least for now, stranger. A welcome bit of news. Assuming, of course, that it's for the best, for you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think so, sir. I'll still be passing through, and visiting the surface every opportunity I get. But it seems my place really is here. Besides, it means getting to see you every now and then, like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That sounds agreeable to me. Then, you take care.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's been considerable talk of late about the Queen Persephone, stranger. Your mother, it would seem? Sounds to me your tale's almost as complicated as my own.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's a long story, at this point, indeed. But yes. The Queen... my mother... she's returned. And, it's been really good, having her back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can only begin to imagine. May she help govern all of this with wisdom and with grace.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This spearpoint that you gave me, sir. It's been quite useful, though I have to ask you... is there any particular significance to it? Most spearpoints aren't imbued with power such as this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, that. Just something I'd been meaning to get rid of, but... it can be difficult, discarding trifles from the past. Knowing it's provided you some benefit is welcome news.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did you once wield a spear yourself, sir? In your fighting days?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Did I once wield a spear? You could say that I did. I had my moments with it, anyway. Even once slew a demigod! He's probably somewhere about. Quite awkward, running into those you killed. But in Elysium it's all taken in stride.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whatever happened with that war you mentioned, sir? If you don't mind my asking.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, truth be told, here, stranger... I do mind. You speak as one who's not experienced a war. Those of us who survived... or, you know what I mean... we do bear some responsibility to history. But, all the same, it's not a time and place to which I would return. I trust you'll understand.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I always wondered, sir. What was Achilles like...? During his youth, I mean. If you can say.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah. How to describe what somebody was like? Everyone who saw him on the battlefield agreed he was magnificent, stranger. His allies and his enemies alike. But, there was more to him, I think. A certain outlook. A sense of justice. I knew him before he was a warrior. Only reason I suppose I liked him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I heard you've vanquished Theseus however many times of late. Or... someone matching your description has, stranger. Almost had to laugh when I heard that. Though, I suspect he hasn't learnt a thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, you know him? Though, yes, he does seem rather set in his ways. Convinced himself that I'm some sort of demon from the lowest depths. Which... well, it's partly true, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're quite notorious, around these parts. The tales of your father's monstrous son, kept under lock and key within his House. Fear and ignorance make for great stories, no?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Couldn't help but hear the rattling of battle chariots of late. Raucous laughter and the like. You've really riled up the locals this time, stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Must be Theseus and his fancy Macedonian. So he's been joyriding about in that thing? Showing it off?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your arrivals are becoming a bit of an event, I'd say. And, yes, the Champion and his bull friend are likely at the center of it. You'll have to forgive me that I've no intent on attending your contests, but... well, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, for such a loudmouth obnoxious braggart, Theseus does seem to have formed a strong kinship with the Bull of Minos, hasn't he. Are they truly as inseparable as they seem? I feel bad for the Bull.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sometimes it's our differences that make us drawn to one another, no? And, at other times, there's no accounting for taste. I often don't know which is which, and they can have each other, far as I'm concerned.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even the Bull of Minos couldn't stop you, huh. That's one whose way I would stay out of if I could, but... well, you'd not be here if you couldn't handle yourself, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You heard I battled with Asterius, here, sir? I thought you kept more to your own devices. Weren't much for conversation with the other shades.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you're correct in that assessment, stranger. But, as you've seen, I've no ability to stop others from coming and going as they please. So I do tend to hear a thing or two from passersby.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must have met so many great heroes in your day, having fought alongside Achilles... do you still keep in touch with any of them, here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Great heroes... haven't you seen, by now, what they are like, stranger? Not all entirely what they're cracked up to be. But, there were good ones, yes. Suppose they're mostly keeping to themselves. Like I am here. Perhaps we'll run into each other, down the line.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never quite considered... you're related to the gods upon Olympus, aren't you, stranger...? I should be far more careful around you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you mean by that, sir? Though, yes, my father being who he is, it means I have a lot of uncles, cousins, and the like, up on the surface, there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well... you would be wise to watch yourself, with some of them, I think. Don't get on anyone's bad side, if you can help it. Which, when I yet lived, none of us could.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ever been in love with someone, stranger? Might be a mortals-only thing, for all I know. You gods have strange relationships, I hear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have been, sir. Or, I should say, I am.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, that's good. Cling to the feeling, then. And if you lose it... reach for it. Search for it, no matter what, all right? Because, without it... well, there isn't much of a comparison, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ever been in love with someone, stranger? Might be a mortals-only thing, for all I know. You gods have strange relationships, I hear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not sure that I have been, sir. I understand it's one of those things where, you'll know it when it happens.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Perhaps you shall, someday or night down here. The feeling comes with pain, and plenty of it, but... the pain is worth it, in my limited experience. And once you find that feeling, cling to it. As tightly as you can. If you don't mind my saying.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, what's it going to be this time, stranger? The HydraLite? Maybe the Kiss of Styx?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You sure you don't need any of this stuff, sir? I really appreciate it, but... I don't want to take it for granted.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, come, this is Elysium. Taking such things for granted is the point. We gloried shades receive our stipend of the finest goods, so we can battle till we've had our fill. But I've already had my fill, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've ample time for fishing, have you, stranger? And here I thought you'd more important business to attend to, though it's not for me to judge, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll have you know some of us take matters of fishing very seriously, sir! Besides... helps take my mind off having to fight your Elysian brethren nonstop.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh I'd not take your mind off this fight if it's one that you hope to win, stranger. I once took my mind off a fight, and, well... I wound up here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to tell you, sir, it was a real sight to see you fighting alongside Achilles. You two were amazing!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I'm a little rusty. But he's not. Still very much in tiptop shape, except more able to control his temper, I should think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't sell yourself so short! Though, I thought you laid down your spear forever. Why choose to fight again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles swayed me into realizing some activity may be quite good for me. And besides... if we can aid you in a pinch, that's worth my while.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You look positively beaten, there, stranger. Let's see if we can't get you on your feet. For I can do the listless sitting for the both of us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you look terrible, if I may say, stranger. Perhaps one of these trinkets can be of some small help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You again? Then, here. Fates know I'll not be needing this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Move right along, stranger. Let's skip the pleasantries.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And here I thought you must have given up already.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enjoying the splendors of Elysium, yet, stranger?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't let me interrupt your stay in paradise, stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Returned to take more of these trinkets off my hands, have you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, it's only you again, stranger. It's only me, as well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Take one of these and then just leave me be, stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like to be alone again, stranger, so you go on ahead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No need to linger with me, stranger. Go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why your path keeps on crossing mine, I've not the slightest clue.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Some other time, stranger. Right now I'm preoccupied with sitting here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There's nothing you can do to help me, stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Can't you see I'm busy whiling away for all eternity?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A fine whatever time it is to you, stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You haven't lost your will just yet, I see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Expecting I'll still be right here next time, stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just go, already, towards your next death or whatever else awaits.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're back again, I see. And just in time to take one of these blasted things from me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll wait for him, however long it takes. You tell him that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I pray Achilles is surviving well. And same for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's good of you to visit, though there's little I can offer in return.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please make yourself at home here in this corner of eternal paradise.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do let Achilles know I'm doing well, and I'll be ever patient, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I doubt there's much that I can do for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're interfering with my quiet time, you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, what is it, this time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here's what I have that I can spare right now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Might I somehow assist you, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh good, somebody's here to save me from myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How can I be of use to you, stranger?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've no shortage of time to spare, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, just a stranger passing through, I see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not in the mood for conversation now, stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go on about your business, there, stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Good fortune getting out of here, stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here's something for the journey still to come.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Prepared to face the champion, soon, stranger?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: May this aid you against the champion, out there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be careful with my brethren out there, stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Battle with glory and all that, all right, stranger?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I would prefer to be alone for now, stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just don't go starting any wars you don't intend to finish, stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Leave me be to my eternal paradise, damn you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall not take up arms again, stranger, not even against you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Begone from here, we've nothing to discuss.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go haunt some other corner of this realm; this one is mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought I told you to leave me alone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do I look like I want to talk to you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it that you want from me this time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What would it take for you to leave me be?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, what is it this time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What would you have me do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're faring well enough, and may you fare the same.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We were just wondering when you'd arrive, stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Achilles and I were just passing the time I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I and Achilles here still have a lot of catching up to do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fight like my friend here used to fight, stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: First a visit from Achilles, and now you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please stay as long as you would like here in our little glade.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, look, I can tell you're struggling right now, and... maybe this isn't the way to help you through it all, but... I want you to have this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ahh, so you are taking pity on me, then? Well, I've no pride like many others here, so I shall take it. Though, let's make it a fair exchange, shall we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why would you waste a proper vintage on the likes of me? Questions that are better left unanswered, I would guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If this eases your burden even for a little while, then it's in good hands, as far as I'm concerned.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, a means to drown my sorrows temporarily. That's good. And rather kind of you, I have to say.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's nothing. Thank you for not trying to slay me where I stand and boast about it, like seemingly everyone else around here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh. Here in Elysium you have to win this stuff, so I have rarely had occasion to enjoy it. Thanks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd say you earned it more than anybody else I've seen around here, lately. Though I don't make the rules.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You owe me neither time nor generosity, and certainly not this. But if you truly have no better use for it...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not a matter of owe, sir. Please open your mind to the possibility, nay the fact, that there are those who care about your wellbeing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just the relief from misery that I was looking for. A fleeting feeling, really, but I'll take a fleeting feeling over none.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's both very dejected and very astute of you to say. Take care of yourself, will you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here, sir. The drink of the gods, themselves. Thought maybe you would like to try it! Just a small token of my appreciation for your selflessness with me, time after time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'd give the precious gift of Ambrosia to someone like me, stranger? A gloried thing like that. Why bother...? I should be just another shade to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, you're not. You're someone I look forward to seeing here in Elysium, which is more than I can say for just about anybody else around here, so... please, enjoy it. Perhaps with Achilles.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well... perhaps I'll try. You're not so bad, you know that, stranger? Careful with that, or you'll undermine the ruthless reputation that you have.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't see that last bottle of Ambrosia anywhere, which I can only take to mean... you need another. Here, sir. Thanks for seeing me through all of this, time after time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're thanking me, stranger? I've been here for some time, I think, and yet... some of your customs I'll admit remain quite strange to me. You've done more for me than I've any right to expect, from anyone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's just a bottle of Ambrosia, sir, it's really no big deal. OK, fine, it's rather difficult to come by, but still!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You jest, but I do not. I'd offer you my lifelong gratitude, but... well, you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've got the rest of your life ahead of you, as far as I'm concerned. Here's to starting anew, right? You can call me Zagreus, or stranger, whatever suits you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And... I'm Patroclus, by the way. I'm realizing now... we've not officially met. It's good to know you, Zagreus. Stranger.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're much too kind to such a wretched shade, you know. But I'll not turn away this type of thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't attack me indiscriminately, I give you Nectar. I don't think I'm being over-generous!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forgive my bluntness, but, why go out of your way for me like this...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not going out of my way, sir. Look, I don't pretend to know the depths of your despair. But when I look at you, I'm reminded of how I've often felt. When I was in that dark place, someone said to me: Don't give up. If nothing else... it gives you something to do.
label: CHARACTER
