dialogue: I am most grateful to you, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just checking up on you, sir.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Makes little difference I should think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's all the same to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I doubt it'll be of much help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, you must be the Hades kid! How's it going, then, Your Royal Majesty? Nice to meet you, I'm Eurydice. What brings a big important guy like you up to a place like this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hi there! No need for formalities, I'm Zagreus. Just heading out on some official business! Surveying the magma situation firsthand. Don't mean to be rude, though I'm in a bit of a rush.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well don't you have your hands full, hon! I'll let you go, but there's one rule in my place, which is: Nobody leaves here empty-handed, you got that? So take your pick, my treat!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey you must be the Hades kid! How's it going, then, Your Royal Majesty? Nice to meet you, I'm Eurydice. What brings a big important guy like you up to a place like this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hi there! No need for formalities, I'm Zagreus. Just heading out on some official business. Past the menacing Bone Hydra. Don't mean to be rude, though I'm in a bit of a rush.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well don't you have your hands full, hon! I'll let you go, but there's one rule in my place, which is: Nobody leaves here empty-handed, you got that? So take your pick, my treat!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey you must be the Hades kid! How's it going, then, Your Royal Majesty? Nice to meet you, I'm Eurydice. What brings a big important guy like you up to a place like this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hi there! No need for formalities, I'm Zagreus. Just heading out on some official business. Say, if your name's Eurydice, I don't suppose you know an Orpheus, do you? Quite musically inclined, a little dour, impressive hair?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He put you up to this? Look, hon, why don't you get on with your business, then. But you can't leave empty-handed, that's the rule, so take your pick, my treat! Nothing for him, though.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, hon, what's going on, speak up! I know when something's up down to my roots, and something's up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well it's just, I think that you may know an Orpheus, don't you? Quite musically inclined, a little dour, impressive hair? He's court musician in my father's house. Calls you his muse. Says he misses you terribly. I... thought you should know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Orpheus said all that, huh? Tell you what, the next time you run into him, you ask him about the time that he came all this way to try and save me, even though I was already dead. Can you guess how that turned out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm... yes, I do believe I can. Look, I didn't mean to upset you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, well, neither did he! But you know what? Actions beat intentions, hon. Now, here, how about a treat and you can be on your way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, hon, what's going on, speak up! I know when something's up down to my roots, and something's up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well it's just, I think I wanted to tell you more of Orpheus, since... he's court musician in my father's house. Calls you his muse. Says he misses you terribly. I... thought you should know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Orpheus said all that, huh? Tell you what, the next time you run into him, you ask him about the time that he came all this way to try and save me, even though I was already dead. Can you guess how that turned out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm... yes, I do believe I can. Look, I didn't mean to upset you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, well, neither did he! But you know what? Actions beat intentions, hon. Now, here, how about a treat and you can be on your way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is it, hon? Oh no, don't tell me you've come all the way from Tartarus to ask me more about your good-for-nothing court musician friend.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Certainly not! I'm merely here for your wonderful singing, cooking, or conversational ability. Though, since you mentioned it, you... seem to have a lot to say to him. Is there anything I can do?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So let me see if I understand. Orpheus blew it with me like an idiot, but now I'm supposed to be reaching out to him? Sorry, hon, but that's not happening. The two of us are finished. And, you know what? I think we're finished here, too. If you'll excuse me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey there, hon! So what do you think, pretty good tune, right? Don't know how come everybody doesn't sing. Lightens the mood, passes the time. What's not to like?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's a beautiful song. Even though you're angry with him... Orpheus, I mean... you're always singing, still?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh it's not Orpheus' song, you kidding me? This one's all mine. He always did like going on about how I'm his muse, well, that's 'cause I wrote half his songs for him! Bet he didn't mention that, did he.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, not exactly in those words, but... Orpheus can be a little hard to parse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He can be a little hard to tolerate. A quality I hope isn't going to rub off on any of his mates. I should get back to practicing, see you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look, Eurydice, I promise not to bother you with this each time, but... you should know your husband's shattered by what happened with the two of you. He's genuinely sorry, and he loves you very deeply, still, I'm sure of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsk... and what am I supposed to do with that, Your Royal Majesty...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... I don't know yet. Though, you know what? You shouldn't take my word for it. You should take his.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't think I will be running into him anytime soon from what I understand. But you're the Hades kid! You want to pull some strings on our behalf, go right ahead, I guess. But I won't hold my breath. Even if I could.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, uh, how's Orpheus been doing lately, anyway? Still keeping his hair in those neat little curls? I guess his tan must have faded by now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Curls? Erm, not exactly, no. But he's doing all right! For him. He's started singing again, lately, which was a big step. He never used to, before. Would go on about how he'd lost his muse.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And now he knows I'm out there, still, huh. That's... well, thank you for the update, hon. Music's his gift. Good to know he's not thrown everything away.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eurydice, can I ask you for a favor here? Not that you owe me anything, but, would you hear me out?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, sure, hon, what is it? Though you had better not be asking for my recipes. Closely guarded family secret! I'd say I'd take them to my grave, but... yeah.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not your recipes, though they are wonderful. It's your song. I'm sure it'd be a hit around the House! And, I know someone who really needs to hear it. Don't suppose you've got a parchment-copy I could have?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your Royal Majesty, you want my song? You are aware it's called 'Good Riddance', right? Tsk, but sure, why not. If music's going to be playing in your House, it might as well be great. And let me give you something to go with it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...What'd he say, hon? I mean about the song. Bet he loved it, didn't he! But, I don't know for sure. And I've been wondering, kind of a lot, I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No need to wonder any longer. He sings it beautifully, around the House sometimes. It... has a sadder sound to it than when you sing, but... you've inspired him again. As you've done many times before, from what I know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Huh. So it's a hit, is what you're saying, then. I had a feeling about that one. Sometimes you put some words together and right then and there, you know that you've got something special.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What happens now, hon...? What I mean is... now you got me thinking about Orpheus again, so... what am I supposed to do with that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Even if you can't be together right now, I hope it feels better knowing how much he cares for you. And I will try to pull some strings, like you said. I can't make promises where my father's concerned, but... I'll do everything I can.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, what can I tell you? Thanks, Your Royal Majesty. That means a lot. No pressure, though. I've been all right without him all this time, and I will be all right, no matter what. If only he could say the same.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, listen here a moment, Hades kid. Look, I... Thank you. From the bottom of my heart. For bringing Orphy back to me again, and everything.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eurydice, you're more than welcome, really. You've helped me through the flames of hell, time after time. Least I could do is coax old Orpheus out of his private pit of despair so you and he could set things right between the two of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, you're a real sweetheart, hon. You'll still be seeing Orphy all the time around your House, but now, I get to see him, too. Nice having something to look forward to, you know? Bet someone out there feels that about you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey! What's the matter, Your Royal Majesty? You're looking kind of down. Normally you're all smiles, for whatever reason!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I... well, looking back, all this stuff between you and Orpheus, I realized... well, I hope I wasn't too pushy about the whole thing. It wasn't any of my business to pry into your personal life. I should have asked.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, that? Pff, come on, don't even worry about it. If you were being too pushy, you better believe I would have put you back in your place, royalty or not. But hey, can't ever be too careful when it comes to people's past and feelings and stuff, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got to tell you, hon. Orpheus sure is different since last he and I met. You know, back when he was still living and breathing and all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think the experience of trying to rescue you, failing, dying, becoming court musician, refusing to sing, then being locked in solitary confinement, then finding out about you probably did a number on him. Why, is everything all right? You seemed to be getting along last I saw.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, we're getting along great! Better than ever. He used to be a bit more of a hotshot, but now it's like, he's a little more... what's the word... sensitive? Now I can always tell exactly what's on his mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, Your Royal Majesty! I must say you've accomplished some truly amazing feats, according to Orphy at least! But don't worry. Your secret's safe with me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, no, he's been boasting of my fabricated exploits to you? I've tried to tell him I was only joking with him but now he just thinks I'm being modest.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That modesty won't get you anywhere with me, either, hon, Your Greatness. I'm honored to merely be in the presence of one with so many wild exploits to sing or speak of!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey did Orpheus really use to have curls, and... something called a tan? I've only ever seen him looking... well, how he does now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He did! And a tan is like... well, when you stay out in the hot sun up there long enough, your skin kind of starts to bake a little bit. But nicer than that sounds! Got to say, though, the years have been kind to Orphy, don't you think?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say, tell me something, there, Your Royal Majesty. You know a lot of shades. You wouldn't happen to know an Orpheus, would you? Spindly little thing, whiny voice? Heard he's officially serving in your court. Making music!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of course I know Orpheus, we're mates! Wait, why do you ask?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're mates, huh. Just as long as you don't count on him for anything. Hasn't even mentioned me, has he. Well if he ever does, you tell him I am doing great! I'm great.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's the latest, hon, anything been happening down in your fancy House lately?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, you mentioned Orpheus... my father had him locked up for a little while for refusing to sing. Being court musician and all. But he's out now, and doing OK! I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not following instructions, huh. Sounds like Orpheus, all right. Well, if that's the most exciting thing you've got going on, then I haven't missed much being out here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, what's up, hon? Say, you must know a lot of big shots, don't you? Other gods and all that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know a few. As a matter of fact, I heard recently from Hermes, wanted you to know he felt sorry for how things ended up. That something to do with when Orpheus went in here after you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, that's sweet of him! Nice enough guy, for an Olympian. Yeah, he was the one who dropped me off here in the first place. No hard feelings here, he was just doing his job. It was Orpheus who messed everything up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sure don't see a lot of other nymphs around here, huh! We don't die too easy, most of us. Makes me feel all special!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've never met another nymph, now that you mention it. Heard of a few! The goddess Artemis, sounds like she spends more time with nymphs than the other Olympians.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's what I heard! Though it's not like we all hang out, I mean, you've got the dryads, and the naiads, and the nereids, and the oceanids... pretty much every type of terrain up top, there's a kind of nymph who loves it! Maybe we need a name for Underworld nymphs, too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eurydice, did you by any chance ever meet a Persephone during the whole thing when Orpheus came down to try to get you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, her? Yeah, she was with Hades Senior, why? Wait. Whoa. Are you...? I thought...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's complicated. And, please keep it quiet. I was just wondering... what was she like? If you recall.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Didn't get much of an impression, but I can tell you this: She had good taste in music! Orpheus and I, think we won her over with our little duet. Haven't seen or heard from her lately, though. Look, I hope everything's OK.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eurydice, did you by any chance ever meet a Persephone during the whole thing when Orpheus came down to try to get you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, her? Yeah, she was with Hades Senior, why? Wait. Whoa. Are you...? I thought...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's complicated. And, please keep it quiet. I was just wondering... what was she like? If you recall.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Didn't get much of an impression, but I can tell you this: She had good taste in music! Orpheus and I, think we won her over with our little duet. Haven't seen or heard from her lately, though.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, everybody's saying Persephone... she's back? That sounds like a bit of good news, there, isn't that right, hon?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, she is back, and yes, it is good news, thank you. She and I have a lot of making up for lost time left to do, though I think we're off to a pretty decent start.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, that's a relief. And, you're still here! So I guess you've got more official business to take care of, which means I've still got somebody to taste-test for me every now and then!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Orphy tells me the Queen, she's been settling in just fine down at your House! Must be different having a lady like that around. How's Hades Senior taking it, if I may ask?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, he's taking it... about as well as he's taken anything ever, now that you mention it. Still very much himself, mind you, but still... it's been a welcome change.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Glad to hear it! Orphy always liked singing for an audience more than I did, and it sounds like she's a good one.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You ever play any music, or sing or anything yourself, Hades kid? It's good for you, you know!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I play a bit of the lyre, as a matter of fact! Orpheus himself gave me some pointers on it. Never really tried singing, though. I can't even imagine it, really.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, might I recommend giving it a shot at some point? Who knows, you might be the next Orpheus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You been snacking on onions or something, there, hon? No offense or anything, but you smell like you ate a whole one of them raw.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, yes, but... wait. How else are you supposed to eat those things?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, are you kidding me? You can grill them, sauté them, fry them, boil them, pickle them, roast them! Oh, hon. You've been missing out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You got anyone special in your life, by the way, hon? You seem like you'd be good for somebody out here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know what, yes, I do, Eurydice. Things have moved so fast for me lately I barely stopped to think about it, though. It helps not having to go through everything alone... just knowing I'll see them again soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Know what you mean. And hey, that's great! Long as you can still be yourself. I've known too many nymphs, their whole lives revolved around somebody they loved. I bet whoever it is that loves you... it's because of who you are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eurydice, how long have you been down here, anyway, if you don't mind my asking? Seems like you're pretty settled in. It's quite a lovely place!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How long have I been down here, hon? Huh! I don't have the faintest. You lose your sense of time once you're a shade, or maybe once there's not a sun or moon over your head. But yeah, I found myself a decent spot and fixed it up a bit!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're just in time, Your Royal Majesty! Got something real good cooking right here that you are going to love. You hungry, yeah?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Am I ever. You're always so generous. And you're always cooking! And singing. Do you have many guests come by? Your place seems... somewhat off the beaten path.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, you think I get a lot of guests, here? Haha, no, but I like cooking anyway! It's like singing, in a way. Keep getting better the more you try, turns out a bit different each time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eurydice, how can you cook so much with all the searing heat around these parts? Has it been magma-flooded like this all the time?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The searing heat? Haha, I am dead, Your Royal Majesty! Searing's just a cooking technique to me. Don't need to sleep, either! I can just keep cooking up a storm. It's not so bad!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, I've never met a nymph before. You're closer to the gods than mortals, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, gods that can die! How is that fair? Was just a stupid snake bite in my case, can you imagine something more embarrassing? You're just minding your business, and then snap! You're dead, and on your way down here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... know the feeling better than you might expect.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I was going to end up here sooner or later. Might as well while I'm still looking good. Though, I guess you do kind of get to lock in whatever age when you register. Bet everybody dying of old age pushed that one through.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's your official business, anyway, Your Royal Majesty? Seems like it's bringing you through Asphodel an awful lot lately.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's... look, the truth is, I am trying to get out of here. I've hit some stumbling blocks along the way, but, I think I will make it there, eventually.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh really! Say no more, I know how that is. Hope the Fates will look the other way for you. Getting out of here, huh. Not thought of that myself in I don't know how long...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Of all the lava rocks in Asphodel, the Hades kid found this one once again, wouldn't you know! You got a map or something to this place, or what?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't know that a map would help me much since things keep shifting out here every single time. Though it is an interesting coincidence how I keep running into you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Coincidence? Come on, hon, you're a god. Someone out there is sending you my way. Maybe it's just the Fates. Ah well! I sure don't mind a little company. And I have lots to eat!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, not just any plants, hon! Trees! Big gnarled oaks and things. Some of them live hundreds of years! Way up there as mortals go. You take good care of it like that, maybe it'll grow to be something special for you, too!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, this is sort of a weird question, but... this Evergreen Acorn, it's not... related to you, is it? Since, you know, you're... partly oak, aren't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah, I'm part oak, that's right. But maybe not the part you're thinking of, I mean, you think I would just hand you one of my babies or something? Hahahaha, that's disgusting!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold on, hon, is that... huh! Almost felt like Orpheus was with you there. Would you listen to me? Must have been singing too many high notes, or something.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, wait, you're onto something... I think you must have sensed Orpheus' Distant Memory! He gave it to me as a keepsake of our friendship. Though, something like this... I feel like it should belong to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, that's him in there all right! See, I never should have second-guessed myself. Well, you hang onto that, as I've got plenty memories of him already, thanks!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, hon, you look awful. What did you get yourself into? Here, one of these should make you feel a little better.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you look like you've been through a lot, Hades kid. Maybe a decent bite to eat will help!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oof, you're a mess, there, hon. You save your strength and see if this will do you any good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, don't go bleeding on my floor, hon. I just cleaned the place! Take one of these, maybe it'll tide you over.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sing when you're happy, sing when you're not, Your Royal Majesty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, it's the Hades kid! So what's it going to be this time, Your Royal Majesty?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd say make yourself at home, hon, but you look like you got cooler places to be!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are just in time, Your Royal Majesty! Cooked up something special just for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why, Your Royal Majesty, you're back! Well, see you later!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And here I was just thinking it's been too long since the Hades kid stopped by!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So what'll it be this time, Your Royal Majesty, hmm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh you look positively famished, hon! Here let me help with that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must be hungry, hon. Got something ought to keep you going!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How nice of you to stop on by, Your Royal Highness! Here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How's it going lately, hon, you eating well and everything?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just singing to myself and cooking up a storm. You know me, hon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eat up, hon! Not like I got other mouths to feed!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All's well in Asphodel, Your Royal Majesty! You take care of yourself. I'll be here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want the best cooking in all of Asphodel, you know where to go!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, it's the Hades kid! What's it going to be this time, hm?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Take care of yourself out there, all right, Your Royal Majesty?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't let Hades Senior get you down, hon. Here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know you've got important business to attend to, so thanks for checking in, Your Royal Majesty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You look like you're in a rush, though there's always time for a quick snack, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, welcome back, Your Royal Majesty, you're just in time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Been trying to perfect these recipes for I don't know how long!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You look like you haven't eaten since you were here last!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're always welcome here Your Royal Majesty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I get you something for the road there, hon?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's it going to be, Your Royal Majesty?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You just be sure to tell that good-for-nothing Orpheus I'm looking good.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hon, I'd ask how old what's-his-name is doing, but I don't even care!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Bet you Orpheus hasn't had any strokes of musical genius lately, now, has he?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Better not be Orpheus putting you up to visiting here all the time like this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This song's better than anything Orpheus ever came up with I can tell you that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If you'll excuse me, Your Royal Majesty, I'm not exactly in the mood for an extended chat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You best have no more messages from no-good Orpheus this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here, have a snack, hon, and tell Orpheus it was delicious.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You keep an eye on Orpheus for me, all right, hon?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do one thing for me, hon. Make sure Orpheus knows I'll be right here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've got to be honest with you, hon. Sometimes I kind of miss him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sometime you'll visit me like this and Orpheus is going to be here too.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't let Orpheus get into too much trouble, won't you, hon?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm fine here on my own, hon. But, I wouldn't mind if he was here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hope Orpheus is on the up-and-up down where you live.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd ask you to bring one of these to Orpheus, but they're no good unless they're perfectly fresh.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Orpheus tells me you've been a good friend. Thanks, hon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I love Orpheus and all, hon, but it's nice having a little time here to myself!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know you can't stay long, hon, so eat up and stay safe out there, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I sing when Orpheus is here, I sing when he isn't. Simple!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eurydice, thank you for making me feel welcome in your pleasant home. Can't say the same for most places I've been lately. I've a small gift I wanted you to have.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aw, that's awful sweet of you, Your Royal Majesty. Bringing me fresh ingredients like this! Know what, here's something for you, too, help keep you safe out there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just the ingredient I needed, hon, thank you so much! You know, you aren't near as bad as I'd heard!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, don't worry, we're still getting to know each other! Plenty of time for me to live up to my notorious reputation. Though I'm surprised you've heard of me at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aw, for me, really, Your Majesty? This will be perfect for my latest recipes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, of all the souls I've ever met, I feel like you put this stuff to the best possible use.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You read my mind, hon! I go through this stuff awful fast sometimes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And I, in turn, shall go through your incredible cooking awful fast, given the opportunity.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hey, mighty generous of you to keep me stocked up on this stuff, Your Royal Majesty!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My pleasure! I'm always pleased to see you during my otherwise generally unfortunate travels in Asphodel.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanks, Your Majesty! Though you're not going to get in trouble bringing me this stuff, are you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hah, no! I don't think I can get into more trouble at the moment. May this make your dishes that much more delectable!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Eurydice, I was thinking maybe this would benefit your culinary practice. Here, please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Whoa, this is Ambrosia! Hard to come by this stuff around here. You sure I can have this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Absolutely! Least I could do for all your friendship and support. Always happy to hear your voice when I'm out here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I ever tell you you're a real sweetheart, hon? Because, if not, I'm telling you right now. Where would my culinary practice be if not for you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think your culinary practice would be every bit as extraordinary, though I'm pleased to have done small service to you in this great pursuit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, we both know you've done a lot more for me than that. I wasn't expecting to make any new friends here anytime soon, so all the more reason it's been a real treat to get to know you. If I may say? You're a hell of a guy, Your Royal Majesty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: As you wish, Your Royal Majesty.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Pray, who might you be, wandering all the way out here? You're trespassing on private property, you know. Speak up!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, you must be... Persephone. My name is Zagreus, and... I think I might be your son.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What?! How dare...! Get out of here! Get out, or I shall make you!! Out with you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No!! So then you are her. I, I don't care if you hate me, but I'm not leaving until I get some answers! I never even knew you existed. Why did you leave me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You died! You, you died...! Those burning feet, they... sputtered out, when you were born. But... now you're standing here before me. How...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I died? I died... what, you mean permanently died, but, I'm alive! Oh, gods... you never even knew I existed, either.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Alive! Zagreus, he... even kept your name! You live, how can this be, you live? You live...! Oh, the cruel Fates! My son!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah. He told you that, did he. That's good. That's good! Though, tell me something, Zagreus. How... is it that you found me? To have journeyed all this way, I scarce believe it.... Zagreus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ugh... Oh, it's... guess I'm just a little tired, that's all. Not accustomed to the weather, as I think you call it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No... no, that isn't it, it's that... you cannot stay here. You can't stay here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Really, you're... heh... kicking me out? Why?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Fates are cruel, Zagreus. You're bound to that place... same as your father. So they would have us say good-bye, for now. My heart soars, knowing you live. Then it breaks, that our time together was so brief.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No... I can... come back... I can come back, now that I found you, he... maybe he'll just let me come back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You tell him I demand it. And I demand he also tell me how come he, or for that matter Nyx, never sent notice that you lived! Olympus is all rife with schemers, but I was so naive to think that they were different.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll tell him... I'll tell him, I... feel awful. I... I have to go.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Styx shall take you, then. Oh, Zagreus. Farewell, my son. Won't you come back to me? When you are able, please. Come back. I shall be waiting here. However long it takes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I begged the Fates that you'd return to me. Perhaps I ought to be more careful how I speak of them. Tell me, how was your journey? What happened?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Father didn't make it any easier for me. Nor would he tell me why he never sent for you, after you left. So, I don't know, what's going on, still, but... I wanted to see you, again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wanted to see you, too. Come, speak quickly with me, that our time together here may be as full as possible, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I just... I need to know what happened, between you and Father. Why are you here, and not with us?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I couldn't live with myself anymore, down there. After I left Olympus, a long story in itself, I came to be with your father, in the Underworld. It was a shock, to say the least. The others in your father's house were welcoming enough, but... I never felt that I belonged.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know the feeling, I think. But you stayed. Long enough to have me. Those whom I've spoken to about you, it's as you said, they have fond memories of you. And then, you even had a child. Did Father... did he mistreat you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, no. Your father could be very difficult. Though, he was gentle, with me. Soon enough, we got on fine, better than fine, at times, but... when I was with child... why, I struggled terribly. Because... a child born of surface-dwellers could not live, down there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Could not live down there, according to whom, exactly? The Fates?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: According to them, yes. According to your father, and to Nyx. Even having heard... I took my chances, anyway. But when you emerged stillborn... it was too much. I fled. I fled, and came to reside here. Above the notice of the Underworld. Beneath the notice of Olympus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Urgh... but... why would Father lie to you? If he never wanted you... or never wanted me... surely he had the means.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't know. I'm wondering the same. But, oh, look at you, Zagreus! We're running out of time. It's happening again! Stay with me, please?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I'm trying... but I can't... stay that much longer... I don't think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, my dear son! Then please... ask Hades what you asked of me! Why he would lie? Tell him I must know, the same as you. And you farewell. Until we meet again!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's just... a hunch... of mine...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother, I... discovered how come Father led you to believe that I could not survive past birth. He didn't lie to you, exactly. So he says.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, slow down, Zagreus, what do you mean? He told me you would not survive your birth, yet here you are. How wasn't that a lie?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Because... he thought it was the truth. The Fates appointed him dominion over the entire Underworld. But he would never have an heir, so he was led to understand. He never expected me to be born, much less survive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He never expected you to survive? Then, forgive my asking, but... why did you? How did you? The Fates are not known for making mistakes when it comes to such things.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx saved my life. Or gave me life, I guess. Then raised me in your absence. The Fates are her daughters, right? Maybe she persuaded them to go easier on me. She cannot say more. In any case, apparently it took her quite a while to revive me, and... by then, you were gone.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx... of course she was involved. I only managed to escape because of her. Then, she restored my stillborn son to life, and nurtured him? And, I never would have known, unless that child, fully grown and having learned the truth, defied his father, and then found me here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. Although, we still don't know how come Father and Nyx never sent for you. Though, ungh, let me ask you something, Mother, if you please. If you had found out... that I was born, and very much alive... would you have come back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would I have come back... to see my only child? Had I but known you lived... I would have gladly gone through hell again to see you, Zagreus. Of course I would have.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well then... what if... urgh... what if Father... didn't want you... doing that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What if he didn't want me coming back to him? Or seeing you? Oh no, you're fading again, Zagreus. You've pushed yourself too hard! But what is it you meant, by what you said?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So good to see you, again, Zagreus. Since last you left, I couldn't help but think the worst, about what happened after I had left... or soon before. You mentioned Nyx... you don't suppose that she and Hades... wanted me out of the way?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I just... don't think that can be. Though, let me ask you. How long did you know Father? And Nyx, for that matter? Did they seem trustworthy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes. I knew them long enough to have decided yes, that they were trustworthy. As much as anyone I've ever met. But I also know never to be trusting to a fault. I have to consider the possibility I was deceived.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Especially since neither of them is being forthcoming with me even now, right? And yet, I have this feeling something else is going on, Mother. The way that Father speaks of you, the way Nyx speaks of you... I think... they care for you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, hahaha! Well, they have a funny way of showing it, I think. Your father, so... you have to get through him each time you visit me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do. Mother, what if... what if Father thinks that he's protecting you? Have you... considered that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Protecting me? Why Zagreus, what do you mean by that? As you can see, I can fend for myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well... urgh... you're from Olympus, aren't you? But... the gods, none of them seem to know... you're here... so...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What, how would you know something like that? Zagreus? Ah, curse the Fates, you're leaving me again...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Son, I have to ask you, how much do you know about your relatives upon Olympus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think I know quite a bit by now. I've been in steady contact with Athena, Zeus, and other members of the family ever since I first left Father's House... they've been assisting me in getting here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No... Zagreus, what have you done? You've led them here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, no, they think... they think I'm trying to escape from Father so that I can join them on their mountaintop. At least I think that's what they think. Most of them, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But then... does Hades know of this? That Olympus is involved?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He does. Both he and Nyx. In fact, it's Nyx who put me and Olympus into contact. I could never have broken free of the Underworld if not for their help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So Nyx and Hades are against each other, then. And Olympus is helping you... but they don't know I'm here, as far as you're aware?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's right. More or less. Nyx and Father seem to put up with each other. Don't seem to have much of a choice. Though, ever since I learned of you, Nyx has been helping me to find you... while Father's tried to stop me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That fool... what was he thinking? What is he thinking...? Do you suppose... he thinks that he's protecting me from them? Oh, no...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... urgh... I think maybe he does think so, indeed... because, now having met my relatives upon Olympus, I... can definitely see that they can be a bit... vindictive about things.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vindictiveness runs in the family, my son. Then, if Olympus is involved, that would explain a lot. I'm here, not there with them, as you can see. But, oh, it seems we'll have to speak some more, when next you return...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Son, I have to ask you, how much do you know about your relatives upon Olympus?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A little. I've been in contact with Athena, Zeus, and other members of the family ever since I first left Father's House... they've been assisting me in getting here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No... Zagreus, what have you done? You've led them here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, no, they think... they think I'm trying to escape from Father so that I can join them on their mountaintop. At least I think that's what they think. Most of them, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But then... does Hades know of this? That Olympus is involved?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He does. Both he and Nyx. In fact, it's Nyx who put me and Olympus into contact. I could never have broken free of the Underworld if not for their help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So Nyx and Hades are against each other, then. And Olympus is helping you... but they don't know I'm here, as far as you're aware?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's right. More or less. Nyx and Father seem to put up with each other. Don't seem to have much of a choice. Though, ever since I learned of you, Nyx has been helping me to find you... while Father's tried to stop me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That fool... what was he thinking? What is he thinking...? Do you suppose... he thinks that he's protecting me from them? Oh, no...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I... urgh... I think maybe he does think so, indeed... because, now having met my relatives upon Olympus, I... can definitely see that they can be a bit... vindictive about things.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Vindictiveness runs in the family, my son. Then, if Olympus is involved, that would explain a lot. I'm here, not there with them, as you can see. But, oh, it seems we'll have to speak some more, when next you return...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I could not stand it on Olympus, Zagreus. The blustering, the posturing... my overbearing mother... none of it. I would have left the mountain voluntarily, except...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Except Father absconded with you, didn't he? Dragged you down with him into the Underworld. So if Olympus were to find that out... I shudder to think of the consequences.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That fool is trying to protect me even now. It wasn't he who absconded with me, my son. And it's more complicated even than that. I was content to leave. Willing to make my life within the Underworld. With your father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I dare not ask who did bring you to Father, then. So, essentially, you ran away from home, to live with him? I mean no disrespect, but... did you realize what you were getting yourself into?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We have a tendency to be impetuous when we are younger, Zagreus. I'd heard all about your father before we met. Admired paintings of him. It was very awkward, at first. But he had a bluntness I fancied. A sense of principle. I much preferred him to his brothers, I can tell you that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, urgh... then you secretly left Mount Olympus to be with the god of the dead in the Underworld. And Olympus never found out. What do you suppose would happen... if they did?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I think... there would be war between Olympus and your father, Zagreus, if they found out. Especially now. After all this. And after all this time. They slew their parents once. If the Titans could be wiped from this world, so can we all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So it makes sense... if Father, he agrees with you, and thinks... that leaving you in hiding here, that it's the only way... he can prevent that war...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can see how your father, shrewd but also single-minded as he was, might have followed such a line of reasoning as that. Oh, Zagreus... what have I done?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus... it's wonderful to see you, but... I need to ask something of you. That you not visit me again, here in this place. Both for your safety, and for mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, what? Because of what would happen if the Olympians found out? So, after everything, you're taking Father's side in all of this?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am. Your father is no fool when it comes to matters such as this. Besides... all that has happened... it's my fault. I was selfish! And now both sides of our family threaten to be torn apart.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your fault? So let's say you never left Olympus! Then it'd be just like you thought, until quite recently, I think. That I'd never existed! Besides, they haven't found out any of this. What makes you so sure they will, all the sudden?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx may be veiling you from them as she veiled me when I fled here myself. But even her own powers aren't infallible. Each time you visit me, you are incurring risk. One small slip, and they shall find me. Discover your deception. Go home, Zagreus. Please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go home with me, Mother! You came here under false pretenses. I haven't fought all this way, over and over again, only to turn back now. I need you in my life! How can you just... turn me away like this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Zagreus... I cannot return. After all that happened between Hades and me, and everyone, I just cannot fathom the idea. Besides... the risks we're taking would be even greater if Olympus were to find me there, with him. And you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then... ungh... you're just... going to stay here? Alone, in the middle of nowhere, in this little garden... forever? After we part ways, just like that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My son... I know you've made hard choices and sacrifices to be here with me. And I'm forever grateful to have finally met you. But this is my home, now, yes. While your home is below. Please, if not for your sake, then for mine... do not return. I love you, Zagreus. Good-bye.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You can't do this to me, Mother. You said Father is no fool, and neither are you. There has to be a way to fix this. Not just with you and Father, but with everyone. There has to be a way!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...You have your father's stubbornness. Listen to me. You're endangering everything you care about by coming here. Don't you understand? Besides...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? Besides what? Tell me, please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...The truth is that I like it here, Zagreus. I have done well for myself on my own. And your father, he has his domain to look after. The feelings he once had for me... feelings we shared... they fade, with time. You'll understand, someday.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No! I won't be understanding anything of the sort. Father still loves you. I'm sure of it! And, he owes you an apology, damn it! I cannot make amends with you on his behalf. It's something only you can do together.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What do you mean he still loves me, Zagreus...? How would you know?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Because... ungh... I'm his blasted son, that's how I know! But trust me isn't ever good enough, I know that, too. I'll prove it to you, Mother! Just you wait and see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're fading, Son... you don't need to prove anything to me. Please don't do anything rash. All of us made our choices. Now we have to live with them. Isn't it enough, to know that I am safe? That I'm content to be alone?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No... urgh... it's not... it's not enough, for me, because... this blasted family... it cannot just keep hiding from its problems! Running from them! We're stuck with one another, we... we have to do everything we can... for one another!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Of everything down in that gloomy House, I miss old Cerberus the most, I think. But, I miss other things as well. The lack of light was gentler on my skin. Not being as cold. And Nyx, and her young sons. It was all very odd, but...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother... in Father's bedchambers... mind you, there's almost nothing there, just neatly sorted rows of all his samey capes... but on his nightstand... is a portrait of you. Wearing a regal crown of red laurels. A Queen. His Queen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was fitted for those garments when I first arrived. They... were not my customary style. So Hades has a portrait of me, still. Why would he put it back on display, now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No, no, he's never let anybody in his bedchambers! I broke in. Don't you see? He didn't put your portrait back on display. It's always been there! Ever since you left. So, Mother, why do you suppose he would do that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Because he... because he loves me still. Is that what you want me to say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you ever loved him, yourself?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All I really wanted was to leave Olympus. I didn't exactly abscond. I doubt I had much of a choice, but I went willingly. Perhaps Zeus knew how I felt, and thought he was doing me a favor. As for Hades... I grew to love him, yes. He always gave me my space.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Won't you... urgh... won't you please talk to him? Or visit Cerberus again, or Nyx? As for Olympus... surely all of you... can figure something out...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I just don't know, my son. Olympus is behind me. And the Underworld... I cannot imagine I would be very welcome there after all this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother, wait, what is all this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Zagreus, I almost missed you. Truthfully, I hoped that I could make it a surprise...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My arrival. I'm going. To your home. To Cerberus. Nyx. Your father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're... really?! Mother, you, you're serious?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am. Now if you could just help me pack up my remaining things? Only a few loose odds I'm bringing, just in case. If we hurry, maybe you could join me, rather than return the customary way. Not something a mother ever wants to see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Join you, but... wait, how are you going to get back? I... hadn't thought that far ahead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Doubtless he has pressing matters to attend to. So let's not keep him waiting any longer, Son. Come on, then!,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're on the River Styx. No longer in the mortal realm, entirely.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can't believe that this is happening.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know. My heart is racing. Nothing like a river journey to remind oneself that there's no turning back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Seriously. Though, even after all of this... it's like we only just met. I have so many questions for you still.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We'll have plenty of time for them, I think! For now, best we keep quiet. Pretend we're just a couple of dead souls on their final voyage.,
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is embarrassing, but... I don't know the way to get back in. Except, you know, the customary way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's quite all right; I do. In the name of Persephone, the Queen!! Open the gates!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How has it been for you so far, Mother? Reacclimating to all this. You said before it was a struggle. Must be very strange, being back. Being in darkness all the time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, I think it's gone all right so far! Thank you for asking, Son. Everyone has been quite welcoming. The darkness is a pleasant change of pace, and while this dress can be a little difficult to move in... I quite like it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's good to hear. I have to admit I was a little worried you'd be desperate to return to your cottage by now. This place can be a little much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure it can. And I do miss my little cottage here and there, but... I think I'm through running away. There may be times when it is necessary, of course. But no matter how far you run, it doesn't make your problems go away. You taught me that, you know.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I did? But... I tried desperately to run away, myself.... Oh.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Turns out there's still an awful lot to do around here, isn't there, Zagreus? I'm still getting caught up on day-to-day affairs.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Day-to-day, how can you even tell it's day around here, anyway, Mother?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well that was just a guess, now that you mention it. In any case, forgive me if I don't get swooped up in every household detail, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, Mother, all the pomegranates around here... those are your doing?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not a lot of fruit trees take to this environment, my son. Though, there's something about pomegranates! Maybe it's that their seeds so resemble the gemstones your father likes so much. Or that they don't need much water.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Fruit trees, huh. I grew up around all these poms and never thought much of it. Are there many other types of fruit trees on the surface, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well... I suppose there are a few. But I like pomegranates most of all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This garden isn't quite the sight yours was back on the surface, is it, Mother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: On the contrary, Zagreus! It has its own unique charm. As each garden does. I was impressed it wasn't left entirely to rot after my absence.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It was totally off limits to me. Though I guess Father must have taken care to maintain it as best he could.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He did, all right. Minus the part where you weren't allowed. Though, let's look after it from here, shall we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Still can't believe he let me hold his spear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, that painting in Father's... I mean your bedchambers, it turned out rather well, didn't it? Some very talented shades around here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, it's beautiful! I tried to persuade your father to hang it out in the hall but he's too coy about such things. Though, I like it where it is... a reminder to us, every day and night.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This garden may not have all the varieties available up on the surface... though it's coming along rather nicely, I should say!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cheers, I'm glad you like it!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's lovely what you've done to this place, Zagreus! It's looking better than ever, thank you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Were you able to make it to my cottage on the surface, Zagreus? I hope my lavender patches are doing all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I, erm... I couldn't make it all the way there, Mother. It's like... without your presence on the surface, I'm unable to hang on for very long at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, I was afraid of that. Well, don't despair. I placed a charm upon my seedlings there that ought to keep them flourishing well on their own. Your duty now is simply to escape. You keep it up!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tell me something, Zagreus... sometimes I fear... do you hate him? I mean your father. Regardless of his intentions... it sounds as though he made your life extraordinarily difficult. All his pent-up fear and anger... you bore the brunt of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do I hate him...? Mother, I don't know that I hate anybody, really. The tales of him and the Olympians rending their immortal Titan parents to bits... I can't relate to how they must have felt. But, I resented him, for sure. And... I don't know if I'll ever get over that, entirely.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I understand. I think that when Hades told you he asked no forgiveness, he understood as well, and meant it. Well, for all his failings, I'm thankful that he did not teach you how to hate. For your own sake, if not for his.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, how has it been between you and your father lately, Zagreus? I know the two of you have lots of work ahead of you. Especially him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, it's been all right, I guess. I think he's set in some of his ways. But at least we have some sort of understanding now. Even if he acts like everything is still the same when I'm out there on the job.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He says it's so you put forth your fullest effort every time. All this is a big adjustment for him as well. Not that it's any excuse for how he's treated you. Are you... all right, seeing us together?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, so are things with you and Father... everything all right, so far?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Things are good, Zagreus. I'm from Olympus... all the relationships I've ever known have been the complicated sort. But with your father... despite our different dispositions and interests... beneath it all, we share a simple understanding.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And... what understanding is that? If you can share.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That we're all we've got. And that we love each other. Through thick and thin.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, you're not... you're not thinking about having more children, are you...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx has a very steady presence, doesn't she? I want to say she hasn't changed a bit since before you were born, but... I know that she's been through a lot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: She's always managed, and quite gracefully at that. Never seen her break a sweat over anything. Even when I confronted her about you. Though, you two seem closer than I realized, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, your father isn't always the conversationalist, and Nyx... she was the first chthonic god I ever met. I suppose she welcomed having another lady about the House.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus... how am I doing? As a mother. Tell me honestly. Nyx has had so much to share about raising you. Foods you hated or enjoyed, your natural abilities, your friendships... she knows everything! Sometimes I wonder how I can ever compete?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother, I think you're doing great. And I'm sure you know it's not a competition between you and Nyx. I just get the benefit of having two great mothers rather than one. Or zero.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, my son. I know I wasn't there for most of the hard part, but... I'm here, now. Though, when I inevitably, inadvertently trample all over your feelings at some point, please tell me, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No idea what a calling card is, but, OK!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother, one thing I was wondering about was, how did you summon Charon to your surface residence? Especially without, you know, being dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, why... he gave me his calling card after he graciously helped get me out of here the first time. No doubt at Nyx's request, but still. Never thought I'd use it, but... I still kept it. Just in case.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At least we've some of that in us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother, you'll forgive my asking, but... your mother used to call you by a different name, didn't she?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, don't remind me. Imagine if I called you Zaggie-poo from when you were born to this very moment, that's how that name felt to me. I much preferred the name my father gave to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your mortal father, right...? So he called you Persephone. What was he like?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He was kind to me. And funny! Little bringer of destruction, I was to him. I liked that. He was right, I was a terror. But then he passed. I was very little still. My mother never spoke of him again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Demeter mentioned him a bit to me. She seems... I don't know, but I don't sense that she regrets the relationship or anything. Just sad about the outcome I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose I can see that. I thought I might end up like Father... growing old, wasting away. Then the time flew by, and I realized I was closer to Mother's side. Mortals certainly don't have it easy. But their limited days, it means... they live their lives to the fullest, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother, just how long has it been snowing on the surface, do you know? Because, it seems to me that Demeter... Grandmother, I should say, she... well, it's been very cold up there each time I've been.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was afraid of that... I wanted to believe the snow about my cottage, it was native to the climate there, but... seems that Mother took my absence harder than I thought. Oh, what have I done. All those poor people.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's not your fault. You couldn't have known. And we can fix this, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx told me that you helped her reconnect with her parent... after a long, long time. That was very kind of you. She never asks for anything. But we all owe her a lot, don't we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think so. If not for her... I can't even imagine, really. Did Nyx ever speak to you of Chaos, before I was born?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not really, no. Nyx is very private when it comes to personal matters. But she has feelings and desires same as anybody. Well, mostly, but the point is... I know this meant a lot to her.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you. He more than deserved it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems Achilles had a complicated arrangement with your father. I understand you simplified things for the better, there, and he was able to visit Elysium at last. Well done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So Orpheus was finally able to reunite with Eurydice because of you, my son? Ah, I'm so glad! Your father's arrangement with him was quite severe. Though he did ask for a lot, for a mortal soul to return to the land of the living...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is it even possible, for Father to return a mortal back to life if he so chose? Just by letting their shade escape, or something?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I've no idea, probably not? But we were so moved by Orpheus' plea and song, that, well... I think your father took pity on him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait, we were so moved? You were there when Orpheus came to try and rescue Eurydice?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I was. Your father knew I loved their music. Imagine my surprise to see him as our court musician, here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I always fancied Thanatos, you know. So put together and everything! I'm pleased to see you've grown so close. Things good between you two?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That Dusa sure has quite the uplifting presence around here, doesn't she, Zagreus? Sometimes I see you chatting and it warms my heart.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus, I know you're upset about what happened between Nyx and Dusa. Before you ask... I need to respect Nyx's space and authority on this one, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I saw that Dusa had returned. I trust Nyx's judgment, though I must admit I was pleased to see she decided to give her another chance.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know what you mean. I'll let you know when it's done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All right. We've matters with Olympus to resolve. They don't know I'm here, most of them, besides Zeus, maybe Athena. They think you're Nyx's son rather than mine, and that your goal is still to join them on their mountaintop.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What a mess. What can we do? The gods of Olympus have all been very good to me, for the most part. I don't feel great about deceiving them. They keep trying to help me escape!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can we do? We can make peace with them. And let them know the truth. So much of it as they would tolerate. Diplomacy is not your father's strong suit. But I am going to need you two to do exactly as I say. Do you understand?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, Mother. So what do you intend to do, and how do I fit in?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're going to invite all of them to a little family gathering! Here. And you shall personally deliver them their invitations, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother, are you serious? So, we're just going to have a bash with them, and they'll just see you after all this time, and be fine with everything?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They certainly shall not be fine with everything. But, Hades and I, we'll be prepared to tell them what they need to hear. Don't worry, I shall do the talking.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What are you going to say?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, you know! That we met, fell in love, eloped. Had a child. A child who, once grown, sought desperately to reconnect with his extended family. To the chagrin of his grim lord father...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That's... that's all true. As individual statements, at least.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Fortunately, our loving and dutiful son at last persuaded his mother and father to reveal their secretive relationship, and make an effort to rejoin their great family.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your mother won't be happy that you left.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll deal with her. Perhaps I'll have to visit her and the rest of them from time to time, if that's what it shall take. But I'll be back. I've no choice! Did you know that if you eat the seeds of an Underworld pomegranate, then you cannot leave for one month out of the year, per seed?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What? No, I never knew that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How soon is this family gathering you have in mind going to take place?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Soon after you invite them all, I hope. Now, go. And trust in me, all right? We have a lot to learn of trust, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How goes the doling out of invitations, Zagreus? Have the Olympians been amenable to the idea?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not just amenable, Mother. Positively intrigued. I can't believe you scrambled the invitations in such a way that, only with the lot of them combined will they get all of the details!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A bit of collaboration seemed in the spirit of things. We're a great, big family, Zagreus. Past time we started acting like one, no? Now, keep it up. And thank you for your help.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother, this family gathering you're planning... are all our relatives welcome? Because I was wondering if I could extend the invitation to a distant ancestor... you know... Chaos.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx's parent... you've been in contact, then? Look, if you feel it's the right thing to do, I trust your judgment. The spirit of this event is to bring the family together.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanks. I doubt Chaos would be able to attend, though would still appreciate the thought.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sounds good. I'll see you then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's done, Mother! Father. The invitations. Personally sent to everyone with whom I've been in contact. So, what do we do now?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Excellent, Zagreus! Congratulate him, Hades! On a job well done.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Grr. Persephone, how can you be so certain your request was executed to your satisfaction?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's known as trust, Hades. Or faith? They're similar. Try one, sometime! It'll be good for you. As for what we do next... why, we've a great, big feast we must prepare!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This House is not a suitable location for such guests! Dionysus, alone, shall bring ruin to this place! Or... urgh... the faith thing that you said.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yes, good! Now then... we have a lot of work to go around, so why don't we call everyone on staff, and let them in on this, and dole out suitable responsibilities, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Whew! I'd say that went about as well as could have been expected! And the cleanup wasn't all that bad. For the most part.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We're fortunate Uncle Zeus seemed to catch on right away, and went along with it. But, this whole elaborate tale you spun... I remember how hurt I felt when I found out Father lied to me about you. Now we're lying to Olympus. What if they find out? Even if they don't... I don't like it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus... I may not be an expert... but here's what I've come to understand about how families work. At least our own. The thing is... how we speak to one another is even more important than the words we use. I think, deep down, everyone in our family knows this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're saying they all knew you weren't being perfectly honest, and went along with it anyway? I guess the pomegranate thing in particular was a bit of a stretch.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The common ground in our family is that we want peace. Besides Ares, though even he would rather the conflict occur elsewhere. That elaborate tale... it's less a deception, and more a concession. A way of saying let's move on from the past, and start anew. No hard feelings.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't have hard feelings? What about Father? What about Demeter?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, let's see. My hard feelings are nothing next to the joy of having my son in my life. Your father never imagined his relationship with me could be out in the open. And my mother... she's just glad I'm alive.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: And Uncle Zeus is glad things didn't turn out worse for him. I get the sense he acts a bit impulsively at times, and deals with the consequences later.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What can I tell you, Zagreus? We're family. You said it yourself to me before: We're stuck with one another. That any of us like each other in the slightest... it's a wonder and a blessing, I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Yeah. I know what you mean. Thanks, Mother. Think I'll be heading out again soon. See you when I get back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going to miss you too, Son.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to say, Mother, that was a clever plan. Convincing Father to finally let somebody have some fun around here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Haha, well! I'm glad it worked out for the best. There's just one thing that happened that I ought to tell you about, Son. No secrets between us, and all. This... is quite difficult for me to say.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's about Demeter, isn't it. You two were talking half the night. She wants you to come home with her, doesn't she? You'll always be her little one, something like that?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Indeed... something like that. You're quite perceptive, have I ever told you, Zagreus? But yes, my mother, she was quite conflicted. Didn't know whether to smite me or to hold me, maybe both. And, yes. She asked that I come home... to my responsibilities.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So... you're leaving...? No, Mother, you can't be leaving, you just got here!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, it's not as bad as that, it's just... if we are to keep the peace down here, then, I must spend some time up there. Every so often! But, I shall always return, in no time at all. I promised Hades, and I promise you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well then... when are you going to go?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Soon, Zagreus. Perhaps by the time you're back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I don't suppose... I can come with you, can I?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Tsk, you know the surface isn't good for you! Besides, you're needed here. But, if you really want to see it for yourself, someday, who knows? Perhaps eventually we'll figure out a way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm going to miss you, Mother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Welcome home, Mother! How was your trip, things go all right with you and Demeter? With... Grandmother. Still getting used to thinking of her that way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, it's funny... I think she was so overwhelmed to see me again that maybe something finally changed in her. I always thought she was utterly unyielding. She asked me if I truly came here by choice, and I put her at ease.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ah, that's a relief. Grandmother can be rather intense, but... she's been kind to me, and very helpful, too. Do you suppose she'll ease up on the whole eternal winter thing there on the surface, now that she knows you're safe?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I asked. She told me that she would. Warmth shall return to the surface. Some of the time, at least. Likely on a rigid schedule, knowing her. And perhaps not in the vicinity of our domain. She's not the sort to forgive and simply forget.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Oh, come on, Hades! Mortals are much more resilient than that! What, you think they'll show up at your gates here, all at once? They have our family looking out for them.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That is what I'm afraid of. Do you truly believe my brothers and the rest shall take the sort of care of them while they draw breath, as we do here after they have expired?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's true we have to look out for them indefinitely, while Olympus need only look out for them for a little while. But our relatives are always watching from their mountain! And if they do turn a blind eye once in a while... mortals aren't bad at fending for themselves.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: But they are never satisfied! Always begging us to provide more, and more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They like us, Hades! They praise us, tell one another about us. What do you expect? Would you rather they forgot about us?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...No. No, I suppose not. But they need us!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...And what of the complaints from Elysium? They wanted the lawns thoroughly manicured for their athletic contests.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Already taken care of. Though, the flooding in Asphodel, hm, that doesn't look like something we can clear up for quite some time. Fortunately, the residents seem to be getting accustomed to it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There have been fewer reports about it as of late. And what of the Satyr problem? Blasted things are rampant up there, still.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, they're probably contained up there, at least. And Zagreus has been keeping them in check, hasn't he?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Our best... that I can promise you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Well, be that as it may... if they pester you at all, do let me know, and I shall have them dealt with quickly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Hades... I think the shades around here have been through enough as it is! I don't mind them. After all the time I spent on my own, having some company has been a welcome change.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are certain all your needs have been provided for? Because if there is anything that you require...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Require? Look at this place, Hades. Look at me! I have everything! And so do you. Try not to worry quite so much. And be patient with your son. That's all I ask.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Persephone, I cannot promise you such things, they're... not my strengths. Besides, I have a reputation to uphold! God of the dead! If the wretches do not fear me, or you for that matter... what, then?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not going to tell you how to balance your work, your marriage, and your parental responsibilities. I don't think anybody on Olympus or below knows quite how best to manage that. So long as we do our best.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Sometimes, I... still cannot believe that you are here. Returned to us. Your radiance, in all this darkness... you must miss seeing the coast.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The coast was nice enough, Hades. But nothing is ever perfect, right? No matter how hard you try. Still... I think we get quite close around here, every once in a while.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have taken much less time adjusting to this place than when first you joined us. Part of my surprise. I, myself, was forced to be here. I never thought anyone would come from the surface here by choice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The heart can make us do the strangest things, can't it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...So if there's anything that I can do for you, Nyx, you need but ask, all right? I plan to pull my weight.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your services were always welcome, here. Please acclimate yourself at your own rate. I am available to answer any questions you may have at any time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, my friend. I have to tell you... it's good to be back.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...I just don't know how I can ever repay you. For raising him. For everything. After I left... besides old Cerberus, I think maybe I missed you most of all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can remember feeling similar emotions at the time. However, it is quite unnecessary to give thanks to me this way. You are the Queen, safely returned where you belong. I did what anybody would have in my place.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Anybody would have lovingly raised my estranged son, while keeping safe my secret, eventually orchestrating an elaborate plot to reunite him with me, so that I might someday return, to have a Nectar with them in the lounge?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Cerberus! Doubtless you deserve the biggest thanks that this House still stands, don't you? Did you enjoy the treat I brought you from the surface?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The surface-treat-devouring hound of hell provides the Queen a most decidedly affirmative response.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought you might. You wouldn't know it wasn't made of meat, I'll bet! I'll see if we can't grow you plenty more.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're such a good boy, aren't you, Cerberus? Yes you are! Guarded the place while I was out. And even let my son come visit me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The ever-vigilant and terrifying Cerberus merely accepts the praise.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sorry, Zagreus, I've pressing matters to attend to now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do let me know if I can help with anything, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father's prouder of you than you think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go make us proud, my son.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Keeping the realm secure as ever, right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's always nice to have a chat with you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I think the House is well enough in order as of late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I hope your last assignment turned out well.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do give yourself a break from time to time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I ever tell you you're the best son that a mother's ever had?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hope my little cottage on the coast is holding up!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please keep an eye on my garden on the surface when you get a chance.
label: CHARACTER
