dialogue: I'd say this garden's doing quite all right for now.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't let your father get to you too much, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're looking just as well as ever, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You show your father who's in charge next chance you get, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The pomegranate trees are coming in nicely still, the tough old things.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll let me know if there's something that I can do for you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We have to say farewell again, for now, my son. Olympus calls, but I'll be back, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I shall be leaving again for Olympus soon. I'll miss you, Son.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must go visit Mother on Olympus, Zagreus. I'll tell her you said hi.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to go again, soon, Zagreus, all right? I'll see you soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm due to visit Mount Olympus once again, so please be good to one another while I'm out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time that I headed up to Mount Olympus, though you keep an eye on things till I get back?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to go now, Zagreus, but I shall see you just as soon as I return.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Things are well enough upon Olympus. Though, it's a relief to have come home again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't think I'll ever get fully accustomed to Olympus, Son.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Zagreus, you're the most welcome sight I've seen in quite some time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Always such an exhausting journey, from Olympus down to here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I trust that you and Hades have been good to one another since I left?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll tell you, it is so much colder up there on that mountaintop.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is a welcome sight from all the snow-capped mountaintops.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh we're busy just formulating more of our dark schemes together, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx here is a wellspring of parental advice, as it turns out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx was just telling me some more about your early days, my son.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It seems I failed once again to persuade Nyx to take some personal time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please excuse your father and me for the moment, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go on, Hades. Try saying something nice to him, for once.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your father and I still have a bit of work here to wrap up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The work certainly never ceases, Zagreus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: More than enough parchmentwork to go around!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Plenty of parchmentwork to contend with, I can assure you, Zagreus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't go too hard on each other out there, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've heard that you've been doing great out there lately, Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Erm, Mother? Was it always a custom in Father's House to secretly give Nectar to those you care about? I guess it also could have been a thing on Olympus. Look, I wanted you to have this. I'm so glad I found you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, Zagreus, you're so thoughtful, truly! Your father never permitted Nectar out in the open so I'd practically forgotten its savor. Though, just a moment, I have something for you, too!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For me? Are you quite sure? You know, this vintage must have made it all the way up from the surface, to the mountains, then to here. We've both had distant journeys, haven't we?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, I, for one, am certain this vintage here has journeyed to the right place. Please enjoy it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I must confess I do enjoy having a good bottle of Nectar, every now and then. And you appear to have a careful eye for such bottles, from what I can tell!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My careful eye has got to be the green one, hasn't it. To having a discerning eye, Mother!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you very much, my son! You know, gift-giving customs of the Underworld are just so much more straightforward than the complicated social graces of Olympus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If there are other ways of showing one's appreciation than with Nectar and the like, well, they must pale in comparison I'm sure!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, this is wonderful, except... I'm wracked with guilt for having nothing much to give you, in return. You never even got a mother's love from me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Please don't say that, it's just a gift, all right? Besides... can't we start now? Mother and son type things. If you would like.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'd like that even more than this fine Nectar, Zagreus!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Somebody raised you very well indeed, my son. Nyx, I suppose. I'll never be half the mother she is. She's done it for aeons! While I'm only getting started.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For what it's worth, I happen to think you're off to an excellent start. Nyx did teach me a lot. Achilles, too, and Father, in a way. But there is no replacing your presence. I felt that before we ever met. And now I know for sure.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you, Zagreus. Let's hope you're right. I nurtured very many plants, at least, of that I can assure you! Perhaps my gardening experience provided a bit of a head start on this whole mothering thing.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother, I know there may not be many things you miss from living on Olympus, though I wondered if perhaps Ambrosia may be one of them. And got you some, because... well, here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...Why, this really is Ambrosia! How did you even acquire this, Zagreus? It brings back memories, for certain. And, never the bad ones, which... I think it must be why we prize this stuff so much. This is for me?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is, it is, of course! And, it's my dearest hope that, at some point long from now, when you're relaxing with a bottle of Ambrosia, dare I say perhaps with Father... that these memories will be among the ones that spring to mind.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, my son... I shall certainly not need Ambrosia to think back upon getting to know you with the greatest fondness. Thank you very much.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here, Mother. More bottled pleasant memories for you. I know you're glad you've long since left Olympus, but... I'm glad you were there, because the experience of it must have played no small part in making you who you are.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You know, the last bottle you gave me brought more pleasant memories than I expected. No telling just how many more of them I've tucked away. Say, would it be all right if I shared this with your father?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It is yours to do with as you please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Haha, almost sounded like a no to me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No! I mean, yes, please share it with Father, if he would be willing... I imagine what few pleasant memories he has are all of you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nonsense, there's also Cerberus! Present company excluded. Come on, Son. Your father has a lot of work to do, but I'm absolutely certain that he has fond memories of you. Though, I know that isn't reassuring, coming from me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Everything is somehow reassuring, coming from you, Mother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought about it more, Mother, and I would like very much if you and Father were to share this. Though, maybe don't let on where you got it, just in case?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is splendid, Zagreus, but please! If there's one thing I've learned since we met, it's that the trust we share is at the very foundation of our relationships. Why shouldn't he know who this is from? Besides, I think he could figure it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, when it came to the Olympians, you said yourself that there was only so much truth that they could tolerate. Are you sure Father would be tolerant knowing I got this for the both of you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure enough! And if he isn't, I suppose it's more for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Haha, well! Just as long as someone puts it to good use.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...You know I always wanted to be a mother, Zagreus? But after you were born... I was certain I had lost my chance. Then one fine morning you just walked into my life. And here we are. I still cannot entirely believe it. What I mean is... I love you, Son. I'm doing my best.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I know. I love you, too, Mother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mother must still be on Olympus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hope this can get me out of here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Should be able to get back through here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's just go down this Satyr hole.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get you for last time, Father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm leaving, Father. Try and stop me.

dialogue: Should check the admin chamber just in case.

dialogue: The Claws of Enkidu helped me scrape by to the top.

dialogue: Always happy to oblige Master Chaos.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Anything to cut Theseus down to size.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This one's for you, ever-bloodthirsty god of war.

dialogue: Hermes really believed I could pull this off.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Concealed in the dark recesses of the Underworld is the land of Erebus, wherein the dead await eternal sentencing; they long for the attention and good graces of their master, the Lord Hades.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nice place you got here, mate!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A hidden stretch of the boundless river Styx cuts through misty Erebus, providing for the river-boatman Charon a locale in which to deal with the unruliest of souls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: 'Hades: I can no longer tolerate my life here in this place. So, I am leaving, even if it kills me. I won't be returning to Olympus. If there is a place where I belong in this world, it must be somewhere between heaven and hell. Perhaps it's on the coast and has a little garden. Take care of Cerberus; I shall miss him.  Persephone'
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Having traversed the flaming river Phlegethon to gain this vantage point, relentless Zagreus must now confront a foe of unimaginable savagery, who lies ahead, awaiting patiently its time to strike.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Get out of this damn heat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well past the flaming river escalates the hidden stair toward the most well-guarded, splendorous environment within the Underworld: the heavenly Elysium, home eternal to the greatest souls which ever lived.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Huh, a little quieter than usual.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thought Voidstones didn't get this big...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time for another voyage 'board the Barge of Death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Barge of Death is always here for me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have to say, the Barge of Death is never late.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ready when you are, Barge of Death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why it's the Barge of Death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Somebody lose a spine out there?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't let it go to your head?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Until next time, gigantic gorgon head.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well I, for one, had a lovely time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's do this again sometime all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure the Witches Circle will reconvene soon enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The act of sorcery often ends in an untimely death and an eternity in Tartarus for careless souls, though some are able to perfect the trade, and take up permanent residence elsewhere...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The searing flame and ashes of the river Phlegethon mean nothing to the ferryman, Charon, who travels all the waters of the Underworld, bearing the dead, the damned, and all their fineries.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The gods were pleased with all his bravery.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hidden well within the limitless inferno of the river Phlegethon, somehow, a trickle of life-giving water yet remains; as though provided by the Fates themselves unto the very lucky Prince.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's this doing all the way out here?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Is that a sight for sore eyes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The once-verdant plains of Asphodel are now engulfed in scintillating flame, having been flooded by the river Phlegethon, whose hideously superheated contents could bring death swiftly even to those resistant to most heat.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Within the suffocating heat of Asphodel reside the vast majority of those who lived upon the earth and died. There they persist until the end of time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: From within a humble residence in Asphodel reverberates the golden-sounding voice of lorn Eurydice, who once attempted to escape the Underworld, and failed, utterly, much like Prince Zagreus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The magnificently ominous facade of the great Elysian Stadium looms tall above the rabble-rousing Prince, as if to goad him into such a competition which he cannot hope to win.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: ...This has to be some kind of bad dream.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thanks for believing in me, my good Shade!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I dedicate this victory to you, good Shade!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That shade there, have I got a fan?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I won again, Shade, thanks to your support!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That was for you, good Shade!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hope you enjoyed the show, my good Shade!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Thank you for your support, my Shade!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We got them, my good Shade!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Showed them who's boss, didn't we, Shade?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Was not about to let you down, my Shade!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Makes up for last time I hope, my good Shade?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Should be another such performance soon!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Enjoy the rest of your existence, shades!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll take the service exit, thanks!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Be seeing all of you next time, all right?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I can do this. I can do this.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll keep my soul for now, thanks.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Farewell for now, sinister ball of butterflies.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Butterflies better stay away from me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The vast and multitudinous riches of both the surface and the Underworld are hoarded by the river-boatman, Charon, whose services are often tendered to the wealthiest within Elysium.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Within the delicately hewn constructions of Elysium exist places of peace so utterly serene and absolute as mortalkind is seldom to experience during the average short and often-painful coil.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Amid Elysium's moss-covered chambers, carved of stone, stand untold numbers of eternal monuments in tribute to the greatest heroes which mortality can offer, there to honor them in life as well as death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This what the outside world is like...?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Champions of Elysium, I have returned.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another day or night in paradise.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The dead must have it pretty good up here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The rare, heavenly splendors of Elysium, reserved for only the most great of mortal souls, spread forth luxuriantly all about the fire-stepping Prince.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The enshrouded river of forgetfulness, Lethe, flows through the hallowed chambers of Elysium, numbing old pains and memories of the most-noble shades residing there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thank you for this, child.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The deepest reaches of the Underworld... the void from which all life and consciousness sprang forth during the dawn of time... the realm of Chaos. A land almost unseen even to denizens of death's kingdom.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The fathomless expanses hidden in darkest corners of the Underworld stretch well past the notice of Lord Hades himself; and yet, the interfering Prince somehow discovers passage there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Within the Underworld's quietest, most solitary, darkest abyss lies hidden evidence of the beginning of all things, of Chaos! The most ancient sculptor that has shaped this world.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Go clop your hooves in hell.

dialogue: Inside the filth-encrusted lairs carved into the looming edifices of the Underworld lie such terrible abominations that not even grim Lord Hades is inclined to speak of them.

dialogue: The Satyrs must be fashioning those things...

dialogue: Been looking all over for you.

dialogue: Well, Guan Yu...? Take good care of Varatha for me.

label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Working on getting you your treat still, boy.
label: CHARACTER

label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One Satyr sack for one good boy.

label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The vast Temple of Styx and its innumerable dangers now are all that separate the Underworld Prince from the land outside, which he so desperately longs to see.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not far from here, the dead begin their journey to their final resting-place down in the depths below; and so the river-boatman Charon often passes through.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The widely-feared and many-headed Cerberus, the Underworld's sentinel, presides over the entrance to this realm, devouring whole those fool enough to make attempts to flee.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A crudely-hewn network of tunnels grows from one of the cold Temple's flanks, containing vicious denizens unwelcome in this realm, even in death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beyond the frozen overlook... await the first glimpse of the sun to your left... then onward through the cold.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beyond the frozen overlook... await the first glimpse of the sun to your left... then onward through the cold.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beyond the frozen overlook... await the first glimpse of the sun to your left... then onward through the cold.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beyond the frozen overlook... and all that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The surface, wind-swept, wracked by freezing cold, nonetheless instills within the prince a sense of awe, and the sublime. For it is unlike anything that he has seen.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All manner of fruits and vegetables thrive within the hidden gardens of Persephone, the one-time Queen of all the Underworld. A world of life, far from the realm of death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm leaving. Try and stop me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Beyond the present chamber lies the outermost perimeter of Tartarus, promising terrifying dangers far beyond the Underworld Prince's reckoning.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The gods were pleased with all his bravery.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Got a feeling it's Tisiphone this time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They'll just have to try harder next time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Erinyes; known also as the Furies, they are the trusted sentinels of Lord Hades, charged with torturing the worst of mortalkind... and ridding the Underworld of any fool enough to trespass where they do not belong.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, Father? I'm trespassing through your secret hall, and going up.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll just be a moment, Father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The path from Tartarus is finally laid bare. Far above, the heat from Phlegethon, the river of flame, is faintly felt already... even as its dangers lie in wait.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: None, other than those in the trusted inner circle of Lord Hades, are authorized to enter the intricate chambers connecting the vast regions of the Underworld; but the Prince decides to barge in, anyway.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: See you next time, I'm sure?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stay out of my way next time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You stab me, I stab you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The most violent wretches of Tartarus are sealed away even from other condemned souls; their only visitors, those fool enough to attempt escape.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: They basically turn into big crystals.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Damned, lost souls with nowhere left to turn congregate in deepest Tartarus, where they fuse together with the earth itself into odious forms which defy description.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A place of calm and respite, whilst perhaps unimaginable in the Underworld, occasionally is to be found, in fact.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The infernal wares of the stygian boatman, Charon, lie sprawled about, available for sale to whomever would be willing to quench the boatman's great thirst for riches.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The River Styx flows infamously through the Underworld, offering the boatman Charon expeditious travel from the realm of mortals to the lowest depths, where many of their shades reside forever.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The gods were pleased with all his bravery.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have to tell you something, little Hades: My relatives and I, we've been holding back one of our greatest gifts!! To see if you were worthy. And you are! My aid is yours, so call me if you need anything! Especially to smash your enemies to bits.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nephew! I'm mightily impressed with your ability to cull those rivers there of all the denizens of my domain! Your crusty father's not entitled to the bounties of the sea! But, on my limitless authority, you are! You have my Rod of Fishing... now have this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Should help me on my way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: No harm in giving it another shot.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not staying. Not even for him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm not staying. Not even for him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll have to be more careful.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What's life without a little pain.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mortals know to make the most of it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I wonder if I'll beat you once again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At last I know the gods more than by name.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm leaving, Father. Try and stop me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: At least Zeus is helping me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Glad I'm on his good side...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll find my place all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I've found my place I think.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My place is with my mother.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: We've put each other through a lot, haven't we, Meg.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll show you neat and orderly.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll be the judge of that.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, I don't know, the surface is quite nice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll leave my mark all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not even the Pact of Punishment can stop me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Who's ready for the real afterlife experience?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I take some pride in making messes, yes.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How about I take a closer look.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You don't need me, and I don't need you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: If only you could see me now, Father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time for another blood spree, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Just have to cross a couple rivers, then.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'm sure you'll think of something soon enough.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I am the god of blood.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll be sure to say hello.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Headed over to Elysium right now...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Not afraid of you or your damn spear.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Guess I'll see what I can do about it, Father.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: My differences have made me strong, all right.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Here's to my friends and family...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Still figuring our boundaries out I guess.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You taught me that, at least.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: It's nice enough to visit, anyhow.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll see what I can do.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wait for me, Mother. I'll be there soon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Composed of such innumerable ever-shifting interlocking chambers, the Underworld of Lord Hades all but guarantees the dead shall there remain until the end of time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Each time the Prince delves back into the Underworld, its ever-shifting chambers realign to frustrate his attempts to perhaps map it out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Within the depths of Tartarus reside the most wretched of all the shades who linger for eternity within the Underworld, whose Lord and Master is especially unkind to those attempting to cheat death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Few tales are told of Hades, whose very name inspires fear and penitence, reminding us of the inevitable fate which we all share.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I, however, mean to tell you such a tale. Listen carefully...
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Family? Death is your only family. Death, and I. Best get accustomed to the both of us.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Death is inescapable. If you think otherwise... why, then, don't let me stop you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nobody gets out of here, boy, whether alive or dead. You think I jest? You think I haven't tried?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: That dog is not your plaything, boy! Cerberus defends our realm so that no-one gets in alive, or gets out either way.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are a weakling, boy! Disgraceful!! Now, strike again, and make it hurt, this time!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Watch where you step, you oaf! My House is not a sty through which to track your filth!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A mortal's life is short, and fraught with pain; is that truly the life you yearn for, boy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What have I wrought, that such a witless, careless brat would be my progeny?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The fear of death keeps mortals well in check. You'd best learn to fear something yourself, you hear me, boy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How dare you, boy! Learn well to shut that foolish mouth of yours, or I shall shut it for you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have a tendency to ask too many questions, boy. Would that you had a tendency to wonder silently, instead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You're not to speak of that accursed Mount Olympus in this household, do you hear me? Nor shall you invoke the names of its inhabitants.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Say it: Blood and darkness. It's a curse, boy. Say it with me. Blood. And. Darkness. Each available in high abundance here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Time you learned the bearing of the gods, and to assert yourself. For this I have employed the greatest of the Greeks, or what became of him.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Where do you think you are? Who do you think you're talking to? Nobody gets out of my domain, whether alive or dead.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wish to meet your uncle Zeus someday? Imagine me, with a luxurious white mane, without a modicum of self-control. That's your Zeus.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: In my domain, you either find your place, or learn your place. There's work enough to go around, believe you me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: This is where you belong. You feel out of place? Where would you even go, what would you have me do? Your place is here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: One thing the mortals have on us is that they quickly become men. This is the Fury, Megaera. She shall accelerate the process in your case.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The dead are judged and sent to Asphodel, Elysium, or Tartarus. We keep the process neat and orderly. Everyone gets in, no one gets out.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Nyx is the Night herself; her twin sons, Sleep, and Death! But, you? I cannot think of anything, I fear! Except the god of talking back to me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your place is here, and nowhere else. The same as it is mine. There's naught of any worth to see beyond this realm, besides.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Poseidon's an incomparable fool I am ashamed to call my brother. He can shake the earth up there all he pleases; he is unwelcome here.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Elysium? It isn't for the good; it's for the great. Great kings or killers. Oft one and the same. They left their mark upon the world. Shall you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: For their mistakes in life, the wretched shades of Tartarus are bound to me in death, however hatefully. They answer to me; quite unlike you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How many times must I explain this, boy? Each Pact of Punishment needs to be promptly signed, and sealed, and filed. Rather than pile up!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What exactly is it, boy, that makes you feel entitled to show me such disrespect? You dare not say such things to Mother Nyx!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Asphodel has flooded once again, with flame! Not quite the afterlife experience promised to the dead residing there, now, is it, boy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Upon my name, you lack the cheerfulness of Hypnos and the competence of Thanatos, but have more willfulness than both, combined!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sometimes I think this mess you call your chambers is one which you've cultivated with great pride, is that the way of it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do not stray far again into the pits of Tartarus, or become lost like all its residents. Content yourself to look upon it from afar.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Sulk in your chambers all you like, for I care not! I have eternity to finish with this work, so your assistance is entirely unneeded.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why do you bleed like mortals do? An aberration, nothing more! And nothing to be proud of. I suggest you keep it to yourself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Don't you dare look at me like that, boy, with your mismatched eyes. You save it for yourself. You have a mirror in your chambers, don't you?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How suitably disgusting. Fling your blood at me like that again, boy, and I'll have you cast into the Styx, where you can drown in it.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The surface is off limits. And furthermore, you are forbidden from the Temple of Styx, until such time as you are fit to tend the situation there.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You wish to feel the breeze against your skin? Perhaps the coolness of the seas? You shall writhe from such sensations, I assure you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are immortal, boy, but in a manner, you can die; as you now understand. A most unpleasant feeling, is it not?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The rivers flowing through this realm divide its regions suitably enough. And every shade knows better than to try and cross them!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why are some chambers in my House off limits? Someone deserving access would not ask. You can't always go where you please.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Infernal Arms are sealed away for a reason, boy! Your curiosity exceeds your common sense, but heed my words, you stay away from those accursed things!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heroes? Mere mortals, same as all the rest. Someday you shall visit Elysium and meet some of these heroes, and discover that they are quite different than the songs suggest.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: How dare you to insinuate Poseidon has the slightest jurisdiction, here! Once waters from the surface flow beneath the earth, they become mine. Each of the rivers, they are mine, not his!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You would have better conversation with your chamber-walls than with the boatman Charon, boy. Not all those of the Underworld are prone to ceaseless chatter quite like you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now, fling the blasted thing again, I said! And put your anger into it, this time, like so. Or if you've not anger enough for it yet, you'll learn, I promise you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Never lay hands upon Gigaros, boy, ever again. The power in that spear could tear you to pieces finer than the ones to which some of your ancestors were once reduced.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All of this realm are born of darkness, boy. It's part of everything you'll ever see. The mortals on the surface, they all fear it, foolish as they are. Unable to even see its power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: These gemstones that you mock, boy, are a symbol of the power of this realm. To you they're merely trinkets, but to mortals, gemstones hold more value than their very lives.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Another vermin outbreak near the surface, then. Would that I had someone dependable to deal with it. Where are those blasted satyrs coming from, and to what end? The vile things.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You seek such fame as your great relatives upon their mountaintop? Seek to be valuable, not to be known. Obscurity is not what makes you weak. Worship from mortals is a nuisance, not a boon.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You need to learn to hold a spear, observe! A sturdy grip is necessary, here and here. Though, we must find for you an instructor with more time to spare.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You must accept that you are not like all the others here. Your differences do not make you deficient. They can make you strong. It's up to you.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I have no idle time to spare you, boy! Have you observed the parchmentwork upon my desk? Go play with Thanatos, or Hypnos, or the dog. I need to finish this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your grandparents? The Titans, they were called. Long since passed from this world, boy. You have my assurance, however, that you did not miss much, in having never met.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Keep to yourself, then! Our House is not so great in size, thus boundaries must be set. I shall refrain from entering your chambers, as you shall never again try to enter mine.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Waste not your time, though it is limitless. Busy yourself in doing things of use. Learn. Learn how to learn. I cannot teach you everything myself.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: The Eldest Sigil shall never work for you, boy. Only a privileged few have unconstrained authority to traverse this realm, and you are not among them, I'm afraid.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You call this shouting?! This is not shouting, boy. This is merely having certain expectations, which you have not met. Now, try once again.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Look to me for clear instruction, boy! Not for the embodiment of the standard to which you are held. Set your aim higher than to be like me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Forget about the surface, boy! You are not missing much. Here we have warmth, and wealth. Stability! Up there? Nothing of the sort.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Speak not to me of failure! Failure is the greatest instructor of all. Your existence is a sequence of mistakes; avoid making the same one twice.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Ask Nyx about such things, do not ask me! She is the one born to this realm. I am a foreigner. Moved here to take this job, can you believe it, boy?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Mortals believe that there is no return from here. They are correct! And we all must do our part to keep it that way. We have a certain reputation to uphold.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why am I never proud of you? Don't take it personally, boy. I'm never proud of anything. Pride is perhaps our family's worst trait. See how many mortals are with us, because of it?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Exagryph, the Rail of Adamant; annihilate all who oppose me.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Exagryph, the Adamant Rail; come turn my foes to ash.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Coronacht, the Heart-Seaker; let's deal some death.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Aegis, Shield of Chaos; lend me your power.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Varatha, the Eternal Spear; join my pursuit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stygius, Blade of the Underworld; I need your strength.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Malphon, the Twin Fists; what say we crack some skulls.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Twin Fists of Malphon; our strength combined surely cannot be stopped.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Let's punch things up a bit.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are a waste of time.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You want a taste of this?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll kill you where you stand!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll kill you where you stand!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll kill you where you stand!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now that's not nice at all.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I swear I'll get you yet!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fiend! Who taught you such sloppy technique?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fiend! You are unfit to walk these hallowed passageways!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Monster! Your battle prowess leaves much to be desired!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Monster! You have no bearing, and no grace or courage!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hoh, blackguard! How your spirit must be quivering inside!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, hellspawn! Not ready to admit defeat, as yet?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have a lot of nerve, hellspawn! But little else!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come, monster! Attack with everything you have!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do not fear you, fiend! Your presence is a stain upon Elysium!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, fiend! Are you yet fearful for the inevitable end to your foul quest?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, monster! You think you have the wherewithal to achieve victory?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You, blackguard! By my honor and the gods, you shall soon be destroyed!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now it is abundantly apparent that you are beneath me, fiend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you anything to say for yourself, daemon? Before I slay you once again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What now, filth? Are you prepared to be sent screaming back to the hellish darkness?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Back, foul daemon, or be vanquished even faster than you've come to expect!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cower uncontrollably, you monster, for there's naught else you can do against my might!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I warn you, filth, you'll gain no quarter from me, or my good companion over there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Undeserving fiend, all which you think you have achieved was merely handed you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is the matter, fiend? Is your weak sense of resolve already shaken?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Foul daemon! We shall thwart your each and every trespass in Elysium!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Attack me if you dare, blackguard! Either way, I shall crush you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold, you unwelcome pustule! I shall run you through!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Your slouching form is but a laughingstock compared to my superior technique!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You've no defense against my blessed spear, blackguard!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are all talk, you know that, don't you, filth?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cower all you wish! My blessed spear shall find you, anyway!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come fight me in the open, fiend, or are you quite afraid?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: He thinks that he can vanquish us, Asterius!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have insulted me too many times, blackguard!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You'll get no quarter from me, daemon!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Oh, stand and fight, and quit it with your writhing there, hellspawn!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are unwelcome in Elysium, and I shall happily escort you out!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: A monster such as you shall never have a chariot as fine as this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You shall be imminently crushed beneath my chariot, you filth!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Either I'll run you down or else I'll run you through, hellspawn!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Do not think for a moment that you can outrun the Macedonian!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You truly think you shall withstand our unsurpassable Bullhorn technique?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: There is no greater pleasure than to send my spear straight into you and back, daemon!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fiend! Who taught you such sloppy technique?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Fiend! You are unfit to walk these hallowed passageways!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Monster! Your battle prowess leaves much to be desired!
label: CHARACTER

label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hoh, blackguard! How your spirit must be quivering inside!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, hellspawn! Not ready to admit defeat, as yet?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You have a lot of nerve, hellspawn! But little else!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come, monster! Attack with everything you have!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I do not fear you, fiend! Your presence is a stain upon Elysium!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Well, fiend! Are you yet fearful for the inevitable end to your foul quest?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: So, monster! You think you have the wherewithal to achieve victory?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You, blackguard! By my honor and the gods, you shall soon be destroyed!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Now it is abundantly apparent that you are beneath me, fiend!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Have you anything to say for yourself, daemon? Before I slay you once again?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Would that you, too, had a chariot, so I could conquer you in racing just as in battle!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What now, filth? Are you prepared to be sent screaming back to the hellish darkness?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Back, foul daemon, or be vanquished even faster than you've come to expect!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You shall be imminently overrun, I can assure you, blackguard!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Cower uncontrollably, you monster, for there's naught else you can do against my might!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I warn you, filth, you'll gain no quarter from me, or my good companion over there!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Undeserving fiend, all which you think you have achieved was merely handed you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: What is the matter, fiend? Is your weak sense of resolve already shaken?!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Stand your ground, hellspawn, and I shall run you down, or run you through!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Foul daemon! We shall thwart your each and every trespass in Elysium!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Attack me if you dare, blackguard! Either way, I shall crush you!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hold, you unwelcome pustule! I shall run you through!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Zeus, I call upon your might!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Zeus, I need your strength!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Poseidon, I invoke your might!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lady Aphrodite, I invoke your aid!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Goddess Athena, lend to me your strength!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Goddess Athena, I need your aid, now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lady Artemis, make my strength be true!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lady Artemis, I beg you guide my spear!!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Ares, give me your power!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Ares, lend me your might!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Lord Dionysus, lend me your power!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: O Goddess Demeter, I must have your support!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Goddess Demeter, I beg of you, assist me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I suppose that you must hate the very sight of me. You'll understand, then, why I wear the Helm of Darkness.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: You are blind even to simple truths.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Souls of the dead, to me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All you damned souls, come on!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: All you dead souls are mine!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Become as darkness, wretches, and destroy him, now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come, wretches! I shall turn you from our sight!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Arise, wretches, and fight without a trace!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Come forth, wretches! And dispose of this unfilial oaf.
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wretches of the Underworld! Heed me, and rise from the earth to do my bidding!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Hear me, wretches! Rise now from my realm, and fight again!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: On my authority, as Lord of Death! Awaken, wretches, and defend your king!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Upon my name, I order all you wretches of the Underworld to attend me, now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: To me, wretches! Destroy my kin, and an eternal torment to you if you speak of this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Rise, wretches, and fight with the ferocity with which you once clung to your meager lives!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Wretches of the Underworld, I command you now to rise and fight for me!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Awaken, wretches, and fight once more upon this surface-realm where you were slain!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heed now my summons, wretches, and come bring my wayward son down to your depths!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Deathless wretches, I compel you to fight!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Heed me, wretches, on my authority!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I thought you planned to handle this yourself!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why don't you tell your loyal subjects to stay out of this!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Upon my name, I'll bury all you wretches here and now!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: I'll send your wretches back where they belong!
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Why don't you let your wretches rest in peace?
label: CHARACTER

dialogue: Then I'll just have to attend to them!
label: CHARACTER
